hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was a great resort. It's my 2nd time coming to Hawai'i. I had a partial ocean view. Plus mountain view. I enjoyed it very much. I highly recommend staying here. Anyone would have a great time, with friends, family, and everyone.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I am currently staying at the Grand Waikikian. DONT STAY AT THIS NIGHTMARE. They advertised the unit as having a partial ocean view IT HAS NO VIEW!. DAILY CONSTRUCTION UPSTAIRS sounding like a jack hammer. This property is a DISGRACE to the Hilton name. NO DAILY MAID SERVICE! Hookers all around outside the hotel.  I am a Hilton Diamond member and previous to this stay enjoyed a much nicer room that I received a free upgrade due to my status having daily maid service, daily food credit and OCEANFRONT panoramic views ALL at a price 1/3 the daily rate of the Hilton Grand Waikikian. I am heading back to the Hilton Hawaiian Village because of the DISAPPOINTMENT of this nightmare. The Hilton Grand Vacations was built to sucker people into buying their overpriced properties by the tourist who can least afford it. During the presentation the amount they wanted upfront worked out to about 2 Million per unit when divided over 52 weeks, the ripoff gets worse because in addition there is about a $2000 and yearly INCREASING fee per year to use the unit!... NO HOUSEKEEPING, CONSTRUCTION INTERRUPTING YOUR STAY and NOTHING WAS DONE TO ALLEVIATE THE ISSUE. Hilton Diamond member says avoid this nightmare and DONT get suckered into their ripoff timeshare.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Arrived after booking months in advance to a room facing construction and was moved after extensive conversation with a Manager on duty. New room away from beach in different tower. Constantly called about timeshare briefs (hell no) and told to pick up our coupon packets 5 days into stay.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed for 1 night stopover enroute from Australia to the U.S. The resort has an assortment of dining options - the Tropics Bar is great for cocktails and beach-watching. The condo style rooms are well equipped for families, but be wary of "partial ocean view" marketing - that means you can't see the ocean from your room, but possibly get a peak of it from the balcony!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I only give it a 4 star rating because this is not a Honolulu type of experience. This could be in any big city in the world. We had a 3 bedroom penthouse on the 38th floor. The view is lovely, the air conditioning is very efficient and the high rise feel of it is not my idea of a Hawaiian vacation. The pools are very crowded, the beach is fine, but not special. I would prefer to go to a different island or at least a different area for a more authentic beach holiday. I cannot complain about the service, cleanliness nor accommodations. But for me, this is not what I enjoy about Hawaii

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Rooms were excellent, very clean. Almost none of the hotel amenities were included with the very expensive room rates. Every activity required spending more, including beach chairs, umbrellas, etc. There was only one pool on the resort that we were able to swim in; the other two were freezing. Stores on-site (other than the ABC stores) are designer level stores. Restaurants were very expensive, to the point of price gouging. Overall we had a decent vacation, but it was hard for a young family to participate in a lot of activities due to the cost

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and I rented a two bedroom condo for a week with a view. The extra bedroom was a free upgrade. I had never stayed in condo before but I think it might be a nice life style change when we retire. This place has a beach, lagoon, and three swimming which we enjoyed. The restaurants and shops are nice but pricey as was the connivance store which was very handy. It's within walking distance to the malls, downtown and other places to eat thou we took a taxi.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village offers everything as well as being near shops, restaurants, Hawaiian Culture and History. You can get away to the North Shore, see Whales on the Eastpoint and visit one the most significant Sites in American History.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: overall was really nice. In walking distance of Ala Moana. we could swim at any of the four pools. there was a lot of places to eat at and a large variety, too. We enjoyed the fireworks on Friday night.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Room and resort were nice but everything at the resort was very expensive. Food, beach equipment, parking, drinks, and most shops were unnecessarily priced to the point of gouging. Staff was helpful and responsive. Some guests were rude and snobbish.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Have owned 4 annual weeks in the HGVC system since 1995 and this stay has by far been the worst. Stayed in a 1-bedroom which is advertised as suitable for 4 people - no way. It is so tiny as a couple we struggled to find floor space for our 2 standard sized suitcases. Resort caters to Japanese which is fine but more than once got stuck in lines where the guest didn't speak English and the staff member didn't speak Japanese?!?. When we checked in we were not told about the "owners lounge", only found out about it on day 5 of 7 when we asked a staff member what is the "arrival/departure lounge", turns out it is code for the "owners lounge". Too few pools that are overcrowded and under cared for, there is a designated "adults only" pool but it is at the far end of the resort and has ZERO amenities. Went to the Japanese steakhouse onsite where the food and drinks were below average, we asked for the HGVC advertised 15% discount and after some back and forth with the server got 10%?!? Bottom line is room is clean and a 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach, you can't do any worst and obviously can do better. Mahalo.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton treats their owners like sh** and they will tell you they do..I Purchased tickets to the pearl harbor didn't know that the tickets were free and they charged $90 for two people. I went to the Hilton concierge desk and they told me that there was nothing that they can do. I asked to be refunded and spoke to a manager named Nikki, who told me "it is what it is" and she will not refund me my money. She was very rude and argumentative, I asked to speak to her manager; she said there was no one above her to speak to. I also spoke to the front desk manager name Tim, he also told me that there was nothing he can do to help me and I was told that this is the way they treat their customers/owners. What is the point of being a owner and Paying all this money into an ownership when you are not getting good service or getting my money's Worth. This has been the worst experience I have had with the Hilton

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our experience at the HGV-Grand Waikikian was rather poor. Our privacy was violated multiple times. On two separate occasions and days during our stay, a male employee from housekeeping attempted entry into our room without properly knocking and awaiting a response; instead he just attempted to enter. Both times I expressed my shock and made clear to him it was unacceptable to attempt entry into our room like that. He appeared unconcerned and dismissive.Of course, I informed management and I do not feel they adequately responded to this disrespect and violation of m my family’s privacy. We were very disappointed by the entire experience. I suggest considering a different property.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed here over New Years holiday. The inside part of 2 bedroom Unit was nice but the balcony was a disaster with a major bird problem as they slept on it at night. Covered in bird poop every morning to the point you could not use it. I complained but nothing was done. The pools are very over crowded and the restaurant scene throughout all of HHV is mediocre and overpriced. If staying in Waikiki area I would suggest staying closer to heart of Waikiki.
user_name:
MThorp1834
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband and I are in Hawaii for two weeks. We went to our update as we haven’t been to one in a few years. Our salesperson didn’t update, but instead inundated us with rapid fire information covering every topic from her flying first class, driving a Mercedes, being a chef, living around the world. This included photo albums of her airline boarding tickets, her car keys to prove she drives a Mercedes and photos of her family, including her virgin daughter in law (yes, she told us this) When she did talk about the timeshare, it was hyperactive, high pressure and overwhelming, not to mention very confusing. She was degrading and insulting because we wouldn’t buy more points. I told her I was overwhelmed and her reply was that I hurt her feelings. She told me not to tell her boss in the follow up how I felt. I have a brain tumor, I do get overwhelmed easily. I left the room in tears. My husband was also overwhelmed. This is a horrible way to treat people who PAID A LOT OF MONEY already and a terrible waste of our time. After my husband and I had time to talk we decided this woman’s manager needed to know this information.We came back the next day to talk to her manager, whom we met the day before. He was sitting in the lobby, 10 feet away from us. We were told they’d call him. After a few minutes we were told he wasn’t in. I pointed out he was just sitting in the lobby and the guy at the front desk said “WE ALL LOOK ALIKE”. Are you kidding? We left, they knew we weren’t happy. As we walked out the manager came running after us....yes he was there (shocking). These people are LIARS. Just be honest and say he’s busy. Nothing I can’t stand more is liars (or people who make excuses for behavior).We are here now, we asked for an ocean view, but nothing is available, so we are a city view. Not really impressed with the place, it’s ok. The air conditioning in our room works inefficiently. No one has followed up with us if things are ok or if we need anything. Bottom line, don’t go to the meetings. Waste of time and they are liars.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: 1. Check in for the penthouse was 45 minutes long! Unacceptable. Regardless of the time of year.2. Elevator wait to check in on 35th floor: 32 minutes!3. Check-in hostesses for the penthouse did not speak fluent English and it took another 15 minutes for them to check us in because of this. My husband's name is listed after mine, & they had the audacity to tell him he wasn't on the ownership list, and when they did see it they told him he was listed second! how dare they say that? It should not matter whether I'm listed first or he's listed first. We are a couple with different last names, and alphabetically mine is first. So very rude! We were very offended as was our VIP guest, who is the CEO of many companies.4. The amenities in the penthouses should be of higher quality, not the cheap lotions and shampoos that you can get in any other room or at any other hotel! The penthouse experience should be top-notch and VIP from check-in to amenities all the way to check out. it felt very cheap and there was no distinguishing between penthouse and regular hotel room, other than size. Definitely NOT experience.5. Owners and those that rent The penthouse, especially owners who rent The penthouse, should not have to pay the $50 parking fee. If anything, it should be at a discount. We are already paying for VIP.... Why not extend that to the parking and have us pay less?6. 35th floor lounge breakfast: Mei Ling was the only person who treated us, and every other customer there, as special and VIP! She was the most gracious, friendly, warm person from the entire hotel!7. One night we had to pick up our car at 11:30 p.m. and it took us 30 minutes to find someone to find our car keys from the valet and get our car. we called the valet desk no less than eight times and no one answered! We finally had to have the front desk call. They said we might have caught the valets in a shift change. That should not matter, somebody should be manning that desk. This was definitely the worst, most insulting experience we've had as owners, and as penthouse renters. We rented the penthouse for two days for our CEO friend who is very VIP, and we stayed in at the third night. He was insulted and offended by the lack of service of Hilton and the Grand Waikikian, and he will never purchase nor stay at a Hilton property here in Hawaii again! That is how poorly Hilton reflected upon our friend. It was so embarrassing for us.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I have been coming to this hotel for 11 years straight and still do not feel any more welcome than the first time. Hilton Diamond members, please stay away from this hotel you do not have any perks, might as well not have any membership because that is the way you are treated.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Good trip, food choices are limited, mostly Asian food. The suites were very nice, but there are limited two bed room suites with double beds in the second room, so do not plan first tjid room type. Our 2 bedroom suite had 2 king beds, which was not suitable for our family.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Haven’t been to GW for about 3.5 years and was impressed with nice updates to rooms, retouched decor. Location as always wonderful... short walk to the hustle of the Waikiki strip yet a calmer oasis from beach walk area with access to the Duke lagoon and awesome pools.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Right next to Waikiki beach. Easy access to all transportation. 10 min walking distance to Ala Moana mall, 15 min to Food Farm (large grocery store). 20 min walking distance to the other side of Waikiki beach (Moana Surfrider hotel). Staff are friendly and very helpful. Close to many good restaurants (i.e. Red Lobster). Resort restaurants are very good but a little more expensive.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This property is in a great location. However since the mid 2000 teens so much construction has taken place that it has become a "Disneyland" with respect to crowds. Also parking for resort guests is a minimum $50/day, more for valet. Elevator access to rooms is extremely frustrating.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Had a blast. Great drinks. Great for families or couples. I like the location because it’s not in the middle of all the Waikiki craziness. We rode bikes to where most of the beach action was (close to the Waikiki police station/beach area) and it took about 7 minutes.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed for a little over a week for a family trip for Thanksgiving. The staff was very friendly, the village was massive and the views from our room were beautiful. Sadly, upon our last day and while packing up we discovered bed bugs! We were beyond disgusted as this is not a low rent motel on the side of the freeway. It’s a resort! When we reported the bugs we got a simple “oh I’m sorry.” We had to ask for a manager and then were told that their housekeeping manager had inspected the room and found it to be free of bugs. So we we were at an impasse. We said yes, they said no. We asked to file a report, and did so with security - odd, but ok. They gave us vouchers for our taxis to the airport and I am now trying to figure out how to keep our home free of bed bugs. Will be doing laundry immediately and putting suitcases into some kind of bug fogger.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton Grand Waikikian is a time share but they rent certain of the units out to non-members in their travel club. We spent the second week of our Waikiki vacation in the Grand Wakikian, which was better than the much more expensive Rainbow Tower. The furnishings in our unit were much nicer and in better repair. There was a full kitchen (with incredibly dull knives, but you can't have everything). The daily maid service was prompt and thorough. There is a small built-in clothes washer and dryer. The toilet is equipped with a Star Trek incredible seat which is heated, works like a bidet, dries one's nether portions with warm air, and levitates to the moon, I think. The view is terrible when compared to our view of Diamond Head from the Rainbow Tower but the price was half of what we paid there, so it makes sense. The most annoying part was the constant drumming we received to attend a sales pitch for Hilton's Vacation Club (which is a fancy name for a time share programme).

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are hilton grand vacation owners, we reservered a 1 bedroom plus at the grand waikikian. The rooms are decent, but the location is away from pools and beach. The lagoon tower is much better location. The elevator is very slow, some days, will have to wait more than 15 minutes. The kitchen appliances need replaced, particularly the dishwasher. The is completely pack and none of the water slides were open during the thanksgiving week, until the last day (our checkout day).

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As a HGVC Elite Premier member this stay was very disappointing. No recognition of your status- just want you to buy more. Rooms were dated and poorly cleaned. Departure process was a mess. No late checkout offered but only 2 or 6 shower stalls working in the departure lounge which alternated every hour for men vs women.Pools were overcrowded and service was short staffed- best thing about the place was location!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Please note this is gorgeous hotel with beautiful grounds but charges for every single little thing. Parking is $49 a night for self park and $58 for valet so don’t bring a car if you don’t have to. Also please note that check in is at 4pm but checkout is 10am. They do offer a checkout lounge but no showers. The rooms are old and dated and definitely need some sprucing. We went with our two kids who are 7 and 9 and the truly enjoyed the lagoon and pools. However the hotels charge for every little thing even though there is already a daily resort fee. Just be aware that you will be nickled and dimed here.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I recently traveled to Waikiki on business and was fortunate to bring my family along for the week. Our choice of stay was the Hilton Grand Waikikian at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Complex. The room had a full kitched, washer & dryer, hardwood floors, and beautiful views of the city. My wife and I slept on literally the most comfortable couch bed I've ever slept on in a hotel. Our kids shared the 2 double beds in the room and had plenty of space. The Hilton complex is astonishingly beautiful and full of family-fun and adult amenities! We had access to several Hilton property pools, extra beach towels, and the famous lagoon. Additionally, the restaurants were amazing! My wife and I enjoyed MaiTai's and dinner at Tropics Bar and Grill - right on the beach. Our kids favorite eateries on site were Bluewater Grill and Round Table Pizza. We all enjoyed Lapperts Ice Cream! The Hilton complex - of which the Grand Waikikian is part of - is within a short walk to every other major attraction on Waikiki. We walked all the way to Duke's along the beach one day and returned through the main drag and Fort DeRussy path.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Beautiful resort a must see. Great staff, clean rooms, very spacious, unlimited amenities and walking distance from great shopping, restaurants and tourist attractions. On the bus route for the hop on and hop off.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The weather was in the 80’s, crystal blue ocean, sunset cruise, all the amenities to make you feel special and want to come back again. Thank you for heartfelt memories that will last a lifetime. Will be planning to come back ❣️

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was a great resort in amazing location, Hilton Hawaiian Village! Plenty of shops, restaurants, swimming pools, and amenities! This is the main location for Friday evening Fireworks on the beach, which were so beautiful! Loved the comfortable bed!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I arrived at this property at 9:00 AM. I wasn't given a room until after 4:00 PM. The management was not friendly or cooperative with my situation. I booked the hotel through Hilton website. Apparently it's a time-share. I was asked to attend a 2 hour presentation of which I refused. I believe based on the fact that I showed no interest in the time share I was checked in late. I watched others arriving after me check in before 2:00 PM. The manager there John Reagan was not willing to oblige me in any way. Since I was there for one night, I wasn't informed about the $40.00 resort fee. Obviously with a one night stay I couldn't use the resort fee.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We love this hotel and the Hilton Hawaiian property. You really can submerge yourself in the property and have everything you need for an awesome stay. We of course ventured out, but it was so relaxing to come back and have everything needed from food to fun all around. The staff and property are amazing!! #myhgvc

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great time at HGV Grand Waikikian, as usual they went above and beyond to help us. The room was very spacious, clean and allowed us to relax in our getaway with our friends. We had a great time and the Hilton staff across the entire property was so accommodating.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our room was a delight! The view was better than I ever expected. All the staff were friendly and helpful! The rooms were clean, what we couldn’t find the staff promptly provided. The bidet was quite the surprise, not something we were used to but we’re getting acquainted with. We would stay here again in a heartbeat! Thanks to all!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This resort is typical of the quality of Hilton Resorts. The accommodations are top shelf and all of the services were exceptional. There is something for everyone, both couples and families, with activities set up to entertainment all. There were even fireworks on Friday night! I would highly recommend this resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great Stay at this hotel. The staff was outstanding and really professional. The hotel was extremely clean and will keep. Looking into be coming Hilton Grand Vacation Property Owner. I think this places was outstanding.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed 5 days and stayed in lagoon tower on 18 floor. Large room and sitting room very well appointed internet 58mps fast! Balcony lovely with sea view. Huge tv! Obviously a huge hotel complex and busy but not crowded. As in the heart of Honolulu easy access to everywhere. Lots of swimming pools including an adult only one. Free daily water and bottle refill stations is a nice touch. Very good enjoyed stay

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We came as part of a marketing package. The required presentation was kept to a minimum so we had a lot of time to enjoy our stay. The facility is very clean and the staff very helpful. If you need a use either Uber or Lyft to get around town, it is not always easy to lock in the street address because the app tries to direct everyone to a preset rideshare site.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a two bedroom suite with kitchen and the views were amazing from all rooms. Great service and amenities and location! The master toilet even had a bidet and seat warmer. The restaurants were great and the pools were clean, although busy.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This timeshare experience in a property I stayed in a dozen times over the past 30 years was surprisingly disappointing. It’s such an outstanding property with excellent staff but it’s popularity is likely its demise. Cockroaches in two bedroom suite, dirty sheets on beds on arrival, overcrowded pools with murky water and lots of sand in pools. Poor experience at what was a wonderful place.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I came here for a work trip but got to spend 4 extra days and I wasn’t disappointed at all. The location of the hotel is awesome!! There is shops below the hotel and it has its own little village, super convenient. The food and parking at the hotel was pricey... parking $45 a night. The rooms are pretty standard, but having a full kitchen was a plus! The staff are so kind and helpful! I would go back here again!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Family and I stayed there last week and really enjoyed our stay. Great view if the ocean and easy access to everything. Kids enjoyed the pool and beach.Food was very good but pricey like every other restaurant on the island.Room was clean but some of furniture is a little worn and little things like iron board need replaced. (Had to fight for 15 min to get iron board to close.). Would stay there again for sure...

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The workers are rude the room was not cleaned well dust had my allergies flared, dishes were dirty and the shower had nasty piles of hair. They dont speak when or make you feel welcomed at all. I couldn't even swim good because of locals coming in and taking over the pool.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The condo was roomy and had many creature comforts. It was comfortably furnished, but not luxurious. We enjoyed the view from our patio, as we were able to enjoy the fireworks, and to see the beach and ocean.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton Grand Vacations Grand Waikikian is a beautiful family oriented resort on the peaceful end of Waikiki Beach. The resort has beautifully appointed 1 & 2 bdrm condos with full kitchens that truly come in handy when trying to save on costs. The resort is closely located to the Ala Moana shopping center, & there are a few rental car agencies nearby to rent a vehicle. We rented a vehicle the last day if our vacation & it was well worth it as we got to check out Kauloa Ranch where Jurassic Park & Jumanji were filmed, & we also got to drive along the North Shore & see all of the beautiful beaches! Absolutely stunning & perfect for picture taking! If you're looking for more action, head towards the east end of Waikiki Beach just past all the shopping. Looked like a lot of fun & surfing! The only recommendation I would give the resort is to greet customers with a tropical drink & a lai, & play more music in the common areas throughout the day. That would enhance the vibe of paradise!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Couples Getaway to Paradise! We had an amazing time. The resort was everything we needed and more. There is eateries and shopping right there on the resort. There is also high end shopping about 1 mile away. The dollar rental is across the street if you want to rent a car and travel around the island.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed in a one-bedroom suite. Beautiful and modern. Service is good, rooms were clean and I got everything requested in a timely manner ( light blanket, extra sheets or towels). Mid August the pools (especially kids’) were extremely crowded, slide closed early and my sons were upset. Adult pools were extremely crowded , as village is open to public. Definitely not using pools. Easy access to the beach. Fireworks were amazing at night.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a beautiful place to stay with your family. You’ll find everything you need while you’re staying in this resort: restaurants, entertainment, market, stores, and it’s beachfront and has a beautiful lagoon!! I totally recommend it!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: There is no children activities room and there is no beach chairs and umbrellas available for members, these amenities have to be rented from a third party on the beach. Besides that it was beautiful place to stay

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was a beautiful property located on the water in Waikiki. The staff worked to provde any adjustments needed. Be sure you budget money for parking expenses. The fees are quite high. Also, accessing pool towels and pool hours are limited at this resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: trip was primary for business but added our 13th anniversary, Gym was was good needed a cable univiersal machine to go with free weights. Wife and I wereextremely happy with the Rocky Resturaunt, they took very good care of my wife and multiple food allergies.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Grounds are wonderful with direct beach access & the lagoon. All types of water activities available or concierge helpful with off site activities. Various restaurants & shops on site. Exceptionally friendly & helpful staff. Somethings may be a bit pricey, but overall worth it for convenience.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Everyone at this hotel was friendly,bathrooms are every where,even tho we local they treated us like family, valet parking guys are cool braddahs, the guy that took our bags was cool, clean hotel, water slide n pool was amazing kids never like get out the water, hotel room was amazing kids had a blast, we will b bak 4 round 2

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our second stay at Grand W & while spoiled by penthouses first time, we booked a 2 room suite the second time and were not disappointed - room exceptional Size perfectly big enough for our blended family. Views from all rooms were unreal. Watched luau from balcony was a great $ saving experience after having done formal ones on past trips. Facilities excellent Clean and attractive decor.Room beautifully designed included laundry, full kitchen, 2 bedrooms plus 2 balconies & very comfy sleeper sofa! Staff greatttt! Pools good even if crowded at times. Gym & spa greatttt!beach great- bring water shoes. Surf boarding great for beginners and advanced right here! Rent a board just a block away for the week or onsite with lessons!Marketplace onsite, shops range from abc groceries to luis Vuitton- explore property your first day then walk into Waikiki! You don’t actually need a car but we are adventurous and always rent one to drive all over the island. Close to airport (10 min), short walk to major shopping districts and malls, restaurants & groceries. Eat offsite- prices too high @ property restaurants.We purposely didn’t engage w sales team as we are club owners already but they are available to assist w tour bookings. I used trip advisor to avoid sales pitch.We will be back!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Instant check in. Bellman offers to help with luggage. Open and airy, clean and tropical. This is a massive resort area with plenty of restaurants, activities and exploring. Room was immaculate. Ocean view is wonderful. Of course the pools are busy, but there's a wonderful lagoon and the actual ocean within easy walking distance. What are you waiting for? Get here and enjoy!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Amazing service, rooms, and views at the Grand Waikikian in Honolulu. Since I am forced to write at least 200 characters of text when I only needed 70. I’ll go ahead and inform everyone to bring plenty of money because the resort is expensive and Hawaii is expensive.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Super clean and near everything. Loved the fireworks on Friday night. The Grand Waikikian by Hilton is the best place we have stayed in Oahu. We stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bath condo with a full kitchen. The place was super clean. With 3 kids who are always hungry the kitchen came in handy. The beds are super comfy and the place was just squeaky clean. We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family and I enjoyed the conveniences of the kitchen and dining table along with two separate bedrooms and bathrooms, including a separate bathtub. Nice hotel with great staff. Get down to the pools early by 8:30AM to get a spot or else there may be slim pickings by 10AM. I got a major discount as I was using the timeshare sales pitch deal (mandatory 2+ hour presentation) but worth it for a rate of $340/night for 2bed/2bath/kitchen/livingroom/dining table and two balconies.
user_name:
Patrick C
San Francisco, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The room had several items not working and was in need of some repair. HGVC sales teams are very nice until you tell them you won’t be purchasing. HGVC is not the best deal out there IMO but the push to sell.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very terrible experience at Hilton never staying in any Hilton Hotel or resort. The staff service and the room cleaniness was horrible. AC wasn’t working because the filter was full of dirt my son got sick because of it and some one had to come and replace it at 11 at night

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: During our family vacation each member of our family received bug bites while staying at the Hilton. When the bites were shown to the hotel manager we were disappointed that the hotel manager only offered to change out the sheets.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian is supposed to be a premium HGVC resort. However, the building is in a bad location that really limits your view from the balcony/lani. Although I had a 2bdrm premium ocean view, it was not good enough to see the 4th of July fireworks. I talk to other people that higher rooms and they also did not have any view to the 4th of July fireworks. This is compared to a non-premium 2bdrm at the Lagoon Tower. The 2bdrm is supposed to accommodate 6 people but there was only room for 4 people at the dinning room and the kitchen was smaller than the bathroom. If you retracted the pullout bed in the living room, you lost the use of the living room. As compared to the Lagoon tower, the table can accommodate 6 people and the kitchen was large. When the pull out bed was retracted, there was still a lot of living room left to maneuver around. Bottom line, same points/money and stay in the Lagoon Tower.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Paradise for families. So much to do without ever leaving the property. Stellar pools and beach. Walking distance to the shopping district and all tours pickup right across the street from the Waikikian tower. We had a great time here. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The room, hotel, and outdoor areas were beautiful and well kept. Housekeeping was above expectations for a condo. The room was very comfortable. The kids still had some space. Staff was all friendly and helpful. The Hilton Hawaiian Village is convenient but expensive.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations was wonderful. The room was ready on time, it was very neat and clean. The master suite was very luxurious. The view was amazing. The beds were very comfortable. The staff was very polite and helpful. My remote wasn't working. A repairman was there in 5 minutes and had it fixed. I would definitely recommend this facility.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Poor cleanliness of the room and customer service was not help full with our issues. House keeping left a cleaning bottle on the tub and a plastic bag on the floor. No toilet paper was in the bathroom and the spare toilet paper was soaked from the leak from the sink. The dishes in the kitchen was dirty. A dust pan was left on the chair in the dining table.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: With our ocean view 2 bedroom suite on the 21st floor, we thoroughly enjoyed our days and nights here. It made us feel like we had our own apartment in Waikiki looking over the ocean with everything we need. The staff here is absolutely fantastic.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Overall stay was good, just upset about our air conditioning. For a honors member using a timeshare for a honeymoon, I would expect different from Hilton. We have stayed at other Hilton locations and had a much better experience.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We love everything about the Grand Waikikian at the Rainbow Hilton Village. This whole complex has everything. Friday night fireworks is always a must see. The staff is friendly helpful and makes us feel like Ohana!! This place is more than just a hotel stay...it is an experience to remember.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Outstanding resort has everything for everyone, the staff looks after your very need. For it to be wide open as it is , it was extremely clean no sand or trash. Being in the Hilton villege is a plus also, ascess to everything.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Brought my family there June 15-21, 2019. The Grand Waikikian is one of, I think, seven towers within the Hilton Hawaiian Village. I believe three of the seven are Hilton Grand Vacations properties and four are hotel towers.The GoodWe loved our room. We were on the 31st floor with a great balcony view of the entire village, the lagoon, the main pool and, of course, the ocean. We had a two bedroom with a full kitchen. The master was large with a nice bathroom which had separate shower and tub, and a Japanese-style electronic toilet (don't mock it until you have tried it!). The second bedroom had two double beds (not twins, which was nice) and a nice shower. Our unit also had it's own washer/dryer which was nice to do laundry there instead of when we got back home.My wife and I both have limited mobility and I will say that you will walk A LOT on this property. It was a good 10 minute walk for us to get down to the beach, and just getting around the property from tower to tower takes some doing. It would have been nice to have a golf cart to shuttle us around, but we were able to deal with it as is.The BadThis property is very crowded. If you are the type of person that thrives on the hustle/bustle of a city, with all kinds of activity going on all around you, then this might be the place for you. We have been to the other 3 main islands and the Village and Waikiki in general lacks that "Aloha Spirit" of the other islands. The staff was disinterested, at times, and the service in the restaurants was lukewarn for the most part.The UglyWhile we certainly understand that resort pricing is always at a premium, especially in Hawaii, $32 for fish & chips is flat out ridiculous. Thankfully, we did some grocery shopping and never ate breakfast at the restaurants and were able to save on lunches and dinners as well. There is also a food truck just off the property near the beach and lagoon that offered some nice options for far less money. The fish tacos there ended up being my son's favorite meal for the week. Also, did I mention that Hilton charges $45/night just to park there? Because of this, we used Uber/Lyft several times and they are always within a 3-5 minute pickup. We rented a car twice for the day to explore the east side of the island and the North Shore as well. I think we spent less that $270 on the week for transportation which was less than it would have been to park a car for the week, much less the actual rental cost. Also, the beach is fine, but if you want any shade, then you have the option of renting an umbrella and two chairs for $65/day. We just went to WalMart and bought two chairs and and umbrella for $30 and gifted it to another family on our last day.Final ThoughtsIf you like crowds, and cost isn't a focus for you, then the Village may be a good choice. We had a great time the week we were there, but our best times were when we got away from the Village and explored other parts of the island. We went to Pearl Harbor, found some great beaches that weren't overrun, and were able to get a little more of that Aloha Spirit on the North Shore. We didn't spend any time at the pools, mainly because they were very crowded and we weren't into getting down there really early to save chairs. There are 4 pools on the property - the main pool, a pool that's more for kids, and adult pool (small and subdued) and The pool at the Tapa Tower which we only saw a couple of times. We love Hawaii and can't wait to go back, but I think it will be either Kauai or Maui next time.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family just bought this specific property as part of a time share for Hilton. I enjoyed my stay for the majority of the time however I enjoy the properties on the big island of hawaii rather than oahu for a few reasons. the specific hotel the Grand Waikikian was very complicated and hard to get to because we had to walk from the lagoon tower through multiple halls and rooms to even get to our hotel elevators. this typically would not bother me but after a long day at the beach i did not want to walk that far, let's be honest. the biggest issue i had with this exact resort was that the elevators were EXTREMELY slow there were 4 and i am not lying say we spent 5+ minutes waiting for ONE elevator. the final issue i had was on the big island at the Hilton Waikoloa Village, there are colored wrist bands that change everyday which helps to show who resort guests are. this is extremely helpful because it filters out random beach bums and non resort guests from using and occupying all of the facilities. besides these three things i liked this resort a lot. i personally liked the rainbow and tapa towers for their location but nothing beats and enormous rooms at the Grand Waikikian. there were many fun things to do such as yoga, lei making, and even fireworks on friday nights. i would definetly go back but it wouldn't be my first choice.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel has a fully equipped kitchen and washer dryer. The housekeeping was excellent and all I had to do was tip and and I got All I wanted extra coffee, towels, toiletries, detergent, etc. this tower is the farthest away from everything in the Villiage. Better to use the Halikai bus stop for trolley, tours , etc. closer than the Hilton bus depot. The food land farms grocery at ala Moana mall is closest grocery and its on trolly route. 8th floor departure lounge is fully equipped even water and snacks and restrooms with accessible showers and lockers.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Lovely hotel, beautiful grounds. Property is enormous like a small city. So much to do on the grounds; shopping, restaurants, shows and water activities, you have to remember to venture outside of the grounds. Wonderful friendly helpful staff. We’ll definitely be returning

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Just returned last night...and obviously wish we were all still there! Absolute paradise! Our first trip to Oahu/ Waikiki and already want to go back!The Grand Waikikian was great! We were spoiled with the two bedroom, ocean view, suite. (Well worth the 90 minute sales pitch we had to go through.) Room had every necessity you'd need and was extremely comfortable. Also, never heard any noises from any of the adjoining rooms so the privacy was great too. The little general store in the lobby was great as it had everything (alcohol, snacks) and was open all day. The location is great too as there is plenty of stores/restaurants within walking distance. Hotel personnel were all very nice too.The pools, lagoon and beach were all very beautiful and made for long easy days of relaxing! You'll need to spend some money ($65) for a couple of lounge chairs and a pop up umbrella if you're going to be on the beach as the sun gets a bit scorching.We enjoyed walking to the downtown area, either via the beach walk or through the beautiful park, a few times and there are plenty of great places to eat and shop there. We rented a Jeep for two days and used it one day to travel to the north shore and the next day to the east shore. No real need to use it for anything else. We found a cheap tour that took us to Diamond Head and to Hanuma Bay which, while very busy, are musts to do. The Diamond Head hike is a workout!I definitely recommend this hotel, and any other hotel within this Hilton Village. I also recommend purchasing your alcohol at one of the many nearby ABC Stores to make your own drinks! You'll save plenty of money and calories by mixing your own!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Awesome resort! Everything you need is on the property! Friendly and helpful staff. Our room was very nice and extremely clean. We had a great view of the city and the beach. There were a variety of stores and restaurants on the property. Looking forward to visiting again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great staff, great rooms. We had a 2 br which included a kitchen and living room. Just know that due to the location of this resort on the property, the BEST view you will get will be a partial view of the ocean. We were in a xx01 room, which was a corner room and you could see the water from the balcony between 2 other hotels. I believe the room across from us was an xx02, and they had the same view. You could also see the "luau" each night that was on top of the parking garage so you can preview it before you buy the overpriced tickets.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Beautiful place but NO umbrellas at pools, no baby pool, no shade, no playground for kids. They say they are geared for families and we don’t agree. Awesome property though and it really is a “village.”

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was supposed to be a quick anniversary trip but ended up being hassled for a timeshare presentation. We love this place but not like this. We wanted to make great memories of our stay but they hassle of a supposed 1 hour presentation become 2 and half hours. Poor form.
user_name:
Caesar John P
San Diego, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with ocean view and it was very clean and spacious. great having washer and dryer in the suite specially traveling with little ones. the staff was very nice and accommodating.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We saved our time share points to come to Hawaii for a week and stayed at the Grand Waikikian mainly because it had enough space and a full kitchen. We intended to cook breakfast and some dinners reducing the need to eat out for every meal. These units are very comfortable, well maintained and thought out. All the necessary bits and pieces in the kitchen were there. The electric toilet was hard to get used to as it hummed and heated. We ended up unplugging the unit. Beds were comfortable. I was disappointed because the business centre which is on the 8th floor, is part of the lounge which is limited to 8am to 6pm. When I had to print tickets for the following day, I found out I would have to go to the IBM business centre and pay by the minute for the use of any of their machines. Fortunately, a kind night manager allowed me to use her desktop computer and print the tickets that I needed. There is a huge complex that this hotel sits on that includes many restaurants and shops. It's made up of many hotels, some time share and some not. It backs up against a long beach front that is private for the most part. There is a large man-made lake for some people-powered water vehicles. A nice stay.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is my 10th trip to Oahu and it keeps getting better. The grand Waikikian is such a magical place! The staff is attentive, the rooms are outstanding, the views are perfect. The pool, the beach, the food, the amenities are always above my expectations.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The property has the signature Hilton look and is maintained to their high standards. The staff/employees are fantastic. Rosalinda at the check-in desk is an absolute gem. The complex is massive with happy travelers from around the world. The Grand Waikikian is definitely a family fun venue for young and old. The hotel pools are kid friendly and busy. Should you want to escape the kid energy packed pool environment walk over to the Kalia building for the adults only pool experience. The hotel's urban environment provides plenty of shopping and eating choices all within walking distance. If you're the type that likes to walk and stroll you will love it. Beach front, shopping venues and restaurants. We did not rent a car. The public buses as well as the sight-seeing trolleys got us to the places we wanted to visit. The hotel concierge has all information. If your trip happens to include a Friday night stay be sure to take in the 7:45 PM fireworks show.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We were able to get a 2 bedroom corner unit on the 30th floor. The room was nice and had a balcony facing the beach. The room had a smell from someone smoking in the room. But the view was so good and we had unpacked some we didn’t want to change rooms. The smell wasn’t Terrible but noticeable. Besides that the room was great.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Nice property and decent location. There’s not too many restaurants and bars adjacent to the property like other parts of Waikiki. If you choose to eat and drink on property be ready to pay ridiculously high prices. It’s also very crowded everywhere you go . Pools are not big enough to accommodate all the guests from the many several towers on the property.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The suite was awesome and most employees were nice. A beautiful place,close to beach and stores.I am 70 years old and I had an employee run into me from the back with a huge luggage carrier. Knocked my glasses off, and bruised my leg. The guy who hit me just kept going. Fortunately their was a guy with him that stayed around until I felt good enough to get up.i have been home 4 days and it is still bruised and swollen..bad experience.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We arrived too early to check in so went up to Level 8 to the guests lounge to rest after our flight. We were welcomed by a lovely gentleman who takes the walking tours and he couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. The Grand Waikikian exceeded our expectations. Because it is part of the Hilton Village there are so many dining/bar options as well as pools/lagoon. The kids loved the pool with the slides and we enjoyed sitting by the pool drinking cocktails. We had the best sleep as the beds and pillows were so comfortable. The daily room service was also a bonus. We caught the Pink Trolley to go to Waikiki for dinner and to the beach but we enjoyed leaving the crowds at Waikiki and going back to the tranquility of our resort. The grounds are beautifully presented and was so lovely to walk around and take in the atmosphere. We are looking at booking our next holiday so we can come back. I can't recommend the Grand Waikikian highly enough to stay at on your Honolulu holiday. Mahalo!!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Overall, very nice experience. The property is an HGV so I’m sure the experience and value would be different if you were an timeshare owner vs a renter even if you’re a Hilton Honors Gold member as I am. Stayed in a 2BR POV and accommodations were very nice with a kitchen when made storing leftover foods convenient. Location is by the marina and a short 15 minute walk to the main Waikiki strip.
user_name:
Ted L
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Visited Hawaii for the first time, Stayed at the Grand Waikikian in a 2 BR condo. The accommodations were excellent . The resort is beautiful. The GW is part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village and has ocean views. The resort has several restaurants but there are also good restaurants within walking distance. I cannot say one negative thing about the GW. The entire resort is beautiful and the staff is very accommodating. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Grand Waikikian location is great for access to the Village and easy access to Taxi, Bus, and Tour pick-up points. Full kitchen and great view. Very quiet and relaxing. No waiting for check-in or check-out. Always staff available with no wait.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Lovely hotel with great location, gorgeous lobby, gift shop, and very helpful, friendly staff. We had an unexpected medical issue and they provided immediate assistance and a voucher for taxi back to the hotel. Went above and beyond.Only 4 stars because the room could have been cleaner.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The rooms here are very nice. And the staff is very friendly and helpful. But the pool was crowded and rather cold. And the sand at the lagoon beach was very coarse. Still, there were a lot of nice amenities. The Round Table Pizza and the deli close by were good for a quick dinner. The other restaurants there were also very good, with very good food, even though they were rather expensive. We were able to watch the fireworks on Friday night from our room. Next time, I think we will try the Marriott at Ko Olina. Their lagoons are much nicer, they had shade trees and the sand was nice and soft like sand should be. It was much nicer for snorkeling too. Also it just seemed much quieter and less frenzied.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family and I stayed here on a VIP promotion to reconsider the Hilton Grand Vacation Club purchase.Our stay here made the decision easy not to buy. The accommodations were average here but not bad.Lots of room in the 2 bedroom suite. The staff is friendly. Housekeeping was responsive. The front desk is not as friendly and could provide a more friendlier welcome. There was not much information provided, no lai and no smiles. Just checked in. Don't expect to be treated any different than a basic hotel guest, but wait, there was no daily housekeeping, not even a mid-stay tidy for our 4 day stay. The Hilton Hawaiian Village where this is located is nice, no need to leave but very expensive to dine. I suggest venturing beyond the resort the first day. There are great options nearby. It was far from bad,we enjoyed our stay, it was just not what we expected. Would I stay again? Yes, now that I know what to expect I would book the Grand Islander. This is the latest Hilton property that we were promised. It is awesome. If you intend to do Honolulu I would recommend that tower. For what I paid for the VIP package it was not the owner experience we we promised.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel fasility was very expensive. For example valet parking costs $50. Rental for umbrella for the beach around $45 ...If you are not a club member they told us they don’t clean the room every day.The pool was very crowded , done kids jumped over one of the rocks in to the pool. This endangered some of the kids and people that were in the pool. There was no supervisor to keep an order there and people safe.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: BA fan clogged w/lint, so hardly moved any air.Over cooktop light didn't work.Had to request blender.Pillows way too soft for comfortable sleep!! Requested option no better, also 'dead'.Noise like furniture scraping/being moved around on wood floors in rm 3211 above us, all hours.Hairs found in BA.One lamp in LR had no switch, so had to unplug to turn off.Dishwasher did poor job (on it's most aggressive settings) & the detergent tabs for it left many water spots.PS2 use for DVDs very awkward at best.DVD selection in lobby machines by elevator was very limited, way worse than Redbox.But great location!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Check in and check out was easy and quick. Rooms are clean and quiet. Pool areas are nice but busy. Great views in all directions. Beach area is great but a little rocky. WI-FI is not that strong in the rooms. Overall this is a great place to stay and I would highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Room is very comfortable and useful.Activitise are good for us.We enjoy some pools and walking beach in the early morning and sunset.Fireworks on Friday night is very beautifuland Fantastic!Staffs are yery kind!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Brought the kids to Hawai’i for the 1st time. They loved the pool! The room had a great view. Kinda loud when the rooftop luau is going on. The rooms are well appointed and staff friendly. Nice places to eat around area.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had an amazing time at the Hilton Grand Waikikian and cannot recommend it enough. The staff alone make this place worth 5/5 stars. Everyone from the front desk agent, bell staff, valets, housekeeping, and gift shop attendants showed much aloha spirit as they did there jobs over and above the service I expected. The rooms were beautifully decorated, with comfortable beds, a gaming/DVD system, washer and dryer, dishwasher and complete kitchen. Perfect little home away from home! The grounds are beautiful and you have everything you need without even leaving the property!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel itself is fantastic. Our room was wonderful - good size and a fantastic view. Club ownership is where this falls short. The parking fees charged were outrageous. Free or greatly reduced parking should be a perk of club ownership with as much money is spent on membership. Additionally, having concierges whose primary focus is to get you to a sales presentation or upsell you while you are on vacation is poor form. I am seeing less and less value in Club ownership as the years pass. They will nickel-and-dime you in addition to the significant fees already being paid.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our room was a 2bdrm, 2ba condo type unit, but it was as elegantly appointed as a Hilton hotel room AND with full, daily service. Stupendous!The resort was everything that we wanted except that the weather didn't cooperate and we had a cloudy, rainy weekend and the pools were too cool to be thoroughly enjoyed.Outside of that, the hotel was perfect and had its own lobby, which was less busy than the main lobby for the Hilton Hawaiian village hotel.This is our third Hilton resort and this one had the most restaurants and stores available BY FAR. I found this resort a few years ago and had been wanting to come here for years and every expectation was met or exceeded!Resorts are pricey, but sometimes you need the resort experience and renting a house doesn't compare.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our Ohana from the Big Island was very impressed by the hospitality of the staff and 2bedroom we stayed in was beautiful and very roomy!If given the opportunity will stay here again with out a doubt!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My kids first vacation, their 1st hotel stay n this hotel made it so exciting for them, my kids didnt wanna leave,they had so much fun at the pool, the water slide connects n u can swim a little more down n u will go under the bridge to another pool

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location! It’s promotes great access to various locations and links to exursions via multiple transportation options. Amenities are great! The food options onsite and off site were easily accessible.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Perfect for families fantastic pool and beach options. Suites were. Wet clean and spacious but the beds were horrible and very uncomfortable. It was a bit of a walk to the main wakiki strip and decent restaurants so plan on lots of walking and definitely take a stroller for the little guys.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: highly recommend staying here. The service, rooms and staff are wonderful. I took my whole family and we had a great time exploring Hawaii and the Hilton village. One thing, might want to bring your own pillow, they are extremely soft. We all had a hard time sleeping on them

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We've stayed as HGVC guests and regular patrons. We love this location. Easy access to Waikiki, great beach access, lots of family activities, excellent service, fabulous pools, great food options. Our kids love it!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Is a beautiful place directly on Waikiki beach. The pool is beautiful but the hot tub has everybody in it cost of parking was expensive $52 a day everything else is great.Beautiful views awesome restaurants.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are here for a night vacation in a 2-bedroom premier room. The room is nicely furnished, and we have an ocean view (obstructed by the Rainbow and Lagoon towers). Like most of the HGVC properties we've stayed in, there are nice amenities and the room is nicely appointed. However, we definitely prefer the Lagoon Tower (wasn't availability for our stay this time). In the Lagoon Tower 2 bd, the living area is more separate from the Grand Waikikian, where the bedrooms flank the living area. It's also a much longer walk through the hotel to get to the resort grounds.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The resort/hotel is beautiful. There are different towers and with that different pool areas, grills/restaurants. There are different customer desks throughout with staff ready to help with questions, tour bookings, etc. The only thing we struggled with was getting Uber drivers to get to the front of the hotels. It seems that it is confusing for most with the different towers there. Overall, nice.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Sounds like a great hotel, but buyer beware. The Grand Waikikian tower is dated, dirty and the views are obstructed by buildings no matter what floor you are on or what view you’ve booked (we saw all types of views as we had to move rooms many times as a result of maintenance malfunctions, cleanliness etc. - food from a previous stay was even found in our freezer when we checked into a room that had been “cleaned”.) While the hotel claims renovations are planned in the next year, they don’t make you aware of this - you find out by reading reviews on the internet. The village the resort is situated in offers convenience to food, shopping etc. - all of which they advise you can charge to your room as they are part of “Hilton Hawaiian Village Waiiiki Beach Resort” - they don’t tell you that you will have issues charging to your room everywhere you go. Hilton will claim it is an individual vendor issue - the vendor will claim it is a Hilton issue. And if you call the front desk about it, they will be rude, dismissive and unwilling to help clamining these are independet vendors and not part of Hilton (yet, they are listed as part of Hilton village when they entice you to stay here.) Guess they want to make it as difficult as possible to spend those grand experience dollars they offer. This resort is terrible for kids. While I am sure many kids come back often, the kid pools are in the shade almost all day so the water is too cold to swim in, there is little to no seating around the pool, and no playground. Some may be used to limited amenities for kids - in our experience kid friendly hotels offer so much more. The beach the resort is on is not private so be prepared for panhandlers to solicit you while you are trying to relax and pickpockets scoping out your valuables while you swim in the water. If you are headed down as part of a marketing package, be prepared for everyone at the hotel to remind you that you do not own and are here on marketing dollars and they can’t help you. Then, after you are poorly treated, they will ask you to impulse purchase into their hotel timeshare program - why would anyone want to buy into a hotel where the accommodations are less than standard and the staff makes you feel like you don’t matter? All in all, this was a mediocre experience so while it may sound like an awesome deal, be prepared to be stressed while on vacation.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The size of the resort is daunting and has zero charm. The sole intent is to keep the guest on property and spend money here. Don't bother with a partial ocean view room because it'll be a city view and they will say, "if you look over the balcony, you can see the water." Spare me.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed here on one of the HGVC marketing deals. Our room was a low floor with "city view" which was really looking down a busy street. We kept the curtains closed. We were supposed to have a "resort view" but received no explanation of the switch. The room was really nice, and the staff was excellent. This building (Grand Waikikian) is a bit of a walk to the pool/lagoon/beach but overall a very nice building. The HGVC pitch was the big downer. It took longer than promised, and we felt like we needed to take a shower after. It was a total used car salesman experience complete with being held in a small room and told we couldn't leave until the "manager" checked us out. The "manager" did another hard sell routine. Even after that we had to have another person come in and try more tactics. I'd rather pay full price than do that again. If you want a decent place to stay in a beautiful resort, this is a reasonable choice, but stay away from the HGVC sales pitch. It left us with an overall dissatisfied feeling.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights while attending a conference in the HHV complex. The unit we had was a 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo-like unit with a full kitchen. The beds were comfortable and the baths nicely appointed. The HVAC was abysmal and the only ceiling fan is in the living room. We went to Target and bought a small fan for our bedroom that allowed us to sleep with some degree of comfort. The lanai was spacious, had a table, four chairs, and a city and partial ocean view. The traffic noise was overwhelming and made sitting on the lanai somewhat unpleasant. Staff were quite nice and the HVAC maintenance man apologized for the disgustingly filthy filters. Though changing them did little to make the AC work any better. Honolulu is a BIG, loud, crowded city and we only go because of the conference that is there every year. We try to spend as little time there as we can. However, this is a better place than many in this large complex of condos and hotels and having your own kitchen is really plus!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian entrance and public areas are certainly a wow factor, but ends once you enter the condo. The furniture, bedding, and most importantly the dishwasher are in desperate need of an update. (0r maybe a serious cleaning of the dishwasher’s interior at the least). Granite countertops and other kitchen appliances are ok, but utensils in the kitchen are very minimal so don’t expect to be able to do much cooking. View of ocean from the lanai, but outdoor furniture is pretty shabby. Bathrooms appear to have been updated not too long ago. Kitchen, dining, and living area pretty small. The Hilton village is massive with several restaurants, pools, shops, car rental, and beach right here. You wouldn’t have to leave the property if you didn’t want to. Short walk to Food Pantry for better selection of grocery items (not a supermarket but has most what you’d need). Wouldn’t hesitate to stay on property again, but would choose a different tower until this one has been updated.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband and I with our 3 adult children enjoyed our time at The Grand Wakikian. We were on the 32nd floor and the view was amazing. We watched the sunrise every morning and the Friday fireworks from our balcony. (great fireworks!)There were a few minor annoyances, but most services were excellent. I would recommend this to all who can afford it!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights in a 1 bedroom partial ocean view room. We were pleasantly surprised by the generous layout of the room and fittings. My son loved the resort facilities and playstation in the room. It was quiet and right near the paradise pool and lagoon. We will return.Only slight frustration was that the HGV will not advise you that they will charge your credit card for charges you make to your room nor do they communicate they are doing this until you see daily charges for items you thought were being tallied for final payment on checkout being charged to your card each day! Might as well not charge anything to the room as it defeats the purpose! A quick text or call to advise that this will occur or to remind us to top up our room credit would have been appreciated. Our stay was wonderful minus this hiccup. John was understanding and managed to sort it all out which was appreciated.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Be careful if booking. Impossible to modify the reservation. Front desk will transfer you to Las Vegas headquarters, who will then transfer you after a long hold and hang up.It is a Hilton property but Hilton customer service can not even contact this branch. Worst hotel experience ever.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We were contacted by Hilton with a great offer to stay at this hotel. The 2 BD suite was nice enough. Other reviewers say dated, and yeah a bit but mostly the issue is with overcrowding. As usual, people come down to the pool area, drop towels on chairs and disappear for the day so if you’re trying to watch your kid swim there’s no place for you to sit. I was disappointed there’s no lifeguards... how is that even possible in a massive child’s pool with 3 water slides where the view is often obstructed? The Lagoon Bar served my drink with a paper straw. Don’t get me wrong, I’m in favour of reducing plastic consumption and I actually don’t mind paper straws. What I don’t understand is the entire week we stayed here, we separated our plastics/glass/paper from our garbage and were told that the resort doesn’t recycle. Imagine how much product that could be recycled but is instead going out as waste! It’s Hawaii! Isn’t this state all about protecting the oceans? What the heck?! ... so they don’t recycle any of the waste from any of the rooms but they will give you a paper straw?? This is backwards. This property needs to recycle. The cost for a chair $18 /day for the beach and a beach Umbrella $35/day; are you nuts? That’s insane. There were people smoking on the beach and the resort said they can’t do anything about it. Great! Second hand smoke for all your little kids playing on the beach. The beach was sandy only in parts; the parts that were overcrowded. The rest of the beach was rocky. The room and amenities were fine. The restaurants are all way overpriced so prepare for that. The staff were extremely friendly and pleasant but we won’t go back.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed at Grand waikikian Great Location for Honolulu Able to walk to Waikiki and the mall. Close to surfing In Betweens Parking expensive but can park at close by marina for $1 per hour which is cheaper than hotel fees. Didn't need a car just a little too crowded for my taste but good for families

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We planned a staycation in Waikiki to celebrate the New Year and relax over the weekend to avoid driving and the traffic. While we took advantage of the full kithcen to prepare some meals during our stay. We found that Fresco's was an excellent dining experience on New Years. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. Definitely a great time had by all and enjoyed our stay. We can't wait until next year!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hawaiian Village has become very busy, and this means you will wait for every service. The rooms are tired, and the staff are over whelmed. Be careful with the pools as there are loud teenagers taking over the space.
user_name:
Cruiser39038940339
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Enjoyed our stay in a bedroom with partial ocean view. Loved the fact that they had a Bidet in the bathroom. Had a problem with the dishwasher and upon calling room service, someone came to fix it within 15 minutes.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family and I (wife and 3 young boys) stayed at the Grand Waikikian for 3 nights from 13 December to 16 December. This was our second stay at this hotel after a stay 4 years ago which we enjoyed very much. This stay was just as good. We were in a 2 bedroom apartment with partial ocean view. The room was great for the 5 of us with plenty of room for everyone. We found the room clean and the service each day to be of a high quality. We arrived after a 10 hour flight from Sydney in the early AM and were accommodated with a room which we were not expecting (did not happen on the first visit). This was greatly appreciated. The room itself has two bathrooms with a tub and two showers. The room was serviced each day. We had breakfast and lunch in the room each day by getting something either from in property (2 ABC stores to choose from) or one of the options across the road (Subway, sushi, Buffalo Wild Wings, McDonald’s, etc.). The balcony with a partial view of the ocean was nice because we had a great view of the city as well which was nice to relax on at night.The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping Mall which is convenient for some late night or early morning shopping. With kids it’s about a 20 minute walk each way to the main part of Waikiki which we did each night and was fine considering the big meals we had at Duke’s and the Cheesecake Factory.The apartment also has a TV in each room, full kitchen and washer dryer which is great for a family with kids. The pools were a highlight for my young sons with 3 water slides to choose from. The bigger water slides do require stronger swimmers or a flotation device. The Lagoon which is right next to the pool area was also a highlight and good for young children.Overall, the Grand Waikikian is an excellent hotel and we will look to stay there again in our next visit to Waikiki.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Grand Waikikian is definitely the place to stay if you want to be close to the beach and have access to different pools. Far way enough from the main Waikiki area where you can enjoy the place with less people.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We go to Hawaii every year. This time I thought I would book another hotel for 3 nights of our 9 night stay. I chose to stay in the grand Waikikian with partial ocean front 1 bedroom suite. First of all there isn't enough staff at the front desk so we were left waiting for quite a while and after a long flight ( And the price you pay per night ) its not worth it. The room was the most disappointing. Our view wasn't partial ocean view, we had a few of the car park, other hotels and road. The balcony / partial ocean view was a total waste of money. The staff at the front didn't rush to help us with our bags, they just stood there. I haven't experienced this in any other hotel in Hawaii. I will give them credit for the bed being amazingly comfortable and the cleaning staff assisted my when my daughter vomited. Thank you to those lovely ladies. The hotel is to far from everything thats " Happening " If you are someone who likes to be where its all happening, where its busy and all the restaurants are in walking distance, especially with little kids then this hotel isn't for you. We always stay at the Outrigger Waikiki on the each and won't make the mistake to change again. The pool is good, if you have children. Its easy having a kitchen so you can cook and wash your clothes in the washing machine. The Tv was also good with heaps of options.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is in a nice location in Waikiki. It is part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village so there are lots of little shops, restaurants, beach activities, etc. We are Hilton Diamond members so we try to stay at Hilton products when available. This hotel is not directly on the beach, it is a short walk through the complex, so not too inconvenient. Positives:The set up of the unit is very nice for families.
