We travelled with our adult children and two grand babies who are 2 yrs and 6 mths old. The unit has 2 bedrooms, one BR with a bathroom that had a tub & shower. The second BR had 2 Double Beds & a bath with a shower. There is also a sofa bed in the Family Room. It was convenient to have a full kitchen, especially with young children in tow. There are service settings for 6 people (plates, bowls, silverware, etc) and a table & breakfast bar for dining. There are 3 TV's in the unit (1 in each BR + FR). There is a stacked washer/dryer in the unit which is nice so you don't have to take home dirty laundry. The staff at the hotel were very kind, they went out of their way to help you (with the exception of one of the pool towel guys who was very rude). We called many times for extra towels for the room (they would only supply 5 towels for some reason) plus we called for baby portable cribs, and they arrived within minutes of our request.The hotel lobby & exterior was decorated beautifully for Christmas and there were many nice areas for photos. The pool at this hotel is convenient for families, located just outside the lobby and it has several water slides for children and a slightly bigger slide that older kids/teens would like. There is a food stand by the pool so you can get treats, drinks, shaved ice, etc. There are several other pools at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, but we only went to the one at the Grand Waikikian. They have 3 DVD rental machines, kind of like Redbox, but you don't pay since it's part of the resort fee. That was nice to be able to relax and watch a movie in the evening. Within walking distance of the resort are many many shops and restaurants. We went to Hard Rock Cafe, Cheese Cake Factory & Outback which were all good. Within a few miles there are grocery stores, Walmart, Sams Club & Costco. The bellhops said that the Safeway store will deliver groceries to the hotel when you order online.Negatives:The unit itself was a bit run down. There were some kitchen cupboard doors that were coming off their hinges, the washer/dryer soap dispenser was falling apart, the extra blanket for the sofa bed had holes in it, the oven took FOREVER to heat up! There are no baking trays, we bought disposable aluminum trays to use. There is a safe in the room, but it was broken so we were nervous leaving computers, ipads, etc in the room. The toilet in one of the baths would run constantly & at times water would leak from the tank. There was a nice balcony, however the chairs were metal chairs with no cushions, so you had to put a towel, or one of the couch pillows on it, to be comfortable. We had booked an Ocean View Unit, and while you can see the ocean, it is not a direct view. There is another hotel in your view and the hotel is set back a ways from the ocean. The unit does not come with any condiments or spices for cooking, not even salt or pepper. Also there is not a blender in the unit (but we called down for one and they brought it promptly). The cleaning service was so-so. We only requested the unit to be cleaned every few days, but it seems like something was missed each time, like no spare trash bag, no dishwasher soap, not enough towels, etc. Parking is extremely expensive $47/day to park yourself, $50/day for valet. We did valet and the drivers were exceptional and courteous, it is just super expensive. Not only was parking expensive, but EVERYTHING at the resort is expensive. A teeny tiny pizza at Round Table (child size) was $10, a shaved ice at the pool was $10, the Luau pricing started at about $120/person. We went out to one of the restaurants the first night (Rocky's which used to be Benihanas), it was around $300 for 6 people & we did not even have any alcoholic drinks. The 2nd night we were at the resort, our little grandson ran into the table and cut his eye/face. We called down to front desk to find out where the closest urgent care was located so he could get stitches. They kept referring us to an in-house, on-call doctor. We kept asking for an urgent care, assuming the on-call Dr could not do stitches, or take the health insurance, but we were disconnected. It would have been nice if the front desk had emergency contacts for guests other than just telling us about an on-call doctor. While it is nice to have towels specifically for use at the pool, you need to be aware of the times that the towel stands are open (the towel stand at this hotel does not open till 9:30am) and DO NOT lose your pool towel card! This is not very convenient if you are heading out to another beach earlier in the morning. All in all it the hotel was nice, but I don't know that I would spend the money to stay here again (we paid $600/night for an ocean view room + resort fee & valet). I think I would look at other hotels or condos if we were to visit Oahu again in the future.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was a deception, I was invited as a VIP to purchase a time share, OMG what a scam, no soap in the room to clean hands, room keeping once a week only, not luxury like I would have imagine for this price, no bath tub in the room, very old furniture, the bed was very comfortable. Nice balcony with partial view of the sea. I felt really pressured during the time sharing meeting, the representative acted like my best friend until we started to ask question and ask for some time to think about it, the deal was now or never, like my money wouldn’t be good the next day. After searching on the Internet, did not regret not to purchase at all, turns out, lots of time share to sell, lots of unsatisfied customer because no ability to book once you purchase and it is not a rebate al all when you look at the maintenance fee.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I have been a HGV Elite owner with my husband for 6 years now. We have used our points in several locations and countries. We always have been satisfied with our accommodations everywhere except in Waikiki. The Grand Waikikian did not meet the standard of other Hilton properties we have used for the following reasons. First the appliances in the kitchen were old and the dishwasher was not working properly. We did report it to the front desk. A repair man came by and left us a card that he had replaced the parts but the whole problem to begin with is that it had not been maintained properly and is due to be replaced. It did not work better after the service call barely washing our dishes sometime we would have to run the cycles 2 or 3 time to remove the soap scum. There was a huge build up of soap inside that was never dealt with and it was pretty disgusting. Clearly the soap dispenser was not working. No one from management followed up with us to see if the problem had been resolved. Who wants to spend their vacation time dealing with maintenance issues. The clothes dryer was old and took forever to dry so we used the balcony to dry our items. All the Hilton kitchens has the same basic things this one had less for some reason and the equipment was dated and missing things. The TV remote control in the master suite could only changed the TV channels backwards. There was only one sink in each bathroom. The closet wardrobe door in the master room did not open properly. Overall the rooms looked dated. The living room sofa was extremely uncomfortable to sit in and was in need of re-upholstery from holes on in the arms. Also the mattresses where not comfortable and did not meet our standard. I found a lot of dead space in the main lobby with a lot of walking to get to the units. The pools were also very disappointing. There is not a lot of space to accommodate the guests. I just came back and this is not the busy season yet I can only imagine how much less space there will be at peak season. There is no section for adults. The beach towels are the worst towels I have ever have to use in any resort. There are smaller than the ones in our bedroom covering very little of the pool chair if you happen to be lucky to get one. There are also very thin and rough. You can use the pool at the Hilton but it is a long walk and the layout is poor. There is a beautiful lagoon that could accommodate the extra flow of guests but you have to pay $ 18.00 to rent a chair and an $30.00 to rent a parasol. That is ridiculous. In view of the fact that the lagoon was empty HGV should consider having more chairs and parasol for free at the lagoon for their members for free and also to make sure gets a place to sit outside. By the way there is no parasol in any of the pool areas which again I have never again in any resort. So if you go to the pool be prepared to have no shade depending on where you are sitting. Also be prepared to pay $ 47.00 per day for valet parking or $ 43.00 to park your car rental per day. I find those rates again very stiff. I parked in downtown Vancouver hotel at a high end hotel the week prior and I paid $ 40.00. This is not the Ritz and I think they should make the parking rates more reasonable and give a special rates to the HGV owners.We did like the location and the Hilton HawaiianVillage with all the shopping and amenities. I think the The Grand Waikikian need a huge make over and a review of how their property is managed. I am no sure I could ever go there again unless they improve their accommodation. I do not feel we got our money's worth this past week.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Local resident enjoying a staycation and it felt like a vacation! Accommodations were cosy, location was ideal with shops nearby or convenient trolley to take you there. The only thing was the internet did not reach the pool. But I shouldn't be on my phone at the pool if I'm there to relax, right?

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It's a huge hotel, half condos / timeshares, and very kid-friendly in a great location. That said...a bit old-fashioned, with bars and pools closing down early and only middling music and food. A good "starter" introduction to Hawaii, but not, for most, for repeat trips.....

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Spent five nights at the Grand Waikikiian and it honestly felt like coming home. Everyone was very friendly, pleasant, and full of the aloha spirit. We didn’t want to leave! You honestly don’t need to leave the Hilton Hawaiian Village to have a great time. It’s all there!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We visited Hawaiian village in 2014 without the kids. We made the promise to return with them so 4 years later we seized the opportunity. So happy we did.......This time we stayed in the suite so we had plenty of room. Beautiful views all around.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This resort is awesome! So much to do here. I have a 2 and 5 year old...they loved all the water activities, the pools, water slides, lagoon and the beach. Lots of restaurants close by. The only draw back is it is farther from the action on the "strip" so kind of a walk, but you have everything right there no need to leave. The kitchen was a plus we didn't do much cooking but the kids could have their mac and cheese and chicken nuggets. And the extra space is awesome with 2 little ones. Would definately stay here again. Very pretty and clean resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We love vacationing in Honolulu and roaming around Oahu. It is our second favorite Hawaiian vacation after Maui. We found the service at the Grand Waikikian outstanding. We has a great view from our room, it was quiet and peaceful. The property is just fantastic. Beautiful grounds with a great lobby.The location let's you walk to all of Wakiki and the great shopping area and retaurants.The staff right from the valets, bellmen and front desk were just great.Only two minor complaints. The self parking is an issue. We tried it one day and went back to valet. It was worth the extra $7 per day.Second, we went to tropics 4 times. We really enjoyed it, good food and music at night. They need some more good retaurants.
user_name:
Joe W
san francisco, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Room location can make or break the trip. A view of loading docks and bird feces is not my idea of lovely location! Rooms are very nicely done. Nice kitchen too. Parking is a bit painful - quite a lot to pay for nightly self parking. May not want to get a rental car in that case.
user_name:
Alicia Wolanski B
Santa Clarita, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had an amazing stay at the Grand Waikikian. It is in a very convenient location - plenty of shops in the nearby Hilton Village, swimming pool was great, and you have access to all pools in the Hilton Village - and of course the ocean and the Marina were lovely.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Pros: The rooms were great. The staff friendly and helpful. The sights are beautiful. Cons: parking is expensive, no brewed coffee of site. Unless you can make do with 2 packs of sugar and a single pack of creamer they put in your room. You have to go to the icecream shop for $6 coffee. Crowded even on off season. Everything other than your room is an addition expense. No free breakfast, lunch or dinner. All items for water activities like paddle boards, are expensive to rent. The sun does not rise or set over the water at the resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed our seven Night stay at the resort. We had a large family and a two bedroom unit in the tower closest to the wharf. This was easy for catching ride shares and for using the bike system called Biki.The pools and lagoon are ahead with the younger children. There is a reef to snorkel out to for adults and plenty of water sports. There’s a surf break just off the jetty. The central location makes it easy to get around town and enjoy the highlights of Waikiki and Honolulu.The staff are friendly and attentive and the food on site is good. There are enough dining options and local spots to hit within walking distance. We only use the car to drive around to the North Shore. Parking is expensive so not having a car was useful.The dock boat tour of these for across the street and gives you good views of the island from the water. The zoo is a walk away and is another highlight. Overall great time we’ll be back.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Room 3011 city viewWe stayed for 12 nights and found the hotel & grounds to be everything we had hoped for. We never had to wait for sun beds and towels were always at the ready. Our suite was comfortable and our 6yr old daughter slept on the pullout sofa bed with no complaints .House keeping never rushed us ,as we do like a sleep-in & the room always spotless on our return in the evening. We made use of the kitchen as we had family around from other towers on the resort, everything I required to cook a decent meal was accessible . The Only thing that need attention was the dishwasher , very tired and ended up washing up by hand. The balcony was huge that stretched across the whole living room and bedroom but was a little windy on some evenings. Still 5* tho

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed in a one bedroom suite, with a partial ocean view. If the view is important, splurge for a room with a full ocean view. From our balcony, there was a large building blocking the sunset every night. That's the only negative part of this review. Our room was spacious with lots of amenities, like a large soaking tub, full kitchen, and washer/dryer. We were away from the noise and crowds of the Hilton Hawaiian Village, but the resort and all it's features were just steps away when we wanted to enjoy them. The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful, as were the concierges. The Grand Waikikian is close to shopping and restaurants and the beachfront location of the resort can't be beat. Would definitely recommend this resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian has an excellent location. On the beach and within walking distance of Downtown Honolulu. Staff was excellent and always helpful. Variety of things to do and numerous pools to use besides the beach. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed for six nights after our Maui trip. I'm a bit disappointed the second time around, the reception when I checked in, and the rooms that I booked was not what I was expecting. The housekeeping services was great.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a lovely resort. It is not right on the beach, as you have to walk out of the resort and around a building to get to the beach. Check in/out was great. The personnel were very professional, kind, and willing to answer any questions.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed here in 2010 when it had just been built. Nothing has changed in 8 years. This 2 bedroom unit appears stuck in time. Most of the appliances were broken or did not work properly. Bring a clothesline as none of the dryers work (they don't vent.) Beware, however, of the pigeon droppings.There is absolutely no shade here unless you move chairs every 10 minutes or rent an expensive beach umbrella.Sadly, the beach has become a large tourist trap with none of the local shops open any longer.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Recently stayed here with my son and fiance in a 1 bedroom suite on the 30th floor. First the good points. The room is beautiful with a stocked kitchen and comfortable beds and living space. From the balcony we had city views (even though I paid for a partial ocean view room) Some days we were just happy to stay in. The kitchen served us well since my fiance can prepare meals on the days we didnt feel like going out. Since our son has food allergies making eating out all the time difficult, having a kitchen was essential for us.....until the hot water stopped running. Front desk advised it was due to a leak and 'someone' was onsite fixing it and if we needed to take a shower we could go to level 8 to use the showers in the departure lounge. Only floors 28 and above were affected. No big deal as we were expecting the issue to be resolved soon. My fiance and son had to shower on level 8. My fiance said it was a like a hostel experience, sharing a communal wash facility. The next day still no hot water and asked for a manager with an explanation and requested another room. This time 'Joe' a manager advised they were waiting for a specialist to arrive onsite and that no rooms were available. He also said they were waiting for upper mangement to decide on a strategy based on how 'inconvenienced' guests were before deciding on compensation. As we had plans to go out for the day we hoped it would have been resolved by late afternoon after we came back which wasnt the case. This time we went down to the front desk and spoke to 2 resort managers. My fiance confronted the first manager demanding to find out what is actually being done to fix the hot water issue and if we could be moved to a similar room. Of course she didnt have a clue and went off somewhere to find an answer. Overhearing what was said the second resort manager advised a room was available. After telling him we were told a different answer he apologised and moved us to a similar room with hot running water. We were without hot water for 2 days and the way it was handled was just unacceptable. We basically had to confront the most senior resort manager to get something done or else nothing would have happened. For a name such as the Hilton to not have hot running water is inexcusable. Also they were still putting guests on the affected floors without telling them at check in which is a joke. In the end we managed to enjoy the rest of our stay but found out the hotel were waiting on a part to be shipped in from the mainland to fix the hot water issue. There was still no hot water after we checked out on the upper floors as far as we know. Hilton, need to get your act together this issue was a beyond a joke.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a one-bedroomed apartment. The bedroom was large, lots of space, lovely big bed. Nice kitchen, small dining table & chairs, Sofa & chair. Partial seaview from small balcony. Nicely shaped swimming pool, fun things for children, which we didn't use. We only had one night there so it all suited us fine.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Worst place to stay, unless you're willing to gamble with your Health & take a Risk, by staying at this Resort and breathing all of the Mold and Mildew to get you and your Family sick. Poor Customer service! No Housekeeping Service! Concierges are Useless and are Very Rude and Not Helpful. Worst place to stay. Save your money & go elsewhere!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed here for two weeks as Hilton Vacation Owners and absolutely recommend the Grand Waikikian.We had stayed on last visit at the Lagoon Tower and the Grand Waikikian, MUCH BETTER here.Here they are all suites. Our one bedroom is a suite and at least twice bigger than our Lagoon Tower one. Even though it's city view on the 15th floor, it's fantastic because of the huge balcony that connects both living room and bedroom. We get to watch sunrise every morning and it was beautiful. Facing East along Ala Moana Blvd was nice as I observed the tower across that's facing West had the sun beating down on them daily and it looked too hot for me. Our suite enjoyed the city view and the park below comfortably.Inside there's a full size kitchen with everything -- utensils, detergent, paper towels, silverware, pots and pans, microwave, fridge, rice cooker, coffee machine, dish washer etc etc. You just need to supply own food (ABCs are just few minutes walk. Food Pantry market in less than 10 minutes walk). Living room has a pullout sofa bed even for 3rd, 4th guests. But for 2 the suite is perfect. Flat screen TV, PlayStation 3, dining table. Plenty of closet, drawers, hangars. In room safe.Washer and dryer is what we like BEST. For 2 weeks stay it's a godsend to be able to do laundry (they even provided detergent).Bedroom had ultra comfy bed. TV, hot tub for 2 all add to the fun. Through bedroom door or living room door one can access into the bathroom. Good size, shower only but strong and hot. The fancy toilet seat that's commonly found in Japan is here. You can adjust water spray, heat etc to pamper your bottom. Soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion provided.WiFi was free, strong and fast. Entire property is well kept and tastefully decorated. There's even a water filling station on level 2 where in house convenient store is. Staff very helpful and courteous.Access to all the pools, the Lagoon and the beaches are only minutes away. I didn't find this tower any less convenient than other towers which maybe few minutes faster by walking. The whole HHV complex is huge, take your time to explore.Being at the West end of Waikiki we can walk to center of Waikiki in about 15 minutes. And walking towards the Ala Moana Mall took about as long.Then there is THE BUS which we used and can get us farther to downtown, Chinatown. There are plenty of food choices both at HHV and outside and around the area. ALL within walking distance.This trip we ditched the rental car idea totally (parking at HHV $43 per night) as we already did circle the Island etc on last trip. Been there, done that. Surfing and snorkeling is not our cup of tea.Transport between airport and hotel we used Johnny's Cab, online booking is easy couple days ahead, $25 set rate. Uber and Lyft are also widely available for short and medium quick trips around town and does not cost much.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very enjoyable and relaxing. The balcony is great to eat breakfast and watch the day start in a beautiful surrounding. Though i was there for a wedding anniversary, I wish I had the kids as well, as the water recreation opportunities were so abundant on the property.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We did a vacation trial at this resort and ended up investing in a timeshare with Hilton. We had a great experience for our honeymoon - friendly staff, clean rooms, well maintained hotel, lots of resort activities and awesome location in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a beautiful place to stay, with friendly staff. We had a couple of maintenance issues, but they were taken care of quickly. We had requested an ocean view and were disappointed to have the city view, but it was spectacular and we could see a section of the water with sail boats on it from the balcony. This is a very large complex, so get a map and venture around. If one pool is very busy, the next one might not be. Also, I would suggest using Charley's taxi from and back to the airport. The service we used dropped off a bunch of other people first and said they had to leave us at the bus depot, which was a long, confusing walk to our tower with suitcases and after an 8+ hour flight. Charley's charges $29 each way. Also, bring some plastic or paper bags with you if you plan to purchase any items. Most stores charge for bags. Hope this is helpful. We enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have stayed at the Hilton Grand Waikikian in Honolulu twice. Both times were fantastic. Located right beside Ala Moana Boulevard, the Grand Waikikian is a little ways back from the beach unlike some of the other towers in the Hawaiian Village. It’s a great place because the whole village is filled with stores priced from low cost souvenir shops to even a Louis Vuitton store. Lots of eateries and ice cream, fresh yogurt, coffee shops...you name it. The grounds are well kept and the place comes alive during Christmas, which is when we went twice.Walking distance to the Ala Moana mall, and to Waikiki. Depending on the room, you may get a partial ocean view or a city view. Either way, it’s panoramic. Most of the suites are time share rentals and is part of Hilton Grand Vacations. It’s pricey but you get what you pay for.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Anyone considering staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, stop thinking. We have stayed here twice now once in the Rainbow Tower and this time in the Grand Waikikian. The Grand Waikikian is perfect for a family. Kitchen, washer dryer and seperate lounge room makes it the perfect accommodation. Staff are friendly, Ocean View room is awsome. Love it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I came with a group of friends and stayed in the Penthouse (35th floor) and I thought I could touch the clouds! The service was top notch. Daily Pu Pu and morning breakfast service was the bees knees. The resort was pretty incredible. If you ever have a chance to visit. Spend the money and come. I would repeat this vacation over in a heartbeat if given the chance. The resort had everything you need and then some. Well worth the money.
user_name:
rhall26
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is an excellent place to bring family for a stay on Oahu. Couples seeking a quieter more intimate setting might consider another Hilton property adult oriented but if you have your children or grand children, this is the place.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Property and amenities were pretty good. Valet service could improve by having more than 1 person working. Cost was a bit higher than we thought it should be, but still our family truly enjoyed our time there.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Urban beach vacationing with full amenities and a whole village of wonderful shops and restaurants make this an ideal place to vacation at Waikiki. This was incredibly helpful during the few days of Hurricane Lane which amounted to no major weather disaster but we did have to change plans and do stuff at the resort only for 3 days. But they did have 2 of the pools open and the beach so it was nice to be able to do stuff and access food and shopping right here. Great staff and just a wonderful resort with an owner’s lounge where you can shower and relax after checking out.
user_name:
Keith O
Great Neck, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Couldn’t have asked for a better resort. Out of all the places we have travelled this was by far our favourite stay. This is a huge resort so be prepared to walk a lot. However there is so much to see and do on the resort you will never be bored. Lots of shops, restaurants, spas, pools, the beautiful beach and lets not forget the amazing lagoon! Our hotel room was huge. We had a 3 bedroom penthouse. The balcony went around most of the room! We had a gorgeous corner suite. Full kitchen so we could cook (didn’t do a lot of cooking, but when we did it saved money). We stayed 10 days in this room. Had a huge living room. Ocean view. Very clean and spacious. Part of our family went home so we then moved to a 2 bedroom suite. Just as beautiful with a kitchenette. The resort is spectacular. Pricey so be sure to bring cash. It’s not an all inclusive resort so you do need some money on you. It’s like a mini city on the resort. It’s also within walking distance of the ABC stores and groceries. Nearby is a mall so we rented a car and toured the ENTIRE island. Just an incredible trip. Pools are very clean. Several of them around the resort. We found them to be a little chilly so our kids preferred the ocean and the lagoon. The sand is soft and white. The lagoon you can paddle boat and board in. My kids caught little fish with their hands then released them. We could snorkel there. The ocean is clear and calm. Could snorkel also. Ate at most of the restaurants on the property. Did a little shopping however it’s cheaper off the resort. Nice marina to check out also. The spa is wonderful! Overall it was an incredible vacation. I don’t think you will be sorry if you stay here. I can only speak on the tower we stayed in but there are others to choose from.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Nice rooms, and very clean. The property is getting a bit outdated on electronics. There are lots of pool and beach options super close by. The pools can be crowded though. It's a bit of a walk to Waikiki where most of the good restaurants are. Food options at the resort are limited to casual restaurants.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great Great Great. Fantastic hotel and enjoyable stay. 2 Bedroom was very big, clean and comfortable and the kitchen well appointed. Located in the Hawaiian Village good location for tours, beaches, Luaus, Shopping Centre etc. the hotel shared facilities such as the massive gyms, owners lounges, ice cream shops etc. We had a splendid one week stay with enjoyable moments especially at this hotel. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This place is so amazing, beautiful decor throughout and clean..luxurious in suite tub..also it was the first time I've ever used a smart toilet.the employees were very friendly and helpful. I would love to stay here again..A+++.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed 3 nights in mid-July at this resort, it is part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We are members of Hilton Grand Vacation and spent the extra points to stay at an Ocean View room. We had a good view of the Ocean from the 16th floor. Unfortunately, we were on the west side of the building and not able to see the sunrise and our view of the sunset was blocked by the high rise building west of us. We did have a view of the luau they hold during the evening. The room is like an apartment, complete with oven/stove, full refrigerator, washer/dryer, etc. On Friday nights, they have a fireworks display in front of the rainbow tower that is tough to see from our balcony (half our party stayed back in the room). My wife and I went for a walk along the beach to catch the sunset and stayed by the lagoon to watch the fireworks. They have several tours of around O'hau that pick up at the Hilton Hawaiian Village bus terminal. We were also able to catch a "lyft" from the airport to the hotel without issue, so we did not have to rent a car during our stay and pay an extra nightly parking fee. Overall excellent trip. We will be back and looking to stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian is a beautiful hotel. The Hawaiian village is fun. Beautiful green blue water right outside your door. Don’t get there before check in time, unless you have plans for something to do offsite. The pool was very crowded and so was the beach.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: no complaints at all, access to all the hilton pools. just a wonderful place to be. Rooms were very nice at the Grand Waikikian. The staff was very helpful everything was within walking distance. The view of honolulu was amazing from the 10th floor of the hotel. Great place to enjoy family.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Beautiful 2 bedroom suite that was ocean front really impressed me. The rooms are spacious, master has a king and the other a queen. Beautiful terrace in the main room overlooks the beach view and also the 2 bathrooms were very nice. Master bedroom had a triangular tub and the toilet had a state of the art electric Bede for cleaning with temperature controls and air dry. That alone was an experience. The kitchenette was a nice size and it functioned well for the most part, just doesn’t have large pans for Big omelette or stir frying, small batches is what you’ll have to do. The cleaning ia offered on day 3 of a 7 day stay and they are very accommodating of any requests you make for additional supplies. All in all a classy place with great service. Note, they don’t have any restaurants on the immediate property although there’re plenty of options all around. Also no food in a room service option as this a vacation ownership and not a hotel.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Not a great chain of Resturants. Very expensive to stay in village, very crowded each and pool areas rentals on beach expensive also, on the whole a nice family atmosphere, not so much for couples. Everything seemed so over priced, especially to eat

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Booked a 2 bedroom suite, stayed for a week. Hotel was amazing. Our room was on one of the higher floors, had a complete kitchen, and 2 bedrooms, one with its own bathroom. The hotel was very accommodating with any request we had, including having fans for us to barrow. This hotel is part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village resort, so you get access to all the pools on property, but the beach is steps away. There are so many good restaurants with walking distance too. We went to Walmart and bought breakfast food to save money and allow us to get out and about earlier.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Alas, it was over 12 months ago... but we've spent the last year a bit trying to find time to go back.And we'd stay at the Grand Waikikian again... absolutely.The cluster of about 5 Hilton facilities is great as they share the majority of the amenities but the good ting about the Grand is that it has its own Check in desks. The rest, at least at the time we were there, shared a great big area for check in. We were about half way up the tower with a street view, but even that is OK because you can see some mountains, some ocean, marina, and business of Honolulu.Service was great. black out curtains very good, as we slept in until about 1000 on our first morning - partially jet lag (no one having slept on the flight from Sydney, and partially simply because we didn't have daily jobs to do. The lady doing housekeeping, inadvertently woke us, wanting to service the room. But she was great about it, and was more than happy to give us time to get up and going.Beds were comfy. ablutions spotless. Couldn't hear any neighbours. Plenty of cooking facilities in our little apartment. couple of TVs. plenty of towels available from the kiosks around the grounds. I could go on, but it was awesome. Would definitely go back.... and will continue to try and find the time to do so!!!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our first time to Hawaii and This resort was has great views and excellent amenities. The kids had a great time and can’t wait to come back. The sofa sleeper is small for two kids to share I would recommend getting a second bedroom.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village and Beach resort is the perfect location right next to the beach. Staff is very helpful and professional. The rooms are clean and very spacious. The resort has many food and shopping options

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Three years since our last visit to Hawaii, we returned to the Hilton Hawaiian Village, only this time we stayed in the Grand Waikikian, in a self contained apartment. What a wonderful complex this is, spectacular gardens and pools, surround luxurious accommodation. We saved a fortune on food, simply by finding a Safeway Supermarket (definitely not one of the ubiquitous ABC Stores) and preparing our own breakfasts. Not having to eat out, for every meal, with a family of five, sure makes your holiday dollar go further.We loved this accommodation, it was clean, modern, spacious, comfortable and beautifully maintained. We had two bedrooms, two bathrooms a rollaway bed and a fully equipped kitchen. All with spectacular views over Waikiki Beach. We rented a car for two weeks and booked a parking spot at the nearby, Hale Koa, undercover car park. They rent parking either daily or monthly. At $180 US for a month, it’s very economical, even if you only use it for a couple of weeks. It’s only a short walk from the Hawaiian Village and it’s safe and secure.A fabulous holiday destination, which I recommend, whole heartedly. We will certainly return there again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: All the furniture is very Hawaii like.It felt good and relaxing. I could enjoy staying with my family.Hilton Hawaiian village has everything you need you really should go and stay at the Hilton Hawaiian village.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Employees were very helpful. They made checking-in and out very easy. We arrived early before the check-in time and they were able to set us up. We only had to wait for a text to let us know what room we were assigned. Unfortunately, we did not get a higher floor room which we wanted. The room was clean and they are cleaned once a week. We simply call and get our hotel supplies promptly. There are several pools. However, at the time we were there, they were pretty crowded.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed here for our first trip to Hawaii and would definitely stay again. The village had everything from a small shop to buy breakfast items and medicine, to a wonderful coffee shop and great restaurants. The beach access was convenient and our suite perfect for us. The workers in the village and at the hotel were great- especially with the bell services.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a very nice hotel in the middle of everything. We stayed in the 2 room suite. It has 2 bed/2 bath, washer and dryer, full kitchen, living area and we had a nice view of Waikiki beach. The hotel rooms are nice. My only issue was the furniture looks a little worn. But the rooms are clean with all the amenities you need. We are a Hilton timeshare owner so I’m not sure what the price would be. But with all the amenities in the room and with grocery stores, shops, restaurants and the beach just steps away, it might be worth it!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This facility inside the Hilton Village offered a two-bedroom 2-bath condo style room with a full kitchen, and partial views of the ocean. This facility is within walking distance of the beach, ABC Store, and many different eateries. The sweet that we had was more like a home. It had a complete kitchen stock with all essential appliances and dishes.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Best hotel ever! Nice staff, clean hotel, we will go back again! Nice to have washer/dryer in the room. Beautiful atmosphere. Friendly staff, pretty view, Room had everything we needed, maid staff was very thorough & friendly.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our friends have a timeshare here. The atmosphere and decor is very different here to the other tower we stayed in to start with (Tapa) much nicer. More relaxed. The ‘room’ we have is two bedrooms, both en-suite with a communal lounge, dining and kitchen area. Very, very nice.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It’s been about 10 years since our last visit to this property, and our first in the Grand Waikikian. The facilities are wonderful, with multiple pools, an ocean lagoon, beach front access to one of the best known beaches in the world, and dozens of shops and restaurants right on property. Guest services were the most responsive of any other resort we’ve visited, and the fully equipped kitchen made in room meals possible. One new (to me) feature that we absolutely loved was the wristband access keys. No more fumbling for cards or keys - an easy touch of the wrist to the door, or even the parking access provided immediate access to locked doors. That they were also waterproof meant I never had to take the band off in my 2 week stay.We had a 2 bedroom, partial ocean view unit with an external lanai. It provided perfect positioning to enjoy the dinner shows and the multiple fireworks displays right from our lanai. Enjoying morning coffee while viewing the beautiful Waikiki coastline is hard to surpass. Location is the key, as they say, and the Hilton Hawaiian Village is perfectly situated between Ala Moana and Waikiki shopping and dining. I look forward to returning to this property before another 10 years passes.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Horrible attitude from staff member and continued issues at Pool bar food area. We sat down with 4 people and had people walking by on sidewalk and they stopped to say hi. They did not sit down and eat just were there for a couple minutes. Then when the check came it had bill noted as large party and gratuity was included. When I asked about it she said she is trained to do that so I asked to speak to a manager. When the manager arrived I explained the situation and he stated that I am not allowed to curse at staff. First off I did not ever curse and I nicely asked to speak with a manager. When we went back the same staff member would talk bad about us and you could see her talking to other staff members about us. Completely unprofessional and awkward. Very ucalled for.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We arrived in Honolulu to a beautiful resort with a pleasant staff. Nothing out of the ordinary. I was a bit disappointed we did not have a direct ocean view until I saw the Honolulu views. Wow! The stark contrast of the city and the sand is such a dichotomy. Pros: Great beach, Great views, comfortable beds and friendly staffCons: Crowded beaches, Overcrowded pools, (seroiusly, where do all those 3 year old pee?), and no beach chairs or unbrells unless you want to pay $16 each.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family's first trip to Hawaii was an excellent one. The hotel has enough activities to accommodate everyone in the family. Location and staff was great! 2br suite was spacious enough for our family of 5.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: What a beautiful hotel! Overall the entire property is beautiful. Our suite was very nice and views gorgeous. Most staff are friendly, food good but over priced. Love the fireworks on Friday evenings.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We truly enjoyed our stay at the Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations. The hotel rooms are beautiful and spacious. The staff is friendly and have been very helpful when called upon. There are lots of things to do in the Hilton Hawaiian Village including swimming, shopping and places to eat. Honestly, I think this place has everything you need to have a great family vacation. Well, except for one thing… As a property owner, Hilton typically wants you to sit in on a 60-90-minute presentation to update owners on the newest happenings within the Hilton brand. Since Hilton is a very reputable organization with very good product offerings, I don't understand why they put their owners through high-pressure sales pitches using questionable sales tactics. Here are a couple of claims that were made to us during our presentation:First, my wife told the salesmen that the last presentation we sat through, she felt the salesmen was not straight with us. Our salesman told us not to worry because Hilton has eliminated 90% of the staff. (This may be true but seems a little fishy to me.)Next, we were asked to sign up for a new credit card that would give us more points per purchase than our existing Hilton American express. We would get up to 12 points per dollar spent. (This may be true as well but why is Hilton trying to get me to sign up for a new credit card. Seems strange.)Next, we were told about the new "Maximize your point feature." The salesmen stated that this new feature is only available to those owners who purchase an "every year plan." And this new feature would be available 15 minutes after we upgraded our plan. Our current plan provides points every other year which means we need to upgrade our plan to qualify. To prove his point, the salesmen showed me a property in Italy, that last year would require 200,000 Hilton Honor points to book. But as a yearly owner using the "maximize your point," I could now book this property for 17,000 points per night. (WOW). I pulled up Italy on my phone and saw a property for 240,000 Hilton Honor points per day. The difference was the salesmen was showing me a cheaper property in Italy during a non-peak time, and the property I found was more expensive booked during peak time. In short, this had nothing to do with a “maximize your point feature,” but everything to do with peak seasons and hotel selection. Lastly, during the presentation, I noticed that I could not pull up my Hilton account on my phone while logged into Hilton's WiFi. I had to either switch on my VPN or log off the Hilton WiFI and use my cellular account. Of course, there is no way for me to verify this, but it appeared that they were blocking access to my Hilton account, so I could not validate their story. Just my guess. So what's my point? I love the Hilton product. Since being members, we have visited three Hilton properties, and they all have been great. The only downside to our vacations has been these high-pressure presentations. My suggestion to Hilton? Let your property, your name, and the excellent vacation experiences that you provide sell your products. Please stop the high-pressure sales and questionable sales tactics.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We holiday in Hawaii almost every year as we have a time share at the Hilton Hawaiian Village on Waikiki beach. We love it. This year we were there with the whole family and stayed at the Grand Waikikian. Amazing accommodation. The view we had was partial ocean view on the 10th floor. The only negative was looking at the top of the car park which could be improved with some fake grass and ornamental palms. The staff and the facilities are amazing. 10 out of 10.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Please be careful when selecting currency rate. We booked our accomodation under the Australian Dollar instead of USD by mistake.We thought we got a great deal at $5700 for 11 nights.However we discovered on arrival it was actually costing us $8081 for 11 nights.We loved the hotel & couldn't give a bad review for them.We were over $2000 out of pocket from day one. This affected our time there as we then had to watch every penny for the whole vacation.Otherwise I highly recommend staying here. We were extremely happy with location & the suite catered to our families needs.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: this is an awesome location and facilityif you can get there make sure to book itthe rooms are wonderful, great pools, staff very helpful, lots of restaurants and shoppingwonderful views and close to all activities

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Nice location, property a little dated and rooms in disrepair. On site food options shut down at 8 pm. Common areas very crowded. Common areas were taken over by private function one night during fireworks. I was offended as an owner to be restricted from using main viewing area for fireworks (to rope it off for a private function) after spending quite a bit of money in buying time share and traveling to location.Beautiful views, many activities. Central location for activities in Honolulu but it is quite a walk to most off site restaurants. We were able to Uber to most in city locations, rented a car for off site locations (Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head, snorkeling, etc.)

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a great time at the Grand Waikikian. We booked a partial ocean view, one bedroom unit directly through Hilton, and got a real good price. We decided to add on to our Maui trip, and added 4 nights here on Oahu, before going back home to the mainland. We took a cab from the airport, no need for a car as everything we needed was in walking distance. Saved us a bundle of money, as parking was pretty expensive ($40) or so every night...The traffic is pretty congested, and I just didn't want to have to deal with it, turns out to be a good choice for the two of us. The cab rides were booked on line and only cost us $30 including tip each way. The driver was waiting for us at the airport, and twenty minutes later dropped us off at the Hilton.Check in was a breeze, we were given a room on the 27th floor, and as advertised had a partial (but pretty nice) ocean view from the balcony. I actually enjoyed the view of the mountains and nearby buildings and the Giilligans Island Boat Harbor as much as the ocean.. The view was amazing, I couldn't believe how lucky I was to have such a view as this.The one bedroom unit had a full kitchen, with all the necessary cooking tools. There was a full size refridgerator, with ice maker, a full size stove, oven and dishwasher. There were plenty of kitchen towels, and they give you two coffee packets for the Cuisenart Coffee Maker, which are replenished daily. The water tasted fine, but I prefer to use bottled water for the coffee and it did taste better with the bottled water. The ice cube maker in the fridge made plenty of ice, and it did not have any unpleasantness. Our ice tasted fine, not great, but fine. There is not very much storage for food items, so plan accordingly. Also, as there are no outdoor grill stations, you will have to broil those steaks in your kitchen oven.The living room was nice, and had been recently remodeled, I think, because the furniture was in surprisingly good condition. It was also very comfortable. The TV was on the smaller side, maybe a 43 inch screen? We didn't watch much TV, but there are three free Video Kiosks that allow you to borrow from, as often as you wish, and we watched a few movies.The bedroom and bathroom were clean, spacious and also in like new conditon. We enjoyed the view from our bedroom, as it looked out to Gilligan Island Harbor. The bathroom had a really unique toilet, I can't expain it, you have to see and experience it for yourself. It's something else.....The pool areas are, as you might expect, extremely crowded. The good news, you have Waikiki beach right there. We tried the pools a few times, but the noise and overcrowding made it unpleasant. I would probably consider the Alii building on our next visit, as they have a more controlled pool environment. The pool attendants did a good job trying to manage left towels on chairs, but the situation is pretty hopeless. The property is very underserved for pool access. For the size of this property, they need six or seven more pools, rediculous....We enjoyed the Village, the shops, restaurants, bars, and I think 3 ABC stores. We loved walking around the property through the small alley ways winding our way here, there, and everywhere. It was especially fun in the early evening, when it was all lit up, and not quite so hot outside, if had that Tokyo feel to it. We enjoyed it every evening.In summary, we had a very nice time at the Hilton Grand Waikikian. We loved having a one bedroom condo vs a hotel room, we loved the location, right on the beach, and we loved the friendly staff. We did not love the pool.....Not having a car, we walked up to Ala Moana Mall, to stock up on a few food items. It was only about 15 minutes or so each way. The Foodland Farms Grocery was fantastic. Prices were reasonable, and great selections. Friendly people. Well worth the trip.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed here for a week with my family. Room was very nice with some age showing. We had the two bedroom suite that faced the city with a nice side view of the ocean. Kitchen and laundry were a nice addition. Balcony was not all that noisy as others stated.Be prepared for sticker shock at the restaurants and shops nearby. Go off resort and you can find great deals. Milk was $10 a gallon just for example and other food items from offsite were pricey as well. The island as a whole is very beautiful. Took a Grayline Tour of Pearl Harbor and circled the island, a day long trip that was well worth it. We then rented a car for three days that included a parking spot within a 5 minute walk from the resort. Parking can run from $40 to $50 a day. The Hilton Hawaiian Village is very large and can take some time to learn the layout. Clean and well maintained. Restaurants on site were pricey for just average food. Again go offsite to find places that are good and reasonable. Walking distance.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This a great location on the beach and lots if shopping nearby. Also you can walk to the Hilton pier where you can catch the Atlantis submarine. If you are active duty or retired military or DoD civilian go next door to book your tours and the sub for discounts and also a great ocean side bar. Lunch is very reasonable at Bennihana and includes the chef show. The Hilton Hawaiian Village also has a bar with a happy hour and decent drinks. It just a short walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Center which offers free Hawaiian dancing shows.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stay here often- over the years they have overbuilt the property and not added amenities proportionally- but if you have to be in Honolulu it is a fine place to stay. The staff is friendly and helpful but the resort overall is crowded- pools, gym, restaurants, beach are all crowded. I give it a low rating because it is over crowded.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a reallly nice resort. Everything is so close 5 star but poolside bar forces you to buy doubles (said the bartender) which is unnecessary and expensive. Also, there were too many young children (under 5) even though there was a sign prohibiting them. Rooms are extremely nice, as well as the whole complex.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We came to Oahu on a Hilton Grand Vacations VIP tour that we purchased during another HGV timeshare presentation in Las Vegas. We spent 3 hours with the RJ Marvilla but in the end, HGV wanted too much for a 5000-point ownership week at this fabulous Waikiki Beach resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed here for 10 nights recently. Could not fault the hotel from check in to check out. The room was better than I expected - 2 bedroom (king and 2 queens) with a sofa bed as well. Not sure if we just got lucky but had a partial ocean view and it was sensational. Room had everything we needed as a family of 6. Full kitchen with kettle and toaster. Even a dishwasher! Having a washer/dryer in the room was a bonus as well Housekeeping did a great job every day left more than enough in toiletries and towels. If I had one disappointment it would be the resort fee. If you can’t use the activities (because of disabilities) where you would get a discount it’s an exorbitant fee for two bottles of water a day. You don’t get a discount on parking or anything. Room are expensive enough to cover the cost of the upkeep of the resort and pools. I think they should reconsider this fee but having said that why would they when everyone just stays there and pays it. Everything else I could not fault you don’t have to leave the resort if you don’t want to but Ala Moana is a 20 min walk as is the Centre of Waikiki. Fireworks on Friday night were spectacular. I wish I got the name of a very jovial man always at the front of the hotel he was super nice and spoke to us every time we walked past - Mahalo to you you made our day every time we passed you. All in all it was a great stay the pools were great but a bit of a walk to the less crowded super pool as was the lagoon pool from the hotel. We have a son with a disability which uses a wheelchair and was easy to get around. He had a ball! I can’t wait to come back

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Enjoyed a wonderful stay! Highly recommend enjoying a trip and a stay at this location. Gorgeous facility. Beautiful grounds. Within walking distance of a lovely shopping area with great restaurants. Enjoyed it and would love to return.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I stayed at the Hilton grand Waikiki village and enjoyed all the comforts of home but with luxury. The island of Oahu is absolutely beautiful. I took it all in. For our stay , Hilton had an actual village of shops and restaurants connecting all the properties that made it extremely easy . Our hotel was perfect. For touring, we took a tour almost everyday to see the islands beauty. We were at the heart of the town, walking distance from everything we could need so it made it very easy.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a very beautiful place to stay while on Oahu. There are many amenities and the service is good. The only negative was the temperature in the bedrooms. Got down to 62 degrees, which is too cold for us people with Hawaiian blood.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: What a great time we had . lots of things to do , Staff did exceptional job for us . Excellent location , easy access to Waikike beach. Beaches are well maintained . All staff continually ask if they can do anything for you

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are HGVC owners and this was our first time at this location. Very nice one bedroom with city view. Pleased with the room except for pillows which had no firmness to them at all. We enjoyed the owners center on level 8- you can use that to shower, get water and coffee if your room isn’t ready or you have time after you check out. Location is great- a lot shops and dining within walking distance. BeAch is a short walk- but plan on spending $75 a day of you want 2 chairs and an umbrella.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great accommodation, clean, good facilities, spacious and friendly staff! It is also in a very convenient location and there are lots of pools, the beach and a lagoon with water activities. In walking distance to main beach and shopping

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My stay was overall good, most of the staffs were overall friendly with the exception of the concierge staffs, they need to focus more on clients in front of them and stop rushing people out and be nicer to the non-Japanese visitors. Their service definitely didn’t wow me.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Overall was great. We know sis me of the staff. We love the fire works. We will always return within the next year and every year after that. We might try the lagoon tower next year depending on who comes

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Overall, poor experience. Beds were uncomfortable, our sales person for our presentation wasn’t even listening to my wife and he couldn’t remember our names. Our kids did enjoy the lagoon and pools though.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: For this stay we booked a 2 bedroom with a partial ocean view. The room was away from the hustle and bustle of the busy lobby and courtyard. Our room on the 11th floor was very clean and quiet. We had 2 balconies with views of the ocean. We also had a full view of the luau and the Friday night fireworks- amazing!The 2 bedroom has separate bathrooms and a full kitchen and super roomy common tv area. I rate this room a 10 and the hotel staff an 11.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Before we even left home I had enough material for a scathing review of the Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations. The fact that they aren’t getting a Terrible review shows how much this property has managed to impress us since we arrived.We were originally booked into the Grand Waikikian for 11 nights: two nights in a 1-bedroom apartment and nine nights in a 2-bedroom apartment. We booked through the Hilton website, the same way we would for any hotel booking and becoming Hilton Honors members in the process. What we didn’t appreciate at the time was the rigidity of their booking process and the extreme level of frustration we would experience when circumstances (a very sick baby) required us to delay our arrival in Hawaii by five days. I made 10 phone calls all up, no exaggeration. On the first call I was able to cancel the first two-night booking and was charged the expected one-night cancellation fee as it was inside their one-month cancellation window. The problem was the second booking. We didn’t want to cancel it, we just needed to change our arrival date from Wednesday to Saturday. Phone call after phone call and I kept getting referred to a different phone number because no-one could help me adjust the arrival date. On one occasion I was referred to their conferences and trade bookings phone number, on another occasion to a fax machine. I was referred to Hilton Grand Vacations as though I was a timeshare owner even though I had explained that I wasn’t, then back again to Hilton Honors because I wasn’t a timeshare owner. It was absolutely ridiculous and totally unacceptable. In the end I had to talk to the front desk at the Grand Waikikian and insist that they put a note on my booking stating that we would be arriving on Saturday and not to treat us like a no-show and cancel the room when we didn’t arrive as expected on the Wednesday. I had them send me evidence of the note too – my trust levels were so low. And obviously that meant paying for the full booking, not just the nights we could use, which would have been the case with a regular hotel. I know we’ll be back to Honolulu again however I will never book with a Hilton property again because they are incapable of dealing with a simple change request.So now to the Grand Waikikian…. Check in was very fast and friendly. The room was ready, as it ought to have been, and the portacot we’d requested was made up and outside the front door. (I hope it hadn’t been there for three days!) The layout of our 2-bed apartment was different to the floor plans we’d seen. We had an ocean view apartment (room 2902) and the view was all that we expected and more! Bedroom 2 and a self-contained bathroom (shower only) are on the right, followed by bedroom 1 which is massive with the open ensuite and small bathtub, then the corridor opens up into a lounge, dining and kitchen area. The lounge area seemed a bit squashed compared with some of the photos we’ve seen, but it had enough seating for four adults. The balcony off the lounge is a good size with four comfortable chairs and a round table so you could eat out there and savour the view. There is also a balcony off bedroom 2, with two chairs and a coffee table. From our bed in bedroom 1 we could see the marina and the ocean. It is lovely.We were happy with the amount of cookware and utensils in the kitchen. They also supply washing powder for the washing machine. They supply a caffeinated and decaf coffee sachet per day (four cups) but no tea. I brought my own, thank heavens. There is nowhere to hang wet clothes so I’d suggest bringing a portable clothesline if you prefer to air dry your clothes than use a dryer. Beds are comfortable, shower water pressure isn’t great, but I’ve come to expect that in big hotels.The Hilton complex is massive, and there are a range of pools to try out but you’ve got to get in early to get a deck chair. We went to the Paradise Pool three times without finding anywhere to put our towels. The lagoon is quite nice and one of the reasons we chose to stay here, though the sand is quite coarse by Australian standards. Who cares though, it looks beautiful!There are a range of bars and restaurants in the complex but we only tried two of them – Tropics Bar & Grill and a very casual pizza restaurant. There are no restaurants in the Grand Waikikian building itself. The closest eating options are in the Rainbow Bazaar and it gets very crowded. Room service is offered for breakfast and dinner but the menu is quite poor. There’s a Red Lobster and Outback Steakhouse 5 minutes’ walk from the Grand Waikikian for take-out which offer a great alternative if you don’t want to self-cater every night but are restricted from dining out by a small child.There is a small shop near the lifts on the reception level with basic cooking supplies, snacks, drinks, toiletries and souvenirs. Our main shopping was done at Food Pantry in Eaton Square. It’s less than 10 minutes away by foot. Alternatively there is an ABC Shop in the complex and also on the other side of Ala Moana Blvd. We were given vouchers for bottled water (2 small bottles per day) at check-in. You can drink the tap water but if you leave it to sit for any length of time it has a rather strange taste.We would have rated the Grand Waikikian Very Good (an Excellent apartment but losing points for the crowded nature of the pools, poor room service offering and not having a restaurant in the building) but given the hassle we experienced dealing with our enforced change I can’t give them more than an Average rating.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Don't expect to get recognized as a Hhonors member no matter what your status when booking at a Hilton Grand Vacations Club (HGVC). Which means no matter how loyal you are to Hilton don't expect to get any perks even as a Diamond member when booking at an HGVC. I was told by the front desk that if you are looking for loyalty benefits book at the "hotel" part of the resort not HGVC. With regard to the accommodations, I must say this is definitely the furthest of all the towers from restaurants and the beach. At first I thought it was Kalia tower, but I was wrong. However, if you really want to do a lot of walking, you will definitely log some serious steps at the Waikikian. But the elevators are definitely more readily available than Lagoon tower. Our 1-Bedroom Partial Ocean View room had a nice kitchen, breakfast nook, living room w/ sofa bed and a good sized bedroom that had a 2-person tub (yes in the bedroom) as you see in the pics and a roomy bathroom w/ shower and single sink. The bathroom also had a connecting door to the living room which I thought was convenient so you didn't have to enter the bedroom to get to the bathroom. If you are looking for ocean view, definitely book ocean view. What they consider partial ocean view is a joke. You have to go to your balcony, lean over the rail and then look beyond to see that partial ocean view. Housekeeping as usual is fantastic! The staff is very friendly and always welcoming. I still say after staying at Waikikian, Kalia, Lagoon and Ali...STAY @ ALI! It is definitely worth the $$

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We were greeted by very professional and friendly staff from day 1 when we checked in.The multi-language team, lead by Keiko, made our stay so much better than expected. They (Hiromi, Naoko, Lan, Mei Ling and Darlene) all appeare to be long time and happy employees who treat the guest like family. Starbucks coffee and Very fresh fruits and other breakfast items were well presented with smiles daily. As were afternoon drinks .and hors d’oeuvres. The locations of this lounge on the 35th floor provides breathtaking views. One of the best such lounges among the Hilton and HGVC properties.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand is a beautiful Hilton property. The welcome area and open atrium design have a spiritual feel.We were within a few minutes walk to being on the Waikiki beach. Perfect location, as all the water recreation choices are right here on the beach. A bonus is the availability of unique restaurants. Either in the Hilton Hawaiian Village or along the beach, there many great food and cocktail choices.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I am a timeshare owner and have been one for 20 years! I am ashamed to say this but this property over the last 10 years has become like a old amusement park, dirty, dated, and poorly kept and worn out!! Too many people and over sold it now has taken it's toll!! First off most of the classy stores have left , that's putting it mildly the penguins are no longer there to greet the guest,Tropic's the Restaurant with beach side seating has been covered with a net giving you a feeling of being a trapped in like a wild animal when dinning , making the view obscured by the netting! The abeyance is gone no more sitting and enjoying the beautiful view of people and ocean. The open air experience is gone and somehow the birds still have figured out how to get in to restaurant and eat scrapes of food so now your chance's of being pooped on are even better because they are trapped under the netting!! It now lacks that relaxed and wonderful view of the sunsets on the beach. The timeshare rooms are worn and dated including the mattress"s on the beds after one night of sleeping on a worn out bed and sinking to a nest like form with pillows that smell like someone's bad breath and have no neck support you are ready to go home! The DVD players are so dated that when you turn them on it's so loud it sounds like a airplane engine tunneling wind and you can't hear the movie it will also get on your nerves after a day or two!! Lighting in this condo is minimal so don't expect make up mirrors with lights because there are none, and the size of your TV in the master bed room is the size of my carry on laptop screen!! It's a complete joke for this day in age! I mean Best Buy sells new TV's cheap Hilton! The hallways of the Waikikian upstairs as you can imagine of course smell of remnitz's of a leftover of nationality of foods that have been prepared by the occupants, at times we saw trash bags in hallways with leftover garage from thoughts foods which just enhanced the smell in the air in the corridors. This is not what we were expecting! We are totally disappointed that the Hilton Reputation has gone down hill!! I am sorry to say that you are no longer the clean,classy , timeshare you sold us on!! It's all about the money right?? Shame on you HILTON!!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: To begin on the positive side the room was very nice with wood floors and plenty of space with even a heated toilet seat but the room faced the busy street below even though we are gold members and asked for a beach view and booked over 3 months in advance. The $43 parking fees per night are just highway robbery and should be included with the very expensive room price. Don't plan on using the pools unless you get there before 10:00 as the pools are not near large enough to handle the probably 7,000 guest that are staying at the village at any one time.Probably the biggest complaint is the fact that we are just your average Americans and not Japanese, our hotel was at least 90% Japanese and they are treated like royalty. We were trying to get information from a concierge on some whale watching but every concierge had a Japanese they were helping for hours at a time bc we passed by constantly. Finally we did find one open and asked about the whale watching tour they would recommend and they just took the brochure I had already picked up and started reading, they must have thought I couldn't read, I told him I had already read the brochure but wanted someone's opinion that actually lived here bc there were many whale watching tours but he just said I guess they are all the same. It was at this point that I knew we were definitely second class at this hotel bc I think I knew more than he did and I had only been on the island a few hours. Unfortunately it seems like the whole island of Oahu is like this, if you are planning to do anything you have to get there before the bus loads of Japanese get there bc they get first preference even at the restaurants in Honolulu. All in all once I learned how things worked I was able to adjust and still see most of what I wanted to see and do without hurting someone in Oahu, Japan!!!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our first time to the islands and it began in Honolulu. Grand Waikikian was one of the only places we could find with a 2 bedroom suite along with full kitchen and beach front balcony. Oh my goodness, it certainly exceeded my expections. Our rooms were beautiful; very spacious with shower and hugh tub in one of the bathrooms. Even had a bidet........We were right in the thick of action and had a great time touring the city. Since I had never been was not expecting the amount of high rises and commercial. Glad I got to see but loved the other two islands better.
user_name:
Vickie H
Wake Forest, North Carolina

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have stayed at the Grand Waikikian several times a year for the last 6 years and feel that it’s a perfect place for us when on Oahu. The hotel is well maintained with friendly and helpful staff. We arrived early at about 11am for check-in (normal check in is at 4pm) and was unfortunately unable to get into the room right away. We still completed registration and got all the room keys and cards for the towel service and free DVD rental, then registered my phone to accept a text from the concierge when the room was ready — however they could not tell me what room we would get. I was offered a lounge that we could use that has comfortable seating and showers until the room was ready (which is also available if you have to check out early but you have a late flight) but opted to grab lunch off property. By the time we finished our lunch, I received a text that the room was ready — a very welcomed surprise! We did not have to return to the front desk as they programmed out pre-registered keys and we just went directly to the room. Very expedient and a service that was completely no hassle. As for the hotel itself, we feel that even as it is at the west end of the Waikiki area, it’s a great balance of good walking access to the middle of Waikiki and the main mall (Ala Moana Shopping Center), away from the crowds of Waikiki beach, as well as easy access when driving to other places on the island without dealing with the traffic of Waikiki. Having a Resort that is actually beachfront in Waikiki is a treat, and because it is not on Waikiki Beach means that it’s not crowded or noisy ever. It is well positioned on the Hilton Resort property, with direct elevator access to the parking garage but steps away to the beach, pools, and shops/eateries within the resort. Many of the other hotel towers on property do not have direct access to the parking garage (a godsend for shoppers). The rooms are well maintained, with separate living/dining room area and kitchen, a large tub in the bedroom and walk-in shower in the bathroom. A fun surprise is the electronic toilet seat that was not there last year. The resort fee (charged per day per room) and the parking fee continues to increase but I guess that’s the price you pay for paradise.We have stayed at other hotels in Waikiki and while they had better access to Waikiki establishments, they were noisy as many hotels feel like they are right on top of eachother and they were not beachfront, meaning we had to carry our stuff across the busy Kalakaua Ave to get to a crowded beach with all of the other hotel guests staying in Waikiki. We’ve also stayed at several towers in Hilton Hawaiian Village as well as, but find the Grand Waikikian to serve as a perfect balance for all our needs while on Oahu. We will continue to call this hotel home while in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton complex is incredibly busy and crowded. We arrived at the location around 12. We asked a couple people were we needed to check in, and we waited in a line there only to find out we were at the wrong hotel! Even though my reservation said Grand Waikikian (and no other info), our stay was really at the Lagoon Tower. So we had to haul our two kids across the campus and attempt to check in again. When we did, our room wasn't ready. That's ok as they would hold our luggage. I asked where the elevators were, and I was told the wrong ones. Of course, I didn't realize that until I was walking around the 7th floor looking for the wrong number of room. Again, I've got 2 kids with me while my husband is trying to park the car.
