I had to walk back downstairs (quite a journey) and call my husband. PARKING was a HUGE pain. The cost is insane - think NYC prices, $50 for valet. $43 for self parking. for Self parking you will have a few blocks walk, and it is just not worth MORE walking. Even valet parking was an enormous headache bc it was so crowded and the drop-off was so tiny. There were constant taxis in and out, buses, golf carts, minivans, etc. It was scary with kids and difficult to get a minute to buckle them in their car seat. It was one of the worst parts of our stay, every single day. The complex is too overbuilt and there is not enough pedestrian space. My next biggest problem was that they gave us a handicapped accessible room. We waited for about 4.5hrs for our room (check in is at 4:30 I think?) They told us when it was ready we would get a text. Great. We went straight to our room. We looked around and I was underwhelmed. Then later my daughter came to me and said, "where's the bathtub?" Sure enough, I realized we had no bathtub. I called immediately and said, "I'm sorry, but we weren't told this was an accessible room." She said, "You weren't?" No....we had just gotten a text and came up. She said that since we had already put our stuff down etc etc, the room was going to have to be cleaned (NOT MY PROBLEM). I explained to her that I have two small kids and I need a bathtub. She put me on hold, and came back and said the best they could do is for ME to check out, bring my bags downstairs at 10am the next day. Then they'll see what they have and we can recheck in at 4pm. I said that was unacceptable. She said, sorry that's all they can do. I find that really unhelpful. We paid a lot of money to stay there and we are Hilton Gold members. The very *least* they could have done was offer to help us down and back up with our luggage, instead of telling *me* I had to do it. Obviously, they didn't want to give me another room. I said again, "I don't know how I'm going to keep a crawling baby out of a shower with no door. And I don't know how I'm going to bathe a baby after the beach without a bath." She said, "I'm so sorry ma'am." end of conversation. It was seriously annoying. Considering I paid good money to stay there, I should have been asked about the room. And when I complained, I should have been reassigned. It was not my fault, and they acted like it was my fault.The room itself was very dark and loud. We have previously stayed at other HGV locations and to us, this room was dated and overpriced. We were disappointed. Granted we were on the 7th floor, it was so loud outside it was impossible to enjoy being outside on the balcony, let alone listening to the tv. The kitchen was awkwardly designed with the microwave hardly in reach of everything else. The shower and bathroom were really basic. The showerhead was pathetic (handicapped accessible). The only thing remarkable was the bidet seat.Also, I wouldn't recommend this hotel b/c it is too massive. My husband put it, "Water water everywhere and not a drop to drink." In all things. People walking around everywhere, no one helpful. 6-8 pools, but get ready to walk 15mins to get to one. They nickel and dime you with everything, including towels. I asked a couple times where we could get breakfast, and I could never understand how to get there...to any of the restaurants...and in alllllllllll our walking...I never saw a hotel restaurant. I saw other restaurants around the public beach area, but not a hotel restaurant. ? Additionally, we constantly had a language barrier. I have traveled a lot and this was part of an 11 day stay in Hawaii. This hotel was the only one that we repeatedly could not understand what the workers were saying. They were nice, but unhelpful b/c I couldn't understand them. It was a really frustrating experience. Our guest room attendant was nice, but again, a language barrier.Lastly, I didn't like how the beach and pool area was open to the public. The "super pool" with the slide was where my daughter wanted to swim. People were constantly walking around, hoards of people. It was just chaotic.  Ultimately, Kingsland was so much better and I wish I had of just stayed there the entire 8 days instead of breaking up my stay.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Had 2 2BR condos at Grand Waikikian over looking Hilton Hawaiian Village for 8 adults. Beautiful new resort, nicely furnished, 1King BR, 2 Queen beds 2nd bedroom, washer/dryer, well appointed kitchen. Just be prepared to walk, walk & walk some more & be sure you have everything you need before you leave your room. All kinds of shops, restaurants, ABC store within walking distance (just bring lots of $$$s, nothing is cheap). Scooter friendly for those who cannot walk so much. Some very good off site restaurants within walking distance too (like Harbour Place beside Chart House & behind Red Lobster). City Bus service nearby, drivers were great about telling you where to get off, one even drove us to the stop we needed to get back to our resort after a visit to China Town ($5.50 pass for a whole days worth of rides). We also took the bus to Leonard’s for some Malasadas! Overall great week, on the Village side of the resort, unable to see sunset from room though, just down on the beach.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at this property. It's in a great location (plenty to do, only 20 min or so from the airport) and the property itself is massive with many other nearby Hilton hotels sharing common areas. We loved having the kitchen and we could easily walk to a grocery store or two as well as a few restaurants. The one gripe we had were the parking fees are outrageous here. We ended up renting a car nearby and just keeping it for one day only just to avoid these fees. Otherwise the room was quite large and comfortable (especially the bed) and the partial ocean view room worked out well. We weren't in the room a ton, and the ocean is still a little ways away, but we could see the water from our balcony. We could even see the Hilton rooftop luau from our room! Service was good and they only tried getting us to go to their timeshare presentation once, which is better than some other properties I've been to! My wife and I loved just walking around the property at night with all the tiki torches lit. It was quite romantic. I'd certainly stay here again or even try one of the other Hilton properties just for the fun of it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Everything at the property was awesome only the resort and parking fee were pricey. Friendly and efrfective staffs. Easy check in and check out process. Lovely heated pool. Little bit crowed though since almost 6 -8 properties in the village.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: After travelling 19 hours from Australia with our 11 month old baby, we were very excited to finally arrive at the Grand Waikikian. The lady at reception was lovely and offered to check us into our room early so we could put our baby down to sleep. As we were finalising the room details, my husband noted that we had booked and paid for a full ocean view room. We had come to Hawaii to celebrate my birthday so we had splurged on our room choice and paid more for a full ocean view rather than partial at the hotel. We were then told we had a partial ocean view room as that was the information Agoda (who we booked through) had given them. We produced our booking confirmation (which clearly stated ocean view room) to which we were told “it’s not there problem” and we need to sort it out with Agoda! After going back and forth for 20 mins, with our baby getting upset, we decided to just accept what we had been given for now and they would get back to us with a resolution. So..I am currently sitting in my partial ocean front room. It is a view of a busy road and high rise buildings. If you stand on the edge of our balcony and look around the corner you can just, and I mean just, see the water!!!Neither Agoda or Grand Waikikian are taking responsibility for falsely advertising Ocean Views, charging for Ocean Views, but providing a room that doesn’t even come close. We paid a higher rate because we have a young baby and while she slept during the day we could sit on the balcony and enjoy the ocean view. It I wanted to watch cars, roads and buildings I would have stayed in Australia. Very disappointing and dishonest!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family and I had a fabulous stay at the 'Grand Waikikian'. Fabulous facilities, fabulous service, fabulous accommodation and fabulous location. The Hilton Village had everything on-site to allow my whole family to just kick back, relax & enjoy our stay after a busy two weeks prior touring Maui and the rest of Oahu. The location (just outside of the main Waikiki strip) allowed us to be out of the hustle & bustle however close enough to venture into Waikiki when we wanted. All staff were very attentive and friendly and went out of their way to help.We were so impressed we became Hilton Vacation Club Owners!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton people have thought of everything. Fabulous location and happy, helpful employees make this Hilton property an A plus. Lagoons, pools (with slides!), restaurants - fantastic! We will definitely return to this Hilton.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Three of us rented a 2-bedroom, 2-bath condo here with an ocean view. It's not a bad place to stay, by any means. The condo has small, but full-sized kitchen and a washer and dryer. The beds are comfortable. Plus, it's very clean and our housekeeper was honest. One of us left a credit card out on the kitchen table, and there were no unidentified charges on it. All staff members have been helpful, although a couple were a little too pushy trying to lure us to a timeshare presentation. We even had a great view of the luau and their awesome hula and fire dancers.Also, the grounds are nice with a good selection of restaurants (if you're not vegan), stores, and swimming pools. I'm partial to the Le Sportsac store, and the Paradise pool with its 3 sliding boards is great for kids. They even have attendants at the slides to make sure just one person goes down at a time.So what's not to like?My number one grievance about this place is that it's noisy, both inside and outside the condo. The walls seem to be paper thin, and a person with normal hearing can hear people on the other side of the common wall. Even worse, there's a LOT of noise outside, such as music from bars. We're on the 28th floor, and it's just about impossible to fall asleep before 11 pm due to the music outside. We like to go to bed early so we can be up early for activities, such as snorkeling and climbing Diamond Head. We don't like to be kept up by all the "night life" noise outside.Furthermore, there are a few odd things about the condo:* The bathroom to the master bedroom doesn't have a door, other than a separate toilet room. So there's no privacy between the tub and shower and the bedroom. The sink is close to the bed, which can easily wake up a light sleeper.* The master bedroom/bathroom have a window that views the ocean, but there's no blackout shade on it like the window parallel to the bed. Why would there not be a blackout shade or curtain on EVERY window?* There are no pullout clothes lines in either of the bathrooms. Many lower end hotels have this small but very useful amenity.* There's a problem with the air-conditioning, as it keeps getting too cold no matter where you set it. To fair, the Grand Waikikian offered to immediately have someone come and fix this. We just haven't been in the room during working hours to have someone come up. (I did not factor this into my rating.)* One of the elevators scared me, as you can hear the cables banging, and you're not supposed to hear that. The other three elevators are fine. All the elevators are fast.If noise doesn't bother you, or if you're a "night life" kind of a person, I bump my rating up to 4 stars and recommend the Grand Waikikian for you. Or if they fix the elevator, put in a bathroom door or at least divider, plus a blackout shade in master bedroom and pull out clothes lines, I'd also bump my rating to 4 stars. Despite the noise and the quirks, we've greatly enjoyed our stay here, although we'll try another property next time we're in Honolulu

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This property is our favourite in Waikiki. From the traditional Hawaiian greeting through to its beautiful decor and the friendly staff to a very sad farewell. We will keep returning because we know we’re never disappointed.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Much to like in this mega resort, you can find everything here and never have to leave. We had a 2 bedroom which was nice fit for 6 (4 adults 2 kids), nice furniture and full amenities. Property is beautiful with lots of choices between the pools and lagoon. In terms of restaurants we liked the Tropic for breakfast, lunch or dinner as well as the italian in the mall for dinner. Only complaint was that if you wanted to hang on the beach you have to pay extra for chair and umbrella and it's pretty expensive (they are free at the pool-- as they should be).

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As HGVC owners, we have stayed in this hotel in the past. And, we love it!Here are some thoughts:1. The room has a full washer/dryer...which is awesome if one has kids!2. We had an ocean view room. It was definitely worth it. It was lovely to be able to sit and look at the ocean.3. There was tons of room! Bigger than my 1st condo! The second room even had its own balcony.4. Service was attentive and kind. 5. The room had a full kitchen...again, nice if one has kids! Or, to cut costs on the holiday.6. It is a bit of a walk from the lobby to the elevators. But, thankfully, we never had to wait for an elevator.7. There is a small food/souvenir shop at the base of the elevators. While this was a bit pricey...it was convenient. There is an ABC store on the property---this is very convenient. 8. Parking was VERY expensive...$43US per day! Waaaay too much!Overall, we love the hotel...and we will be back!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A week of site seeing topped off with exceptional accommodations. Stayed on an upper floor with ocean view. Two bedroom suite was perfect for two adult couples. Check in average. Staff professional and responsive to requests. Rooms are updated, spacious, and clean. Pricey.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The best vacation experience for a family in the world. 14 of us come every Christmas. Great joy. Perfect beach and Lagoon. Grandchildren roam free and safe. Wonderful open air restaurants on beach especially Tropics. Friendly professsional staff.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: When looking for a hotel in Honolulu, the biggest resort in the area is the Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort. It is one of the oldest and most well-known resorts in the area. The resort is also centrally located and is walking distance to many shops, restaurants, and other activities. The Resort is made up of a couple of different hotels including the Hilton Hawaiian, the Grand Waikikian, and others. The Grand Waikikian is part of Hilton Grand Vacations so they are mostly suites – and that is what we were looking for. Each suite came with a room with 2 double beds, one bathroom, a full kitchen, washer/dryer, and a dining table. As they are part of the resort, each room comes with a resort fee which includes Fitness/yoga classes, Internet access, in-room bottled water, and other resources for $35/day. Booking the hotel was easy and convenient through Hilton’s website.There are many entrances to the resort depending on which hotel you are staying at – each hotel has their own separate entrance. The entrance to the Grand Waikikian was off to the side and it was at the far side of the resort, so you have both marina and beach views but you are not on the beach. The hotel lobby is located on the main level and it is an open air lobby to allow for the breeze from the ocean. The lobby contained the check-in desks, the valet, the concierge, and a couple of benches. It is not a traditional lobby but it serves its purposes. Check-in was easy and we received our keys, a map to the resort, as well as a packet which included amenities included in the resort fee. This included towel passes for the beach, passes for two free bottles of a water a day, a dvd rental, as well as shopping discounts. The elevators to access the rooms were not located near the lobby – to access them you had to walk out of the lobby, through the concierge room to another hallway and walk down that hallway to get to the elevators. It was a bit confusing at first and not well planned out. There are 4 elevators and each time we did not have to wait a long time for the elevators. The elevators came and we went to our room on the 17th floor. When you enter the room, you enter into the open kitchen on right hand side and a door to the left which leads to the bathroom. The open kitchen is spacious and includes a full fridge, a stove, a microwave, an oven, plates, glasses, cutlery, a toaster, a coffee maker, and a full sink. It was a nice full kitchen. On the other side of the counter to the kitchen were chairs were you could sit and eat. There was also a half table that pulled onto a bench so that was another option to eat there. Beyond the kitchen was the sitting area with a couch and chair against one wall and the TV on top of a chest against the other wall. The chest had the TV on top and a drawers on the bottom. The sitting area looked out onto the balcony which was a bit small but was nice to go outside and see the sights and enjoy the breeze. Next to the TV was a door that led into the bedroom. Given how spacious the other rooms were, the bedroom was a bit narrow. The bedroom contained two double beds with a nightstand in the middle against one wall, and another chest with a TV on top and the drawers on the bottom. The beds were comfortable and provided a good night’s sleep, there just was not a lot of room between the two beds. Next to the beds, with minimal separation between the two, was an area that contained a tub on one wall and the closet on the other. It was an odd layout to have a tub in the middle of the room. The closet contained a safe, an iron, ironing board, and luggage rack; however, considering the narrowness of the room it was not a lot of space to place your luggage. In between the tub and the closet was a door that led to the bathroom. The bathroom contained a sink a standup shower, and a Japanese-style toilet. The Japanese-style toilet was a nice and welcome touch. The bathroom itself was a decent size. The bathroom also contained a second door which led out to the main room next to the kitchen and the main door. As you existed the bathroom, and before you got to the main door, on left hand side was a closet which contained the washer and dryer. Overall, the room had many amenities that were very nice and the sitting area was spacious; the only negative was the lack of space in the bedroom area.There are many amenities that can be accessed as part of the resort. As the hotel is part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village, you can walk around and access any part of the resort. Each hotel had their own pool, so you could choose which pool you wanted to access. To access the beach you had to walk to the Rainbow Tower near the main entrance to the resort as that was the only beach access. Other amenities included free classes in the morning, fireworks on Friday night, many restaurants to choose from, an entire whole shopping village which included other restaurants, desserts, souvenirs, a convenience store, and other amenities. If you wanted, you could access everything in the resort and never have to leave. The hotel did provide free wifi, but our wifi was only applicable in our tower. Other amenities we took advantage of was the discounted taxi rate and the lounge. The resort does not provide transportation to and from the airport, rather they have negotiated a special discounted rate with a local taxi company that provides a flat fee to passengers to and from the airport and the hotel. We used this service on both sectors and it was very convenient and easy to use. Another amenity we utilized was the lounge. Check-out of the hotel is very early, at 11am, and given the high volume they generally do not allow for late check-out. To compensate for those guests who have later flights, guests can access the lounge throughout their stay and after checkout. The lounge is like a standard business lounge with lots of couches and tables for people to relax and rest. There are many outlets so you can charge your electronics as well. No food is provided and only water, tea, and some juices are provided. There is a small kids play area as well as a small business center as well. There are bathrooms as well as showers available, as well as hotel amenities included soap, shampoo, and lotion. The hotel will hold your luggage so this lounge is a nice place to go and relax and recover prior to your late night flight. Overall, it was a pleasant stay at the Grand Waikikian. The hotel provided a lot of amenities for their guests. The rooms themselves were nice and had lots of amenities, with the only downside being the lack of space in the bedroom. While the costs for the Hawaiian Village are a bit higher, you do get a lot of amenities as well as a convenient access to many shops and restaurants within walking distance to the resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is part of the Hilton Grand Vacation Club, so you have either people who are members (ie, own a Hilton timeshare) or people to whom they are trying to sell a timeshare. The hotel is one of several towers situated around the Hilton Hawaiian Village complex. The room we stayed in was nicely appointed and maintained well, so no complaints. The rest of the complex is a combination of pools, lagoon, and commercial shopping. Nice place to stay if you need a real vacation as you don't need to go anywhere if you don't want to.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great resort but you better bring your bank account. They charge for everything including beach chairs when this is a beach resort. For what you pay to stay here and the price of food - you should get more. But this place stays packed so they will never change their policy.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are HGVC Premier Elite folks and actually own at this property. We did not book an ocean view room but had hoped for an upgrade. Didn’t happen so we got a city view room. The traffic noise 24/7 really ruined our stay. The location of the property in general is very good and not a far walk from the Waikiki beach, many restaurants, shops, etc. we had a room on the 22nd floor out of 39 I think. Thank goodness it was not any lower. Our room was not ready when we arrived so we went to the Arrival/departure lounge on the 8th floor. Nice place to wait. The front desk folks were very pleasant.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We only spent 3 nights here and I had made the reservations months ago. I figured with that and the fact that we're Hilton Vacation Club members, we'd have an awesome experience at this hotel. Was I ever wrong about that! When we checked in, after a long airplane ride from Denver, Colorado, we learned they had put us in a handicap room. Neither myself or my husband are handicapped, and there was no explanation for this. We also expected to have a view of something other than the buildings of downtown Honolulu. But that was what we got. When we tried to change rooms upon checking in, we were told that was all that was available unless we'd like to move to a floor nearer street level where traffic was very noisy. Hilton has a policy that when you have a problem upon check-in, a supervisor is to be summoned, yet we were never in contact with anyone other than the person at the check-in desk who had no good news for us. She went to a back office at one point, I assume to make further inquiry, but we never spoke to any supervisor. We borrowed points from 2018 in order to stay at this hotel which incurs an additional cost to us to transfer points. What a disappointment we had. Our room was not made up each day and the room, which was set up for a handicapped person, was extremely inconvenient for us in that closet and dresser storage was not even in the sleeping area, but around the corner in the bathroom. We'll not be going here again any time soon. Pool area was large, but overcrowded so we never even went there. There's no beach access from the hotel.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent a week in a 2 bedroom penthouse. Our experience was wonderful, beautiful grounds, accommodations have everything and the penthouse lounge staff is outstanding. We took another couple with us who hadn’t been to Hawaii and they too were very impressed.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very friendly staff always willing to help. Room was exceptionally clean. Furniture modern and clean. In great location within walking distance to beach, shopping and restaurants. Nice walking path around lagoon.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have been staying at the GW for the past five years but we have noticed there has been cutbacks during our current stay. The housekeeping has not been as consistent as in the past and the place is starting to look old.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Decided I needed a vacation and thought my parents would like to join me in Hawaii for a week so we ended up here. Check in was rather confusing cause the hotel Check-in is different than the condos. Didn’t realize that until waiting in line at the hotel side. Got checked in and went to the room. It was very nice. Large kitchen and living room with sleeper sofa. Large bathroom and bedroom. Plenty of room for the three of us. Oh and the best part is the balcony. Are breakfast there every morning. I mean you’re in paradise how could you not wanna enjoy it. We had a city view which was fine wasn’t expecting much but our view was not just city but we had water views as well. Score. It was magical. The pools were great our room over looked I believe the paradise pool. Which was full mostly by 10am with kids playing since I believe that’s the only pool with the slides. The towel boys where great at the lagoon and beach. It’s kinda awesome walking from your building right onto the beach. That’s what I wanted as close to the beach as possible. We did rent some umbrellas for the beach days which was a wise idea as it would sprinkle a few times and people would leave but not even ten mins later the sun was out again. The water was a bit chilly in the ocean but it was nov and I was in the ocean in Hawaii there’s no reason to complain about that. There was one problem though. The elevators. They are always packed. It sometimes took 20 mins to get one that wasn’t full. I’d say we waited sometimes for 4 -6 elevator passings for it to have room for us to get in. My suggestion is when you’re at your floor trying to go down hit the up and down button. When ever it comes and has room in it get on. Otherwise you’re gonna be waiting a long time. It’s faster to ride up a few floors then back down then wait for the down. They really need to find another way for employees to change floors with the carts. The cleaning crew did take up a lot of space. They should have a cart per floor that way no transferring carts around. Oh well if that’s the worst thing then it wasn’t too bad. Have to say it was a wonderful week. And they actually waited till after thanksgiving to put up Christmas decorations which were Beautiful. I’m sure I’ll be back to the property.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: What can I say except grand! This is a busy property...not a quiet retreat. That's not the attraction of the village. We enjoyed our walks around the village especially hunting happy hours! The suite we stayed in was perfect and stocked with everything we needed in the kitchen area. It featured a lanai with a fabulous view. All in all its a destination my wife and I will look to return to when seeking a city vacation on Oahu.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you want to find a quiet place to relax, this is not your vacation spot. Hilton does a nice job with the room upkeep and service. Big bath tub in Waikikian could be removed to add bigger closet and queen beds. Resort is just too crowded. Wall to wall people and kids at the pool. Chairs and shade on the beach are not included in the resort fee.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: love this property! been going for 10 years and it has everything. gentle waves for family surfing, a reef with fish and large turtles. great pools, hot tubs and restaurants. In addition, waikiki is a short walk away.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Beautiful beach, lagoon. Decks off each room. Enjoy the early mornings watching over the ocean. Nice to have a kitchen because eating out all the time can be pricey. But walking on beach can help burn calories. Rooms equipped with the essentials so leave your hair dryer at home. Only negative is elevator. They have 3. But if one is down, you may have a 10 minute wait to get to room.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Firstly, the check in, check in took over 30 mins, this is absurd for a place rated this highly. The hotel should look at implementing a self check in system when it takes that long to get guests to their rooms. Secondly, the parking, charging $40+ for parking each day is highway robbery, this parking should be half that, $15-$20. The parking attendants and valets are also very jumpy and all over you for a tip which we felt very uncomfortable with. The staff were attentive at times but also are VERY biased towards the Japanese guests, many time we would walk past a desk and not get greeted but the Japanese behind us would get a warm greeting, this is unacceptable and very off-putting, a guest is a guest and all should be treated equally. Now the positives are, the rooms are gorgeous, the beds are comfortable, the kitchen is spacious and in great condition. The toiletries were great and generous. The pools are beautiful and the lagoon as well but, again with the fees! charging a crazy amount for the pool toys and water bikes is ridiculous, guests are shelling out a fortune to stay there and this should absolutely be included! Considering the humidity and heat, charging for umbrellas is also outrageous, there is no shade provided and cabanas and shaded areas should be looked into as this is crucial for young families and children Fireworks display is great and we enjoyed the other resorts in the area, ice-cream place is nice too.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed half our week at Aulani and other half at Grand Waikkian. Hilton did so much more with the same size room (full kitchen vs micro fridge). Resort was crowded and showing their age. Pools were always too cold and the hours varied. Pools open at 8am but can't get towels until 9:30?

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Family of 4, children aged 8 and 9You seriously don't need to leave the compound of the resort, fantastic beach, Friday night fireworks, 5 pools, lots of restaurants, we arrived at 8am and although check in is at 4 the staff tried to get a room ready for us asap.Room was spacious, great variety of channels on the tv and reception was excellent, wifi speed was good. If i was to say anything negative it would be there wasn't any pamper packs, but thats just nitpicking. Kids loved it, we loved it. You will love it

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The first thing we noticed in this hotel was the quality of the room furnishing. We've stayed in many HGVC locations, but the Grand Waikikian stood out in the attention to details. We were in a 2 bedroom with a balcony that overlooked the Hilton Hawaiian Village with ocean views. The staff was very helpful in making our stay enjoyable. For Elite members, there is a separate concierge that will help with anything. From the hotel, you can pretty much walk anywhere on Waikiki Beach. There are a few pools to choose from and it's a short stroll through the grounds to the beach.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Awesome location, amazing amenities. The pools, the beach, the sights all too much for a couple of days.We will certainly be back for longer to explore further.Walking distance to everything, a night walk along the boardwalk is highly recommended.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very modern, clean and welcoming hotel resort. Everything you need is in walking distance. Wonderful place with no hassles. Resturants, shops, bars and entertainment at your finger tips. Warm and relaxed atmosphere, you will not want to leave.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Accommodation in the owner system. Many other facilities came out in Hawaii. Is not this Hilton adding a new accommodation to Don Dong, whether cleaning of the room is not properly done, a little attention for guests can not be made, and I do not care about hospitality, I said one thing can not do It is an ordinary facility. I can not taste any special feeling. Next time, I began to examine another owner - system and want to replace it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Needed a gateway. This place was perfect! It was close to shops and convenient. We had our own kitchen and there was a tub in the room to relax separately from the bathroom. The partial ocean view was nice.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton is great however, ac in the room would never go below 72 degrees. Maintenance came to “fix it”. It then didn’t go below 70. That’s not cool enough. The floors were filthy and turned our feet or socks black the moment we took our shoes off. Otherwise it was great!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was a mother daughter trip. The location was great. The bed was comfy. Separate towels for the beach provided were a added bonus. I WILL and going again as soon as I can! The Hilton Hawaiian Village made restaurants and shopping close. No car rental was needed.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very nice accommodations, had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath, room. Great ocean view, friendly and accommodating staff. Close to many events and walking distance to restaurants. The Hawaiian Village shops were very interesting to browse. Pools and beach were also very nice. Great way to spend a week!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent location. Great amenities. One exception: only one small area for fitness/exercise for all the buildings. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. Restaurants excellent. Location incredible. Multiple surrounding restaurants. Grocery store nearby. Easy to get around with Uber or taxi.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great resort facility. Nice rooms. Make sure you get a room with an ocean view. You won’t regret it. Spent many hours sitting on the balcony looking at the ocean. Multiple pools, the lagoon and beach offers endless sun and fun opportunities. Great upscale shopping within the resort as well as multiple dining choices.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is the best resort in Hawaii. The decor and atmosphere are true traditional Hawaiian look and feeling. Very comfortable and superclean. The customer service and staff are outstanding. We are penthouse owners.....we always look forward spending time in ourunits. Highly recommend this wonderful resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: There were so many things wrong about this hotel and the lack of staff response to address the complaints that it was unbelievable. * Partial ocean view room included FULL VIEW of the parking garage and maintenance areas from guest bedroom. * Down-filled comforters on two king/queen beds were filled with "dirty down" that caused every one of 4 guests to have allergy problems * There is a shelf surrounding this room that was to have been decorative but instead has become a very popular "bird roost". While the staff cleaned up the excrement and feathers at our request, we were informed they only usually did this every 3 months. It was unappealing, DISGUSTING, and most probably a HEALTH HAZARD.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Newer Hotel in Hilton Hawaiin Complex. It is very beautiful and clean. The staff was always very helpful. There were plenty of restaurants and shops. The fireworks on Fridays are a must! Definitely recommend!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The service was only ok, the staff were disappointing in general, they seemed to busy to deal with any issues or resolving addition requests. Pool , bar and other amenities provided within the resort were good. Room was ok along with basic bedding requirements.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our second stay at the village. we found it to have a great location, facilities, and amenities. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. There was something for everyone to enjoy , adults, teens and young kids alike.Great range of recreational activities, and a wide variety of food and beverage outlets available, as well was the ability to self cater.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The staff was very professional and accommodating. The grounds were meticulously maintained. The access to the beach was easy and it felt like you had your own private beach. We stayed in a suite which was well appointed and comfortable. We would recommend this hotel without reservation.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: in the hear to Waikiki and all the city action on Oahu, the Hilton Grand Waikikian is a beautiful condo-like apartment with a washer and dryer. The skyscraper views and partial beach view were the perfect combo for us city slickers. There are many restaurants, pools and the beach on the property. The concierge service is exceptional. For trips to the quieter North Shore of Oahu, tour group and bus pick ups were right next door.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a 2 bedroom apartment for 5 adults and 3 kids and all fit comfortably in our Lagoon Tower room. The balcony is huge with great views of the marina and the fully furnished kitchen was very handy. The en-suite in the master room had a very high tech toilet, which was very interesting. The pool with the water slides got lots of use from us but we weren't there long enough (only 2 nights) to really enjoy all the facilities that the massive resort the Hilton Hawaiian Village has to offer, which is a shame. Next time we will stay longer! And service staff were very friendly and responsive, just be weary of the inevitable timeshare sales pitch. Location wise - it is within walking distance to the Ala Moana Centre for shopping. Not as close to the main Waikiki shopping strip, but just jump onto the $2 trolley (pink line) to get there.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you are looking to enjoy shopping on Rodeo drive this is your place. If you're looking to enjoy Hawaii stay somewhere else. In room dinning is cardboard to go boxes and the fresh fruit juice is a to go bottle of Minute Maid !!!!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Could not have been less thrilled with customer service or views. Horrible experience. Management was unresponsive and not helpful. Expensive ocean views included rooftops. Was shocked at the lack of service provided although the rooms were very nicely appointed

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had an excellent week at this resort. Outside of everything being more expensive than anticipated, we had a fabulous time. The units were nice sized with balconies Hilton provided everyone with water bags and warned us to stay hydrated. They also out on a spectacular display of fireworks on Friday night. Just a fantastic time had by all.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are Hilton timeshare owners. So it is always obvious for us to chose properties on the islands that fit this.The property is nice. Very busy.The condo was clean, neat, comfortable and suited our needs. We had a great harbor view from one balcony and a great view of the main street. It was nice for people watching and watching the clouds rollover the mountains behind the buildings.Great location for getting to Waikiki Beach, restaurants, tour activities, bus routes and shopping.Be prepared for parking fees! They are very excessive!!!!!!!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton Waikiki Beach resort has a number of hotels clustered together with pools, shops and lagoon all within the complex. The Grand Waikikian is situated a 5 minute walk from the lagoon and beach and close to the shopping area and pools. We were lucky enough to have a Penthouse Suite (2 bedroom) on the 36th floor with views over the beach and Hilton Village, the suite itself is very large, 2 great size bedrooms (With great beds, very comfortable) and bathrooms (With each bedroom having a Jacuzzi bath also), the dining area and lounge is large (There is a bed settee in the lounge if required). There are 3 TV's in total with HBO etc, so plenty of choice if you require. The kitchen is well equipped, with oven, hob, microwave, fridge-freezer, dishwasher, washing machine and tumble dryer. The staff that cleaned rooms did a wonderful job with a great evening down turn service. The sir conditioning in the suite was very efficient and kept us cool at night.We had two very large balconies with stunning viewsHaving a Penthouse Suite gave access to the Penthouse lounge, the staff there were lovely and very helpful, we especially enjoyed the breakfasts that were made available and the evening meals/snacks were very nice - In fact the healthy menu meant we did not put on any weight during our stay :-).The hotel shop on floor 2 was well stocked and open from 7am to 11pm, very useful, you may pay a bit more but saves a walk.The lobby, floor 2 areas were always calm and quiet, very nice to come back to after a busy day out.We would love to come back, Oahu has much to offer beyond Waikiki and we can recommend getting a car and exploring the island.For those who like to shop, the Waikiki Beach area has fantastic range of shops and shopping malls, the Ala Moana Mall is a 25 minute walk away (Or a short bus ride).

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I stayed at the Grand Waikikian in the Hilton Hawaiian Village for the fourth time and it may be my last, I feel Hilton don't seem to care for their guests as they used to do only want to over charge their guests. I found the value for the stay is a lot less than before. There is no lei greeting anymore, the atmosphere is dull at best. The prices at the village for food and beverages is getting to be unaffordable. I found a lot of the staff sitting around playing on their cell phones a lot, very few acknowlege the guests when they walk past. Waikiki is now just too over crowded with tourists for the size of the city and there is planning for many more high rises and I would recommend tourists look elsewhere like Maui or the Big Island.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent our the last part of our Hawaii vacation on Waikiki beach in August. In another review I wrote I would not spend time on the beach but the Hilton was very nice. We had a two bedroom suite on the 38th floor. The hotel has very nice rooms that were clean and modern and we had a spectacular view. The only negative was check-in. We made our reservation back in February and specified a two bedroom suite with One King bed and another with two queen beds. At check-in they only had suites with two king beds. This was not ideal for a family with two teenage boys.I was told at check-in that Room Type is not guaranteed when the reservation was made. (News to me). So why specify the room type? This is something everyone should be aware of when you book a room at a vacation (time share) property and you are not an owner...In the end the hotel did make it right and they magically came up with a room which made the stay very enjoyable.The pools are nice but very crowded and the accompanying village and shopping is nice to walk around in. The hotel itself has very few accommodations like restaurants etc..

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very clean! Excellent customer service! Totally updated. We highly recommend. Had a suite so our family of four had two bedrooms and two bathrooms. Loved this place! Would definitely stay here again. Worth every penny!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The policy that there is no room service for people staying at the resort for less than 5 days is bad. You have to stay with stinky bathrooms, wet towels and overflowing garbage bins. It is better to stay in a hotel where is room service everyday instead of no service.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our first family holiday overseas with our two year old toddler. We requested a cot some months prior however upon checkin were told cots are not available. Had to cosleep with my son as he is not yet in a bed and my husband had to sleep out on the couch. Had to go to bed at 7.30 pm each nights I could not leave my son alone. Totally ruined our holiday.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Rooms are kinda small but very nice , staff are very friendly. Disappointed for price you pay for valet parking that u can't call down before and have your car ready like hilton grand vacation ocean 22

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The rooms are very nice as is the property. However, the entire Hilton property is crazy! It is almost too big and it was very overcrowded when we stayed there. The "super pool" is in the center of it all but could not find a bathroom nearby!? Plenty of restaurants and shopping as well. Staff were all very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and I recently visited the Grand Waikikian for our honeymoon and our experience was fantastic! The Hilton village, the concierge, and quality/cleanliness of the amenities was amazing. HIGHLY recommend

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was a great experience and a good idea to spend the vacation at this resort. Great location, professional service, and great selection of activities and places to shop and dine. Will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel basically is what i find relaxation should be.I find is so convenient for the restaurants and shopping places! Also Friday night fireworks!i had an amazing suit with a wonderful bathtub! The living room area is great place when you get back from shopping. I love getting welcome with a lei! Loving the aloha spirit!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Spent 4 nights here, pre cruise and it was fantastic. So much to do on or near the property, we rarely left. Highly recommend. The rooms were awesome, the washers and dryers worked perfectly and the kitchen was a great addition.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Loved my stay here. Close but not to close to Waikiki Beach. Clean and modern rooms, plenty of concierge staff, helpful bell staff. Beach and lagoon right at doorstep. Loved proximity to Ala Moana beach and shopping center.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are owners in Hilton Grand Vacations so we decided to take the family to Hawaii. To get the noms we wanted my wife had to go online and book the 2 BR and 1 BR rooms we wanted back in November. The rooms go quick. The resort complex is vast and crowded. When we arrived we were facing the parking lot, but the worst was the layers of pigeon droppings ALL around our balcony. It was horrible to sit outside, my wife likes to sit outside and drink her morning coffee. I enjoy evenings on a balcony. It was impossible to sit outside because of the stink and sight of pigeon poop all over the place. It wasn't just by our balcony but everywhere on that side of the building. I immediately went downstairs to a resort manager and explained the issue. She changed our room to the other side. No pigeon poop at all. Now HGVA tells you that the cleaning service only comes 3 times a week. If you want more than that then it will cost you. We are OK with that but in a 2 BR with 5 people you generate garbage. We had bags of garbage. There should be somewhere to bring the garbage. We rented a car, they charge you $39 a day to self park. WTF!!!! I give HGVA thousands of dollars to be an owner. Charge me to park!! Really???Now it wasn't all bad. The accommodations and great. Hilton quality. If we needed something, ice, toilet paper, etc we called 54 on the phone and it was brought up quickly. The beds were comfortable, showers spacious.The bellmen were attentive to our needs.I probably wouldn't go back, but thats not because of anything they did wrong. I enjoy quiet laid back resorts. But we did enjoy our trip.
user_name:
Greg B
North Babylon, New York

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We just returned from a week at the Grand Waikikian. This was our 3rd visit and we always have a great stay. We like the location at the end of Waikiki. It is close enough to walk to the main shopping and restaurants on Waikiki, but less crowded on the beach. The Hilton Hawaiian Village has most of what you would need, but we always walk to the shopping area a few times and walk along the beach to have lunch or dinner at other hotels. One of the great things for us about the Waikikian is the kitchen. We make a trip to the Walmart and/or the ABC store to get supplies for breakfast and lunch so we don't have the expense of eating out all the time. We also like the lagoon at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. It is annoying to pay $15 to rent a lounge chair, but it is nice to be at the beach of Waikiki or at the lagoon and not be right up alongside a bunch of other people. The lagoon is nice for stand up paddle and for the kids to swim and snorkel without the waves. There are some fish to look at in the lagoon although not as colorful and impressive as you find on the snorkel trips. We found the staff very helpful.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Just finished a week long stay and very much enjoyed it. Our room was clean and the check-in and check-out staff, bell hops, and concierges were friendly and accommodating. The availability of multiple places to eat and shop were great. Only complaints are minor quibbles like beach/pool towels not available until well into the morning hours and then hard to find near the Grand Waikikian after 7:00 at night. But again - minor stuff. We would certainly stay here again. Also my recommendation is to use Lyft anywhere you go. We took a taxi a couple of times the first day and then used Lyft and it was way less and the drivers were friendlier and ready to pass along great info on local stops and locations. We paid less for a Lyft to Pearl Harbor than we paid a taxi for a much shorter drive (for example).

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Staff are unfriendly and hate their jobs and it shows in the overall quality of service; the resort itself is top notch but without good people working there it detracts from the entire vacation. The pools beach, food quality are all top notch. The food is far overpriced even taking into account it is resort food. I really looked forward to going to Hawaii and the experience was really lacking due to the poor people.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton Hawaiian Village is a great destination for a family holiday. Facilities are wonderful from everyone from the 2 year old child to the 75 year old grandparent. Once you get past the difficult to navigate website EVERYTHING else is wonderful. Well worth the 9 hour flight for the great facilities, staff and WARM WATER of Waikiki. Fix the AUD - USD exchange rate and this would be the perfect destination!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great views. Excellent amenities. Convenient for excursions as well as beach and lagoon. Good choices for a variety of eating locations plus the convenience of stores for in-room preparation and dining. Not sure why people bring such big suitcases with so many clothes when there is an excellent washer/dryer in the unit.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: HGVC has overbuilt on this property, pools, lagoon, beach, way to over crowded and if you do not stake out a pool chair by 9am, you will not get one. Then to get a chair for the beach you have to pay $20 per day, which lasts til 5pm, then they are taken from you. New tower, Grand Waikian, is poorly designed. If you use the sofa bed in the living area, when used it comes out to the wall, so you cannot get around it, this blocks access to the kitchen area. We had to crawl over the bed,(we had one of our sons using it) just to make coffee in the morning. Also, in the master bedroom, there are no room darkening blinds to block the sunrise from coming into our room. We were aweakend by the sunlight at 6am. Finally had to sleep backwards in the bed to avoid the sunlight from hitting our eyes.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: had a room on the 25th floor of this luxury time share .. hilton grand is situated near the main st but close to all the shops .. a few minutes walk to the beach. the hotel is walking distance to restaurants outside of hilton village ,,

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed 5 nights in a 2 bedroom Ocean View Suite on 21st floor during 4th of July week. The Suite is very large with two bedrooms, one ensuite bathroom, one in the hallway. Each bathroom has a walk-in shower. The suite has a complete kitchen and dining room table with 4 chairs. The hotel is part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village resort and the grounds are massive, multiple pools, including the really cool lagoon pool. Be warned, the resort is open to the public so it can get crowded.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The HGVC is a premier property on Waikiki. The Grand Waikikian is a premier tower within HGVC. It is relatively new and well-appointed. There are several drawbacks that bring this down to 4 stars. Number one is that the suites are small. Some are smaller than others and very poorly laid out. Much of the sq. footage is wasted in a hallway and little room is left for the living room or kitchen area. The parking throughout the HGVC is ridiculously expensive. $47/day. It tops NYC! Lastly, they have overbuilt and there is never any room in the pool which they seem to close nearly every day due to some accident or water imbalance. If this resort could sort some of these problems out it could be a 5 star.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a very nice hotel. Close to the beach. Close to restaurants. No restaurant in this particular hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. Very nice room. Loved just sitting on the balcony watching the ocean. We had a wonderful stay. Hard to say that the room was expensive because everything is on the expensive side...even McDonald's

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Located right on Waikiki Beach the Grand Waikikian was beautiful. The beach is only a walk away and shopping at Ala Moana is right down the road. The rooms are spacious, clean and thr staff is very friendly. My stay was excellent and I will for sure stay here again in the future!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A very nice property, but really large with a number of towers and tons of people. Yet, it didn't feel crowded. Our room was a nice 2 bedroom with a full kitchen. Not the newest, but decently maintained. Very friendly and helpful staff. Quite a few sales folks on the property, but they aren't pushy.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Huge complex of Hilton properties. Lots of pools and on premises stores and food eateries. Lots of them branded. Right on the ocean so that was good. Rooms were nice and kitchen was nice too. Big tub in bedroom with separate shower in bathroom. Location was ok, and a mile or so away from main shopping district. Big negative was how unhelpful employees were about anything not directly related to the properties were. The concierge seemed bothered to answer questions. Unless you were helping them to make money, they did not really want to help. With the price for the room, they should be more willing to spend time helping you.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We requested a suite with a king bed one room and two beds for our children in the other. The staff would not give us room we requested - our daughter spent our stay on the couch. The room smelled. The resort charges for lounge chairs umbrellas on the beach. (What do they use the resort fee for - not sure...) The whole place is ridiculously crowded unpleasant and so not worth the money
user_name:
kbk2772
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This place really has it all! Situated on a gorgeous beach resort with all the amenities you could want .... shops, restaurants, Starbucks, ABC store, beach rentals, bars etc. It's only a few mins to the lagoon and beach and the grounds are beautiful! Beautiful beach and lots of choices to snack/eat/drink. And they have their own luau and fireworks on Friday evenings!The hotel itself is immaculate and the rooms are modern and spacious! My husband and I stayed with our daughter and DIL in a 2 bed/bath room with a full kitchen and washer/dryer. The room had a breakfast nook and living room that fit us all plus seating at a kitchen bar. The room could be better described as dual masters as both bedrooms had a large ensuite with a deep soaker tub being the difference our room.It was my 3rd visit to this hotel and I will keep coming back!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at Grand Waikikian Hilton. Our suite was two bedroom two bath. Very comfortable, nice and clean facility. Resort was conveniently located. We didn't rent a car. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Village had restaurants , grocery store and shopping stores. Place is family friendly.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Located in Hilton Hawaiian Village, Grand Waikikian is very beautiful with stunning view from most of the rooms. We stayed in a 2 bedroom Penthouse Suite on the 39 floor. Rooms are super clean and beautiful. Room even come with a PS3 GAME CONSOLE.This is the place to stay while in Honolulu, Oahu.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Nice hotel within the Hilton Village, close to the beach, restaurants and easy to get anywhere. The 2 bedroom suites are so nice and cheaper than 2 rooms for couples traveling together or families. The pool is small but the lagoon and beach are close. The staff is great as well but since it's a Grand Vacations property and not owned by Hilton, they didn't have any benefits for Diamond members (I.e. no free breakfast or lounge) and valet is expensive.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the GW instead of the other options at HHV. It was a great choice. You are a 15 minutes walk each way to 2 large malls. Ala moana mall has a fresh foods grocery similar to Whole Foods. If you have a kitchen in your suite, this is the place to get beverages, snacks for your room. Very reasonable(for hawaii). We ate breakfast at cinnamons and aloha kitchen, both a 5-10 minutes walk. The chairs at the hotel pools fill up fast, so be there by 10am. In my personal opinion, the restaurants on property are not worth it. A short walk gives you such variety, and is a bit cheaper. Our room was a 2 bedroom oceanview room, and it was great. There were 4 of us, and there was plenty of room.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a great time at the Waikikian. The environment was very relax and welcoming. The location of this hotel is great. There is a lot to do, many shops, great beach and exciting pool. My family really enjoy the stay.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are vacation club members and have stayed at the Grand Waikikian many times. We prefer it to some of the other towers at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. As with all vacation club towers, suites have kitchens and free wifi as well as great access to all that the Hilton Hawaiian Village offers. Until recently, it was the newest of the club towers, but it is still very modern and the only tower with a washer/dryer in each unit AND direct access to the parking garage. Our 1 bedroom high floor city view room was at one the end of the floor (2812) with a very large balcony that stretched the length of the suite. The rooms are quiet and we never heard our neighbors. The check in was quick and everyone was very nice.I appreciate that Hilton Hawaiian Village is still beachfront (one of only a few Waikiki hotels that are actually on the beach) but away from the crowds of Waikiki. Yet, it is very convenient to walk to anywhere most people would want to go in Waikiki. The walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center or the International Marketplace from the hotel takes a leisurely 20min. Perfect stay for us every time.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed 4 nights at the grand waikikian in a 2 bedroom unit with our family of 4. The room and ocean view was very nice. We liked the balcony and kids liked the DVD player. The Hilton resort is very nice, the pools are great just wished the beach sand was a little softer. It was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Liked being so close to the Ala Moana mall - great shops and food! Will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are vacation club members and this was our first time at the Grand Waikikian. We had a one bedroom. 2 adults and a 5 year old. Described for maximum of 4 people and that would be a stretch. The closet and drawer space really is only enough for us and our son. Really nice resort though located in the Hilton Hawaiian village. Our encounters with the staff were always nice and friendly. Short walk to the beach and the lagoon.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We loved the location and being part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village meant many restaurants were on your doorstep. Walking to the massive shopping centre one way and the shopping strip in the other direction was enjoyable. The beach and beach lagoon catered for all as well as the many pools. Our apartment had everything we could want including a dishwasher, washing machine and dryer. We cooked ourselves a couple of times and enjoyed using an entirely different oven to that which we have in Oz. Overall a great experience - hoping we will be able to do it again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I stood at the Grand Waikikian for 8 days. It is located in the Hilton Hawaiian Village which was great because the grounds are beautiful and you have pretty much everything right there. They have restaurants, stores, and 2 Starbucks! The ABC Store is the go to for everything-groceries, sandwiches, gift shop, etc. The reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 stars is because you had to pay to use the business center. I am a Hilton Honors member and only stay at Hiltons and I never had to pay for using the business center. Before you can even use the computer you have to swipe your credit card for the computer to log on. Then it starts count of how long you are on it and the amount increasing. They they charge per print out. Meanwhile they charge you $35 daily resort fee which I would think that should have been included. Otherwise, everything else was lovely. Views are gorgeous, pools are clean, staff is very cheerful and pleasant, grounds are clean and beautiful, and easy access for transportation (cabs, shuttles, tours, etc.)

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a great stay here. The rooms are small but but very nice. The balcony and ocean views are amazing. Waikiki beach in front of the hotel is just beautiful and wasn't to crowded. Grounds are well maintained. Food at the many restaurants was very good as well. Tiki bar near super pool made the best Maitai I had all week. My I only reason for not giving it 5 stars is the size of the resort. It so large and lots of people. I prefer less crowded resorts.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Amazing spot to enjoy paradise even if only for a few days! Had everything my family and I were hoping to get out of our trip. Awesome location, fantastic staff. Parking prices are a bit steep. $39.99/day but that's expected.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our third stay at the Hilton Village but our first time at the Grand Waikikian. We have been fortunate (or unfortunate) timeshare owners for about the last 4 years. When you first enter the Grand Waikikian the lobby is beautiful and the staff was friendly. Unfortunately, they stopped giving out the Hawaiian Leis when you enter which was the least of our worries. The check in was slow, but the crazziest was the $39/day parking fee they charge now. Apparently, they just started this last month. I just wish they had told customers that booked before last month about the fee. It takes a good chunk out of your budget so please be weary if you rent a car. Rooms were nice and clean with a washer and dryer in unit. If you stay more than 3 days you will only have housekeeping come by once. We were there for 8 days and with housekeeping coming once. Things were a little grimy. It's no big deal for us I like to clean. Just got some Windex and wiped everyday. Food at hotel and like all other hotels were pricey. We took advantage of our over priced car rental and picked up some cheaper local restaurants nearby. There used to be fireworks often but now it's limited to Friday nights only and go figure the Friday we were there it was cancelled due to "technical difficulties." The pools in the village are nice and I recommend going in the morning when water is clearer and cleaner. The pool with the slide has lots of kids and going there early is a plus. They closed one day because a kid went #2 in the pool:-/. No biggie plenty of beaches you should go to anyways. Overall, it was a great trip. I would have given it 3 starts but it's Hawaii so I gave it an extra star for that.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: After traveling from the Mainland for hours, we finally arrived in the suite. We opened the curtains and stepped out on the balcony to the view posted here. That breath taking view summed up the resort. Everywhere on the property is lovely. All our meals were delicious.All our needs were anticipated. We had a full kitchen and there is a small grocery store only a few steps from the elevator. Free DVDs. The beach is near. It takes lots of walking to explore all the choices within the resort. Why leave except to see other sights on Oahu?

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel is pretty good. The location is great. It's right next to the lagoon and about a 5 minute walk to the beach. We were in a 2 bedroom suite. It was great having a washer and dryer and kitchenette. The room was good, not great but not bad. The reason I give it 3 stars is because one of the comforters had blood on it. Housekeeping did not switch out the comforter from the previous people who stayed there. On top of that when a new comforter came, we thought that the staff person would make the bed with the new comforter. She just dropped it off. The hotel did give us a credit, but we could not shake the feeling of finding the blood on it. Everyone there is super nice and so helpful. Hopefully, ours was an isolated incident, and it won't happen again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A great location with everything you need nearby. Rooms are beautiful and very functional. Service was great and everyone was very helpful. An easy walk to shopping and beaches. Many restaurants on premises make it easy to never leave the premises.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: In case you are wondering: There is a laundry machine and dryer in the room. They start you off with one pack of laundry detergent. You can buy more detergent at the ABC store downstairs (There are 2 on the property, and a third just off property). No included breakfast, but lots of local places within walking distance. It's hard to find parking in the local downtown Waikiki area, so if it's within a mile or so, you might as well walk, especially east of the complex. If you are going to the local Ala Moana mall, it's easy to park because of the parking garage. It's a great location. You can walk to either the Ala Moana or the International mall. There are 3 pools on the property. There is also a salt water lagoon. The beach is just outside the back entrance. Our room looks recently renovated. I recall reading that they were doing major renovations last year. The room was clean and well stocked. The bed was a little stiff though.  There are plenty of places to eat at the complex (Hilton Hawaiian Village), but definitely make sure you walk outside and see what's around. Within the complex, there's Lappert's Ice Cream, the ABC stores, clothing stores, a Louis Vuitton store (!!!) and some other low and high end shopping.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was my 4th visit to HIlton Hawaiian Village. Can't beat the location and access to pools, lagoon, beach and all Waikiki has to offer. First time to the Grand Waikikian. Amazing views...watched the Luau from our balcony 5 nights in a row! Sorry to have missed the Friday night fireworks due to a last minute cancellation.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The staff could not have been more helpful for the entire stay. Reccomendations were spot on and we had the time of a lifetime. We found the most reliable transportation to be the busses. The trolleys were nice, and reasonable, but while different lines stopped at most of the stops, they wouldn't pick you up unless you had special tickets. The Hilton village had whatever you needed and was right on the water. Nice eateries all over, a couple were a bit pricey, but great food. Gift shops, coffee shops, Luau on the roof, fireworks on Friday night, just on and on.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We were staying in the grand waikikian tower for 5 nights. This is an excellent spot for families with younger kids.plus points:1. Excellent location, very close to wakiki2. In Hawaiian village3. awesome pools. 1 pool has 2-3 slides. great fun.4. lagoon is walking distance, kayak rentals. do the aloha combo, best value for your money.5. beach is on the property.6. ABC stores all around to shop for grocery items. We had a kitchen in our room so we shopped for breakfast items and saved money on breakfast.7. Free dvd rentals8. Parking is very close. dont use valet. In fact rent a car the days you need it.9. Wifi is great.10. Rooms are great. Well atleast the 1 bedroom suite was. No complaints.negative points:1. you get 2 bottles of water for free everyday. That should be in the plus point but if you have to collect that water from concierge. thats a very big negative. Since they leave at a certain time. and also that is not their main job. You have to stand in a queue of people actually using concierge service and then get your 2 bottles. I also noticed some of the concierge seemed mad to bring the bottles of water. I was late to collect the bottles on night and I missed the concierge closing time by 5 mins and the check-in people couldnt get the bottles. that is just ridiculous.2. Parking fee is exorbitant $40 to self park $48 for valet.3. The local shop Accents is very convenient but the cashier was very unprofessional and rude.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have an 18-month old child, and we traveled to Hawaii together for the first time. It was so nice to have all the amenities of a condo (full kitchen, washer, dryer, tub, shower, etc.) Our room was cleaned every day. The custodian even washed our dishes! What else could we ask for?Everything felt new/recently upgraded. Large tub, fantastic shower (good water pressure). Partial view of the ocean. We felt like we got our money's worth. We split our vacation in two different hotels, and even though the Grand Waikikian was cheaper, it was FAR better than the Turtle Bay Resort.Staff was attentive. Great service, fantastic location, access to the pools and lagoon. Our son loved the being in the water. It was nice to enjoy the fireworks as a family. A terrific vacation. PERIOD.We came before the busy summer season. The hotel was not crowded at all. Always found chairs around the pool. Food at the restaurants was good. There were a couple ABC stores nearby. Lots of restaurant choices within walking distance of the resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great place for a family vacation. The village offers many choices for swimming, eating, and shopping without leaving the property. The Grand Waikikian tower is probably not the best tower to stay. GW rooms are nice and up to HGVC standards. But, you will be walking across the property to enter the tower all the time. Go toward the beach to get to Lagoon tower and then reverse to go back to GW rooms. Annoying. Also, cannot enter GW from the street. Try other towers instead. As noted in other postings, pigeons on the patio are a real turn off. Pigeon poop is pervasive around edges of the veranda. The tenth floor view is mostly of the conference center with the accompanying noise of ventilation fans although there are obstructed ocean views. Maybe higher floors are more scenic?Luau food just ok although entertainment was very good compared to other luaus I have attended.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed 2 nights on Memorial Day weekend for a "Staycation". Over the years we've often chosen to stay "in town" and we familiar with about a dozen properties in Waikiki. We regard the Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort as our mainstay because the amenities and services are plentiful. It is an exceptionally good choice for families. This review is specific to the HGVC Grand Waikikian Tower. This tower occupies real estate that was once the home of "The Waikikian" hotel, a motor inn style hotel that dated back to the beginning of the jet age (hence the name). It is set back a bit from the ocean, relative to some of the other towers and close to Ala Moana Blvd. Our room overlooked Ala Moana Blvd (even # rooms...odd # rooms over look the 'resort' which, immediately, is the parking deck). and provide a mostly "city view", even though it is was marketed as "partial ocean view" (I would say VERY partial, see photo). If you want to see more ocean, you may wish to consider the large suites that are ocean-front on this tower, or, better still, the Lagoon Tower (or Rainbow Tower). The one bedroom suite was pure perfection and wanted for nothing that I could imagine. Once thing I noticed was how remarkably quiet the room was, even though it was directly on a very busy road in Waikiki. When the sliding door to the balcony was shut, you could hear nothing from the outside (when its open. that is another matter). Another excellent feature that this tower has going for it above ALL of the other towers in the resort is that it has direct access to the vast parking deck. All of the other towers have at least a short walk to the deck (through a retail area) This tower a single floor elevator ride and you are in the deck. The parking on the Waikikian side is in less demand, so were able to find parking within 10-15 spots of the door to the elevator. Super convenient! The Waikikian also has two other features that are very handy: a convenience store in the lobby just steps from the elevator to the rooms and a courtesy lounge on the 8th floor with lockers and showers, etc. in case you arrive early or have a late flight. While we didn't use this lounge, it is a thoughtful accommodation to guests. The public areas of this tower have plenty of seating, but it has an almost mausoleum-like quality and is obviously only a pass-through to more busting areas of the resort. The tower is adjacent to the Paradise pool which is the pool that has water slides and a hot tub area. It is also close to the lagoon. We needed to make a single call to guest services for bedding for the roll-away sofabed. It was delivered promptly. The resort fee was $30/night and the parking was $39/night. These compare favorably to hotels in other metropolitan areas.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This Hotel is gorgeous. The staff greeted us everytime with a smile even those that were working on cleaning up the garage. Everyone was very friendly and smiling and willing to help if needed and in good spirits. The grounds are inviting and well maintained. It's like a park atmosphere. Ocean views, clean, airy, fun, lagoon. The rooms were clean and had many of the amenities you would find in an apartment. Will difinitely stay here again.
