hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Everything about this day was off the chart and deserves five stars. The only reason for the four stars is because we pay $188 for parking for just two days for two cars. The daily rate, even for guests at the luxury resort, is astronomically high

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Location is pretty good, a short walk to Ala Moana mall and within walking distance of the International MarketplaceThe Hilton complex has a lot of variety for places to shop and eatBut, they have a problem with pigeons. The balcony was disgusting.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Absolutely beautiful resort. Rooms are exquisite, beds are very comfortable. We loved the balconies, my son enjoyed the one off his bedroom for reading, we all enjoyed the larger balcony off the living room for breakfast and late day relaxing or an evening drink or ocean viewing.Of course it was nice to have a washer and dryer in our room for our longer stay.I would highly recommend the Grand Waikikian.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great place. Very accommodating and attentive staff. Lost of things to do. Good food at the many restaurants on site. Must check out the Starlight Luau. Very kid friendly. Has a lagoon for the kids. Right on the beach.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikan by Hilton Grand Vacation exceeded my expectations. The accommodations and service was excellent. The rooms were modern and spacious. The resort restaurants were very good. The only negative was the overpriced service of $47 per day.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I traveled to Oahu for a writing research trip so I was looking for a place in the middle of everything at Waikiki/Honolulu yet with enough quiet nooks for me to take notes and get in some writing time.The hotel is large, clean, and lovely with wide open spaces to allow for breezes from the nearby ocean. The grounds and gardens are well kept. The rooms are nice and on par with what I've come to expect from Hilton Grand Vacation properties. Being in Hawaii and on Oahu, I was happy to see a rice cooker as part of the standard kitchen appliances. The bed linens were fresh, clean and the pillows were plump and soft. The bathroom towels were provided in plenty There was one point where we needed extra toilet paper and asked the first staff person we saw in the hallway for it. She went to housekeeping and apparently it had to be confirmed that she really was getting it for a hotel guest before they'd give up the extra rolls. Very strict on providing supplies! But once confirmed it was for hotel guests in their room, the precious toilet paper was provided with a smile.Valet is convenient at the hotel and not much more per day than self park. However we did wait a rather long time one morning because of a large group needing multiple cars and only one valet there to manage us all.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Room on city side is very noisy and has no view. Bed was very uncomfortable, and room was made only once per week. TVs in the room are smaller than your average hotel. Pool area was always crowded, and despite postings of "no children under 5," the staff routinely allows infants and toddlers under 5 into the hot tubs.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: So here we are, if it wasn't for the amazing time we have had outside of the hotel in Waikiki, this hotel would have completely ruined our time in Hawaii.Funnily enough we haven't even completed our stay yet, I'm up at 11pm laying in bed dwelling on how crap tomorrow is going to be at checkout time. It has been disappointing and frustrating since we stepped foot out of the Taxi.Firstly, flights arriving from Australia land between 5:00 and 7:00am. The hotel made us wait 7.5 hours to check into our room because check-in time is not until 16:00. When you come in from a long haul flight all you want to do is shower and settle in. For us the time was spent sitting in the lobby twiddling our thumbs. And then sitting in the lounge with all of the other depressed people who have to wait or have been kicked out at 10:00am waiting for afternoon flights.I booked this place through a travel agent and the itinerary didn't say anything about having to pay a $35.00 USD resort charge PER DAY. This covers Wifi, local calls, two bottles of water a day and 10% off activities booked at the hotel. I don't need or want any of this but still, $35.00 a day is automatically charged. Guest Services rang me shortly after check-in to ask how I was. I told them the check-in experience was pretty frustrating. "Sorry about that have a nice day". Thanks i'll do my best!I'm a Hilton Honours member and pretty much exclusively stay at Hilton properties all over the world. I have always seen cards in the rooms saying if you are unhappy about anything please talk to us and we will try and make it right. I thought I would do just that and see reception. I told them about the check-in experience, the extra fees etc. I thought it would be the perfect opportunity if they could make it right by allowing me a late checkout. I got told the checkout time is 10:30am so I'm welcome to stay until 11:00am free of charge. Thanks so much for the half an hour! My flight departs at 22:00 so something around the 15:00 mark would have been a nice gesture without causing you too much grief. It really is a shame because the Hotel is beautiful, the rooms are extremely well equipped and the location is prime. The bad experiences have made certain that I will never book a Hilton property in Hawaii ever again. So my advice to anyone reading this. This hotel is expensive, it has hidden costs, every question you ask the answer is going to be a polite 'no' and the check-in/check-out time is extremely poor. If I were you, do some very good research as there are much better hotels around the area in the same price range.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Paradise is not fathomable until you land in Hawaii. Top notch service is not experienced until you vacation at this resort! The staff is beyond catering, and pleasant. Rooms are spacious, and maintained impressively. Get an "ocean view" room. You will regret it; if you don't. Out of a six day stay I have not a single compliant for this resort/staff.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband and I had an excellent stay at Hilton Grand Vacations Grand Waikikian resort. We will definitely book our next stay in Oahu at this resort. I would recommend this resort to any of our friends and family who are traveling to Oahu.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Rooms are nice. Location is great. Kitchen has everything you might need in a week stay. Bedding is very comfortable. Great access to shopping and beach. Beautiful views. Layout was nice had a table for dining.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A good timeshare vacation complex which incorporates just about everything on the 22 acre grounds.The building and rooms were adequate and had everything but are getting old and need a refurbishment.The suite was large with a good lounge and kitchen but was dark and needed modernisation.Service was adequate and the pools and beach area pleasant and lots of restaurants and shops.Position of hotel was a little of centre and some distance from the major shops and hotels but close to Ala Moana shopping Centre.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This property is top quality. Rooms are spacious and well decorated. Kitchen furniture is a bit on the low end but all in all very nice. Recommend the rooms on the east side of the building for great views.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Always a great experience at the HHV! Best location in Waikiki, lots of family activities, great amenities. Easy access to rental cars to drive around the island.Only issue we have now is the exorbitant cost of parking at HHV!! $37!!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the Grand Waikikian. We loved it! Quiet, clean, and something for everyone. The beach is so well manicured! We didn't have to worry about stepping on pieces of coral, shells, sticks, etc. like we did at other resort beaches. Hilton puts in the attention to detail.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: All staff and tour members were SOOOO happy and friendly - NO frowns or grumbling on this trip .. They all LOVE their jobs. Our motel had an OPEN entry - 5 huge doorways - with NO BUGS - cannot offer this service in Minnesota ... We only saw ONE fly in ONE store in 8 days ... PERFECT weather - every day - even when it rains. WARM - dry in a few minutes. Saw most of the Ohau Island - BEAUTIFUL water - waves - mountains - zip lines - helicopter tour - dinner cruise - luah - private island tour - Pearl Harbor Tour - Thoroughly ENJOYED it all. Very hard to return to Minnesota !!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights and really enjoyed the stay. After a small hiccup on checking in to the wrong room, we were then located correctly on the 26th floor so had amazing views and the room was very large for the two of us. The furnishings were all good, the bed enabled us to have the best sleep of our whole trip and the kitchen was well stocked with equipment that we used during our stay. It was good having restaurants within walking distance and we went swimming in several of the pools and the lagoon.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We just got back from a wonderful 5 night stay in Honolulu at the Grand Waikikan Hilton hotel.It truly is a village and has great little shops and restaurants on the campus which are more expensive than their off campus counterparts but the convenience they offer is great. The hotel is in a great location, close to shopping, restaurants, beach and pools. You really can't go wrong with the location as everything is within walking distance. Our room was lovely, we had 2 bedrooms, two balconies, kitchenette and sitting area. The room had all the amenities we needed and was cleaned daily. The only thing I would suggest to the hotel is to offer a better deal on beach umbrellas and chairs. I believe the beach area is open to the public and the vendors charge for use of these items. However, it would be great if the Hilton would offer a reduced rate for hotel guests. $25 for a beach umbrella and $10 for a beach chair was very expensive every day.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hawaii never fails to deliver and staying at HHV in a suite (our last 2 stays have been in the GW) makes the holiday that much more enjoyable. If you don't like crowds then HHV and Waikiki probably isn't for you. If however you love enjoying the sunshine, beach and pools, shopping and eating and drinking then you can't go past Hawaii!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Property is fine, just don't ever buy the timeshare product because every few years Hilton will worsen the deal for you, be it ever increasing maintenance fees, poor conversion to Hilton Honors points which they devalue fairly often, increasing parking fees, or even a daily fee even if you use your "points". Basically, they have all the control, and you're just there for the abuse.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are currently staying here. We have two rooms. One is a one bedroom unit and the other is a 2 bedroom unit. The rooms are new and clean and beautifully decorated. Our two bedroom unit has an ocean view and it is amazing.The front desk people are very helpful. Check in was fairly easy. It is a million times better than the hotel part(Hilton Hawaiian village) where the lines to check in are at least an hour long each day.The pools are crowded, but we have been able to get a spot each day.I would recommend staying here

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent one night at this resort. We reserved the 2 bedroom with a city view. Check-in was smooth. Our room wasn't ready till close to check-in time 4pm. We were able to go to the hospitality lounge which has a locker room to change and freshen up. The paradise pool: this is the pool with water slides. It was very crowded. Went to grab towels and they said they ran out of towels. We were surprised none of the pool chairs had umbrellas. It's can get really hot in Hawaii and there seems to be a shortage of shaded areas. There are umbrellas and chairs you can rent at the cost by the lagoon but we wanted to stay by the pool. By the Paradise pool they have Pronto Pickle to order food. Line was so long and took about 20 minutes to order. They need more pool servers.Rooms are really spacious and nice. Kitchen with washer and dryer. Soaking tub in the master with separate shower. Two double beds in the second bedroom. Pull out sofa in the living area. Very accurate from hotel pictures.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: WE stayed a week at the Grand Waikikian in the Hilton Hawaiian Village in Honolulu. Outstanding room, and service. This was our 2nd stay there, and would stay again. Multiple pools, lagoon, and beach for water sports, many eateries to choose from.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We're part of the Hilton Grand Vacation Club and thought we'd try a vacation in Hawaii. The Grand Waikikian fit our schedule. It's part of the Hilton Hawaii village with a number of different towers. Finding your way around is a trip as the property maps aren't that detailed and are even missing a building.The rooms are modern and clean. We found no fault with the rooms or equipment and it was quiet and relaxing for most of the time. Our room gave a nice view of the property and ocean and was suitable for relaxing, which we were eagerly seeking.There are pools, a lagoon, lots of places to eat and shop. Staff are very helpful and give tips on things to do that aren't as touristy.If you want to stock your fridge, a Walmart is about a 10 min drive away, but ABC Stores are everywhere for simple things at higher costs. The hotel restaurants and bars are pricey but offer a chance to talk with other guests. Food was good to excellent.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Rooms are the perfect size for a family vacation. Full sized refrigerator, washing machine and dryer and a well stocked kitchen. Highly recommended for a family vacation if you have 4 or fewer people in each room.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Just finished a week at the Hilton Grand Vacations at Waikiki. It was wonderful. The location is right off the trolley stop for fun sightseeing and exploring. The lagoon safe, warm and beautiful. The grounds and rooms are beautiful, and the staff is so welcoming and attentive. I hated to leave, but enjoyed my stay very much.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Good place overall for a family vacation. Well maintained resort. RJ in Concierge was very helpful. Air Conditioning was an issue during the stay as it could get warm and humid. Pools and hot tub were also over crowded. Beach activities were fun. Could be more reasonably priced.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We purchased a time share with Hilton a couple years ago on Big Island, and decided to use our points to stay at the Grand Waikikian (this was the first time we used the points) in a One Bedroom Plus with single king sized bed and a pullout couch for the kids. The room itself was decent. The bedroom was very nice, and the bed super comfortable. The pullout was suitable for kids (we have a 14 and a 10 yr old), though not particularly comfortable if you're an adult. Kitchen is well stocked with utensils, pots, pans and detergent, although there's no provided salt, pepper or oil, so you'll need to buy all of that. The swimming pool at the Grand Waikikian is relatively small, and was very crowded every day we were there. The lagoon was OK, but I felt the one at the Hilton Waikoloa Village on the Big Island was better. Restaurant food was good, but quite pricey; we paid more than $200 for a light 4 person lunch at the Tropics restaurant. The hotel itself is quite close to lots of stores and buses, all within walking distance, which was great. In-unit washer/dryer was awesome; we made use of them a couple times. Couple downers: We got roped into an "owners briefing session", which was just another time share sales pitch. While we don't regret buying the time share, we had no intention of getting more. After hard selling us for over an hour (during which we repeatedly indicated our lack of interest), the salesperson had an abrupt personality change and couldn't wait to get rid of us when he realized he wasn't going to pull more money out of us. It was quite off-putting. We won't be doing that again. We valet'ed our car while we were there. Not sure if they didn't have enough valets, but we often had to wait long times for the car (upwards of 15-20 min) to be delivered, and there was usually no valet around at the counter when we came by (at different times of the day).

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The property and location are ideally located close to many things to do. The pools are small but you have access to beach a with a short walk. The AC in the room was much warmer than what thermostat says because the 1 vent blows right on it. Overall good stay and having washer and dryer helps.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We made a 1 bedroom reservation 7 months ahead of arrival. For some reason, we were placed in an "Accommodating Room". The same evening that we had checked in, I call the front desk to request a different room, due to hitting my head on the range vent hood twice and lack of counter space because all of the cabinets were locked and dishes covered the counter space. After a few phone calls back and forth, they said we could change rooms in the morning. The next morning, we had to check out by 10 am then we had to wait until 4 pm to check back in. I asked the front desk staff what was I supposed to do for 6 hours? I had a sick child also. The front desk staff said that they would put my new room as a priority for cleaning. I then received a text message at 3:40 pm saying that my room was now ready. What happened to the priority? Nobody seemed to care that my family and I had to be without a place to go for 6 hours. That was not a good way to start off a vacation. The least HGVC could have done was provide lunch for our family while they were storing our luggage and perishable food.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great rooms, plentiy of amenities. Close walking to stores and buses. Very busy pools, very busy at check in and check out. Catered mainly for Japanese. Service is intended for Japanese more than other nations.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: 3 star at best. Hotel is nice but food is overpriced and under impressive. Can't get a decent meal anywhere at the hotel. Breakfast buffet for 4 cost us $200...NOT worth it.People are super nice. Service needs improvement.Beautiful setting but I guess we were hoping for less corporate and more culture...guess that's what you get at a Hilton.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We own in Vegas at the Elara and used exchange points to stay here. First, this hotel complex is a village, complete with a doctor, shops and restaurants. The kitchen was not as well equipped as we have seen in other exchanges. But the service was excellent. Staff friendly and helpful. The washer/dryer was efficient. (vegas takes forever). There is an arrival/departure lounge that has showers, private changing rooms, beverages and space to relax if you have to wait for your room or your flight home. Staff did not push for an owner update, respecting that this is a vacation. Hint: if you are retired military and have a car, park at the Hale Koa garage, across the street! Very reasonable.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I was 3 nights here in Feb 2017 with my family, we were in a 2 bedrooms Suite and it was really suitable for our family. All furnished with kitchen, washing machine as well. Just need a short walk to the lagoon and the beach. Will definitely come back here when back in Honolulu.
user_name:
HuyLeHCM
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian is 1 in large Hilton complex of hotels, each with own pool and amenities. I was disappointed this property doesn't have a fitness room. There is a small one available at a sister building. The rooms are great, full kitchen, washer, dryer, etc.. only silverware and plates for 4. I didn't give it a 5 star because I had to wear earplugs to sleep nightly. This property is roadside and I could hear every passing vehicle And the beep beep of delivery trucks and tour buses that arrive very early. If you're a sound sleeper it may not bother you. The property is clean and well located near its own market place and the iconic Tower with its colorful rainbow colored mural gracing its side. It brought back memories of the original Joni Mitchel song later famous by the Counting Crows ..." they paved paradise and put up a parking lot". After reading previous Trip Advisor posts, we did try eating at Tropics by the sea walk and enjoyed to music. They only take reservations for large groups. Music began at 5:30, we arrived at 6, there was already a line. The food was good, had a mushroom pizza. We did not eat at Tapas as others suggested because it felt land locked within another hotels outer area. They do have their own music. You can use your passport given out at check in for a 10% discount. At this time the sunset is around 6:30-6:40, very well worth watching nightly. There is a walkway and areas to sit at, bring your own drink in a plastic container and camera and enjoy: no reservations needed. I found the sunsets to be more colorful here, beating out Key West- A naturalist explained that it's due to "vog". It's the fog caused by the eruptions of the Kilaweah volcano from the island of Hawaii. The sunsets have more pinks and purple hues that continues lighting up the horizon well past the actual sunset. Within the hotel complex there is a Marketplace with several places to eat. They may not be seaside but you can take to go. I highly recommend Blue Water Shrimp. We are there twice and their portions are abundant to share or save for later. The squid or calamari steak was superb. Check it out. The prices for chairs and umbrellas are high. The Hilton says they don't control that. See picture for poster with rates. You can sit on towels, then move to chairs poolside or walk to nearby Walmart and buy your own. It's a choice. There are small store mixture of food and items called ABC stores, can't miss them. There are over 40 in the island. Every other store is an ABC. The hotel is well located within walking distance to MC Donald's, Subway, I Hop, lots of variety nearby so use your google maps to see. Overall, it was a good experience to savor Hawaii. We took a Viator trip to Hawaii to see volcano, well worth just full day. We also did the whale watching out of the Honolulu port aboard the Star of Honolulu, great trip saw whales. The bus system is available at bus.org. Check it out, convenient and reasonable for $2.50 each. Hawaii and its history is unique and adds a different dimension to what I knew about our US History, as Hawaii became a state in 1959.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife & I together with another couple spent 1 week at the Grand Waikikian, part of the Hilton collection of hotels in Waikiki. We are HGVC members and have stayed at a few properties. The Hilton property is in a great location; one end of Waikiki beach on a wide strip of beach. On 2 mornings we walked the entire beach which was a lovely walk past different hotels & people watching. The complex of hotels has a 'village' of shops in the middle and some decent hotels spread across the properties. I can see that you could spend most of your vacation in & around the Hilton complex and have a great time!When I booked I was told that the Grand Waikikian was the best of the hotels on the property. Certainly the suite was very well laid out and appointed to be extremely comfortable and functional for 2 couples. One of the best properties I've seen in that regard. Common facilities in the hotel itself were excellent. All the staff we dealt with were very friendly and helpful. One thing that surprised me was that this hotel is the furthest from the beach of all the Hilton hotels on the property (not that far, but not on the beach) and our room faced away from the beach even though we had one of the higher categories of suites. Obviously there are plenty of rooms in the Grand Waikikian with great water/beach views, but it would have been nice to have one. Maybe there was a different room category for those with a view, but I didn't notice when booking. The only other thing I found odd was that they have a policy with valet parking that you can't call down and have them bring your car around but you are supposed to come down and only then ask for your car. Its a very small thing, but I use valet parking at dozens of hotels every year and the whole reason I do is so that I can call down for my car rather than having to go to the garage myself and get it. Someone said that it was because some guests had been calling down and taking a long time to arrive, therefore causing them difficulties. Sounds like they've decided to punish all guests because a few had been causing them problems. ("Customers can be such a nuisance some times!")While I've highlighted 2 negatives I should emphasize that in context of the entire 1 week stay they are very minor and we entirely enjoyed our time at the Grand Waikikian. I would definitely stay here again, and would only find out what I needed to do to get a beach/water view.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed here at the Grand for a total of 7 days and it was great. The village allows you to experience several other properties on your own time. The location is perfect. We were able to walk to several different areas in the city without breaking a sweat or the bank.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We're HGVC members and have stayed at a few different properties- this one is one of the nicest. Beautifully decorated - with in-room washer and dryer, walk-in shower - we didn't need the hot tub but it's part of the "plus" rooms. Staff was friendly and location can't be beat. It's on the Hilton Hawaiian Village property so several pools to choose from as well as the lagoon with beach toys. The beach is larger at this end and seems less hectic. Pools get busy (spring break) so plan accordingly to spend time there in the morning when it's less crowded) LOTS of food and shopping choices in the Village. We liked Round Table pizza and the Tropics best. Stop by for a sample of the Hawaiian Cookies and you'll buy them all. A little treacherous crossing the street to the parking garage (did intention its spring break?) so be careful.Rooms are very clean and updated and staff will bring more towels etc if you're between cleanings (every 5 days). We were asked to join an owners meeting but no pressure when our schedule didn't allow. We loved our stay and recommend this hotel for young or older families or couples enjoying the islands.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Had a great family vacation! Facilities are great and the staff was excellent! Would love to stay again when we come back. I would highly recommend staying here to anyone looking for a great affordable vacation.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family and I enjoyed staying at this hotel. They had several pools, the beach, and a lagoon on site. Everything you want to experience in Waikiki is walking distance away. We will def stay here again

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I am a HGVC member. My family and I stayed there between Feb 18th - Feb 25th. We had a two bedroom Premier suite with a partial view of the ocean.The rooms are as you would expect from a HGVC property. Full Kitchen, washer and dryer, quiet, clean, comfortable beds, etc. No complaints about the room. I don't really have any complaints about the property but I think people visiting should know the following.Hawaiian village is made up of several hotels and Grand vacation towers. The closest to the beach is the lagoon tower and the rainbow tower. I did not know that before booking and while I could see the beach from my balcony, it was a 10-15 minute walk from Grand Waikikian to the beach.You have to rent chairs and umbrellas - chairs are $15 each and umbrella was $30. You can keep them from 8am - 5pm. They will boot your out of them at 5pm sharp! we could get up and go get lunch and come back. There is no butler service. The beach is not maintained so watch your step. I did not see anyone raking the sand or cleaning up. Not so say that did not happen after 5pm, I personally did not see it. This place is HUGE so get a map and use the friendly Concierge, bellmen, and front desk staff for directions. This is not a place I would bring anyone people who does not like to or can't walk a lot. I would never bring my parents here. You have to walk far to get to everything. There is no restaurant in GW so you have to walk into Hawaiian Village of off property. We did 10,000 steps a day while there and we were not trying. I barely get 2000 steps at home!!!If you want to save money, go to the ABC store or to a local grocery store and pick up cereal, eggs, bacon, lunch meat, etc. DO NOT buy groceries in the lobby store. A box of frosted flakes cost $10.95. Hawaii is expensive in general but prices on the property are ridiculous. The pools looked so much bigger on the website. They are not large, so they are always packed. There are a lot of kids and noise. If you want peace and quiet this is not the place for you. Its hustle and bustle. Honolulu is in an extremely populated area and all around you will see high rise buildings and traffic. This is why I prefer the big island or Maui. I was with newbies who wanted to see Peal Harbor,etc.Best place to eat for us was DUKE's!!! Drinks and food were excellent!!! Its a WALK from the hotel or you can spend about 10 bucks by cab.We did not rent a car but some friends did. There was a $39 dollar a day fee for parking. Valet was more. We walked most places so i'm not sure we needed it but if you really want to get around the island I would recommend renting a car.You must visit the Polynesian Cultural Center. the play there was awesome---not the luau----the play. It is an all day adventure. You learn all about the different Polynesian cultures that thread through Hawaii. Each has a village with two to three buildings/huts and they do presentations about their cultures, traditions, dances, clothes, etc. The walking was minimal b/c in each village you stop, sit and listen. the next village is close. There are only about 6 of them. One of the cool things was most of the workers in the different villages were from that actual island. Of course, there are restaurants/food stands and you can buy food packages. The hotel has a shuttle for $23.00 ea one way. it is about an hour drive and you follow the coast to get there so its a scenic drive. Beware, the shuttle stops at different hotels to pick up and drop off - it's only about 5 though. We took a cab going ---big mistake $$$$ and took the shuttle going back. We were the second drop off.The luau at Hawaiian village was okay. This was my third one in life, I've had better. it cost about $114.00 if you are a member. This luau does not show the pig coming out of the ground---if that's important to you. I don't like my food looking at me so I could care less but some people want the full experience. The Hawaiian pork was on the buffet and it was yummy!!! the food was luke warm though.If you are an owner make sure you get discount books from the concierge. If you are not an owner, you need to talk fast b/c they will try to get you to attend a time share presentation for 90 minutes of your life. The book has discounts for the different restaurants/shops in Hawaiian Village and the luau----at those prices you want all the help you can get. Now, consider yourself informed! Safe Travels!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you want a relaxing time with your family this may not be the place to go! Beautiful hotel tower at Waikikian, rooms nice, but pools were incredibly crowded and you have to pay $45 for a chair and umbrella for each person at the beach! The Lagoon is also not very clean, the were draining it our last day!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We recently stayed in a 2 bedroom suite on the 38th floor at the Grand Waikikian for 5 nights. The suite was very roomy and large. It was nicely furnished and accommodating. We had a lovely water view from all the rooms with a small balcony from the living & dining room. We enjoyed complimentary breakfast of fresh fruit, juice, coffee & bagels in the morning and in the evening we enjoyed wine & cheese, crackers, vegetables and dip on the 35th floor concierge level. The rooms and entire resort was very clean. The location is within walking distance to the beach, pools, shopping and dining. We had a very enjoyable visit and would not hesitate to return.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at this property for two nights with two kids (ages 11 and 9). Overall, we liked the place and had a great time. However, I did go in with low expectations. I had stayed the Hilton Hawaiian Village before so I went in knowing what to expect. What to Know:1. The property is pretty new. Our room was clean and pretty big. We packed into a one bedroom. The kids on the sofa bed and we were on the king. The rooms were actually soundproof so I could get up at 5 am watch the news while my kids slept. 2. Don't expect to do much real cooking. Overall the kitchenette was nice and very useful. I loved being able to make my kids eggs and pancakes in the morning vs. spending $100 on breakfast. The little store in the lobby sells eggs, juice, pancake mix and other goodies. However, the space is small and there are limited kitchen items like bowls. I wouldn't want to make a gourmet dinner there. We ate one night at Hula Grill which was AMAZING .I would recommend making a reservation there.3. The HHV is a 15- 20 minute walk to Waikiki. I actually thought of this as a bonus. The beach is a little bigger and it's actually a bit quieter. Waikiki could be described as a huge mall on the beach. You could actually not even pack clothes and just buy all your resort wear in Waikiki. There is everything from Prada to Forever 21. 4. You will get charged for beach chairs and umbrellas. We only did this one day so i didn't sweat it but i you are staying for a week it could really add up. I think the umbrella was $35 a day. Maybe more. My kids and husband also did a surf lesson. They loved it but it was super expensive. I think more than we paid for the room.5. The "partial ocean view" is a view of a building and a busy street. I didn't mind this but I wish I hadn't paid for it. 6. The service is bad. It's a condo type place so they are not into service. We got in late and I asked if the bed would be made up for the kids when I checked in. The woman at the front desk said oh it should be. Of course it wasn't and we had to wait 45 minutes from someone to deliver sheets. Not a biggie really. The thing that made me laugh was when I was filling up my water bottles and noticed there is a sign that said guests can have free refillable water bottles just ask the concierge. The first woman I asked said they were out. The next day I asked again and the woman gave me such a hard time about the stupid water bottles. She grilled me about staying at the hotel and then told me that my reservation said I was paying zero dollars each night. I wasn't. So weird to be so rude like I was asking for something crazy. If they don't want to pass out the water bottles they should just remove that sign. They are just cheap collapsible bottles anyway. Again not a big deal but just know that you are not getting a five star hotel here. Overall I would recommend this place. The rooms are nice and clean, there is lots to do in the area and for $330 a night I felt it was a good value.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Ok, so it's kind of long, but I am currently staying here right now, writing this on our patio, so this review is current as of 23 Feb 2017.First, the hotel and grounds are great. It's got all the things that you would need for a family vacation for first time visitors to Hawaii. However, where they fall completely short is the bedroom. We have what they call a Suite with two Double beds, in the Grand Waikikian. The room is ok in size and amenities, the beds are the problem. We are a typical American size family, and my wife and I are squeezed into a Full size bed, while the little one, is on the other bed. The beds are not Queen size, like you are made to believe in the pictures or wording, but are just slightly smaller than a Full size mattress. It's definitely not suitable for a couple to sleep on. After spending over $3000 for the week, I get to sleep on the pull out couch each night. After speaking with someone from the front desk, I was told that "these are the largest beds they had throughout the entire Hilton Hawaiian Village".Second, like everyone has said, parking rates are a complete disgusting fee of $32 USD for self park and $39 for valet, and that's PER DAY!!! The hotel will say it's due to the Hawaii traffic, urban area, etc. Basically, they should be embarrassed to charge that much for registered guest.Other than those two main items, it's a fun place for the kids and family. It's not for retirees that want peace and quiet by the pool side. It has the same concept like Disney World, where everything is done well, but for a price. If you keep that in mind, you'll be fine. But if you and your spouse or significant other, want to sprawl out on your bed after a long fun day, then you won't find it here. Thanks

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Warning, this is a long review but I hope to cover all of the major points :)We were booked in the Lagoon Tower but were "upgraded" to the Waikikian City View 1 bedroom suite. While suspicious about the "upgrade" we rolled with it (OK so they "sold" it to me by noting it had in-room laundry...kids, family, yes this is a consideration) The upgrade was anything but....the room was nice, spacious (although not alot of luggage storage space), full kitchen was handy but the city view? NOISY!!! I am going out on a limb and saying I would not have heard all of the trucks and backup sensors on semi's that are in the loading dock at 3am if I was in the Lagoon tower garden view room?!?! Oh well, a few more details:Full sized fridge, oven/stoveApartment size washer & dryerCoffee maker, toaster, rice cooker, blender, all utensils, etcWifi was free in the room, couldn't get connected by the pool but that was OK for usNice sized bathroom but a warning that the door from the living area and the door from the bedroom overlap and also block access to the closet (weird set up but livable...just be cautious at night to not walk into 1 of 3 possible doors)Bed was a bit soft, pillows were puffy and large (I love it, husband does not...depends on preference)Pull out sofa was comfy according to the little people (they were exhausted so they could have slept on the floor and not known it...take the review of that bed for what it is worth)We found the water was weird - it left a film on anything in the dishwasher and all over the sink. Not a big deal but just a warning if you are using the dishwasher.The amenities at the Hilton Hawaiian Village are too numerous to note but you have full use of the whole property. It is truly a village onto it's own and you have little need to leave if you are looking for a one-stop resort. This tower is a 3-4 min walk to the Paradise Pool (kids pool with waterslides - awesome but also busy) and the same distance to the lagoon (awesome too - salt water but no waves for the kids, fun to swim and rent water toys). Overall we found this tower to be clean and the staff very welcoming. This tower shares a lobby with the Lagoon tower which is nice as it has it's own driveway, cab line and check-in desk away from the main lobby (just visit the main lobby on a Saturday if you want to see how busy that can be!). Only negative was the direction of the room - avoid the city view (aka loading dock view) if you are looking for something quiet. If you are wondering about the Hilton Haw. Village as a whole - it is remarkable! Truly a great resort with lots of pools (and space around the pools), beach, rentals, activities, fireworks...the list is too long.To avoid being too long I have separated reviews for the restaurants. (Room service/Fresh connection is a NO, Hau Tree Pool restaurant NO, Tropics is better, Pizza is OK, Ice Cream is YES, CJ's Deli is a YES...........)

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very large resort complex which was much too crowded and noisy for us, a retired professional couple. We found no peaceful areas on property. Our one-bedroom unit with partial ocean view overlooked a busy main thoroughfare and other high rises; I was unable to see any ocean.
user_name:
Wendy Sue C
Hudson, Quebec, Canada

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel was wonderful We had a great time there. The beach was just walking distance on a pathway. There was also a lagoon and a pool with a few water slides! We were able to walk to lots of things and were able to catch transportation easily from the hotel. There were lots of shops and places to eat in the Hawaiian village resorts.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As HGVC owners, we had previously stayed at the Lagoon tower. It was noisy, old, and huge issues with the elevators. Never again will we stay there. So we splurged on our points and upgraded to the Grand Waikikian. It was a great decision as we loved it! It was much less busy, and much cleaner than the lagoon tower. Our room was spacious and bright. We enjoyed bingo one day and won some prizes! The little grocery store downstairs is convenient and not too pricy. Overall a very positive experience. We have already booked to return!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Front desk was not friendly and concierge was not st all welcoming and accommodating. We were not asked if the 5th floor street view was acceptable since we can here all the noises from the walkway below. The toilet was clogged and we had to call maintenance to fix. Valet was overpriced and the pools looked old, dirty and in need of upgrading.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent 2 weeks at this resort and the experience was wonderful. The club staff, room, and amenities were superb. We took advantage of the concierge and she helped us book tours that were appropriate for us. We would stay here again on our next visit to Hawaii.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed everything about the resort and can't wait to return. This was our second time and it was even better this time. The location is perfect. It is on the beach and not in the middle of Ala Moana. You can access all the bus services and shopping from the resort. The Bali Shrimp and Steak House is excellent with great service and wine list. We enjoyed every restaurant. Also, don't miss out on the Spa services.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This Resort has to be one of our favourite resorts. The staff are always so helpful, friendly and accommodating. The convenience of the Village facilities make our vacation so enjoyable. Our apartment is always fitted out with everything that is needed. We love to return each year for our family vacation.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: What a great resort with lots of amenities. The staff at every station and level are top notch, very friendly, courteous and helpful, so welcoming. Very close to the beach, lots of restaurants around including inside Hilton Hawaiian Village.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This vacation resort is fantastic. We had a 2 bedroom suite in the Grand Waikikian. We had a kitchen, washer and dryer, private balcony. the front desk staff, bell staff and valet service personnel were all professional and courteous. The concierge person we had did seem a preoccupied with staring at his computer screen and never engaged us face to face. We kind of had to pry information out of him. I hope the other concierge staff are more engaging? That's the only reason I didn't rate a "5" for this experience. Plenty of options for dinner and drinks around the entire facility. Dinner prices are comparable to many other major US cities. The lagoon and beach are all easily accessible. Overall great experience. Oh, BTW: Don't rent a car. Use public transportation or get a cab/Uber if possible and avoid the outrageous parking fees.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village is big, busy, brash and perfect for a family with small kids. We stayed at the Grand Waikikian which really exceeded our expectations, since the service was fantastic. It was one of the hotels for a conference I was attending at the Hnl convention centre, and it booked up very quickly. We managed to book a city view 2 bedroom suite for the first 2 nights, and then a ocean view 2 bedroom to finish the last 5, since that was all that was available. Thankfully, the staff found us an oceanview suite for our entire stay, so that we didn't have to move, and at no extra cost. The checkin for HGVC was separate and less crowded than the rest of HHV. The views were great, the rooms clean and spacious and the dining and kitchen areas exactly as advertised. With small children we cooked most nights and used the washer/dryer daily. They loved the pools and the Fort DeRussy beach was so close, and probably the best along the entire Waikiki stretch. The kitchen could have a few more plates, and maybe a cheese grater (our kids love cheese) but really, we had a perfect family vacation. I even made it to some of the conference.....Thanks Hilton Grand Vacations!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As Hilton Grand Vacation owners, we were able to treat our dear friends to a week's stay at the Grand Waikikian. Staying at the Hilton Hawaii village was convenient for walking to restaurants and the beach. The Ala Moana Mall is near and has a wonderful food court for a less expensive meal and McDonald's and Subway are a block away. Walmart and Sam's club is also in walking distance (<1 mile) to gather groceries for the week.Our room at GW was a 2-bedroom Premier which means it had a balcony with an ocean view. The room was the size of an apartment with full kitchen, 2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms, in-room laundry and 2 balconies. The staff at this location were all fabulous. We were truly treated like friends. We checked in and received a lei of our choice (flower, Kukui beads or shells). The friendly desk attendant assigned us a corner unit on a high floor which I had requested prior to arrival. Check-in was fast and smooth.In 2016, we had the pleasure of staying in the Rainbow Tower with a balcony view overlooking Waikiki Beach which was also very nice. It would be hard for me to choose which I liked the most. GW is so elegant with its wood finishes and we do enjoy the condo-style when vacationing. But the Rainbow Tower was our first stay in Hawaii and overlooked the Village and provided nightly music from the Tropics Bar and Grill.The Waikiki area is a very busy place but we will still stay at the Village during our next stay on Oahu. We like how clean the area is, enjoy the ease of transportation and like that we can walk to many attractions the island has to offer.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you have a Hilton you are good to go. The location , the accommodations and the hospitality are great. Hilton hallmarks. Numerous pools and hot tubs to chose from. Welcoming from the time you arrive to the time you leave.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Wonderful week at the Hilton village. The hotel and grounds are awesome. Many pool and dining options close by and just a simple walk through their wonderful lobbies to the beach. The room was a 2 bed 2 bath and very spacious and clean. Plenty of kitchen space for breakfast or snacks. Nice balconies to see the ocean and city. Staff was very friendly too. Parking is difficult and pricy. Rent only when you need a car.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great hotel. I would stay there again without a second thought. Close to shopping and restaurants, yet right on the beach. Always something special, like moving night on the lawn, or the parrots perched along the walkway. Really do not need a car, there a plenty of tourist group tours if you want to see the sites.
user_name:
Jodi P
mission viejo, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Ownership (Waikikian and Lagoon towers) check-in and check-out was a huge benefit, given the nightmare lines we saw over at the Hotel check in (Rainbow, Ali'i). Rooms are probably decent but ours was not, unfortunately. It was clean but not up to par. Staff is extremely nice and helpful.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Kehealani Colón fixed all our concerns, had many issues.Please continue to make locals feel just as welcomed as tourists.If it wasn't for Ms.Colón, we would be giving poor ratings for a third time. Beatiful location, beautiful beaches, and our girls had a great time at the lagoon.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had booked our Hawaii trip back in August for our wedding anniversary in December. Upon arrival we parked in the only parking garage near the shopping plaza and resort. When checking in we didn't realized that the hotel charges $32 per day for our rental car so 4 days $128 in parking fee. Our hotel room was nice, I love the balcony feature we got a room facing the center of the resort. There were tons of places near by restaurants and stores (walking distance 10-15 mins). Overall, we would probably chose a different location that wouldn't charge an arm and leg for parking.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had an amazing time! Our stay and the staff were awesome! We enjoyed ourselves very much! The staff was very informative when we had questions! The conceirge gave us great excursion ideas. We will be back!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed a week in one of the Penthouse Suites and had a wonderful time. Check in and out were both easy and quick; the staff is friendly and helpful. We enjoyed staying in the Hilton Hawaiian Village and being right on the beach and close to shopping. Goofy Cafe around the corner is not to be missed. We invited my brother and sister in law to join us and had a lot of room in our suite; I LOVED the jacuzzi tub in our room. Maid and turn down service was excellent. Having a kitchen and washer and dryer was so convenient, and we can't wait to come back for another visit. We attended a luau one evening and the food was delicious. The property is within easy driving distance of Hanauma Bay, Diamond Head, the airport, Moana Falls, the Arizona Memorial, and the North Shore. We opted to use Uber while in Hawaii rather than rent a car, largely because of the $30/day parking charge. I cannot say enough about this fantastic hotel.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: So the majority of hgvc members pay tens of thousands of dollars for the privilege of making a reservation at a beautiful location such as this, not to mention the annual maintenance fees for owners which are upwards of $2-3K. Well timed purchase of cheaper plane tickets add another couple of thousand dollars. Negotiate a good deal for a rental car, and do some shopping to save more money so every meal is not spend dining out. Upon arrival, what is the reward for all of this? Parking in the structure is $34/day. Are you friggin kidding me? Scrimp and save just so Hilton can take more money from us.I'm not saying it should be free, just discounted for hgvc members who already pay so much.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great time spent in the area and having a nice room to return to was great. I like the free movie treat. Parking is a beast and one must factor in the high cost. It would be nice if there was a reduced price for guests.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Spent another week in the Hilton Village, Waikiki beach, Honolulu, Hawaii. It is the forth time and I will come back. Now You can choose from 4 different towers. A balcony facing the Pacific is always something extra but a balcony facing the city works as well because of the wonderful temeperature. If You want to see the beach You can always step outside. This village is perfect situated just between a giant mall including food stores so You can live like home thanks to the kitchen AND well known restaurants like Hard Rock Cafe and The Cheesecake factory or if You prefer the more local hangouts with live music. Yes there is McD and Burger King too but gooing to Hawaii and eat there is not my prefered dining.
user_name:
Greger Per Ingv... F
Kalmar, Sweden

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian is a time share property by Hilton. The units are like an apartment. Each features a pull out couch, washer/dryer combo, table/chairs inside and on the patio, full kitchen, shower unit and separate soaking bathtub. Most units have views of town as well as the ocean. The pool is like a jungle area that has slides, three pool areas and a hot tub. Restaurants on site are good, but are a bit pricey, but there are several restaurants within walking distance.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had 13 nights at GW and enjoyed every moment. The staff is so friendly and helpful, the place is a very convenient location and the condos are well equipped and spacious with good beds! We loved being part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village with the lovely grounds, convenient shops and restaurants and excellent entertainment. Be sure to go to the Tapa Bar and see Jerry Santos and the group. We appreciated the abundance of chairs at the pools and the lovely view of the Lagoon. We really enjoyed the fireworks. 2 hints. The DW doesn't work very well so watch you need to check. If you use the kettle be sure to rinse it really well. When I first used it black mineral deposits came out but a thorough rinse and it was great. We appreciated the good washer and dryer in our suite. Our only real negative was having to put recyclable glass and plastics in the garbage!!!!We inquired about a place to bring our items for recycling but we're told to put it in the garbage. We were disappointed that a first class chain like Hilton was not being more environmentally responsible. If you want more Groceres than ABC there is a Food Pantry on Hobron Lane a few blocks from GW. To end on a positive note we had the most wonderful, kind helpful concierge, Alia Brown.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed in two bedroom premium unit 2802, corner room on level 28 for four nights. The room is fully equipped with full kitchenware and washer and dryer and each of the two rooms comes with King size bed. We decided not to rent car on this trip and were able to get away with renting car in Waikiki. Our costs of transportation are lower by utilizing trolley (a Waikiki transportation systems for tourist; cheaper four days' pass for unlimited travel) and local tour whereby transportation is included. We do have to walk through the neighboring hotel (Ilikai hotel) to take the 'trolley' around the flagpole area in front of the Illikai hotel (popular place for tour pick-up and trolley stop).

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed at the Grand Wakikian in the Hilton Hawaiian Village and absolutely loved it. The location was wonderful, the resort has so much to offer for shopping and entertainment, you could spend a week there alone without going out to all the other sites that Hawaii has to offer. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Customer service: Professional yet full of AlohaCleanliness: Astonishing Room: 706/ 1 bedroom/2bed suite full/ kitchen/washer and dryer/ balcony/ cold A/CBeautiful city view got to watch the toys for tots bike ride

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Decoration was nice. Wish parking was cheaper as we paid $32 per day....standard for all Hilton guest even the people renting their hotel room. Will return and take advantage of their super pool.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: what a suite! could easily accommodate two couples, has 2 rooms with queen beds and large common area with open kitchen. The penthouse lounge provides buffet breakfast with lots of fresh fruit ( no hot items) and evening snacks with wine/beer. The staff was professional and friendly. It is amazing how they run this large facility so smoothly (never waited for an elevator/quick checking) and keep it spotless clean. Of course everyone is smiling with Aloha spirit.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We just returned from a week long stay at the Grand Waikikian, and we enjoyed every minute of it. We booked a two bedroom and a one bedroom, as our grown children and grandson travelled with us. We had the one bedroom, which was spacious for two people. The suite included a sitting/living room with an attached kitchen area, a bath, and a bedroom with king sized bed. The bedroom had a large jetted tub, and the bathroom had a shower. It was very quiet,clean and comfortable. The kitchen was equipped with table settings for 4, although with 4 people, I think it would have been a bit crowded. It was perfect for 2. The kitchen also had cookware, a rice cooker, toaster. Our unit was near the end of the building, and although it was supposed to be partial ocean view, it was much more city view, and if you looked off the end of the lanai, a very small partial ocean view. The 2 bedroom occupied by our children had a very nice partial ocean view off of their lanai, so we appreciated the view from there. There is a sundries store on the main floor of the Waikikian that carries sandwiches, cut fruit, and snacks, drinks and souvenirs. If you intend to cook, I'd suggest visiting the Foodland Farms store in the Ala Moana Center, not far away. It is an amazing grocery store, and if you give your phone number to apply, you can get a card that yields a 10% discount on your purchases. Rooms at the Waikikian are equipped with washers and dryers in the rooms. Many visitors complain about the dryers in their reviews, and here I have to concur. Perhaps they are steam dryers, and my family couldn't figure them out correctly; I'm not sure why they seem to be very slow to dry even a small load. I did find that although clothing seemed moist when you removed it, within a minute or so it seemed dry. I often hung clothes for an hour or so after removing them from the dryer to make sure they were throughly dry. The resort has multiple swimming pools, plus a lagoon for swimming, paddle boarding, using aqua cycles etc. Water sport equipment can be rented by the hour. We only used the paddle board, which was $35 for an hour. Our 8 year old grandson loved that lagoon, and learned to paddle board with ease. There are many restaurants and shops in the Hilton complex. We used the ABC stores to purchase souvenirs and snacks. We also ate at Benihana, which was great, and the chefs put on a fantastic show. Tropics offers light lunches, and the staff are knowledgeable about food allergies, which is important to us, as we are gluten intolerant.  I've read many reviews that were critical of the staff for not being friendly enough. I couldn't differ more with that view. Every staff member we met was friendly, welcoming and helpful. Many went out of their way to insure we had a nice stay. As owners, we vacation with family often with Hilton Grand Vacations Club. We appreciate the good service, and pleasant, clean accommodations they offer. The Grand Waikikian is a great place to stay, and I'm sure we will return.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We went for 7 nights in October 2016. Even though we arrived late evening, there was a full staff there to relieve and garland us with their very nice nut lei. Check was fast. Our rooms were the one bedroom suites. The rooms were very clean, nicely furnished and nicely set up. The kitchen in the suite was also very nicely appointed and quite large. It had everything we needed. The view wasn't the greatest because it faced the street instead of the beach which I guess was due to lack of funds on our end. We only went to two of the many pools they had and I didn't like them very much. The entire time we were at the pools we were constantly hounded by birds, most likely due to all of the fools that feed them. The pool grounds also weren't the nicest. For the price we paid I would expect the pools to be a little nice and grounds to be a little more well kept. The lagoon was very nice, a lot cleaner/better kept grounds than the pool areas. It was very convenient having the rental place at the lagoon.I wouldn't return to Hawaii in general as it is so overpriced for what we get. I could have paid half as much and gotten nicer and more stuff. Most resirts in mexico, for half the price include better kept pool areas, more entertainment from mornimg til, and food and booze included. That being said, this was one of the nicer hotels in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed here for our second visit. Stayed on a high floor with ocean view. Check in was easy and staff was friendly. Lots of places to eat in walking distance and within the resort area. Many tours pick up here as well so you don't have to get a car. . Parking was a little expensive but if you want to go to the North Shore and other areas of the island, renting a car is the way to go. The rooms were clean and guest services was quick to address any requests.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton Hawaii Village has always been a good, comfortable and great location for Honolulu as a family. The facility consists of many activities. It's walking distance to all shopping. Numerous near by restaurants both casual and sophisticated.The property setting is beautifully designed within the ocean.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Wonderful property; great location; fantastic staff. It was just the best of everything! The view of the beach from the 27th floor of our suite was priceless. Though we didn't spend quality time on the balcony, we were able to visit other parts of the island with ease due to the location in which we lived. The eateries around the Hawaiian Village were great as well as the restaurants on property. A GRAND VACATION! By the way, a family member purchased a timeshare as well. It was simply a DREAM VACATION!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: An Epic Father & Son trip to Oahu was had , here at the Grand Wakikian, early November 2016.  Check in was smooth, there is Valet Parking... we self parked ($ 32/day). Lobby(s) are beautifull. All Staff we came in contact with were pleasant and helpful Our condo was a 2 BR, 2 Ba, unit. had a nice kitchen , dining area, & living room. The Pics on the website and by other TA users are on point. The Bathrooms are very nice. There is Laundry washer/dryer in the condo... we found to be very convenient.  Our room was # 1704, there is a ocean view... especially sunset view from the Lanai.  The only negative comment I might have, is that we had intermittent problems w/our room key-card granting us access to the Parking lot. This was a minor hassle.  Be advised this tower is one of about three towers within a Large & Confusing Maze of towers, shops, swimming pools , lagoons etc... But once you get your bearings... it has everything you need.  The Beach nearby is very nice... the water is decent for swimming , but not great for Waves...if thats what your looking for.  I can answer any questions... if you have them about this place...  I would return here if I had the chance.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the Grand Waikikian Village for a week. It's truly a little village of its own. Lots of shops, restaurants, bar and grills, etc.. There's even a couple of pools. This little village is nestled on Waikiki beach. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. Great place to visit as a couple or bring the family! Live music every night at Tropics and Tapa on the property. Atlantis sub marine tours are right in the backyard as well as Catamaran tours. It's just a short walk to downtown Waikiki shops.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel has easy access to the Hilton Rainbow Tower and Village restaurants, and shops, and the water. Parking was relatively easy and the garage was right next to the hotel. The balcony provided a nice view of the busy Ala Moana Blvd and the neighboring ancient Ilikai Hotel and a partial view of the ocean on the left. Although our room is on a lower floor we did not hear any street noises. The rooms are spacious with comfortable clean beds. A great feature is the big deep bath tub which came in handy after a long day of golfing and sightseeing. We also like the bathroom set up with separate shower stall and toilets with door allowing for privacy. The shower water was strong. The kitchen was adequately equipped although it would be nice if they had provided a larger frying pan. Overall it was a satisfying and relaxing stay.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Loved the hotel complex. Stayed in a two bedroom apartment with a wonderful view. The staff were very friendly, efficient and helpful. Check-in and check-out went very smoothly. There are so many beautiful areas in this resort and it is in a great position. Have no hesitation in recommending it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: You will pay for everything and it isn't affordable. We wanted to stay out of the sun in the lagoon area and it cost us almost 60.00 for an umbrella and two lounges. I've never had to pay to sit under an umbrella. The lagoon area closes at 5:00pm. The paradise pool closes at 7:00pm. While you can go to the superpool, it isn't heated so it was too cold for the kids to play in. You will pay close to 30.00 for three single cone ice creams. Be prepared to part with your money.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Location, Location, Location, if you want a PERFECT place to stay on Waikiki Beach this is perfect..... it is part of the Hilton Grand Vacation complex with many other timeshare, hotels etc.... we had no problem with the unit itself and no question if we wanted an Owner Update.... yehhhhhhhh! The unit was wonderful 1201.... partial ocean view..... was perfect!!! Management knew my wife was having her Birthday and both couples in our group were celebrating our anniversarys so they gave us a free bottle of wine and cookies..... the one downer was not enough towels or washcloths....and the mattress were way to soft.... both beds (king).. and while the place is wonderful, it was smaller then most of the other timeshares we have stayed in.... very busy.... I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed a great vacation week with friends at the Gran Hilton Waikiki Resort. Close to shopping, restaurants and great sunset walks. Pools or beach, your choice. Great rooms were quiet despite being in the heart of it all. We were very pleased.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. Though we enjoyed our stay (mostly due to spending much of our time outside of the hotel), I would not recommend staying here. If you plan to explore Honolulu and Oahu during your time, you can spend much less on a better quality hotel. If I were to do it all again, although may/may not loose out on the HHonors points, I would have stayed elsewhere and engaged in all of the same activities (Circle Island Tour, visit restaurants and bakeries, and visit better quality beaches elsewhere). The hotel did little to accommodate us for our honeymoon (we were given a room w/two double beds despite booking a King), and everything that we did at the hotel (food and amenities) came at a high price relative to quality.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian was very nice in the fact that everything you want or needed from a market to get eggs and bread to Benihana's restaurant on the corner was all accessible all in the village. They had plenty of activities to keep you busy if you wanted to stay on site and there we're plenty of concierge services to help if you wanted to do a little site seeing, which we took full advantage of. I had an unfortunate incident where I had to be taken to the ER and the village was nice enough to pay for our taxi both to and from the hospital, I cannot thank them enough. The village sits right on the beach so no matter where you are you have a beautiful view. There are pools, lagoons, and of course the ocean to swim in. Every kind of restaurant you can think of available. And everyone is very accommodating to you, which I'm not used to. So as soon as you get used to island time and island life, it's time to go back. Sad to leave but happy to look forward to coming back in the future!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We just got back from 2 weeks at the Hilton Grand Waikikian. We were in room 2603 a two bedroom premier. The view was superb, great view of the ocean, hilton village and part of Diamond Head. We really enjoyed the luau we could watch for free each night. The show was below our lani, about 20 floors down. Very nice view of the fireworks over the lagoon, blocked a tiny bit by the lagoon tower. Nice sunrise off the lani, but could not see the sunset.  Room was awesome, nice and clean, great size for two couples . Kitchen was a good size and also well equipment. Living space was very nice. Bedrooms are what you would expect in a high end stay.  Service was excellent, we had a problem getting our phones to access the WiFi. Called the the frontdesk, and they sent an IT guy right away. Eric was so good at solving our WiFi problem. He also took a few minutes to give us a little direction on a great place to eat. The locals do not get enough credit for being ambassadors to their state.  The village is fantastic, has everything you might need.  Highly recommend the Grand Waikikian and the Hilton village.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We love staying at Hilton Hawaiian Village, but especially the Grand Waikikian. We prefer an ocean view, but that was unavailable this time?  The Tropics restaurant has very good food and our favorite waiter there is Ramfis. The pool cocktail girls, Melissa and Stephanie aregreat. It is nice to have the Accents store downstairs for items and food which we may need during our visit.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We own many Hilton timeshare properties and this is our first time staying at the GW tower in the Hilton Hawaiian Village.Location is great, co- sharing direct access to the Lagoon Tower, convenient to the Paradise pool, man made lagoon, beach and the street for public transportation and restaurants outside of the resort.We had a 2 bedroom ocean view, full kitchen, washer/dryer in unit., balcony with partial view of Kalakaua. I'd suggest requesting the Diamond Head side for better views. We also had good views of the hotel's frequent Luau show from the balcony. What a freebee!There's also an 8th floor guest lounge to hang out. Cold guava and pineapple juice, coffee and tea available. Also available men's and women's shower, Internet service and a keiki play area. Nice place with all the amenities.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton Grand Waikiki is an elegant hotel with a friendly and helpful staff from reception to check-out. Had a two-bedroom condo arrangement with balcony, that suited us well. Extremely clean and well appointed. Variety of activities available as well as stores and shopping.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Impressive grounds, pools, beach, even the lobby. Plenty of restaurants with reasonable prices for Honolulu. As a wheelchair bound paraplegic, this was one on the best places I have stayed. Room had everything within reach. Open space in living room and even a built in ramp to the balcony. Highly reccommend.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had just been a few days on Maui at the Napili shores hotel with another couple and we're looking forward to visiting Honolulu. We were staying at the grand watching Hotel on the Hilton complex.  Right from the start, we had trouble with our reservations. I was very disappointed in my stay at the Hilton Grand Waikikian hotel in Honolulu. We where promised a wheel chair, only to find out if we want to use it more than just going to the room we would have to rent one. We couldn't get the room we were promised and the people at the Desk were very rude. We were promised a call back from a supervisor about our room but never received one. The air conditioner in the room didn't work and we found out on our five-day stay they only have maid service one time. I think the Hilton Hawiian has grown too big and lost the Hilton experience! This is not what we've grown to expect from a Hilton hotel.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you want a good ocean view unit, you need to be careful. You may spend some good money and wouldn't get what you expect. The view we had there was a big tower in front of us. We also experienced some discomforts such as room smell and shower water issues.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Cleanness of this place was at 0.Completely gross! After writing a note for housekeeping and leaving a double tip nothing was done as requested. Faces and insides of all cabinets were plain gross! Especially in bathrooms and around toilet area. Smudged mirrors. Food, garbage, and dust under the couch and cabinets. Hair and nail clippings behind couch! Dried food on pots and pans. Icky residue and buildup around faucets, drains and sinks. Had three additional cleanings during our two week stay and those things were never corrected.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed on a high floor that had a partial ocean view and the room was very nice. Walking in to the room you enter the kitchen/living room which is very spacious. The kitchen is very nice sized and they give you all the things you need, plates/utensils/cups/pots/pans/etc. They even provide the detergent for washing dishes, using the dishwasher and doing your own laundry in-room (note that the dryer is electric so it took a bit of time for it to really dry the clothes). Viewing from the kitchen is the balcony which has four chairs and being so high up, you get a nice breeze.The bedroom itself is average. We had two double beds and there was enough space for two people to walk around. The beds themselves were comfortable but seemed a bit worn. Laying in the bed over the few days, I felt like the bed sank a bit. The pillows are also very dense; they are not the fluffy light kind of pillows. There are plenty of outlets around to charge electronics and a nice touch was the USB ports in the phone. The one thing about the bedroom I did not like too much was the bathtub in the room. I didn't use it as I was concerned there would be too much humidity in the room as a result. The room itself is super quiet. I don't think I every heard any noise from any other traveler.The staff at the hotel is outstanding. Maintenance was quick to come up when issues arose and quickly fixed the issues. Valet parking was quick as well and after a while, they remember who you are. Note that self parking is available and is right behind the hotel for a savings of $7/day. The store on the first/second floor is very reasonably priced for their drinks and food; did not feel like I was being charged too much. The only thing I felt was a bit much was the resort charge of $30/day, something lower might be more reasonable. They do however give you cards to get 2 free 16.9 oz bottles of water per day as a result. Additionally, they give you a card for DVDNow which allows you to borrow movies and PS3 games for free for 24 hours.Location-wise, you are about 30 minutes from Honolulu airport and close enough to all the sights. North Shore is only about an hour or so away. Being in Hilton Village, you can get picked up for all your tours in the back or at the entrance of the other Hilton hotel (5 minute walk max). There are a lot of trinket stores around as well which is convenient. Overall, the hotel was nice and relaxing for a family since you can spread out. I wouldn't consider this hotel a "value" hotel since it is a bit pricey and has a resort charge. However, I would recommend this hotel if you can afford it and don't mind spending the extra money.
