hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The staff at the Hilton Grand Waikikian were great during the check in and through out our stay. This was a great location on the beach with shopping and dining near by. A good location for the tour bus pickups. Easy to get to with a rental car and parking close to the resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: No negatives: we have been there several times before,and have always had a good experience. The location is excellent for us as we do not use a car. There is enough to do on the grounds of the village, that, other than sight seeing, and traveling to distant locations, an auto is not necessary.
user_name:
Barbara T
northridge, ca, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: the resort was very good the rooms were spotless all the things you would want at a resort nice beach,pool nice bar and restaurants the fire works on friday night are very good it is only a 10 min walk to the town

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is awesome. We had a 2 bedroom with 2 terraces overlooking the ocean and the city. We were able to see the nightly Luai from our terrace. Everything is within walking distance. Beach just behind the hotel. I highly recommend staying at this resort. Had a great time.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location, plenty of amenities, nice accommodations, and friendly staff. I would recommend this hotel if your planning a trip to Waikiki any time soon. You cannot go wrong if you choose this hotel

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Checked in yesterday after we got lost although with GPS guidance. So this Hilton grand was enclosed within the Hilton Hawaiian Village. According to the reception, you need to drive pass the 1st main hotel lobby, pass 3 stop signs, a wooden bridge, left turn to a ramp to the 2nd main lobby and that's this hotel is.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Place is large and beautiful with all the bells and whistles in an ideal location. The lagoon and Paradise Pool are perfect for a family with young kids. It's one of few true "resorts" in Waikiki. You pay for it though through added resort fees. They overly stressed towel and towel card returns - return your towel cards after you return your pool/beach towels or you get charged a fee. (They are basic white towels.) As an HH member, there was no water or newspaper provided.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed in a very nice 1 bed with partial ocean view (which in our case meant we could see the sea on the left once out on the balcony, which was fine for us). Arrived early and had to wait for our room but their early arrival / departure lounge was a comfortable place to wait, As part of our deal we got 2 bottles of water a day which we had vouchers for. The vouchers were dated 2015 and stated that we had to collect the water from the concierge in the Kalia tower which seemed strange. We went over there and waited for 20 minutes to see a concierge and eventually gave up as it looked that the person being dealt with was there for the duration. We went back to our reception and pointed our that this arrangement was a bit ridiculous. We were then told that we could collect the water from any concierge - pity that they did not tell us that when they gave them to us. They promote a free orientation walking tour of Waikiki which happens every weekday - after half an hour of the tour and having visited 4 of the shops on the complex we dipped out of the rest. Do not know if it did anything other than extol the virtues of the local businesses after we left but I have my doubts. There are several reasonable restaurants on the Hilton site and in the local area (if you like Indian food there is a good restaurant across the road on Ala Moana Blvd). Staff were always polite but did not always seem engaged - hard to put my finger on it, but something was missing. However, nice room and access to a lot of facilities on the resort (in our case though definitely not worth the $30 per day resort charge).

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: 2 bedroom, 2 bath, full kitchen, washer and dryer, everything you could need. Great location. Friendly helpful staff. Clean room. Can't say enough about this resort!! Right in the heart of Waikiki. Walking distance to great restaurants and shopping.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: What you would expect from a Hilton - or any other resort for that matter. Over-priced food, drinks, and (very) expensive shopping. We aren't really resort-people, so for us this was a bit ordinary. You are very close to Waikiki beach which is a plus. Rooms are ok and appear to be updated. Still some funky smells, though. Wifi is not good and continues to drop. If you enjoy resort-life, you will like this, otherwise consider an Airbnb somewhere on the island.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: First, let me say, I love me HGVC membership. Without it I wouldn't be able to visit some of the places I've been and enjoy a vacation every year. That being said, to say I'm a planner would be an understatement. I plan ahead - way ahead. Therefore I made my reservation at the Grand Waikikian 9 months in advance of our trip. My wife and I and another couple were celebrating our 45th wedding anniversarys so we decided to go to Hawaii. This would be my second stay at the Grand Waikikian. The first time was just my wife and me and we stayed in a one bedroom on the 17th floor. It was a huge room overlooking the city and the mountains. Because of the occasion and the number of points, our friends decided to split the points with us for a two bedroom premier accommodation. We anticipated an ocean view which we did get. But the rest of the story isn't so grand. A month before our reservation I began contacting the resort requesting a certain room layout. I didn't want to have a king and two full size beds for two married couples. So I contacted the resort managers and forwarded them a picture of the accommodations I was interested in for our stay. This picture came from the HGVC website as one of the floor plans for the different types of accommodations. It turned out we got a shotgun layout that was pretty small by comparison to the one bedroom my wife and I had previously. It was "okay" but not anything like what we requested. Not even for making a reservation so far in advance. In fact, we felt rather cramped. I don't remember this from our previous stay, but there is very little storage space in this two bedroom layout. It was not sufficient for two adults with full suitcases to put everything away and out of your suitcase. The living area was small and only had a couch and one chair. There are caveats. And maybe that is why we didn't get the accommodations we requested. We were only staying for 4 nights and then moving to the Big Island for a week to stay at Kings' Land. But my friend whom we shared a room with is HGVC Elite. The reservation was in his name, but that didn't help. The area itself is incredible. In other words, Hilton Hawaiian Village is a fantastic place. But I was disappointed with our accommodations, especially since we had planned this so far in advance. One tip for the uninitiated traveler to the Hawaiian Islands. If you think you are going to go on a shoestring budget, forget it. Hawaii is very expensive. Even with accommodations provided by your HGVC membership, food is VERY expensive. One suggestion would be to have breakfast or/and supper at the Wailana Coffee House. Great place for breakfast right across the street from Hilton Hawaiian Village and very reasonable prices for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. We enjoyed our stay in Hawaii, but our first stop on Oahu, and the accommodations we had at the Grand Waikikian wasn't as enjoyable.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and I elected to take a mental health break and stay in a hotel on Waikiki in spite of the fact that we live less than 20 miles away. We are faithful Hilton customers and elected to try one of the brand's Grand Vacations properties with great expectations. I'm sorry to say that they missed the mark. When we checked in the young lady at the reception desk was very polite yet lacked something. Her command of the English language was less than satisfactory - we had difficulty understanding her. It appears that this property caters to a clientele from the far east and that English was a second language for her. We were told our room wasn't ready but we would receive a text message when it was. After waiting 2.5 hours we checked back with the reception desk - the desk agent seemed surprised that we hadn't already been notified; she then told us it had just come available. To say we were disappointed in the room is a gross understatement. We elected to stay in a studio unit; little did we know that meant a room situated behind an elevator shaft with barely enough room to walk on either side of the bed or that the tub wasn't big enough for me to even sit in (I am 6 feet tall - my back was against one end and I couldn't fully extend my legs). We wanted to view the Friday evening fireworks so we asked where best to see them; it was obvious that my wife has limited mobility and unable to stand - the desk clerk told us the only place to sit and see the show was the beach- my wife can't even walk on a beach let alone sit-down and expect to get back up. The fact that the pool deck offered both seating and a view was never mentioned. The property is beautiful, the weather spectacular, the sea view breath taking; however, it is difficult to overlook the shortcomings.
user_name:
Susan N Bill S
Honolulu, Hawaii

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you're looking for a condo with resort facilities, a great pool and easy access to Waikiki restaurants and Ala Moana - stay here! One bedroom, partial ocean view for a family of 2 adults and 2 kids (10 & 13) was ample - adults slept on a very comfy sofa bed - as good as a real bed and queen size. If the budget allowed, a full ocean view would have been wonderful!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Nice room. Poor staff and amenities, The hotel is located very near the beach with access to several pools. Get to the pool early if you want a chair. Shopping is close. The stores are mostly High End.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Had a great time staying at this resort -- the stores, restaurants, and activities were great. Easy access to all parts of the resort -- Beaches were wonderful and kept very clean. - Rooms were spacious and in good condition
user_name:
William S. C
San Diego, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This makes for my third visit to the property. The Hilton property has a big footprint in Waikiki. Try to get a room with a full ocean view. Nothing better than enjoying your morning coffee while watching the waves crash.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a weeks family holiday at the Grand Waikikian Vacation Club, staying in a two bedroom apartment. The apartment was large, well appointed and spotlessly clean. The same could be said for the public areas. It was very comfortable, good, free wi-fi and located at the beginning of Waikiki Beach and a150 metre walk to the beach; no roads to cross. There is a central resort village, various food outlets and boutique stores. The property is situated on a 5-6 hectare beachside property. Staff were friendly, helpful and efficient.So why have I given the resort an average rating? I had not appreciated that there were 7 Hilton properties on the site, towers with over 3,000 rooms and an eighth tower is in construction, pushing the room count above 4,000 according to a very proud staff member. They did not appreciate that the sheer volume of people during this week in September was overwhelming. Everything was crowded and this detracted significantly from the general amenity of the resort. Also, resort pools were both relatively small and too few in number for the population. A large artificial lagoon also provided swimming opportunities and then it was a short walk to the beach. Waikiki beach 'proper', the middle of the beach is a fifteen minute or so walk. There you will find the big name boutiques and many restaurants.There are few off resort restaurants proximate to the Grand Waikian.Should you walk in the other direction for about 20 minutes it will take you to the Ala Moana Mall - enormous for those who enjoy such places. As you might gather, I am not one of those people but my wife assured me it was terrific and not, as I asserted, a level of purgatory.There are frequent buses running outside of the hotel, two dollars a ride, exact fare only, no change. Most of the booked tours pick guests up from the same place and the concierge team is incredibly helpful in assisting in finding and booking tours and activities during your stay.This is a mixed review, we enjoyed our holiday, appreciated the apartment, service and public areas but were overwhelmed by the crowds. If I were to retturn to Honolulu I would stay mid beach in a smaller hotel.In fact if I return to Hawaii, I will stay on one of the less populated, more scenic islands.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very disappointed - there was absolutely no view of the ocean from my "Partial Ocean View" room, just the ugly blue building across the street. Manager was kind enough to explain that when the building was initially constructed, there was a partial ocean view -- not the case when I had already prepaid for my room. Thankfully, I only booked a one-night stay so my daughter could try out the water slides. Compared with Aulani, Grand Hyatt Kauai and Grand Wailean, don't waste your precious vacation time at this overcrowded resort. Both Paradise Pool and Lagoon Pool were both dirty and overcrowded. Avoiding Hilton for misrepresentation -- feel like I was robbed.
user_name:
nycmom2019
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a lovely time at the Hilton Grand Waikikian. Our evenings on the beach were magical. Our nighttime swim in the shallow, gentle Waikiki surf by the hotel is one of my favorite memories. The catamaran sunset cruise was romantic and so much fun. One evening at a bar there by the beach, the band was playing John Lennon's "Imagine" while a lovely young lady in costume danced Hula under a light on the beach just outside where the band was playing. The scene was captivating. Hilton is great at creating magical, organic experiences like this. We had a wonderful time.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a great place for a family vacation. Great staff and comfortable rooms. We were able to enjoy the beach and pool. In our suite we had a washing machine and dryer. That was very helpful. There was plenty of room for the family.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great accommodations, beautiful beaches, great views, lots of shopping. Convenient location. Local transportation was easy and very affordable. The entertainment was amazing and you didn't even have to leave the resort

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent our 36th wedding anniversary at the Grand Waikikian at the Hilton Resort in Oahu. We enjoyed a spacious one bedroom with a living room and full kitchen. The staff was helpful and enhance our stay with reservations and followup. The grounds were beautiful. Prices at the resort's stores and restaurants were comparable to the surrounding area, the quality was excellent. One of the concierges put the exclamation point on our stay here at the Hilton Resort.We also enjoyed the Hilton Luau on the grounds at the resort. I was initially not very excited about attending. Before we went I thought it looked expensive for a buffet dinner show. I was very surprised, it was great entertainment for the value. The food was served buffet style, the food was varied with a local flare and plentiful. The Luau performers were outstanding. I would recommend attending this as part of any Hawaiian Vacation.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: What a great experience staying here. We will only stay at the GW when we come back. Check-in was very fast, answering all questions. Our view from our multiple patios was breath-taking. We loved the full kitchen and the design of the unit.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Grand Waikikian offers great lodging in a great location with beautiful surroundings. The staff is friendly. You can walk to interesting places. The beach is wonderful. The pools are luxurious. It is romantic.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed everything about the Grand Waikikian... from Elite Check in to check out. The parking was close and easy. The room was clean and Housekeeping was great. The pool was nice and loved by the children. It would have been greater if we could have stayed longer. Looking forward to next time.
user_name:
Richardeen Rei K
Honolulu, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Had one problem after another. Being an Elite Timeshare owner meant nothing. From the moment we entered the room to leaving, we encountered numerous issues. Problems with housekeeping, pool lifeguard, resort managers not seeming to sincerely feel our disappointment (at the end of the day, they still have a job so who cares kind of feeling I got), excuses from housekeeping, and cleanliness of freezer/fridge.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed in the penthouse on the 38th floor. It had excellent views of the coastline, into the city. The penthouse was a double suite, that is larger than most apartments! We had our own private clubhouse, which was excellent. The Grand Waikikian is a part of a larger block of Hilton properties. I recommend going behind the resort to the other Hilton properties. There, they have several shops, eateries and lagoons.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Rooms were very clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were clean and modern. We spent a lot of time in the balcony just watching Waikiki before we start our day and as we wind down our busy day. The lobby is amazing! All the staff were friendly and very helpful. The beach, restaurants, and shops are just a few minutes away making the Waikikian an ideal spot!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was a beautiful facility. From the time we walked in until we left we were provided with A+ service. The room was beautiful with a wonderful view. All of the staff was pleasant. The stores and restaurants are nice and affordable. I highly recommend this place.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Truely enjoyed the experience. The hotel staff were very helpful especially the housekeeping staff. The pools were fun and the lagoon had a great choice of activities. We enjoyed walking along the beach each night. The fireworks on Friday were a treat.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed in the 2 bedroom condo.. Great view! Thick dust on top of ceiling fan . Worn scraped areas on walls above chairs in kitchen area. Thick poop from pigeons that land on balconies. Cracks and bubbling on molding. Bathroom and kitchen. Most service staff friendly. Front desk horrible no "welcome on checking no "how was your stay " at check out. Have never experienced such dismissive service in all my years of travel! I'm a very friendly person and always greet whomever I speak with very warmly .
user_name:
Mika H
castro valley, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel really deserves the five star rating. We stayed for a week in a 1 bedroom suite and had a very pleasant experience. We enjoyed all the swimming pools (there were 4 of them) and the in-room amenities. We also appreciate the high quality of customer service that every staff extended to us. The room where we stayed was very well cleaned and maintained and had plenty of space for 3 persons.One of the best amenity is having a washing machine in the room. This allowed us to wash and dry our clothes at the end of the day conveniently. Our room also came with it's own kitchen area as well as a dining table. The overall feeling was really like a home away from home experience.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We really appreciate the friendly, hardworking staff. Everything was taken care of. The kids really enjoy the pool and the lagoon. We feel we didn't have to hesitate if we needed something because we felt they wanted to take care of us.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Nice property but is getting too large. Crowds are getting worse. Charges for lagoon chairs, umbrellas and parking are too high! Also we were charged an additional 18% on our bill at the Tapas grille for what we were told is a large party fee. Four adults and two very quiet children. This was written no where to let people know in advance. Hotel customer service was excellent.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very nice hotel, are room has a great view, we have a 2 bedroom suite with kitchen and pull out sofa, 2 bath, we are here celebrating our 5th year anniversary and my sister in laws birthday...everyone is very pleasant they say hello when you pass them, hotel is huge and beautiful if you stay up to 4 days there is no maid service but you can always get clean towels and sheets...which was fine with us...they do fireworks every Friday at the hotel, and hopefully we get to see a luau today...there calling for tornado or hurricane around 2pm...there are many restaurants around the hotel everything in walking distance food is everywhere...

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this resort! It's great to have everything within walking distance. We enjoyed the lagoon and the pools. There was a great variety of shops and restaurants on the resort. They also give you coupon books for them.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Loved the location of the Grand Waikikian. Being part of the village allowed us access to the other hotels and the lagoon as well as their restaurants and shops. Walking distance to Ala Moana shopping center and Kalakaua strip.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We thought the resort was amazing. However we were disappointed in the ability to lounge by a pool. Too many people and not enough lounge chairs. Also, I would recommend one pool being an adult pool. I have children but they are older. I like to relax without little children crying. I was disappointed that the resort didn't provide lounge chairs on the beach.
user_name:
Pamela A S
Enola, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at Grand Waikikian in a 2-bedroom premier suite, using our Hilton Grand Vacations membership points. It was a beautiful suite with plenty of room for myself and my husband, as well as my sister and her kids. The kids (teenage boys) liked the Play Station in the living room, and it's nice that you can check out games and movies for free in the lobby. There is a big kitchen, and lots of space for people to eat (table with bench and chairs, breakfast bar chairs, and also a table and 4 chairs on the patio). We walked to the Food Pantry supermarket on Hobron Lane to stock up the kitchen with food, and also get nice fresh flower leis. For additional shopping, the Ala Moana Center was a very nice mall within walking distance. We rented a car for the day from the Alamo across the street. There easy access to everything you need from Grand Waikikian. We enjoyed the restaurants at the resort, including Benihana, Fresco, Dairy Queen, Rainbow Lanai, Tropics, and Blue Water Shrimp. The Paradise Pool was a lot of fun, and relaxing on the beach and swimming in the ocean was very relaxing. I recommend water shoes when swimming in the ocean, since there are many rocks.This was our second stay at Grand Waikikian, and we love it. It's great for a romantic getaway or family vacation. The suites are very comfortable and nicely decorated.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton Hawaiian village is amazing and fun place to stay. So much to do and the beach is wonderful. Only unfortunate thing is Hilton has built so many towers, making it mostly impossible to have a god view of ocean or Diamond Head.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great resort, beautiful beach, walking proximity to Ala Moana Mall or $12 cab ride, lots of restaurants on property and nearby. Walking distance to downtown. Lots of activities available to arrange. Friendly staff, always make eye contact and say Aloha.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It was a zoo at the swimming pool. Our kids were looking forward to the pool and the slides the resort so proudly advertised. They were so disappointed at how crowded the pool was and how rowdy the kids were. I mean some older kids were jumping off of the bridge doing backflips and many kids were jumping off from the hot tub into the kiddie pool where babies and little kids were playing....and no one was there to control them! It was pretty dangerous. And one day, they just closed the pool altogether! Thank goodness Hawaii has many good beaches around. I understand they are yet building another building on this premise. It's going to be a zoo!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Not good! Beautiful area but salesmen are extremely misleading and each one tells a slightly different sales pitch. For these high prices go somewhere else. You do not get your moneys worth. Reception desk people do not work together. One person says one thing but another person says something else.
user_name:
Gordon Loy C
L.A., United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a fantastic time in Waikiki. The location is terrific and local transportation is easy to use. This was our family's top vacation. We used the trolley which gave us access to many local attractions and shopping.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Impeccable accommodations, services and great location! Take advantage of the entire resort. Be aware there are fees if you wish to use water sports equipment, beach lounge chairs and umbrellas at Lagoon Beach.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Awesome vacation in Waikiki!!! Friendly courteous staff and so much to do on the property with awesome shops in walking distance. This was our first trip of many I hope. The welcome we received was absolutely amazing!! Thank you Hawaii❤️❤️❤️

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A great family friendly place to stay on O'ahu. Excellent ammenities and retail options on site. You have the choice of multiple pools, lagoon, or the ocean. Staff are always friendly and accomodating.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The facility is OK if you are just a paying guest. If you are a Hilton Grand Vacation club member they just keep pushing to buy more. It's like being around used car sales people. Do yourself a favor and just pay to stay, maybe they'll leave you alone to enjoy your vacation.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We staied 5days in Hilton Grand Wikikian. HGV was very wide room and clean and good scene . The room's scene was very beautiful. Blue sky, blue sea ,white cloud ,comfortable wind ...All is lovey. We felt that we are the paradais .

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Everything is good.Thanks to carefully and quickly responded when daughter lost her shoes in the lawn, found safe and sound. I appreciate it.At this time was the fifth, but was in all aspects. I want to stay again next time. Thank you very much.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village - Grand Waikikian was a great value - with helpful, friend staff and outstanding facilities. Enjoy the lagoon and beach! They made our anniversary stay very special and went out of their way to give great service.
user_name:
Rodney D
Moon Township, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a great ocean view one BR unit. Kudos for accommodating our ridiculously early arrival - flight landed at 6am! We had a delicious breakfast and spent our wait time relaxing on the beach. Unit was ready early and then back to the beach. Decor is Polynesian with lots of wide open verandas on main level. I didn't find unit dated just decorated in Polynesian fashion versus slick modern. Concierges were very helpful. Fully equipped kitchen should satisfy anyone's vacation needs. Elevator service good, stores and restaurants all over the village should meet needs well. Great beaches with view of diamond head. Overall staff helpful and pleasant. A couple need attitude adjustment. What I found annoying - $60 a day for two chairs and one umbrella. We had some outings planned that brought us back to resort around 3pm - still wanted $60 for a couple hours rental as they pick up at 5pm - ridiculous!!! Oh the AC was a little tricky to regulate, but we got the hang of it. It can be really cold.
user_name:
Barbara H
Wake Forest, North Carolina

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Overall great hotel! Near beach, good restaurants, nice pools, nice stores and shops onsite and nearby. Close grocery shopping. Friendly and helpful staff. Luau cuisine and show were outstanding but the rooftop Vince was horrible.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A great facility in a great location. Close to everything on or near Waikiki Beach. We were able to use all of Hilton's facilities on the property. Service from everyone there was excellent. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Love this place! So convenient! We have been coming here since our kids were toddlers. Still coming here, 20 years later. It may be a little busy in the Village, but the location and proximity to the nearby beaches, shopping, restaurants, best shave ice stops, and even the North Shore make this a no brainer.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Beware --- the resort fee includes nothing. Hilton should be embarrassed to take from their guests. $62 per day for two beach chairs and umbrella. Bring your own beach toys. Charge $15 to rent a floatations tube that you can purchase at ABC Store on property for $2.99. I'm for capatalism but this is a bit much.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Wonderful property; however, after traveling basically all day to get there, we were looking forward to taking a break. Check-in went smooth and it was time to relax. One thing I noticed was that I had to sign a disclosure that we would not smoke in the room. Since it was a non-smoking property, I ask the question, "Am I getting a smoking room?". They replied that all rooms are non-smoking so you are fine. When we got to the room, it was evident that the last person in the room smoked in it. My daughter and I are sensitive to smoke and didn't feel that we should stay in the room for our entire trip. Therefore, we went back to the lobby and requested a different room. The clerk introduced us to the "Resort Manager" to go over our options. He noted that the entire resort was filled to capacity. This place is huge and to think not a single room wasn't available is hard to believe. I asked for his manager and he said they are all gone for the day. The "Resort Manager" was more like used car salesman. Really didn't care about my situation. We ended up staying in the room for one night, packed up and requested a new room. The following day we were given a new reservation in a similar smoking room sprayed with some sort of air freshener. Bottom line it was a joke. Being a HGV owner and a Hilton Diamond traveler, I would suspect MUCH better service. Honestly, I won't go back there. SO, check your room before you commit. It can make a difference for your stay.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great experience for her first visit but a very crowded island. If you're looking for cosmopolitan shopping and commercialized tours it's a great place to go. If you're looking for relaxation my next trip will be to Maui

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Large comfortable, well appointed rooms, friendly staff, attractive lobby, convenient access to parking garage, many great places to eat within walking distance. Resort has lots of convenient shopping and eating places. Attractive environment though not sure if it will continue to be so as Hilton continues to add rooms on the property.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton is the absolute brand that I trust and travel with.....Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations is such a hotel..yes, the base for the Grand Vacation Club, aka timeshare ...nice place to stay....no amenities of a resort. No areas that are not overrun by kids. We just chose the wrong spot. Room was beautiful. Hotel Manager Joe Reagan is a real pro. Be prepared to plan your stay and budget for all meals, drinks and attractions. We drove the island and that was well worth our time away from Chicagoland and the hotel.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton 1B/1B room have very comfortable area and cleanliness accomodations for family( with 1-2 children). Pool area, equipment are very satisfact for children and our parents. Also good location for Shopping at AlaMoana.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Overall good. The resort suits my family's purposes - shopping and pool/beach play for my 1-year-old daughter. Location near Ala Moana Center and multiple pools + lagoon + beach were the best. Food review not so good, so we didn't dine in the resort. That was not a trouble because good restaurants are nearby.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We loved our visit in every way--great hospitality, lots of restaurant choices in Hilton Hawaiian Village, and amenities. One of the bonuses we loved was being able to rent free movies to use in the DVD player in the room. Rooms are well-furnished, very clean and well-maintained, and the beach location with the lagoon is amazing.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is a part of a group of Hilton Grand Vacation buildings. We found the 2 bedroom/2 bathroom unit very comfortable. Having a full kitchen and washer and dryer made our stay much more enjoyable. The hotel is in a great location. Close to many restaurants and activities.
user_name:
Robert M
St. Louis, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I distinctly told the check in staff to allow us to have a nice room with a view.He gave us a small handicapped room, where everything is low, for 2 tall people, without any view. Very disappointing.Compared to the Lagoon tower, this onePales in size and view.I just came in from the Hyatt in Maui. This hotel does not even come close. Time for an upgrade. It's an old hotel, and you know it when you walk in. The service staff is also very unfriendly, when you call for help.
user_name:
Daisy P
san ramon, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Good pool. Really large facility and had nearby shopping and dining. Wasn't a big fan of Honolulu but that wasn't fault of hotel. Had to use taxi or uber to get anywhere which gets costly. No hotel shuttle. Rooms were nice, clean and modern. Could tell they've done work to keep it up to HGVC standards.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay this was our third trip and our accomadations have always been 5 star. The staff was very nice. We meet a lot of people everyone seemed to be having a great time . The views were breathtaking !!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Expensive but well worth it! Had some issues trying to book on line, showed availability but when hit the book button it moved us to another night we were not available then had issue getting it switches back, tried to move us to different property.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Lots of activities for children of all ages available here, young & old alike. Enjoyed fireworks display. Hotel in good location, walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center, restaurants, wonderful Waikiki Beach, beach activities i.e. surfing, canoeing, etc. 2-bedroom, 2-bath suite excellent for mom, dad and 4 young adult children. Kitchen well equipped. Washer/dryer very handy.
user_name:
Ernest Gere C
Honolulu, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our first visit to Hawaii, loved the hotel location beautiful view , for water activities go off the hotel property. Make sure you are aware of cancellation policy, manager was not helpful at all.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I and my wife enjoyed staying in this facility. Next time we will select our room or Big island. Acording to staff's advice we went to the tour of Pearl Harbor and art of museum, recomendations were perfect. Swiming pool's quality was very good.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent 10 days between Oahu and Hawaii island and did our best to see as much as we could. Well the resort was hard to leave because it was so nicely done and there was a ton of things to do there. Paddle boarding, lagoon, shopping, pools, and more!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: stayed at (2) two bedroom suites in grand waikikian vacation club and and wow, the place was superb. excellent service by the staff, very polite and courteous, the room layout was excellent, and we got the partial view of the ocean as well. i liked the living room set up, and the kitchen, the master bedroom was huge, and each room has it's own flat screen tv. very good location, there are restaurants everywhere, close to the mall, and local transportation are everywhere.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: nice hotel full of services suitable for families more than couples crowded pools expensive umberellas and chairs poor quality at pool side ,staff expect you to help them? mostly old towels. overlapping buildings,the best is the older LAGOON TOWER

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This village is amazing. It has spa's, restaurants, bars, cafes, takeaway, Starbucks x3 all in one site. The 5 pools are awesome, equipped with water slides. The man made lagoon is great for all water sports. Plus the beautiful beach is also right there. It has the best of everything. The apartment style means u can relax and even cook or have take out meals in your room at the dining table very comfortably. The fireworks on Friday nights is a highlight. This place really does have it all.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed a week at the Grand Waikikian and the resort is showing it's age. At best its a 3 star facility. We were there last in 2011 and was great but it has went down hill. The room was in need of paint and repairs, bathroom was dingy The shower leaked into the hall. It had been this way for sometime as the baseboard was rotten. When you call for the front desk or service you end up on hold for 5 minutes. I had to call twice to get towels delivered. I asked concierge where we could find live music and no one we spoke to had it right. There are too busy selling time shares than rather service guests and building more towers. It was disappointing as it could be very nice. Definitely not a first class facility once you get past the lobby to your room.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The vent in the kitchen needed new charcoal as messaged on the microwave board. This caused the room to have a lingering smell way past the cooking and the smoke alarm to go off. Also, on the mid week cleaning, the kitchen was not cleaned. The stove top was left dirty with all the hardened drippings I had during cooking.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed for the first time at the timeshare and it was better than anticipated. Great rooms, great staff and wonderful location. We will definitely be back -- great location within Hilton Hawaiian Village; and very close to everything down in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is right on the beach, it has lots of amenities and since it is part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village Property you also have lots of shopping and great restaurants to choose from. The lagoon is a great place to swim and paddle board especially if you want to avoid the crowded pool area. We always stay here when we are in town.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Upon arrival we instantly felt the 'Aloha' of the Grand Waikikian. The hotel is beautifully appointed with Hawaiian artifacts and the staff from check-in to bellman, to valet to concierge were friendly, helpful and accommodating. Our 2 bedroom suite was well appointed and had a full kitchen. The suite could sleep 8 people! Waikiki beach is steps from the hotel! How cool is that. The hotel is located at the beginning of Waikiki so it is not as congested as other properties. This is our 2nd stay in 2 years and we plan on coming back to the Waikikian next year!
user_name:
Lindy Minei P
Waikiki, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Outstanding experience and great value. We really enjoyed the property. Property right on the beach. Plenty of shopping and restaurant options onsite too. Staff very friendly. Close to all local areas of interest too!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: At home atmosphere was very good.　But pool was crowd.DVDmachine didn't work. Food was too expennsive. Convenience store was very bad. Japanese conveniense stores are very very good. Please change the store.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: 5 Star! My family and I enjoyed this vacation. The weather was excellent as well as the hotel and the location of the hotel. I would encourage anyone who would like to give their family and/or love ones an experience of a life time, consider The Hilton Grand Waikiki
user_name:
Michael P. L
Frisco, Texas, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a great hotel right on the beach, lots of amenities and activities to choose from, lots of shopping close by and good restaurants in addition to being close to everything in the downtown area. The island is beautiful!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location. Lagoon was the best part if you didn't want to swim at the overcrowded pools. Make sure to stock up on groceries or pay through the nose for restaurants. Very family oriented area so rowdy partiers are non existent but kids everywhere you go.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is an excellent place to stay. Reception area was outside like most places in Hawaii. It's a top notch place. I didn't use any of the pools or other facilities because I was busy being a tourist. I just have two things to note. They only come clean your room once a week during your stay. They also don't keep enough toilet paper in the room. We had to call twice for toilet paper. We also had an issue with a leaking sink but that was taken care of quickly.I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our suite was well-appointed, handsome, and had a nice balcony with terrific sea views. Quietest room we have ever stayed in! Beautiful public areas and grounds. The Departure Lounge on the 8th floor was a real plus! Access to of the attractions, pools, beach, and shops of Hilton Hawaiian Village made for an excellent family vacation.
user_name:
Theodore H
Wilton Manors, FL, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I really like this hotel is as fantastic as Linda water was great and overall at some of the staff you can ask for a better vacation of this hotel this is a dream vacation for anyone to come at this hotel thank you Hilton grand

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed in the two bedroom suite with the city view and the suite were very spacious for four adults. Six would fit very comfortably too. The suite was extremely clean and we had no complaints about anything! Excellent location and was within a mile from fantastic restaurants as well as great restaurants on the property Overall very convenient and beautiful!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights under our timeshare program with Hilton. The village is all inclusive thus perfect for bringing little ones. We enjoyed the tour of the entire facility provided by Hilton. The unit was gorgeous with a brand new feeling. The art work throughout the hotel is stunning even the elevator walls! We plan to go back next year hopefully with our children and grandchildren. A review of this hotel would not be complete without mentioning the great, efficient staff. We loved having a relationship with the bell captain crew and the concierge. Restaurants, bakeries, boutiques are right downstairs from the hotel. We can't wait to get back.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great vacation spot close to the beach and with great pools, which are very good for the kids and appear clean. Staff very friendly but check in and check out times are not very friendly (10 am and 4 pm).

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our stay at The Grand Waikikian was very enjoyable. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Two bedroom apartments are very spacious and clean. The facilities at the resort were excellent, and the gardens are maintained well.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Good standard luxury facility for vacation. No BBQ area, and faulty exhaust fan in kitchen. You cannot cook any special meals in the unit or risk ruin your entire vacation with odor that cannot be rid off. No chance of enjoying your new recipe on the freshest catch of the day with your favorite wines and share with your family members.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed out stay at the Hilton Grand Village. The staff was very accommodating and helpful at check-in. The facility was very clean and welcoming. Good location from the airport and walking distance to some dining options.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We used the first time to commemorate the tenth wedding anniversary. I had a little anxious before going but concierge saved us politely by the Japanese guidance. Since we were able to use the owner lounge after check-out we felt cozy and comfortable.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Loved our stay here. Beautiful hotel and grounds. Especially liked the Hawaiian village, the lagoon and easy access to the beach. Staff was very helpful and kind. We booked activities via the concierge before we came and they had everything in order. Easy access for transportation to activities too. Definitely recommend it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: First impressions were fabulous. Clean property, welcoming staff, flowers, and big smiles. Awww, we are here. The room was decorated with taste, all the amenities that we needed where there. It just felt comfortable. Short walk to beach, pools, village with eating and shops. Ala Moana mall was a 15 min walk. No chance of boredom here, it is literally entertainment over load. Great central location to access the sights. Hilton got this one right.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are timeshare owners and come every other year. We love it. My daughter's favorite thing this year was paddle boarding in the lagoon. My son loved the in-room PlayStation with the lending library of games. My two top tips are to bring your own laundry detergent and dryer sheets (cheaper and your clothes smell familiar). Also, eat at the Wailana Coffee House across the street. Good food and good prices.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Arrival was easy, hotel/time share was clean, staff was friendly and attentive, parking was easy once you got used to it, checkout was a breeze with the express checkout process. We had a wonderful time and the facilities were clean, well kept and met all expecations
user_name:
Glenn J. C
Pennsburg, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I love staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. From the comfortable, clean room to the amenities on site, its a great place to stay. I am an owner, so I know my experience is different because I'm not paying the per night rate, but the experience is exactly what I was looking for during my stay in the Hawaiian Islands. The staff is friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel before and it is in a great location. The hotel room was a one bedroom and was very nice albeit it a bit dated. But you just can't beat the location. The fitness center on the grounds is really pretty good but it was packed when I was there. With the continued additions of new towers perhaps it can be enlarged.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Wonderful HGVC Owners Hilton! We have always in the past stayed in the Rainbow Tower and the Grand Waikikian was so much better and more. Everything within a short walking distance. We had a two-bedroom unit with another couple and it was more than big enough for four adults. The only complaint we had was that the washer and dryer took forever start to finish doing a load of clothes. We have never had that problem at any of the other HVC owner facilities. We even had maintenance come up and said that there was nothing wrong with washer and dryer, but it took 2 hours at least to dry small to medium size loads. That is way too long. Otherwise, all the staff were wonderful and helpful anytime we needed anything. Would highly recommend this wonderful place. Make sure to be down on the beach for the fireworks on Friday evening. Great display! Also, the Arizona Memorial. Even after going there 6 times in the past, it is just as memorable and heart breaking as ever.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had heard how crowded the Hilton Village was, but we found it very nice and easy to get around in. Crowds were not bad and the beach was very open. The Grand Waikikian, while having a little age on her, is a beautiful building, close to bus stops and yet fairly quiet. Overall a wonderful weeks stay on Oahu.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: How do you expect me to get any sleep when they are riping floors apart there was a lot off noise every day from 10am until 3pm thanks for ruining my vacation next let me know to bring my earplugs and Advil also when I arrived at the hotel with my rental car I was asked if I were going to use valet parking or self I told the valet person I would use self parking so he told I had 5 minutes to move the car I had to drive around until my wife called me to say we were checked in so I could unload my luggage this is not real nice considering Iam a owner
user_name:
Aaron M
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: $6 to put air in my daughters floaty ring we purchased. That is just the beginning. Crowded and dirty. Not treated special or like we mattered. The Las Vegas hotel of Hawaii. No umbrellas at the pool. You even have to pay for a lounge chair and umbrella at the beach.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I have stayed at Kingsland, Orlando, Vegas, and Hilton Head. This was my least favorite of them all. It took forever to check in, the ceiling fan worked intermittently with a mind of its own. Bedroom was hot due to poor airflow, loud road noise, no grilling area, and it felt like a regular hotel with charges for everything ($60 a day for two chairs and umbrella on the beach).I expected more based on previous stays at different locations. I guess with nearly 100% occupancy, the lack of needing to compete for customers shows.I really wish I could post a video of this fan turning on and off on its own. I won't be back here.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have one day remaining of our week's stay here, and the housekeeping aspect of this property is not up to the standards we've become accustomed to at other HGVCs where we've stayed. We found fruit pieces under the sofa and tiny ants several places in our 14th floor unit. We discussed this with Resort Managers Akiko and Steve on separate occasions, and both were cordial and concerned about our experiences. Hopefully Steve will be able to incent housekeeping to improve their services because this is a beautiful venue in a wonderful location.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Waikikian in a 2 bedroom unit on the 25th floor with a near ocean view. The room was amazing and all the amenities that goes along with our visit. The resort layout is fantastic in which there isn't a reason to leave the resort unless you want to explore the natural beauty of Oahu. I need to disclose that we were part of an invitation to experience their timeshare marketing plan. If not for that the cost would have been around 600-1K a night from what we were told.
user_name:
Grace D
Hoffman Estates, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The entire hotel staff was very cordial, helpful and engaging. Whenever we had a question, someone was always ready to provide all information required. The family was able to enjoy the lagoon area activities as well as the surfing and parasailing activities.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Location is good, not great. Expect long walks to the main beach and shops/restaurants of Waikiki. The complex is clean. However, I didn't care for it's amenities or quality. It's not bad, just not as good as the other HGV properties in their portfolio.
user_name:
Creag Anthony A
Independence, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are HGVC owners so we know what to expect when getting a 2 BR suite at one of their properties: spacious, comfortable, and all the amenities of home. Most of their locations are stand alone whereas this property is part of Hilton's Hawaiian Village - which includes multiple hotels and time share properties. The cool thing is you can use any of the facilities within the village - the not so cool thing is everyone else can too. The pool adjacent to the Grand Waikikian is designed for kids (slides, waterfalls, etc.) so you better get down there early as the deck chairs are first come first serve and they go quickly. Unlike many of the other HGVC properties, this one does have room service and serves both breakfast and dinner (pizza and wings were pretty decent). The service staff is very friendly and helpful. I have two gripes: one is that they only had one server working the pool area - she could've used some help...hint, tip well and they'll check back regularly to see if you need another drink. The second is the internet connectivity was awful and slow. If I actually had to do any work, I would have been in trouble.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My Favorite of all the Hilton Hawaiian Village properties. Stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, and a living room & a full kitchen and a washer and dryer. Even this 14th floor partial ocean view lanai was perfect for the Friday night Fireworks show.... What can beat 3 flat screen Samsung TV's, PlayStation, DVD player and access to free DVD rentals and cable. HHV has their own set of restaurants, shops, 2 Starbucks and pool side bars. Did I say there were 5 pools maybe more?...

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: overall GW is a good place to bring your young family in. pool and access to beach is good, and surrounding accommodations (eateries, bar, starbucks, etc.) are within a short walking distance. My family enjoyed our stay at this location. Location is within a decent drive from HNL airport and other scenic spots. Hotel also offers amenities that is agreeable for families and individuals. Pool access is very good, could use more access to bigger pools and enhanced water slides. During peak seasons, pool users are larger and pool tend to be crowded. Pool areas also can use shades/umbrellas.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Love Hgvc Waikiki. This building needs a gym for owners staying here. It's too inconvenient to go to another building. For what we pay we shouldHave better amenities. pool area frustrating. Too small too crowded.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A beautiful resort to visit and walk through, but I wouldn't stay there again. Impossible to get a chair at the pool, no bar service, no service people within site. You have to seek out the concierge, bell service or valet, and all were pleasant, although slow. The rooms were nice and beds were comfortable but the balcony was too small to enjoy.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The weather, scenery, and facilities were first rate. I would encourage all to take in this experience with Hilton and the Hawaiian Culture. Seeing first hand Pearl Harbor, the Waikiki Beach area and the experiences available are once in a lifetime for most. Enjoy while you can.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Vacation in Hawaii for 7 days, 2 at rainbow tower and 4 nights at the waikikian. We really wanted all 6 nights but no space. Rainbow tower was what you expect at a Hilton. Upgrade for being a honors member to a ocean view, which was great in the morning with coffee. Called waikikian to see if we can check-in early, since it's on the same property. Was told it was busy, so after 4 would be the earliest .Let the games begin.We checked in and was told that only handicap 2 bedroom was available. Did not particularly like it but told us if another room came up, they would contact us to change.When we got to the room, all the dishes were out and cabinets locked.No coffee table, or end tables.Called front desk, and was told dishes must be out in the open for handicap room by law.How unsanitary . Did get the coffee table.Rest of the room, well interior designer needs to be fired.Size of the room was good.Big issue with me with this property was that the pools close too early and towel dispensing areas close even earlier.Never did get that call for a regular room.Would have got a call if I wanted to buy another time share.Never will I come back to this timeshare. Don't waste your points and money here.I should have gone to king's land in big island.so much better.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: No matter how many times we go to Hawaii, I never get tired of this place. One thing that helps create that experience is the hotel itself. We always stay at the Hilton Grand Vacation club because of the location, right in front of the beach, 10 minute walk to the city centre and Ala Moana on the other side and in fact you do not have to go anywhere as they have so many restaurants and bars as well as shopping within the Hilton compound. It always feel like home with a bigger kitchen and dining area as well as laundry. Another big plus for me is the numerous channels available as well as free DVD rental in each building. There are so many pools to choose from and a man add lake adjacent to the beach. Our favourite place though are the bars and restaurants with live music daily and the fireworks a couple of times a week. This is island paradise and Hilton is Lat the centre of it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed many times at HHV and owners in lagoon tower, disappointed that Elite level of ownership does not rate a little better room (5th floor which is the bottom street side). I'm sure the potential timeshare buyer gets first dibs. Other than room location it was what we have come to expect from our trips to HHV.Thinking of dumping our timeshare for another brand and just becoming the potential customer though, seems to hold the best value.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: All good but too many Japanese people. They are pushy and don't acknowledge you. It's like we are ghosts. Other than that them place is great. Nice beaches,friendly staff. Kids love the lagoon. What else can I say.We love Hawaii

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Also in the souvenir shops, even in the hotel, to be able to consult in Japanese is a very welcome service. Directions to the bank also we were taught polite. Consultation you are worried whether you borrow a car I was also allowed to. Check out I left my wallet at the time, but was very helpful thanks to the support I am entrusted to believe at the time gave me the wife of a friend I went to pick up. We really appreciate the support of the staff.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: First time to Oahu and found almost everything we needed in walking distance of the hotel. Loved the Friday night fireworks and the several pool options. Parking can be expensive but we loved having a car to travel around the entire island.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our first time staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in Honolulu, Oahu. This place gets our 5-Stars, and I would absolutely highly recommend this place. They have 7 towers (and a new one being built), 90/100 shops and restaurants. If you never want to leave this Village, you don't have to - everything is right there. We went to a grocery store that is very close by to stock our kitchen. We like to have breakfast in our room, plus snacks and drinks. Lunch and Dinner we ate out and all were great! Prices are all in every price range. It is within walking distance to the heart of Waikiki. They have excellent trolleys and bus schedules, and they go all over. You don't need to rent a car. We did rent one for five days, then discovered we really didn't need it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Loved staying in the Hilton Grand Waikikian for a week. It was very spacious and clean and located next to the parking deck. It was right near the lagoon pool and the super pool. Only negative thing was that it seened like they closed early . .

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed a week at the Grand Waikikian. The building is beautiful. The condo was small but fine for the two of us. The condo is part of the Hilton Haiwiian Village. It sits on 22 acres and has three hotel buildings and two condos, with another under construction. It is a very busy place. There are things to do for the whole family. My only complaint is because of its size it is very crowded all the time, as is the rest of Oahu.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton staff, not only at Grand Waikikian but also working for travel arrangement, gave us more services and quality information than we initially expected. We will come back again! Thank you very much.
user_name:
Hiroyuki K
Otsu Cit, Shiga Pref., Japan

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband and I stayed in a one bedroom condo at Hilton Hawaiian Village Grand Waikikian Tower using our Hilton Points. The service and hospitality is good with leis and aloha's on arrival. You have use of all the leisure activities of HHV. The Paradise Pool is great for families and next to the lagoon beach. They provide a nice lounge to use before and after checkout. We opted for city view to save points. When you come in a taxi from the airport tell them to drop you at the Grand Waikikian entrance. We did not gave a car this trip but learned that Uber is popular here and half the price of cabs. We enjoyed our stay. Waikiki is a busy area but the Hilton Hawaiian Village is a nice oasis. We enjoyed the Tropics Restaurant overlooking the beach. The pools are not heated so was cooler than I liked...about the same as the ocean.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We just got back from Honolulu and had a great time. The unit we had at the Grand Waikikian had an ocean view and was clean and spacious. All the people we dealt with were very helpful, which just adds to the property.Shopping was there on the property for food, restaurants, gifts and jewelry for my wife. You could go to Hawaii and have a great time without leaving the property. If you decide to leave the property and need a car there is car rental on the property.A great relaxing time and we look forward to the next time.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I always enjoy a pleasant and relaxing time. Everyone at the hotel is friendly and helpful. I enjoy bringing family and friends here to relax at the pool, walk around the shops, watch the sunset, play boardgames in the room, watch movies from the DVD station, sleep in, eat out or cook at the well equiped kitchen.
user_name:
Pamela Vivian C
Kailua, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The staff and service are very nice. Check in went well and concierge couldn't have been nicer. However, The view is horrible if you are in the Grand Waikikian tower and the rooms need to be updated! The shower needs help. Will never stay again! Sad, sad, sad.
user_name:
Pp032918
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have stayed HGVC-Grand Waikikian for 2times with under 6years old kids. I used washing machine and kitchen every morning and night. Those are very useful for us. We can go to Alamoana on foot. There is Good pool for kids.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Fabulous facility at Grand Waikikian; spacious, clean, and luxurious accommodations. Unfortunately, not a good view of ocean and balcony on our room was on street side and therefore quite noisy. Service was superb. Pools were crowded and it was difficult to get a chair in the sun. No chairs available on the beach unless you paid $$$ for a cabana.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I admit, I can be somewhat of a hotel snob... and with that said, I was really surprised and impressed with the Grand Waikikian! Before coming to the Hilton Hawaiian Village, I read lots of reviews that basically said it was a fine but outdated and old hotel - and those reviews are right, except for the Grand Waikikian (GW) tower. The GW is newer and much nicer, so I'm glad we picked this tower to stay in. So if you're coming to Honolulu and you are a Hilton member and have to stay at one of the Hilton towers in the Village, pick the Grand Waikikian! We had a one bedroom suite that had a beautiful modern kitchen, hardwood floors in the living room, and a spacious and comfortable bedroom (with a huge tub in it as well). The bathroom was also very nice and modern. The resort itself is very touristy with your basic touristy shops and restaurants (obv), but the laua was definitely worth the price! The beach is close and nice, and the pools are fine (too crowded and to many kids for my liking - but there's bars at every pool and the drinks are good and reasonably priced - so there's that). So if you're coming to Waikiki and you can't afford a five star hotel, but can afford the Hilton, go with the GW and you won't be disappointed/you'll be pleasantly surprised/satisfied.
user_name:
CJ R
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton out did themselves. They upgraded us to a wonderful ocean view. The 2 bd suite was perfect and well appointed. Everything you need is just outside your door. Shuttle pick ups right next door for all your tour groups.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A great family friendly location to spend your vacation dollars. Entire Village is set up as a destination location. No need to leave if you did not want to. Great time for three generations of family members.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very convient place to stay in Honolulu with a great view of the ocean. Quality of facility and service was excellent. We are fortunate to be able to use Hilton Grand Vacation points to stay at his facility. Our room was partially facing the busy street so the traffic noise was quite loud during the daylight hours - things quieted down at night. Underground parking made it very convent to have a rental car for side trips.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great experience at the Hilton Grand Wakkikian; very relaxing, clean, staff very helpful, great location of course, great music at the restaurant with great food. Love the Friday fireworks etc… Would recommend it to anyone who visit Honolulu. We have been there now 5 years in a row. Looking for our next trip there :)

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A great place, and both near the roads and beach. It felt like a downtown hotel, but when we closed the windows, it was silence. The overall accommodations are very expansive, with a new hotel currently under construction. There are very many stores and other attractions within the overall footprint. It was a great experience.
user_name:
Tim J. S
San Francisco, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Located within walking distance from Honolulu's largest mall and other shopping/dining options made this an excellent choice since we avoided renting a car during our 8-night stay. Also the Hilton Hawaii Village offered us great opportunities for food and recreation without leaving the campus.
user_name:
Robert F. B
Galloway, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The room was great till the day of of construction above our room we were forced to put up with with poor compensation and no warning this would happen! The room and staff were really nice.Location in Honolulu was great. The room was like a nice condominium with great detail to the location

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the Grand Waikikian tower in room 2111 and 2212. We had to move because we didn't have enough points to get a 1 bedroom plus for the entire 7 days. I asked if we could combine our 2 rooms to just stay in one room. They told us because one was a 1 bedroom and the other was a 1 bedroom plus we couldn't do it. Our first room was a "city view" on the 21st floor which we could not use the balcony because of the noise. We were there for 3 nights and then had to pack all our things and put them in storage, check out and then check back in but we couldn't get our room until 4pm. That was OK as we went hiking and had an early dinner. We got our new room which was a "partial ocean view" room for which we used more points. We were moved up one story to room 2212 which was right around the corner from our old room (but one story up). The "partial ocean view" turned out to be a tiny sliver of ocean if we leaned over our balcony. We couldn't see any ocean if we just sat on the balcony...what a joke! And to top it off the room was even smaller than our first room! There were so many kids in all the hot tubs that we couldn't even get in. Why they don't restrict this is beyond me. It was so disappointing as my husband and I like to relax in the hot tub and to make it even worse they close them at 7pm! We had spent the previous week in Maui and stayed at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Villas and they had an adult only hot tub and it was open 24 hours. The Grand Waikikian resort is so busy and congested that we will not be staying here again.The staff was very nice and we had no complaints with them...we are not complainers but this stay was not what we were expecting. If you have kids with you on vacation this is probably the place for you.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you can, you need to stay here. If you can't stay, it's worth visiting. Walk around the Hawaiian village and shops. Our room wasn't ocean front... But ocean view. Loved the lobby area. Plenty of restaurants nearby, walking distance. If you need any last minute items, I recommend the ABC stores. Great alternative with gift items, food, drinks, toiletries etc.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Aloha spirit lives here. Staff always helpful, not always knowledgeable but willing to find out. Parking is a little high $30/night valet only but public transportation of various types are available and most are just a slight walk away.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Beautiful resort with many pools, lagoon and beaches. Room was comfortable and good size but disappointed with the view. Beach umbrellas very pricey at $60 for umbrella and to chairs so take your own. Good restaurant selection with a live band in the evening.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We always stay at the Grand Waikikian. We love visiting this resort. It has many wonderful amenities and it is very beautiful. The rooms are very nice and roomy unless you stay on the end. The 2 bedroom end units either have a beautiful ocean front view or a view of the city. The downside to these units is they are MUCH smaller than the 2 bedroom units on the sides of the hotel.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: had an amazing week at the Hilton Grand Vacations resort in Honolulu Hawaii. Wonderful room and amenities, great location on the beach and only 2 miles from Diamond Head. the resort pools close early, many food and shopping options on site- although they need more "local inspired" food option in the Hilton Hawaiian village. overall 10/10!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: 2 BR condo was nice but had a few maintenance issues, which they did fix pretty quickly. There were a few spots that could have used more cleaning but it wasn't terribly bad. Beds were OK but a little firm for my taste. Kitchen is small but did have almost everything we needed, except salt & pepper. Pools were nice, but pretty crowded. Waterslides were good. Getting a pool chair was do-able but there were not many extra chairs available.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Second time my family has stayed at the Waikikian. Had a two bedroom corner with two balcony's on the 12th floor. Great view. As an elite premier owner I have two complaints and they are the same two complaints I had 5 yrs ago when I stayed there. 1st, elite members should have a guaranteed checkout later than 10:00am. I had to offer up my next born child just to get a 11:30am checkout. 2nd, this is the ONLY HGVC property in the system that doesn't have a designated fitness center for owners. You have to journey all the way over to the Kalia tower and use the only fitness center. With the Lagoon and Waikikian so close together, it would be very easy to put a fitness center in one of those towers.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This property is of the same great standards of a HGVC developed property. The room was clean and very up to date. The staff was helpful and friendly. Even though the Hilton Hawaiian Village is a large complex, everything is accessible. My only wish is that they had a quiet bar for an evening drink. The bar by the beach is great if you want a lively evening, but not for a quiet nightcap! I rated the Value as average because as a HGVC owner I used points for the room, which is consistent with other HGVC properties. The food within the Village is significantly more expensive than outside the Village.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed in a one bedroom plus suite room on the 19th floor. Fantastic city views and a partial view of the ocean. The suite was wonderful, nice wood floors, full kitchen, water/dryer, big tub, bedroom, etc. The lobby and area around the hotel is top notch, clean, and beautiful artwork. But the best part is the actual Hilton Hawaiian Village, everything you need within the 22 acres, restaurants, shops, lagoon pool, regular pools, and of course a beautiful beach, its all there. You want to explore Honolulu and Oahu, but you could just walk around the village, enjoy the beach/activities, and surrounding area, and it would be all you would want on an Hawaiian vacation.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at The Grand Waikian at Hilton and had a wonderful time. We came with our two small kids under 3 and loved everything about the stay here. The resort and the amenities and staff were just so wonderful. Highly recommend as a great place to relax.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Love the room layout/decor, beds always comfortable, kitchen has all the amenities you need including dish washer, full size refridgerator, microwave oven and range. Also the in room washer/dryer is great!!!!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
