review_body: The Grand Waikikian is a wonderful place to stay if you're planning a vacation at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The Village is huge with many restaurants, shops and things to do. It can be overwhelming! The Grand is newer and seems more upscale than the other hotels on the property. We loved it! We are part of the Hilton vacation club and there is a review that states it's Saturday - Saturday. Perhaps most in the club stay those days, but we actually went Monday - Monday with no problem. I do wish checkout was 11 rather than 10. 10am seems a bit early when check in is at 4pm. Our 1 bedroom suite was nicely appointed with a large bathroom and a mirror that didn't steam (fantastic!) along with a huge tub that was in the bedroom. There are two double beds in the bedroom and a queen pull out sofa in the living area. There was a Bosch washer & dryer and the kitchenette had everything we needed to prepare simple things to eat. We were on a higher floor overlooking Ala Moana and that suited us fine. We enjoyed looking at the harbor from the balcony and the city lights at night. This view also kept us from hearing the Luau up on the rooftop of the garage every night! One night may have been fun, but a week of that - no thanks! Our balcony was large with one table and four chairs. The lobby and hallways and elevators were always clean. This hotel is a nice experience throughout. Speaking of the Luau, it was fun! It was pricey, but we enjoyed the convenience of having it right there and easily walking back to the hotel rather than a long ride to the Polynesian Cultural Center. Another benefit for us was all the vegetarian food offerings. Other Luau menus we had viewed had far less to offer those of us who don't eat meats. The food was fresh & tasty. The dancers and host of the show were entertaining and often funny. It was an enjoyable evening. The Village is also convenient with it's great lawn area for pickup. Several of our excursions picked us up in this location. Had I realized the cost of parking and that we'd only use the rental car a couple days I wouldn't have gotten the rental at the airport. There was a car rental place right next to the GW on Ala Moana. I would have rented those specific days only. Many excursions will pick you up and even Uber is priced well for getting to close by spots in town. The entire hotel complex is a busy place. It has very large numbers of people staying here. We are happy we booked just after New Year and not during the Christmas/New Year holiday itself. It must have been crazy then. Despite the amount of people we had no problem getting chairs or umbrellas for the beach area. The pool was often more crowded, but even there we found chairs. My one huge gripe is the cost of beach chairs and an umbrella. Paying $60 for an entire day is one thing, but when you've been on an excursion most of the day and can't get beachside until 2 or later, $60 was ridiculous! Why isn't there a reduced price for late afternoons? We would absolutely and happily stay in the Grand Waikikian again! Now that we know a few tricks such as renting a car by the day only and not bothering with the beach unless you plan a full day for the chair rental price, we are set. We already knew to eat breakfast simply using the kitchenette or go across the street and buy a delicious acai bowl. If you choose the G.W. I can't imagine being disappointed. It is a nice place to be if staying in the Waikiki area of Oahu.
user_location: Santa Rosa Beach, FL, United States
user_name:
Sandra L. M
Santa Rosa Beach, FL, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian is one of the Hilton Grand Vacation Clubs located within the Hawaiian Village Complex. We had a one bedroom condo which included a fully equipped kitchen. It was beautifully decorated, very comfortable and gave us really allowed us to relax. The Hawaiian Village includes several Vacations Clubs, hotels and numerous restaurants and shops. It is located on the beach and there is also an lagoon and several pools. The entire complex is located on the Waikiki side right over the bridge that leads to the Ala Moana Mall, so you are near to that side of Honolulu as well as to Waikiki. We did not have a car and was able to walk to both areas easily.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Check in time for 4pm is little bit late when you have to check out at 10am next morning. The room needs to be checked to be more clean such as I offten see some dust onthe table or on the floor. Need to improve house keeping service. Also for pool, one towel is not engough. At least please provide 2 for each person.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Not sure if it's that the week right after Christmas is just such a busy one or whether it's always this crazy in Waikiki, but this was not the relaxing resort vacation one imagines taking in Hawaii... Total mob scene. About 25 people (including two babies in diapers) in a hot tub despite the sign limiting it to 9. Not an empty pool chair in sight at any of the pools. The beach is a little... "man made-ish" and requires renting chairs and umbrellas... Towels were given out on a "chit" basis: you needed to return the towel for the chit or get charged... but the towel return sites kept closing/moving and it all added to the hassle and long walk when you just wanted to be done and get back to the room. The onsite restaurants had hourlong waits at dinnertime, adding to the stress. Service at the restaurants was minimal/cursory at best (separate reviews).All that said, the two-bedroom suite was beautiful, I have to say. Up to date, very spacious, with beautiful bathrooms (though the lack of privacy for the master bathroom shower meant only one person could use that that entire bedroom while showering - indeed, my husband gave the window washer quite a show (and shock!) during one of his showers! It was nice to have laundry in the room. I liked that there was a little village to shop/wander during downtimes (including a few ABC stores, which are always fun), and I didn't find the convenience stores IN the hotels over-priced, either.We attended the hotel's New Year's Eve luau as well, which was decent, particularly considering their record crowd of 940 people. The show was great, the food quite good (though there was a long wait) and there was easy access to bars/servers.Ultimately, we used it as base camp for Oahu - we ate mostly in Chinatown (yum) but should probably have rented a house or apartment instead, given we didn't really use/appreciate the resort "amenities."

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: So, I'm assuming that if you are reading this, you've already determined that you are probably going to stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in some capacity or another, and you are trying to narrow it down a bit. If you are a first time visitor to Hawaii, you probably will be coming to Oahu and you should probably stay here, since it is such an iconic destination.This is a large touristy resort but it certainly delivers. The overall experience was highly positive and I recommend it 100%. With that said, I am going to try and guide you through some of the pitfalls that I learned in staying here for 8 Nights and 8 Days.The Village itself is 7 (Soon to be 8) Towers situated on the western end of the Waikiki Beach Strip. The towers are Kalia, Tapa, Rainbow, Lagoon, Diamond Head, Ali'i and Grand Waikikan.To really make the most of your time/dollars/fun factor, I would highly recommend getting one of the HGVC rooms here. The HGVC is the Entire Grand Waikikan Tower, The Lagoon tower and floors 12-18 of the Kalia Tower. We stayed at the GW Tower, which was great. Standard HGVC Kitchen/Suite with fold out bed in the living room, but the tub in the Master is a big Jacuzzi style one. My daughter inquired if she could move in....to the tub. The Lagoon tower is between the GW and the Ocean/Duke's Lagoon so unless you are above floor 28 or so, you wont see much, but It doesn't really matter since its nice to sit outside regardless of where you are. We were on the 10th floor city side and didn't even really think that it was an issue for a second.If you do not stay at one of the afore mentioned towers, you will not have a Kitchen. Therefore, no bananas, yogurt, eggs, toast, etc.... from your balcony in the morning (which was an 8am highlight everyday). The real problem here is time, not just money. If you are here with a 2 year old, and you are just going to be sitting in the resort and at the pool, fine. But if you are looking to hike, surf, swim, whatever, you will be wasting 2-4 hours a day eating, waiting in line to eat, determining where you want to wait in line to eat, cursing the day you ever came to this godforsaken place!!! But, with the Kitchen, everyone wakes up, grabs some food, meets on the balcony, and it's off to the activities by 8:45! Remember the Village is busy!I've heard a bunch of people complain about the rooms in the Rainbow and Tapa tower being small and outdated, so staying in the HGVC rooms solves this problem too, especially since the GW is the newest tower (and the 8th one appears to be a replica of the GW tower.)Everything is very expensive, including the Luau, which I thought was a ripoff. If you are going to do the Luau, don't buy the gold tickets, just buy the blue ones and get there precisely at 5pm. It's still a little touristy/gimmicky, and the only really cool part is the fire portion which has to conclude by 7:45, since the fireworks begin then on Friday.Ahh yes, the Saturday checkout. Fortunately, we did a Monday-Tuesday stay since I just use the HGVC properties as hotels not time shares. However, all the time share guests must be out by Saturday at 10am so it is quite a scene at that time. I had to return some rental surfboards at 8 and the madness had already began. My advice...don't be anywhere near the lobby at Saturday at 10am. If you absolutely have to leave on Saturday, I would check out Friday, move two blocks to the Alana Doubletree and stay there the last night. It's that bad.ActivitiesJust a few things. Don't rent a car unless you plan to do excursions everyday. We went on a Surfing Tour with a 3rd party (ohanasurfproject.com) and rented a car from Paradise rental car(next to the GW tower) for another North Shore day. Parking is too expensive and the valet is too much of a mess to make a car worthwhile.Lunch/DinnerYou will probably go to Dinner once or twice per week in the Village, but it will be expensive. Three of us went to Benihani and it was $275. We went to Korean BBQ a short walk away and stuffed our faces for $75 with drinks. If you like Asian food, get out there and explore! Also, check out the food trucks for lunch. Everyone makes their own version of Garlic Shrimp, try for yourself.All in all, I highly recommend the Village for your first Hawaiian experience as long as you stay in the GW tower, and don't get too engulfed in the tourist experience.4.75 Stars rounded up to 5 =)

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: So I don't write many reviews on Tripadvisor, but I felt obliged after my wonderful stay at Grand Waikikian. To start off, I have been to Hawaii years ago with a friend as solo travelers. This time around, I was treating my family to a Hawaiian vacation as my Christmas present to them and needed spacious accommodation for 4-5 adults. After extensive research on Tripadvisor, I narrowed down to booking a suite at Hilton. I quickly learned that most of the 1-to-2 bedroom suites at Hilton are timeshare units. There are 2 timeshare towers (and another coming!) in the Hilton Village - Lagoon & Grand Waikikian. For the most part, you'll have to book through 3rd party sites or timeshare brokers to get a suite in either towers. And sadly every listing looked suspicious as they are using stock photos from Hilton website and they mismatch the photos with the different towers. When I contact a timeshare owner and timeshare broker, they were asking for $4900 & $6700 for the week of Christmas in the Lagoon tower. (Say whaaa, right?!) I started to research more to see if there is another way to booking a suite, especially at the Grand Waikikian. And then I stroke GOLD! Hilton.com had the 2-bedroom suite with City-view (1 King & 2 Double beds) available for 6 night in the GW. Now to the important part - the hotel & suite!Grand Waikikian is a luxurious hotel/timeshare tower with a modern Hawaii decor. It reminds me of the California Adventure Hotel at Disneyland California Park. It also secluded from the rest of the resort/Waikiki Beach so you have less crowd to deal with. We were greeted upon arrival with fresh leis. Check in was speedy and pretty straight forward. We arrived on Sunday afternoon and got into our room within 20 minutes. However, it was a nightmare on Saturday morning when checking out. The elevators are packed with people and large suitcases. Since it's a timeshare, all guests are required to check out at 10am on Saturday and so it was a stampede of families into a small lobby. Because of this, I deducted half a star despite the hotel's effort to control and ease the delay by having all man on deck. As for the suite, it was better than I had expected. The kitchen is stocked with mostly Cuisinart appliances and cookware. The living room and dining area are spacious and well-designed. The bedrooms were simple but extremely comfortable. The bathrooms were beautiful and clean. There are some minor wear and tears in the suite, but again, the whole suite was better than I had anticipated and my family were extremely happy with the accommodation. As for the amenities/activities in the Hilton Hawaiian Village...The pools were crowded but manageable. They had plentiful of shops and restaurants. The local beach had decent waves, but a little more rocky than the main Waikiki beach. The luau on Friday on the Great Lawn was fantastic! The show is 360 degrees so everyone has a great view and the firework show is right after! I've been to the Paradise Cove Luau and this was better despite having less pre-dinner activities. Do not do the luau on any other day as it is less spectacular. I know because our patio overlooked the main luau area on the conference hall rooftop and got to see the show every night.Overall, I would definitely stay at Grand Waikikian when my family and I visit again. Gracious to the people at GW for making our stay so wonderful and pleasant.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had great vacation at hilton grand vacations. It was very convenient to stay at condo with family. You can do laundary every day, cook or take a luxurious bath(there was huge bathtub.). I was very pleased to stay at hilton grand waikikian and is goona stay again if there's a chance.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: For a large establishment we wete so looked after. Apartments were amazing. A beautiful walk close to beachrs..away from main beach hussle. Lots of restaurants cafes and very family friendly. Close to main shopping. Staff always there to help..

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Disappointing experience.Hotel lobby and first floor is nice but somewhat generic and without individual style; service is unremarkable.Stayed in a one bedroom suite; furnishings are of average quality, washer was broken, bell knob was cracked. No daily room service unless you pay extra.They will not even empty out garbage cans etc unless you persist on it, which makes the point of having kitchen etc almost obsolete.Noise level can be high at night.Also, they charge additional $29 daily mandatory for parking (no discount for hotel guests) and their garage can get full easily so circling around for 20 plus minutes; also muggy hot air no ac in garage. Time share presentation was pressure on, and went on for almost 3 hrs despite me repeating I am not interested in buying; classical one two punch approach with nice lady presents and manager gives you exorbitant numbers - close to 50 k for one premium week, then when no interest changed to "softer package" every other year? Then still no interest made me a "special offer" then no interest - slammed his folder and left, hoping to make me feel guilty - which only made me feel relieved and certain I did the right thing by not buying time share from him.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Even though my family and I live less than 7 miles away from the property we find it very relaxing to sit at the pool and chill out. The property is very beautiful and secure which allows us to just relax and enjoy Hawaii.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Trip to Hawaii and was able to stay in a 2br apartment. Big rooms with full Kitchen and lounge room with fold out sofa bed. Unit also has clothes washer and dryer. Perfect for family of up to 6. Large balcony. Free wifi for HH members.Friendly staff and great location. It's within the Hilton Hawaiian village with shops and restaurants. Close to ala Moana shopping center and also to the Waikiki area.Rent a car and drive around the island.Can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The accomodations were very nice. The staff was very nice. The location was nice. The beach was very nice. The fireworks were nice. The weather was nice. I had a nice time. My wife had a nice time. people were nice.
user_name:
Jonathan Christ... B
oakland, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and I decided to go on a trip out of the blue. We were looking to go somewhere exotic like Turks and Caicos. Then, I came across an incredible deal for a week at the Grand Waikikian. I was rolling the dice since Hawaii was getting hit with 3 hurricanes at the same time. The price was simply too good to pass up, so, we booked it even though it was only my wife and I. It was a week in a 1400 sq ft 2 bedroom penthouse suite on the 36th floor for $1495. We normally go to stay in the Ali'i tower in the hotel, but this was cheaper. Luckily, the hurricane passed the day we got there. My review might be very biased because all of the factors were not normal from the price to the type of room.I'll start with the building. It's definitely a newer tower, but there was no real personality or presence. We really didn't need to interact with any of the staff at the front desk because the Penthouse level rooms have a team dedicated to their needs on the 35th floor. That being said, all staff other than the waitresses seemed to be native Japanese speakers. It would be great if I was from Japan and couldn't speak English, but for my purposes it was a little difficult and I'm Asian myself. It would make more sense to get second generation Japanese that can speak both languages fluently and easily handle both cultures. Getting a cheese grater for our kitchen was a 2 day job trying to explain what a cheese grater was to 3 different members of the staff on the 35th floor. Coolest selling point of the Penthouse level was the free continental breakfast in the mornings as well as the evening appetizers with beer and wine. Be sure to try it every night as the menu does change. Certain nights are significantly better than others. Thai night was probably the best in my opinion. Some more thought should go into the menu for this premium service. For the limited number of people that can access this amenity, it would make sense to add a few hot items to the breakfast and step up higher end food options in the evenings. Also, if you're going to have free beer, giving more options than just Budweiser would have been nice. There is a single beer at a time rule in effect, so, no double fisting and going to your room.Regarding the room, it was new, nice and spacious which is hard to find in Waikiki. I have no idea how much a room like this would go for nightly, but I imagine it would be incredibly expensive. Take a look at the pics on the Hilton website to get an idea of the room. 2 bed 2 bath unit with separate pull out sofa in living room, breakfast bar, large round dining table, full kitchen, 3 balconies, and large jacuzzi bathtubs in each bedroom . The theme of not just the room, but also the building itself, is a natural Hawaiian style decor with a lot of natural wood. I like more of a clean and modern look. While nice, it felt like I was sleeping over at a rich aunt's house rather than a staying at a luxurious hotel. But at the penthouse level, I can't say that it was anything other than the bomb.If you have a choice of ocean view side, choose the side that faces Diamond head. You will also then be able to see the fireworks on Friday and Saturday night if you are high enough. We didn't have a choice and we were on the other side. We just got to hear the fireworks.Regarding the pool area, if you have kids, this is the pool for you. For adults like us, we had to use the other pools that were more quiet. The pool area was a zoo and a little like a trip to Disneyland. Not an ideal place to relax. Also, when we came last November we were told that they were going to do a much needed update to the Mandara Spa locker rooms and facilities, which is long overdue. The men's locker room looked like a YMCA from the 80's. The Spa is the same and they only did ADA upgrades. Quite a let down. The Spa facilities are so sub par for this property. It a bit of a shame.Final thoughts, great stay for the price. After seeing the price of studios on the lower levels on Expedia, I would pass on staying in this particular tower again. Ali'i is still the best in my opinion, but I've never stayed in the Rainbow tower.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We recently had a vacation with extended family at the Grand Waikikian. While we stayed here before, this time was the most disappointing. I'll start with the positives - the amenities are great, particularly if traveling with small children. The lagoon is perfect for kids as it is shallow and very calm. We had so much fun with the kids here.The room, however, had definitely seen better days. We had a two bedroom suite. I'll start by saying that when we first checked in there was the odor of bacon in the main area. Then, we discovered that the trash hadn't been removed and there was no dish soap left. So, we called housekeeping and they came to take care of that. They even commented that they thought the room smelled funny and suggested that we have them use their "air machine" to get the smell out and they were surprised that this hadn't been done in the first place. Well, we never had a chance to do this as someone was always in the room. Beyond these issues, the floors felt really grimy, and not just to me, everyone in our party commented (it's Hawaii, so we were barefoot a lot). So, I actually spent the time to get down on my hands and knees to clean the floors. I also ended up scrubbing the counters, cabinets in the kitchen area and backsplashes. They were all filthy.I don't know if this was an isolated incident with our room, but it was REALLY disappointing. I'll also say that I'm an HGVC owner, though I didn't use my points for this stay. The quality of this property leads me to question my ownership.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton rep. booked us on the wrong island to start. When arrived, gave us the wrong room. We reserved a suite with 2 double beds with sofa pull out for the 5 of us.They gave us a king bed and no other room with double to switch us to unless we go to the regular guess rooms which is just a single room with no living room nor kitchen. Staff there are not too friendly nor know what they are doing when approached. They're on vacation too! The ventilation was so bad.The entire time we stayed there someone from another unit fried fish everyday and the smell suffocated us, but where can we go? They can't accommodate us anywhere else. There were molds in the shower stall. If cleaned on a regular bases, there shouldn't be any black molds forming at the edge. We needed a wheel chair to wheel my daughter to the room after coming back from the ER from an accident, the porter conveniently brush us off saying they don't have any. All large hotels such as this always have a wheel chair for their guess. Early next morning we saw a couple of wheel chairs sitting in the corner of where they put their luggage cart. This has got to be the worst service and accommodation from any hotel I've ever been to. I'm not impress with any of the Hiltons Hotel as big a name as they carry.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Over 30 years ago, my wife and me stayed at Rainbow tower in Hilton Hawaiian village as our honey-moon trip, and we got some couple friends there. We promised "come back here together 10 years later! " But we couldn't do it because of the work, children, etc. Finally, after 32 year later, 2 couples arrived at same Rainbow tower. And got the information of HGVC system during the stay. 2 couples bought the Grand waikikian sharing system then. This 2 couples have enjoyed Grand Waikikian stay just this week. HGVC makes our life "Rainbow" such as that we dreamed at the Rainbow tower 32 years ago.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As a Hilton Diamond member I expect more. From rude staff at check-in, quoting the wrong rate, mischarging, missed days of housekeeping, far from the beach, on the side of a loud road there is so much wrong here that even one star is too much. We made several complaints and even management was unresponsive.Stay elsewhere if you can.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Had a good time here, stayed 7 days with friends in a 2 bedroom suite. Had everything one would need to cook, make drinks and relax. The suite we stayed in had a balcony in the guest bedroom and one in the living room, both had ocean views which was very nice. Had coffee in the mornings on the balconnies, average temps at 6:30 am was around 72 degrees. They offer room cleaning mid week into the stay which was fine, we did our own cleaning when necessary anyway. Full kitchen and washer and dryer was nice. Ice maker didnt work but they had someone come to the unit and replace it, worked great after that, and they sent 3 bags of ice up immediately so we coud have ice right away, The grounds were great and the staff were friendly. Lots of shops for browsing and fairly good food at most local restaurants, over all it was a very nice place but expensive so bring your cash and credit cards lol. I thank Hilton Grand Waikikian Hotel and staff for a very nice time. The area is very busy so be prepared for the traffic, its kind of like being in the big city which we didnt like but overall the island has lots of areas outside the city to see that are beautiful.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I came to Oahu for a vacation with my dad and this resort was amazing. The room was perfect from the view to the comfort of the beds to the accommodations in the suite (cooking utensils, eating utensils, small kitchen appliances, etc.) The resort had plenty of restaurants and was in walking distance of many other restaurants and shops. I recommend this resort 100%
user_name:
Brittny S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our vacation was a Hilton Grand Vacations VIP promotional so we got a tremendous price to start with and it ended up with the entire amount we spent being applied to the upgrade of our timeshare so it ended up as "free?". I can only guess at what the "rack" room rate would have been for this stay. We spent a week here in a two bedroom condo and had a fantastic time. Other than one issue with an inexperienced food staffer the stay was flawless. Since this was our first time to Hawaii we did many off-property tours but the entire Hawaiian Village complex could keep the family entertained for days without leaving the property.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The staff were courteous and helpful. The accommodations were excellent. I stayed in 1903 which had a view of the entire complex. It was great watching sunrises and sunsets from the balcony. The Friday night fireworks is a must see activity. The room was clean and spacious. We had a two bedroom accommodation. We watched the roof top luau from our balcony.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent hotel right from walking up to the Reception Desk to register. Room was a 1-bdrm. suite plus fold out sofa bed. Kitchen was well equipped. Large walk-in shower plus Client Services took care of providing extra coffee plus shower accessories (shampoo, etc.) for the 8 day stay. Only a few step away from the private enclosed pool.Beyond the gate was a pond for relaxing or floating by on surfboards. The Hilton beach is just a few steps away.The Pacific was awesome, very warm. I'm not much of a swimmer but even I could tread water and leisurely gloat along in such salt water. First time that I felt warm in outdoor waters except my own pool!Highly recommended but book well in advance as hard to get in.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have stayed at this facility several times over the past 10 years, and it is always totally outstanding. The entire Hilton complex is located along a beautiful stretch of Waikiki Beach. The rooms are all outstanding, and the amenities are equally superb. There is plenty to do on site as well as in the local area. Great for guests of all ages. My wife & I, our kids, and grandkids all had a great time.
user_name:
Harry D. B
Appling, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: What a terrible stay at this hotel Grand Waikikian Suites by Hilton Grand Vacations. Room and surroundings smelled like smoke and the staff were not helpful at all. Mold and rotting wood in the room and it smelled like an ash tray. The whole property is full of tour buses and smokers. This is not a safe place for children.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is our first trip to Oahu after a couple of earlier visits on the Big Island. We are HGVC owners but didn't know anything about this property prior to arrival. If you are flying into Honolulu International Airport, reserve a taxi pickup in advance. The taxi stand at HNL is the worst we've ever seen. Our confirmed Charlie's Taxi driver picked us up within 10 minutes which saved at least 30 spent waiting in that loooong line. Charlie's is also the hotel's official outbound cab as well. Right away, you will find that the Grand Waikikian is an expansive property. (My fitness tracker estimated a half-mile round trip between our room and the Paradise Pool.) GW is one of seven towers that make up the Hilton Hawaiian Village Waikiki Beach Resort. Our one-bedroom unit was nicely decorated and very comfortable. We had an ocean view room on the 23rd floor. The room is furnished as any other HGVC property--everything you need here to cook, do a load of laundry etc. The elevators (4) were prompt enough. When a big group moves in, it can overwhelm the small elevator lobby. Because the rooms are equipped with kitchens, there is no restaurant or even coffee shop in this tower. If you want the livability of a condo with on-site meal service, this isn't your property. Easy check-in at the spacious lobby. There is a small store near the elevators for food, toiletries, etc. they have a nice selection from sushi to soft drinks, frozen foods to fashion magazines. There are several concierge stationed throughout who can help book outside activities and also serve to guide you to HGVC presentations. We hadn't planned to attend one while we were here (the "owner's update" is mostly up-sell) but the $100 toward a helicopter tour reeled us in. Beyond the GW tower, the entirety of the HHV encompasses more than you might imagine. The property is arrayed around the Mid-Pacific Conference Center and bordered by the Pacific Ocean and Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon. There are tons of places to eat, shop, swim and relax within HHV. There is even a post office/FedEx business center here. We walked a few blocks for groceries and along the beach but you wouldn't need to leave HHV if you don't want to.The first thing you need to do here is take advantage of the free walking tour. Justin B. was a fantastic guide: knowledgeable, personal and fun. We discovered a few places that were not obvious (the Italian place is easy to miss) and sampled lots of goodies from the shops, from coffee and chocolate to cookies and cake to nuts and ice cream to smoothies and an obscenely good coffee butter. Certainly there is a commercial aspect to this tour but you get so much more--a history of the property, an introduction to the beautiful flora and fauna found on the grounds, a little architecture appreciation, knowledge of Hawaiian and Polynesian traditions. DO NOT MISS THIS TOUR!There are other on-site opportunities that we did not personally experience. From our room, we looked down on the luau; the fire show and dancing looked and sounded like good entertainment. We will not be here on Friday when there is a special show for those on the property (modest cost, paid thru room charge only to limit to guests). It features music and a fireworks spectacular. Both these would appear to be interesting attractions. While in Hawaii, we like to hit the pools. First day was Paradise Pool off the Grand Parlor. It has slides etc. for kids. Not a bad pool which attracts families. We moved on to the Kalia pool next--a small pool with nothing other than towel service and perhaps the best sun exposure of any of the pools. Did not try the Super or Tapa pools as there are enough palms to make sunning there a little challenging. (Hey, it's Hawaii--we are going back home with tans.)The beaches and lagoon are terrific. Note: these are public beaches so don't come thinking they are reserved for property guests only. There is a jetty near the lagoon where surfers gather and we witnessed wedding photos being taken at the lagoon. Actually, every day we have been here (5) there was a wedding function somewhere on the property.Staff have all been very helpful and friendly. Can't say enough about Justin's walking tour. We enjoyed drinks and pizza at the Tapa Bar and also a nice meal at Tropic. Many will comment that this location is as much metro as beach and that certainly is true. Several cranes poke through the skyline as other hotels rise; flights from HNL and excursion helicopters pass over with regularity. From our balcony, there is road noise from the sometimes intense traffic. Yet the walkway along the beach and the green space of neighboring Fort DeRussey park can be relaxing. The night life in the village can be boisterous and invigorating. There are lots of people--couples and families from all over the world--who come together in the HHV environs which may or may not be your idea of a vacation. Bottom line: If you are looking for a serene, secluded tropical island paradise, the Grand Waikikian HGVC may not be what you are looking for. If you want a little bit of everything--a nice beach, lots of nearby activities, on-site shopping and entertainment with generous big-city off-site options and a global vibe, this might work nicely. Overall, for us, a very nice property and an enjoyable stay

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a nice property overall. There is a lot to do on-site, and it's an easy walk on the boardwalk to other things adjacent to the resort property. Friendly and helpful staff. Some resort prices are high, but with that easy walk to other places, you can make up for it elsewhere at times. Nice central location to travel to other attractions while on the island. Overall, a nice time and a nice place to stay. Mahalo!
user_name:
Ben and Heidi T
Fargo, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Hilton Grand Waikikian on Oahu, Hawaii.As we arrived early afternoon and wondered if the vacation club 2 bedroom, 2 bath, suite would be as nice as in the pictures. We were told the was no guarantee of getting an ocean view, or two king beds.....Well, we got both!! After a bit of difficulty to find our specific "tower" we arrived to the 11th floor and were wowed' by the wonderful view of the harbor and ocean!!It took us a bit to actually realize this was going to be ours for the next 7 nights, Yea!It didn't take us long to get acquainted with the wonderful lagoon, and the multiple swimming pools and restaurants. The restaurants covered Japanese, Chinese, American, Thai, English, and many more. The choices included seafood, sushi, Italian, Steaks, ribs, and anything on could think of...!This is a terrific resort "nesting" with 7 towers, Private Sandy Beaches, along with many great restaurants, bars, and too many shops to name, all within the confines of the Hilton Property! We really enjoyed the property and the proximity to other venues in the downtown area, too. One day we chartered a ocean fishing boat, and had a wonderful time. Also rented a car (across the street) and drove to the mountains to play golf at the Grand Kunia Club, which had terrific views of the mountains, and Pearl Harbor, too.The evenings were terrific, with many activities, Fireworks, torches, colored lights, bands, ukulele music and Luau's too! The prices were reasonable, for the quality of the food and service, and the happy hour prices were great too!This was our fourth trip to the Islands, and this one was the very best for accommodations and access. Other than the long flight time, we would highly recommend staying at the Hilton Properties for a great Hawaiian experience.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed our stay. The village had a lot of good restaurants, shopping and fun things to do. Its like a resort experience right on Waikiki beach. We were there in late October with our kids age 8 & 10 and had a fun, relaxing stay.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This Hotel is a little hard to find while driving. Entry is on side road . The service here is GRAND 5 star it is...Parking is a little expensive but what the heck, saves time to find parking. Your choice of valet or park yourself. Price varies of course.Very clean and well maintained hotel.Many pools and a small beach ..pivate to hotel guests and it is right next to the beach.Small shops within 10 min walk...Walking around is easy and they workers are glad to help you. Smiles and friendly service all around.You get SERVICE all the time when asked for .Personnel is very helpful even in directions where to go what to see exc exc. The rooms are to fantastique and also have a great view. On friday night you get free fireworks. In all a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is the time share portion of Hilton Hawaiian Village and it is an enormous resort. This particular bldg requires a lot of walking as it is not pool, lagoon or beach front. There is not a restaurant or even a coffee shop in it or the adjacent bldg. this proved slightly problematic as I was traveling with a family member who had mobility issues and was often too tired by all the walking to fully enjoy her stay. Hilton consistently ignored their own rules. There was drinking and smoking on the beach every day. The hot tubs were a horror. Clear signs stating max occupancy 9 people, no one under 5. The one time we went to actually use one, by actual count there were 23 people, half children and half of those under 5. People quite literally stacked on laps. The most egregious thing was people standing on the coral reef right off shore. I am assuming it is dead but still that is no way to teach or instill respect. Having said all that the apartment itself was pretty nice. Spacious, clean, sound proof. We had a city view with the ocean view from the balcony. The staff was lovely and my only criticism is they should have been more forthcoming about more direct routes since my sister clearly had issues (she used either a cane or walker at all times). The first two days we took the long way around to get to the beach and could have cut through . Restaurant are average, most way over priced. Hotel guests are treated much better than time share. Better location better amenities and better perks, late check out etc.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Have visited before with the family but this time we found it way too commercialized. New tower is right on the street way too much noise. Too many rowdy drunks on the site for Friday night fireworks no security.
user_name:
Richard Alfred P
Denver, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian lives up to the vision of a royal Hawaiian residence. It's pricey but convenient for transportation and walking to the beach. Staff are very friendly and helpful. We particularly enjoyed the services provided by Concierge Julie! What a sweetheart who knew how to find the right tour to meet our needs.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Despite booking a room suitable for my wife, who is confined to a wheelchair, the room provided was for a hearing impaired person, with none of the features necessary for wheelchair access. The reservation was made using the Hilton website and the wheelchair accessibility confirmed by telephoning the reservation call centre and confirmed at check in, however the room had no wheelchair accessible features at all. Neither the reservation or check in staff had any knowledge of the room types available. The disabled lifting device for the swimming pool was broken and staff showed no interest in fixing the equipment. Don't bother with Hilton if you need wheelchair /disability access.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Always a pleasure to stay here, love being able to have a full kitchen so I can cook and put cold food items in the fridge. It's also a plus to have a washer & dryer in the unit. Our previous visits have been for doctor visits so there wasn't much time to enjoy the resort, will be back again soon to visit family and enjoy the many amenities HGVC has to offer.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Just returned from Hawaii and this resort was top notch! The amenities from the Lei to the pools to the service was heavenly. Location and entertainment was spectacular! We did a little island hopping and this was my first stop.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is located right near the water in the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Shopping and restaurants are around every corner. Beautiful rooms, great for everyone! Would definitely go back soon. Very pretty!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I would recommend any Hilton Hotels. We have been in many of them and are very satisfied with the freindlyness and generosity of the staff. The rooms are amazing and if you have a family and are planning on staying a while, with the kitchen facilities, that is so becoming for anyone.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Staff was extremely helpful in all of our questions that we had, they were immediate with the answers and positive with the attitudes. This applies to the manager as well who was extremely helpful in giving information regarding available computers that we might use for convenience in airline boarding info.
user_name:
Ronald V. G
Beaverton, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment with a city view . 3 adults , 1 toddler . Stayed here for 6 nights after staying at Aston Waikiki Beach Towers at the start . Fantastic welcomes with leis for everybody . Well appointed apartment with comfortable beds , blockout curtains that work , prettying everything you need to make your stay comfortable . Bonus of staying here compared to the rest HHV is that it's less hectic and not surrounded with constant queues in the reception area . Great pool facilities and you have the lagoon . But beach has a bit of coral , moderate waves which are not great for toddlers . It's a hive of activity with shops , restaurants , birds , live entertainment and the fantastic Friday fireworks . You also have access to the 8th floor lounge and we found this invaluable when were waiting for our room to become available and also flight delays ( which we experienced ) . Walking distance to Ala moana (20 min walk) for all your shopping needs . Also easy beachside walk to the Royal Hawaiian shopping area in waikiki Favourite eateries nearby -Aloha kitchen (soufflé pancake), goofy's ( breakfast menu and green spaghetti ) , bubba gump ( ala moana) , cj's deli (pastrami and hot dogs)My husband also made us hike 45 mins to Karai crab ! Would stay at Grand Waikikian again .

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: You will enjoy great views (make sure to book an ocean view room). Rooms are clean and efficiently maintained and cleaned. We know that we arrived during the busy Labor Day weekend, but still we were rather annoyed by slow response from bell staff. My mother needed a wheelchair and asked whether we can hire one; as she was told they will charge $70 for a week, she said it was free of charge in other hotels we've been staying in Hawaii. The Japanese female staff suddenly became hostile and snapped they do things differently here (sounded almost like some sort of school headmistress!). Somehow we felt that young Japanese staff members did not like experienced holiday makers like ourselves. Often we see bell and front desk staff just milling around, conversing among themselves- we wondered what they were doing instead of helping us. Usually older staff were more helpful and efficient, perhaps they were not training younger members equally well. Overall, this is a good hotel, but with some odd, little problems here and there.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family of 5 spent 7 nights in the grand tower, two bedroom with kitchen. Great location on beach with private lagoon that was great for children. No waves on lagoon but the water is colder then the ocean or pool. Having a kitchen was great. We went to a grocery store and didn't have to eat out three times a day. Plenty of restaurants located in resort and a good cafe open 24 hours located across the street. They have a great firework show every Friday night I do recommend staying here but don't recommend signing up for a vacation club member. My bad experience was I was a VIP they call it because I purchased 7000 points to try out one of many hilton locations. Of course I was told I could reserve my date Except for Christmas week because it would be booked up already. I wanted my vacation in July and it was booked up. I went online and also called to reserve a room in July without mentioning my VIP program I have. I found out there were rooms available but not for the VIP guest. So I had to go on vacation when it was convenient for hilton and not me...,,hmmm... That's backwards right?

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed 5 nights in August with 3 kids (16, 14, 12) and wife. The property is LARGE and operates quite well for what it is - a bit of a factory to hurry people in and out.Room was good size: 1 bedroom had 2 double beds and the living room had a pull out sofa. Also a kitchen with full size cooker, micro wave, dishwasher and washer / dryer. Bathroom: large - but 2 issues. Bathtub is in the same room as the room with the double bed! Shower - not sealed properly and there was always water on the floor every time someone used the shower.Service: friendly. We misplaced our ipad on checking out, and they were able to find it (was only 1 hour after we checked out)Location: the resort is a good 15 minute walk to the main part of Waikiki. We walked everyday for dinner to the main area as it was more active and better atmosphere. You can walk on the main roads (side walks) or on the boardwalk.Food: we didn't eat at the resort - not enough choice and preferred to eat outside the resort.Pools: very very busy with young children. Jumping around and on top of us. Parents had little control. Beach: direct opposite to the main pool is the best place to sit and enjoy the beach. No rocks. Warm water and nice waves.Lots of Japanese tourists (not negative, just stating whom to expect)Lounge: on the 8th floor is a lounge with water and coffee and computer/printer. It's big enough but the main benefit is a shower facility which we used late in the afternoon as our flight was not until late in the evening. Open at 08.00 and closes at 18.00.Lagoon: water is too cold and not as good as beach.Check-in/Check out: cannot believe checkout is at 10.00am and check in at 16.00!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton Hawaiian village provides us with very good servise and facilities. We enjoyed a vacation there. Especially, lagoon is very large and we did swiming and canoe. At Friday night fire works were very beuatiful.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the amazing Grand Waikikian Suites for the second half of our honeymoon (after spending a few nights at Kings' Land by Hilton Grand Vacations, which was also wonderful). We took the advice of many other reviewers and did not get a car. We used Spedi Shuttle to get to and from the airport, but a taxi would have been about the same price. Grand Waikikian is situated in a way that was easy for pick up and drop off for taxis, shuttles, and tours, so it's easy to get around. We took a tour to Hanauma Bay for Snorkeling, and that was wonderful. You can get access to a lot of tours from the hotel. My favorite was the sunset cruise that leaves right from the pier at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. It gave us spectacular views and was so relaxing. We set up the tours ahead of time, but there are discounts if you book tours when you get to the hotel because they give you a big coupon book. It is easy to walk around the area, and worth the two-block walk to Market Pantry, a real grocery store with better options and prices than the nearby souvenir stores. Get food from Market Pantry to prepare in your suite's kitchen. I wish we found it sooner. The souvenir stores and store in Grand Waikikian Tower are very expensive.The suite was breathtaking. It was so much larger than I expected. The patio was almost the full length of the side of the building! We booked a 1 bedroom suite with a city view. It was a gorgeous large comfortable room with a wonderful view. The tower is nicely situated on the resort, and it's easy to walk around the resort, to the beach, and to neighboring restaurants and shops. The resort is terrific. We enjoyed Benihana's and Bali Steak House and Tropics. Tropics was a great outdoor bar to relax in, but honestly we spent a lot of time at the outdoor bar at the hotel next door too. It's easy to find a place on the beach to unwind with a Lava Flow or Mai Tai and listen to live music. It was so relaxing to hang out by the beach. It was also relaxing to get a couples massage at The Mandara Spa. I couldn't imagine a nicer place to stay on Waikiki Beach! It was a perfect place to honeymoon.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The rooms are clean, modern, large and well furnished. Hardwire internet is available and fast. Our party stayed in 2 one bedroom suites. Each has a full kitchen. Good to have even we didn't do any cooking other than making coffee or heat up left overs in the microwave. There's washer and dryer in each room and was very convenient since no one wants to pack dirty clothes back in the luggage. This is part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village complex where there are 2 Starbucks. Beach is in back of hotel. The location is great. 15 min walk to the Ala Moana Mall, 20 min walk to mid Waikiki downtown shopping area. A National/Alamo/Enterprise car rental a block away, MacDonald's is in the corner of that building. Lots of local breakfast places within walking distance, Goofy café has good breakfast, just around the corner, Eggs n things, 15 min walk.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Not our kind of place at all... hugely touristy and overpriced everything... too many people and too many children/families... not the Hawaii experience we saw elsewhere on the islands.... of all the places we visited, this was the least appealing....

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is our 3rd family trip to the HGV resort in Waikiki. We have never been disappointed. The best beach in the Waikiki area. Oahu offers amenities similar to the mainland and also the beauty of countless beaches and breathtaking views. Outstanding resort, amenitites, and service. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I love this resort. We previously stayed in the hotel part of the resort (Rainbow tower) but this was WAY better. We had a lovely one bedroom condo with a full kitchen. It was totally equipped, even had a rice cooker. The place was impeccably clean. It is close to everything - walking distance to the beach. Yes, it is pricey, but no where else on Waikiki gives you the same, or even similar amenities. The only thing I wished after we got there....that I had upgraded to an ocean/water view. The city view was - well, just a city view.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Lost a pair of prescription eyeglasses of my daughter at beach side near hut at Lagoon in Hilton Village. Asked immediately about lost and found- they had no idea~ so went to our desk w bellman and when he escorted me to front desk to ask about L&F items she said "we're closed!" Laughed when I told her about my daughters glasses being lost. Close to $650 later, we went to Lenscrafters and have new glasses. They refused to check w other desks for lost and found items. Very rude. I asked a few days later thinking they may show up- same confusion as who to ask and where. Not planning any trips back to this property. We are a club owner so disappointing for us. Hotel could not accommodate the number of guest at this time of year in my opinion. Go to Kahala or marriott

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton Grand Waikikiian is an oasis of calm in the middle of bustling Honolulu / Waikiki Beach. If you are craving a beach holiday, but still want the excitement of nightlife and excellent shopping, this property gives you a good mix of both. We booked a two room premium suite for five adults and had plenty of space. The salt water lagoon was a wonderful change of pace from pool swimming, although the property also has several pools including one with a water slide that the visitors with kids seemed to love. We enjoyed the shopping on site and the CabaRae show at the Tapa Tower --- better than some Vegas shows that we've seen. If you want a Hawaiian luau experience, spend your money at the Polynesian Cultural Center and avoid the roof-top show at the Hilton. We had a view of it from our suite and it looked hot, uncomfortable and not very inviting when you consider the beauty of the rest of the facility. Overall, a great place for an urban vacation ---- but NOT the place if you just want to relax on the beach.
user_name:
Shelley B
St Johns MI, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton Grand Waikikian was great, BUT it is not the closest to the ocean of the Hilton properties. The Rainbow Tower is the closest, and the Lagoon Tower is just in front of the Grand Waikikian. That being said, we still had wonderful views of the ocean, but they were interrupted by both of these other buildings. Everything is expensive in Honolulu, and the GW is no different. I was surprised by the $29/day parking fee. I had not been told about this when I booked the reservation although they did give me a heads up about the Hawaiian State Tax which added over $50 to my overall bill for the week. Now for the more positive aspects. The room is as you would expect from Hilton, clean, comfortable and luxurious. The beds were super comfy. Clean towels abound. Dining and shopping are within walking distance as are several pools, a lagoon and a beach. The lagoon is a small manmade lake of ocean water with a shallow sandy bottom and beach. It has fish and you can rent pedal boats, paddle boards, etc. We didn't do any of those things, but the lagoon was nice. There is a large touch screen in the lobby which you can use to print boarding passes. However, my flight wasn't listed, so it didn't work for me. The night attendant at the front desk (yes, I procrastinated until 11:30 the night before we left.) was very helpful and we were able to get my passes printed out. Wish I knew his name. Anyway, everyone was generally very nice and helpful. Really my only complaint is the constant attempt to sell you more points, but they're not too pushy and they do offer free gifts in exchange for your time.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Just must realize that this hotel is downtown. Very commercial. It has the positive of lots of hustle and bustle if that is what you want. If not then choose a less populated area. We really enjoyed the different places to eat.
user_name:
Lawrence L. C
Henderson, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My HGV experience have always been excellent be it in the mainland USA or the islands. I greatly recommend timesharing with HGV in terms of investment and recreational experience. The accommodations provided exceed typical first class level lodging and recreational facilities. Its really in the great tradition that the HILTON name brand stood for.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Have stayed 2013, 2014, and 2015. Best placed My Family and I have ever stayed at in Oahu. The Lagoon, the beaches, the pools, and Lappert's Ice Cream were the most popular places at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for my family.
user_name:
Jesse Caldejon D
Torrance, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hotel and facilities are top notch. Prices are high, but comparable to other Hawaii prices. Not directly on the "strip" but within easy walking distance. Plenty of on site parking, however for a nightly fee. Much better to not have a car unless you absolutly need one. Plenty of public transportation available for less than the parking fees.
user_name:
Bryan P. T
York, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: 2bdrm with ocean view was amazing! The lagoon was PERFECT for our small children and family time. The village had access to a ton of amenities, dining options and high end stores. It was a bit loud as we were 14 floors above the pool and Lagoon, but couldn't get the view without it. Not cheap, but worth every penny!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I have always recieved excellent service and accomodations with my Hilton Grand Vacation timeshare. The units are fresh, clean and stocked with amenities and the staff is friendly and helpful. The Hawaiian setting is close to many fun and adventurous activities.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Terrific hotel! We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. It exceeded all of our expectations! The hotel was right by the beach. Our hotel beach had the best sand around. We went snorkeling right off the pier. The concierge was very helpful. Their were several concierge available to help at any time. We did not want to leave Hawaii! Although the hotel was beautiful, rent a car to see the other side of the Island. Honolulu is a big city. We enjoyed seeing the tropical part of the island also.
user_name:
Christopher Pet... J
Des Moines, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel staff was extremely helpful, friendly and accommodating! The resort was beautiful. The views are gorgeous - the only down side is this is in the city - the other side of the island is not a packed and more what you think of when you think of hawaii

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is central to Waikiki Beach and Ala Moana shopping centre. Its a village in its own right and you dont need to leave the village. Great Hotel and you will not regret staying here. Service is excellent

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Fun in the room had not been worked during our stay. I could not get 10% discount when my son attended the Camp Penguin progam as I was a member of Gold menber and insisted Manager and front desk staff that I was a gold menmber and had right to get 10% discount, but Icould not get it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Fantastic room equipped with kitchen, living room (pullout couch), two bedrooms, two bathrooms (one master). Plenty of towels and the concierge is very kind with providing extra sheets and towels. The kitchen comes with all of the essentials. There's laundry and a dishwasher. Perfect place to stay for a week. Maid service comes in once a week but can more frequently if request it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are HGVC owners and love having an apartment over a hotel room. The Grand Waikikian (GW) was a great place for our family. We had a room that overlooked the beach and lagoon. The kitchen was stocked with appropriate utensils and the beds were very comfortable. Since we were there for a little over a week, I loved the washer and dryer in the room so we didn't have to pack so much for our 2 week trip (we went onto the Big Island after a week at the GW). Our 11 year old loved the DVD/Playstation. While he enjoyed much of what HHV and Hawaii had to offer, he was also excited to play a few games "to keep his skills sharp" and we watched a movies at night and in the morning as a family.This is a "self-service" experience, housekeeping comes once a week and the concierge seems to be more of a sales agent for HGVC. As an owner this wasn't a surprise to us but if you are paying for a room or using points, something to be aware of. The little market off the lobby (Accent) was great and if you'd rather there are a number of ABC stores on the property to buy coffee, snacks and other necessities.If you want to be right on the water (rather than a few steps away), there are other towers on the property that are closer. We didn't mind the few extra steps since the Paradise Pool was literally right off the lobby (a family favorite). The HHV property is "like Disney" in that there is everything you can imagine on the resort and they get you coming and going on price. The only thing we wished they had had was better room service (because even with a kitchen there are times when you just want to kick back and watch a DVD without fixing your meal). The only thing that kept this from being a 5 is the internet was AWFUL and the air conditioner didn't go a great job at cooling the room at night (not sure why - the thermostat said is was cooler than it felt).

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: the Hilton Village in Honolulu continues to be one of my favorite paces to stay, the hotel grounds, staff and rooms are excellent. Everyone seems genuinely interested in making your stay pleasant and the amenities, places to eat, shop and recreate can't be beat. The Tropics bar is a great place to end the day.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Had a wonderful time at our timeshare in Waikiki. We come here often and enjoy the fact that we are so close to everything that we don't have to have a rental car to get around. Great restaurants. Beach access! A variety of pools within the complex and shopping all within the Hilton Hawaiian Village! No wonder we come here year, after year! It's always a great experience and great fun!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Was Lucky enough to be able to get a room, or should I say apartment at the Grand Waikikian and it was worth it. I am always used to the bog standard hotel room, the two beds, bathroom, tv and if your lucky a mini fridge and rubbish courtesy coffee and small kettle but this place knocked that out of the ball park. This is a full apartment fully fitted and furnished. A fully equipped kitchen with fridge freezer and ice maker. Cooker, microwave, coffee maker, dishwasher, washing machine and separate tumble dryer and every appliance you could ask for. Dining table, lounge area with surround sound tv and sony playstation. A bedroom with a fantastic kingsize bed another tv, huge bath for soaking in watching tv and another seoerate bathroom with a huge walk-in shower. You could honestly move in and live here, it has everything. I was actually arriving back and saying we are home. Also had a good balcony and a fantastic view over the beachfront area. The staff are fantastic, it is modern, clean and looks so new you could have been the first people there. You pay more for the stay here but when you consider we had a cooked breakfast every day on our balcony with fantastic views it was well worth it.It is set within the grounds of the 62 acre Hilton Hawaiian village on the prime location of waikiki beach. There are plenty of shops, bars and restaurants around the complex but you can pay a bit more due to the location. The grounds are fantastic, lots of ornamental ponds and waterfalls filled with koi carp and 5 swimming pools around the complex. The only drawback is it can be busy. The HHV is open to all and the place has various towers in the complex. Diamondhead, Ali'i, tapia, kalia, rainbow, lagoon and grand waikikian towers, so if you think your going to be on a golden deserted beach with no one around you will be dissapointed. The place can be packed especially on a friday night when they have a show and beach firework display open to all. It is a fantastic location and only a 10 minute walk to the ala moana shopping centre, more bars and restaurants than you could ever need and a vibrant night life. Overall a fantastic place to stay. My favourite places in the village was Benihanas Japanese Restaurant, where you sit at a table with your chef cooking your food in front of you. Round table pizza,(the kalua pig supreme has to be one of the best pizzas i have ever had), and next door Lapperts ice cream bar for dessert of a freshly made waffle cone and a double scoop of delicious ice cream (Mauna keys secret,vanilla with a raspberry swirl and chocolate fudge brownie pieces for me).....absolutely heaven. Fantastic apartment in a fantastic complex in a fantastic location. For me it was perfect but may not suit people wanting a quieter time. Be warned at the moment they are building another tower so there can be some construction noise around the diamondhead and tapia towers, especially the tapia pool and bar area, i was so chilled i hardly noticed it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a very nice property but not worth all the points it will cost you to stay here. The rooms are similar to any other HGVC property. (i.e. Florida) You could stay in the Lagoon or Rainbow tower which have better views than in the Grand Waikikian and cost you less $$ or points. Staff was nice, common areas beautiful. We went in late June and we always had a place to sit by the pool. The lagoon is absolutely the best! We rented a paddleboard for $29 for an hour and had a blast. We also utilized the professional photography service by the lagoon and Joseph was just so accomodating and a total pro, highly recommend! My biggest complaints are: 1) We were on the 8th floor and even though we booked a ocean view, it was not that great. I knew it wasn't great because everytime we went to the concierge and told them our room number, they said, oh, sorry you are on a low floor. 2) There is a large window in the bedroom and in the kitchen that only had a sheer, no blackout drape. We woke up everyday at 6 am due to the bright sunshine. Totally ridiculous. Use your points at a different tower.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the GW week of June 22 in a 2bd/2ba room. Room had a full kitchen which we utilized every day. Has a big balcony with 4 chairs and table. Partial ocean view. Building has 4 elevators which are fast. Fresh towels are provided everyday. Hotel provides 3 movie/video games kiosks. Has its own front desk and concierge. Pool with waterslides is just adjacent which you share with other Hilton guests. Towels are provided in exchange for towels cards that are given at check in. Beach is just a walking distance which we didn't mind. Saturday is the busiest time for guest departure and arrivals. The Hilton Hawaiian Village has lots of restaurants and bars, but a bit pricey. Better going out on town or cook in the room. There is Valet parking and self park garage for your rental. Overall stay was great. Family was happy and enjoyed their stay here at the GW.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We inherited a Hilton time share and were staying with family on a staycation. Advice on timeshare (Hilton or otherwise): Don't buy one -- horrible value w steep annual fees and very little re-sale value (expect below 25% of purchase price).

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very reasonably-priced (for Honolulu/Waikiki) luxury and convenience; wood floors, full kitchen (full-size fridge, dishwasher, microwave, stove, oven), washer & dryer, shower and large tub, furnished balconies with views, quiet rooms, flat screen TV's with HBO, Showtime and Stars, free DVD Movie and video game rentals, free coffee, laundry detergent, dishwasher soap, very clean rooms, with all the amenities that HHV has to offer, including direct entrance to the best pool on the property. They even let us borrow boogie boards, beach chairs and an umbrella (so we didn't have to rent them at the HHV's prices). Very clean, "new" feel to the whole property. Self-Parking was very convenient and easy access, no need for Valet. We would/will return.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The location of this hotel on the grounds of the Hilton Hawaiian Village is outstanding. The rooms are complete with kitchen facilities, separate bedrooms, free Wi-Fi, and very clean. Staff is terrific. Everything you need for a beautiful vacation is located on the property. You don't have to leave if you don't want to.
user_name:
Dale P
Hillsboro, OR, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This place is amazing! We came here to celebrate my parents 40th Wedding Anniversary. We stayed in a Penthouse Suite which I highly recommend because you receive breakfast and Happy Hour every day. The staff was awesome and so welcoming in the Penthouse Lounge and the hotel! They even called our room on our first morning there to wish my parents a happy anniversary. There is plenty to do in and around this resort. We did not rent a car so we either walked or took the Pink Line Bus which was run and super cheap to ride ($2 per person) We had several days of just lounging around the many pools and Ocean! I would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking to stay in Wakiki.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I have stayed in this hotel before, but this time as an owner I got a room I was not happy with. 1. partial ocean view, only if you got out on your balcony and looked through the other balconies could you see a small position of the ocean. But you main view was a very busy road with a lot of traffic, very noise if you dare to sit on the balcony. That did not happen. 2. We were put in a room for disability (ADA). All cabinets above were locked and everything was in the lower cupboards or on the counter very inconvenient. Living room had no coffee table or side tables. Very uncomfortable. 3. of course the closet was very small and everything touched the floor. 4 And I had to use extra points to stay in this room big rip off. It was one of the worst experience for a room that we have ever had. Be careful when booking your rooms and the direction they face because this was really stretching the partial ocean thing big time. City view would be more accurate. Attempts were made by manager to help use, but really it was a lot of talk more than help. Luckily outside the room we stayed most o time.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great hotel, great service and concierges were wonderful help with activities and area knowledge. The food prices were a bit much but an overall terrific trip! The water and the beach were beautiful. Swimming with the dolphins at Sea Life Park was the best!
user_name:
Diane L
St. Louis, MO, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed at the Grand Waikikian for a week (Saturday to Saturday) and loved it! The staff was great and friendly (hello to Dominic at the Tropic Restaurant) and it was a GREAT location. The "downtown" area was about a 15 minute walk away and there were so many options within the surrounding property that you honestly did not need to leave the property for anything but sight seeing. My only major complaint was the beach. There wasn't much shade, and you needed to purchase lounges and shades. The beach (including the man-made "lagoon" in the middle) is public property. So having a room key (or pass) should have made the chairs and umbrellas part of the package. Also the wifi service was spotty. Our devices would consistently be "thrown off" the internet. Once you were on, the speed was fine but getting on was the issue.
user_name:
NYSheDevil
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: There are still many reasons to stay at the island-styled suites of the Grand Waikikian. Just be aware that the rooms are showing signs of age. Our family reunion had two rooms, and problems included: dishwasher turned off abruptly, kitchen faucet leaked, and no phone dial tone. There's loose/damaged baseboard moulding, torn lanai screens, refrigerator was slightly tilted so the door swings open wildly, and wobbly dining tables. Management was ok to repair and offer a change of rooms. Perhaps inspect things yourself prior to unpacking. I like that the room telephone has built-in charging cables for smartphones and two USB ports. WiFi was spotty. The resort grounds and public areas continue to be clean and beautiful.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was a great location! At first I was a little skeptical, being that it was a high-rise hotel district! I was wrong. What a fantastic place! The hotel is part of a Hotel village with several pools, tons of shopping and restaurants in the area. The beach was great! I would stay again!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I'll go there again. 私の60歳の記念にと、家族10名でのハワイ旅行でした。私たち夫婦は何度かコンドミニアムに泊まっていますが、娘たちは始めてでした。ホテルと違いコンドミニアムは、家族が集まれる居間があるので、選びました。Hilton Grand Vacationsの利用は、今回が初めてでしたが、楽しく過ごせました。　また利用させていただきます。　来年は妻と二人で、自分たちが購入したホクラニ・ワイキキへ行こうと思っています。

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Everything at the Hilton Hawaiian Village is beautiful. My husband and I stayed for a week celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. The Grand Waikikian is one of the best places we stayed with out time share.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian is an extremely beautiful property with so many outside restaurants and shopping galore. The spacious one and two bedroom units come with everything you will need for a wonderful stay on Waikiki in Honolulu. Washer, dryer, televisions in all the rooms, full kitchen with all the items you will need if you plan to dine in. Just a wonderfully beautiful place!!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My dad is a owner at this place, he was very upset that when we got the room assigned, it was not a penthouse like what he thought he had purchased. come to find out, the sales people will show you the penthouse suites only and sell you a regular elite without even showing you the regular rooms, so beware of that. The accommodations were nice, upscale, but the air conditioning system is VERY weak. Yes I am aware that it goes off when the balcony is open. It is VERY weak when operating properly.Beware of the concierge, they are not a true concierge, since they will only push to sell you what HILTON offers, not help you with finding out other services, or facilitating communication or navigating through your other non hotel interests. The Luau, it was BEAUTIFUL, HOWEVER extremely expensive. we paid about 110 per person, and the food was ok, but the buffet was promptly picked up after 1 serving. ridiculous. The "free" maitais were marginal at best. The show was nice, the dancers superb and talented, but I would recommend doing some research for other luaus that are less than 100 per person, and not in a parking lot rooftop, which is where this one was, pretty disappointing and non Hawaiian-eske.The pools are nice, and are FULL of kids, which is ok, but the hot tubs should be adults only, and the staff barely enforced the age rule or occupancy rule in the hot tubs. I often saw 5,6,7,8 year olds packed to the rim in the hottub without supervision, and surely making it warmer with their pee. There is really no adult relaxation area in any of the pools so be prepared for that. The beach and lagoon are beautiful and no complaints there. The hotel itself is beautiful but there are about 5 towers that share the grounds, so you will see thousands of people all the time. It is expensive to eat everywhere, so take advantage of the kitchens in the suites. The dvd service worked well, and we watched plenty of movies. Don"t be fooled by your status, pr preferred guest experience card, or whatever they call it, like a VIP card that you are supposed to show and get "perks" or treatment. It means nothing. You are just a hotel guest, and will be treated like everyone else.If I was to return to the island again, and not staying with my folks at this place, I would look for something smaller, more quaint, maybe zero amenities, but on the north side of the island, where there are DOZENS of virgin beaches, with beautiful views. Maybe a B&B or something. There is a beach about every 3 miles on the north side with breathtaking views and feel.
