My advice, get a small B&B, rent a car, visit all the different beaches each day, and eat at the shrimp trucks. That is the Hawaii experience I enjoyed the most.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Good location, clean hotel, and great shopping located on site. Very near several local attractions also. Don't expect special treatment if you are a Dimond member, this is a HGVC location that saves that attention for timeshare members/owners.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: These apartments are beautifully appointed, and on the grounds of the Hilton Hawaiian Village, allowing you to take advantage of all the amenities there. We were greeted with an orchid leis for the women and kakui nut leis for the men. There are lotos of great restaurants nearby, you can watch the fireworks on Friday nights and you have the use of six different pools.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: At the doorway to Waikiki without the craziness of Waikiki! Great rooms with great views ~ Great beach access! Pools are a little small but with the beach there you can't go wrong. Restaurants around aren't bad, but nicer ones are a slight walk.
user_name:
Brenden David A
Salinas, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I'm an HGVC owner. The quality and upkeep of the rooms have deteriorated since they were new. I heard outside noise, and not all of the windows had blackout shades, so the room was lit up as though it had a couple of night lights turned on. This hotel has a lot of Japanese visitors which I do not mind at all, but the hotel seems to go out of their way more for the Japanese guests, than others. This is why I give a poor score for service. The Japanese guests were greeted with lei's and necklaces, and I had to go ask for one. This is the 2nd time I stayed at this location, and the 1st time wasn't much better. The dresser drawers were broken, and the refrigerator made noise. This is a 1st rate property ownership, so I expect more. Maybe my expectations are too high, but based on what I paid, and pay in yearly dues, I am sadly disappointed.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This property shares resources with multiple other Hilton proprieties and is a mile walk from the main beach in Waikiki. If you are ok walking around a lot, it is a good location. The staff was very helpful and kind. The HVAC, kitchen appliances and available cooking tools were pretty horrendous. It was always to hot or too cold and the oven and stove took over an hour to pre-heat. Some of the other properties are a lot nicer.
user_name:
Adrienne Lee E
Los Angeles, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As one of the time share owner, this resort is one of the best in Honolulu in my opinion. Enjoyed the privacy of this area. Close -walking distance- to ABC and other stores(mind you-there are high end shopping stores within compound if your wallet can afford). Fair price restaurants are many especially on Ala Moana BV which is a stone throw from this resort. The beaches around HGVC Towers area are superb and are not so crowded (compare to other beaches around Waikiki area). Bars are arm reach from hotel pools and (ocean) beaches for cool drinks. We really enjoyed breakfast at Rainbow Tower restaurant. Our family had a great time! Already planning for next trip for sure will stay at this resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location, accommodation and overall service were experienced by the whole family. Our permanent vacation destination whenever we are in Oahu on Waikiki beach where everything is accessible ranging from entertainment, shopping, relaxing on the beach to fine dining. A pampered and relaxed vacation spot indeed for the whole family!
user_name:
Ariel Aquino D
Fort Worth, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great rooms and very quiet. The pools are full of kids, which isn't great for someone traveling without kids. It is super close to the beach which was nice. Everyone was friendly. The dryer in the room takes forever to dry close and they come out so hot you can barely touch them. I have read this in other reviews.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Just got back from a family vacation where we stayed in several rooms in the Grand Waikikian. Great place. Checking in took a little too long but then again I was checking in over a dozen of family members in various rooms. The check-in staff did a great job not only getting us on the same floor but all in the same section - literally across the hall from each other. Rooms were awesome with all the amenities. Loved the kitchens with everything you need and then some - of course a coffee pot but it also came with a blender, rice cooker a more. Especially loved having a dishwasher and washer/dryer. Plenty of dish and laundry soap, coffee etc. We asked for more coffee and received plenty within minutes.Waikikian is part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village which may be huge but has numerous pools, a large beach, a lagoon and plenty of shopping. Since this was a family vacation with kids we spent most of our time at the pool next to the Lagoon Tower complete with two hot tubs, three slides and waterfalls. The kids loved it. I liked how the attendants were ready to help with an answer to a question or getting our food order but not pushy at all. They did a great job staying in the background. All-in-all a great time at a great place.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Lovely accommodations, friendly helpful staff - great pools on the property for families and for couples. I absolutely loved the lagoon. Honolulu is definitely a city atmosphere with all a city's hustle and bustle but Hilton does a nice job of maintaining a tranquil atmosphere here. Aloha!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Everyone was professional, the valet, concierge, front desk, housekeeping. We were treated like any other guests, although we were just staycationing ( we got leid too). They have free WiFi. Will definitely return just to unwind for a day or two. Very nice views of both water and city.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I've stayed at the Lagoon Tower and Kalia Tower before, so I had high expectations for the Grand Waikikian. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite and it did not disappoint. The room (separate bedroom, living room, kitchen) was nicely appointed and was very spacious. The bed was very comfortable and the room was nice and very quiet. The full kitchen was nicely stocked and was modern in design since it's one of the newer properties as part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village (HHV). They are building a new tower which should be completed in 2017. Everyone on staff was helpful and friendly, from the front desk to the bell personnel. We stayed for 7 nights and never had any issues with our room or cleaning schedule. I went with my girlfriend this time so for the two of us, the suite was more than adequate in size. When I stay with my kids (ages 13 and 9), it's better to request a 2 bedroom suite in the Lagoon Tower for the extra beds. Otherwise, it would mean squeezing them onto the sofa sleeper in the living room. The property is right next to the lagoon and steps away from the beach. It is close enough to the main stretch of Kalakaua Ave. with a short walk along the beach to get to the main shops and restaurants. We didn't eat at any of the onsite restaurants, but we did go to the convenient onsite ABC Store daily for drinks, snacks, sunblock, etc. Since it's away from the main stretch of Waikiki, it's quieter and you can always find an open spot on the beach to lay out without being too close to your fellow sun worshiper. The property is also close enough to walk to Ala Moana mall or a short 5 minute drive by car. Parking fees are a bit ridiculous ($37 / day) but the nearby parking structures are convenient and we never had any problems finding an open spot. Overall, the Grand Waikikian is currently the most luxurious of the properties in the HHV. They will ask you to attend a timeshare presentation, but just say no and you won't be bothered the rest of the trip. It's a wonderful property with a fantastic location and I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: the staff was awesome and great rooms at the waikikian. I love the lagoon. the location is great and it's close to everything. food and shops. the kids loved the pool and the slides. happy hour was great too.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed at resort for 7 days. Awesome two bedroom condo with full kitchen and great family room. Needed a better guide to daily activities, wanted to do tai chi but only offered 1 day. Supposed to have room cleaned 1 day, but didn't happen. Concierge was awesome, very friendly and knowledgable. Location was great, with mall and lots of beach fun. Watch out for parking fees if you have car. $37 a day. Over all a great place.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton Club and village is a lovely place to relax within a very busy city of Honolulu. We enjoyed walking along the beach, snorkeling, and taking the sail trips right at the resort. The musical performances were enjoyable as well especially some of the bands at the Tropics restaurant.
user_name:
John S C
Clinton, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian HGVC was a great place to stay. It was centrally located in the Hawaiian Village. The overall staff was very attentive, professional, and friendly. HGVC was steps away from the beach. The lagoon was beautiful. The village has everything you need. There is so much to do within walking distance or step out front and catch a trolley or the public bus.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: OMG...How can anyone have anything negative to say about this place. It's pure paradise. Yes it was other people there with kids but hell what do you expect from a vacation resort hotel. The Mai Tai's are true party starters. The Luau is a must. The rooms were definitely clean well until we tracked sand everywhere. The beds were perfect for a comfortable nights rest (too bad we were still on CST). If you want to see a beautiful place with great food. Grab your wallet and head here. You won't regret it.
user_name:
Ron S
San Antonio, Texas, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Clean rooms, inviting staff with welcoming presentation. Hilton Hawaiian Village is a great place for an all in one experience. You can catch a Luau, restaurants, shopping, and tour experience without needing transportation.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We just completed a trip to paradise! Enjoyed a 5 night stay at the Grand Waikikian to celebrate our anniversary and had a phenomenal time. We had a two bedroom unit as there were not any one bedroom units available but could not beat the ocean view we had from the 32nd floor! Great service from the staff we encountered - the unit was immaculate and quiet and fully stocked. If it weren't such a long trip to make (over 12 hour flight) we would make this an annual event!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have stayed at several of the Hilton Hawaiian Village towers. All are very good. This time we stepped it up a bit and stayed in the Grand Waikikian 3 bedroom Penthouse on the 35th floor. WOW! The service, amenities and views are first class.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our second time here and we still love it! Everything you need is on the property, pools, beach, lagoon, shopping, restaurants...no need to leave but if you do it is only a few blocks from downtown and more shops and restaurants. We have stayed in the hotel and the time share, both are wonderful. No complaints.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A great place to stay with a range of activities for different age groups. Easy access to deli type food. Lifts were efficient which was great in such a tall building. Pleased to have in room laundry facilities.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our second visit to this property. The Grand Waikikian remains impressive and is well maintained. Noise from busy Ala Moana Blvd is not noticeable inside suite. Staff and management are pleasant, engaging and eager to accommodate. Elevators, however, are a MAJOR PROBLEM; thus, loss of one star. We use our Hilton timeshare regularly and are happy with the properties.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Beautiful hotel with every convenience and ammenity.The best thing is the location. Friendly, helpful staff. Beach activities, nightlife, restaurants and shopping all just a short walk from your residence. Truely time in paradise !!!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and I stayed for a full week and were very pleased with the location, access to beaches, pools and the staff were excellent. I would highly recommend the entire Hilton Hawaiian Village location particularly the ocean view rooms.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton has gone out of the way to cut cost in their flagship Hawaii properties. No Diamond lounge / beg for an upgrade for a Diamond on the hotel side. Make the owner feel insignificant on the timeshare side, after the sales department promise you the moon. The manager on duty of this property did not allowed me to park on the side for 5 mins to check in because I was creating traffic, which would have been understandable EXCEPT he allowed six parasitic loiter taxi cabs to clotted up the right side of the driveway. So I submit you this: is the manager supposed to serve the taxi drivers, or the owners? The fact that I even have to ask this is very sad. If it is not for the Conrad hotels outside of the US there would be no reason for me to keep my Diamond status at Hilton.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great hotel to stay at if you have young kids and need kitchen and laundry facilities as well inside your room. Nice Hawaiian village with food and retail atmosphere. Centrally located to Waikiki shops and Ala Moana shopping centre.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is located on the far east side of the Waikiki strip.The beach in front of it is actually Kahanomoku beach, which is different from Kuhio Beach Park - the main beach all tourists flock to off of Waikiki Bay. This is good if you want a little more peace and quiet from the main strip, although the area is still very touristy. There is also a lagoon area exclusive to those staying at the Hilton and has rentals for paddle boards and paddle boats. There is also a surfing spot you can paddle out to from the hotel front. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to the Duke's statue and the main shopping strip on Kalakaua Ave.Wifi worked without a flaw, and the room itself was spacious and clean. We stayed in a one bedroom with two queen beds and a pull out sofa bed, totaling 6 people and it still felt roomy enough! There are washers and driers available, along with a dishwasher and microwave. Cooking utensils were present, although they did not have a spice rack like some other timeshares do. The beds and bedding itself were very comfortable and perfect for a good night's rest and the hotel itself is very quiet.The staff were friendly during the few times I interacted with them. Overall a good place to stay, especially would recommend for families. Other tips:There is a parking area next to the hotel that charges for $1/hour instead of the hotel's valet which was $30 a day. Park here and save some money because they also have weekday specials such as 24 hours for $12.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed in the 1 BR suite that had all: full kitchen, washer and dryer and one bathtub. The decor was nice and the unit very clean with nice views of the beach and the city. The front desk was helpful. Nice place to stay with a lot of restaurants and stores. They have a nice beach access with a lagoon in front of the resort. All in all it's amazing, we would stay here again all the times that we come to Hawaii...

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location on Waikiki Beach. Can't beat location. Walking distance to lots of dining and recreation options, but VERY TOURISTY. We spent 4 of 7 days on the North Shore...less crowded = more beautiful. Haleiwa was our hub. Great restaurants and food trucks. Pour favorites are Mackey's Sweet Shrimp Truck, Bonzai Sushi, and Matsumotos Shave Ice Surfing, snorkeling, visited Dole Plantation - surprisingly interesting and fun. Hiked Diamond Head - great views. Pearl Harbor was excellent. Visited Arizona Memorial - kids asked lots of questions. Detailed (1.5 hr) tour of Battleship Missouri really helped them put it into perspective. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I love Hawaii, but can take or leave Honolulu (I mostly leave it). This time, though - Honolulu was necessary. Relatives who "own" with Hilton Grand Vacations recommended the GW - and they were spot on. From the gracious presentation of leis/kukui nuts upon arrival to the "owners' lounge" available for those with late flights on departure day - the whole of our stay was relaxing. The tower is airy and beautiful - individual suites are casually elegant, well appointed (with American and Japanese small appliances in the kitchen) and quiet. There are numerous restaurants (for all budgets) and shops (not for all budgets) right on the property. ON Waikiki Beach (no road to cross), it's also an easy walk (one road to cross) to Ala Moana Mall, which has all the usual suspects, a cheapish food court and a GREAT used bookstore - Book Off - if you are looking for cheap beach books in English or Japanese.As for the beach itself, there is a sea wall near the hotel, so kids can paddle safely. The sea wall was also home to a remarkable number of sea cucumbers, urchins, crabs and fish. I was VERY surprised at how many creatures my son "discovered" in the heart of Waikiki. The rock-pooling is still FAR better at Ko Olina but you are a long way from anything down there.Friday nights there are concerts and fireworks (as seen on Hawaii Five-0). What a treat to watch the fireworks over the ocean from our balcony. Happy days, indeed.We had a car and found it relatively easy to get in and out of the self-parking. The parking is not cheap, but last year at Ko Olina (which is in the middle of nowhere, comparatively) parking cost $8 MORE per night. Build it in to your budget as yet another tourist tax.Two resort caveats: 1. The GW hot tubs were only open until 7:00 PM - and they were often full of tiny children, despite signs stating "No children under five". We were relaxing in the spa one night, when a man got in carrying a child wearing only a swim diaper. 2. The pool area - on the weekends - gets "visited" by local kids who hover around waiting for somebody to leave the gate unlocked, etc. Much as I dislike the wristband police (as seen at Waikoloa) - perhaps wristbands have become a necessary evil at the Waikiki pools. A pool full of kids (or indeed anybody) in grubby street clothes doesn't really fit the tone of the resort.Obviously these problems are ultimately the responsibility of rule-breakers - but I would have liked to have seen the property deal with the two above matters head on. I mentioned it to staff, and they just shrugged. Probably hard to police, but even so...NB: There are no private beaches in Hawaii, so remember that the "lagoon" outside the pool gates is open to EVERYONE, including the homeless guys that wash their clothes in it. Ultimately - I would stay again, the resort exceeded my expectations.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The ability to just walk out from the hotel and right onto a very famous beach without having to get in a car or walk across busy highways is great. A car is not a requirement here you can use The Bus system to get all the way around the island and see many of the sights. Plus there are many tours that can be taken.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The suite is very nice with hardwood floors, granite counters, comfy beds but maid service is only once a week. There are plenty of shopping and restaurants on the village grounds. You really never have to leave. Everything is expensive! The staff is very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It is early as possible, and you make a resevation to a concierge after check in if you want to go for a remote island tour! For the resevation of the remote island tour, it takes 3days. I do not get the resevation of the remote island tour,and,in the latter half of the stay schedule, there is a case not to be able to go for.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Cold room with no heating available, nor a way to adjust the cooling system without a hotel worker. Finally the problem was fixed on the fourth day. We were placed in a handicap room. All kitchen cupboards were locked and all dishes stored on the kitchen counter leaving little room for food preparation (breakfast). As well, due to the lack of space, the coffee pot was placed in an awkward space. The living room furniture was sparse, no coffee table, no end tables. The exterior deck had chairs but no cushions. The store's prices were very high, especially wine. In spite of all the room shortcomings, the location of the hotel on the beach, and the "village" concept with many boutique stores and restaurants was very good. The beach was excellent, and the swimming pools good. It was interesting to note that deck furniture had to be rented. Two chairs and umbrella added up to $55 for a day.
user_name:
Charles T. C
White Rock, Canada

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed in the 2 BR suites at the Grand Waikikian. The decor was nice and the room is very clean. Very convenient location since there are shops within the Hilton Hawaiian Village itself. It's also walking distance to the biggest mall in the city and walking distance to all the busy spots on Waikiki beach.
user_name:
Yar Luan Y
Indianapolis, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Nice place to stay. But it is in the heart of Waikiki and very "NYC like" If you're looking for a more relaxed atmosphere and true Hawaiian experience, you may want to by pass this hotel. Rooms and services great and have great beach access, very nice.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Just completed our third stay at the HGVC Grand Waikikian. It was excellent as always. The only compliant I have is the price for the self parking. At $27 / day, it is not really friendly for the family that rents a mini van for a week to take the kids around and pays more than $1/hr to park a car.
user_name:
Alec Eugene A
Carlsbad, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I really sometimes wonder if people who write these are totally clueless. This is a great place, and you can't find anything to complain about. There are restaurants right within the complex - there are something like 7 towers of condos/hotel rooms all adjoining and there is a steak restaurant, a tropical restaurant, a starbucks, a great buffet breakfast (Ok, $29.95 is ridiculous, so eat plenty.) A private lagoon, snack burger bar, tons of free stuff to do. And tons of expensive tours to do. My one and only beef is that our building had no workout room, you have to go about 4 buildings down. Beautiful furnishings, upgraded kitchen (we had a 2-br). We had the 18th floor partial ocean view room, and it was truly lovely - overlooking the rainbow tower, and the lagoon, plus the beach. Expensive? Yes, Hilton Quality and Hilton Pricing? Add on Honolulu crazy pricing? Yes. But the food was literally to die for. EVERY MEAL!!! Research places and you will have a blast and eat wonderful food. Go to the ABC Store and pick up drinks, and there is a grocery store about a 5-minute walk away.A++++++++ - PS, Everyone and I do mean EVERYONE was super Friendly :)

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We recently spent 6 nights at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. I chose this resort largely due to the reviews on Trip Adviser so I feel compelled to write a bit about our experience. Overall, I felt it was average at best, contrary to the glowing reviews. I will start with the pros. The value of the room was good in my opinion. The room we stayed in was large and reasonably up to date. The beach at this location is fantastic for kids. They have a very large beach area in addition to the lagoon. My kids loved the beach. The property is nice and there are lots of fish and animals for the kids to look at. My 2 year old really enjoyed the fish. Now for the cons: Service was poor. The front desk staff was unhelpful at best. The concierge was even worse. I asked if they could help me find size 5 diapers nearby and they simply told me to go to Walmart. I also went to book a luau however the one at the hotel was booked. I asked the concierge if there were any other vendors for the tickets or if there were any other luaus nearby that we could use instead and she snapped "I have no idea" and moved on to the next guest. I requested late check out since our flight was not until evening and the staff would only extend it until 11am. Regular check out time is 10:00am which made for a very long day with no where for the kids to sleep. Food - This was the biggest disappointment. There are many places to eat on the property but we found the food quality to be poor. The food was generally flavorless and poorly executed. It was also very expensive, which is to be expected somewhat at a resort, but a pancake breakfast for 2 adults and 2 kids shouldn't be $96. I will qualify this by saying we are really into food and have pretty high expectations for it. The food here was a half step below Chili's or TGI Friday's quality. Location - It is located at the far end of the strip so there is not much in the way of food within walking distance if you don't like the food on property. This meant that we had to either eat the poor food there or deal with getting a cab and driving somewhere several times a day. Overall, I would not stay here again. The service and food just made it an unpleasant experience.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: While the accommodations are very modern and upscale, be prepared to hunt for locations where to eat. The hotel does not offer any food service. You must leave the hotel to find a place to eat. For lunch and dinner this is OK, but for a quick coffee and Danish in the morning go hunt for a Starbucks and stand in line for at least 30 minutes. Also, there is no fitness facility in the hotel. However, if you wonder around long enough and ask enough Hilton employees someone will eventually guide you to the unmarked fitness center.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We were here in mid March 13, 2015 on the 17th floor with a partial ocean view. All the rooms on our side of the hotel look out over the street and the ocean can only be seen from the balcony and even then it's tiny and between 2 buildings. The worst thing was the traffic noise. We had to have the balcony doors closed the whole time! The building is a time share and because of this there were no rooms to move to nor to upgrade to. The manager could not help. If it was not a time share we would have upgraded to a better room but this place has around 95 per cent occupancy. the room was very nice, 1 bedroom, but it's a 10 min walk to the beach. We ordered pizza from Wikki Pizza, it took more than 2 hours NOT to arrive. I went to collect it after calling them and when I arrived it was siting in the warmer and the server said she would make a new one if I waited for that, after 2 hours I just too the luke warm pizza. By the way Wikki Pizza is really Fresh Connection, so you can imagine how long it took me to find the place called Wikki Pizza when there no shop sign saying Wikki Pizza only Fresh Connection. Why? I would not stay here again and would not stay at a time share ever again. We foolishly bought the 7 day pre-paid package when we stayed in New York Hilton, booking the place was a nightmare really because of all the international phone calls and as we "only" booked 3 months in advance, you would think that might be enough, but they were only able to give us limited options. Apparently their website says what a partial ocean view really is, for us a Street views with a bit of water if you go out on the windy noisy balcony. We tried to get lunch at one of the Hilton Village restaurants near the beachfront. it was just after 2 PM and even though there were lots of empty tables, we were told it was a 10 minute wait! Why? Avoid going to the time share type sales fest, that's how we got stuck with this establishment. By the way check in is not until 4 PM so if you are coming from Australia it is very annoying after a long flight. We were told that they would call us if a room came up, they didn't but we spoke to a helpful male check in person who got us in earlier than 4, whereas the female check in person did not put herself out to call and say we could get an earlier room. If you are from Australia you will probably be very disappointed with a partial ocean view. I don't think the the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission would let the Hilton get away with such a misleading description of the room. I pity the manager having to defend that description when it's so obviously a city view or road view. I gave it 2 stars because the room is very nice. Two bedrooms on the ocean side would have been better but we not available when we booked. Mind you I haven't seen the rooms so I would check out the guest photos if you are tempted. The cleaners on our level were great.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Outstanding people running the hotel. Great service and hospitality. Room was very clean and spacious. Showers and toilets were very clean. Outstanding view of the ocean and plan to return on our next vacation.
user_name:
Stanley K. O
Miliani, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed in a wonderful 1 bedroom suite for 4 days on our honeymoon as part of HGV. The accommodations were great with a full kitchen, washer/dryer, beautiful bathroom with separate soaking tub & giant shower, private balcony, and living area. Plenty of shopping, dining, pools, entertainment available on the resort itself but it is about a 15 minute walk to the Waikiki Beach Walk and other stores. Plenty of activities can be arranged through the hotel from what we could tell although we did all our planning on our own. Eating on site is a little pricey but you're paying for the convenience.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent resort to stay at in Hawaii. Great location for shopping, dining and access to the beach. Friendly and helpful concierge. Would recommend this hotel to others. The timeshare experience is value-added as it is not pushy but rather informative.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife, two young sons, and I stayed at the Grand Waikikian at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in January 2015.We found the service at this particular hotel to be exceptional. There was a big greeting and the staff couldn't do enough to help my family and I. We got to the hotel early so the room was not ready which we knew would likely be the case. However the staff were able to accommodate our request to check in early within a couple hours which was great because the kids were tired. The staff throughout the stay were excellent.We were in a one bedroom apartment which had a full kitchen and laundry which came in handy during the 5 night stay. The room was super clean and spacious, which met our needs with the two kids. We had a partial ocean view, which was nice and allowed a view of the fireworks on Friday night that the resort runs each week.The Grand Waikikian was the best option in the Hilton Hawaiian Village as the rooms were large and had the best pool. It was also very close to the man made lagoon and beach. The Hilton property itself is massive but has plenty of facilities including more pools throughout and a nice spot on the beach. The hotel is less than a 10 minute walk to the big Ala Moana shopping centre which was convenient. It is about a 20 minute walk into the main part of Waikiki but it was a nice walk and was a good way to get some exercise and stretch the kids legs.My son loved the pool at the Grand Waikikian which had multiple water slides, all of varying thrill levels.This was our third visit to Waikiki but our first to the Grand Waikikian. Overall we had an excellent stay and would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I spent a few nights here, and was very satisfied with the property. The Hilton Hawaiian village is HUGE. It is a city unto itself. You could conceivable spend your entire vacation within the village (which would deprive you of the real Hawaii). There is so much to do on their property, and they do it well.The Grand Waikikian Suites are located at the far end of the property. The entrance was a little tricky to find in the night, but once you drive there, you will find it again easily. If you stay at this property, you may consider renting a car for only part of the time as do not need a car in the Waikiki area. There are buses and taxis available to move up and down the central area. What you will pay for this transport will probably be comparable for the parking fee that you will pay to store your car at this property. There is no street parking here.The entrance to the hotel was packed with vehicles upon our arrival, but the valets did a good job of moving the crowd along. After being initially annoyed by the crowd (probably due to a 16 hour travel day), I was impressed that we got through so quickly. Yes, chill - you are in paradise!Upon entering the lobby, I was struck by its quiet, understated elegance. The check-in area is located in an open-air area, and was nicely appointed. Check-in was quick and painless.We had reserved a two-bedroom unit. The elevator to our wing was a bit of a walk from the lobby; but, as indicated, this property is quite large.The unit was nice. We had 2 balconies: one off of the living room and one off the second, smaller bedroom. This actually worked out nicely in that one couple had the benefit of the master bedroom with en suite bathroom and the other couple had the benefit of the balcony. Everybody wins!Our balconies were truly enjoyed. We were located quite high up. Our living room balcony faced the water, and the second balcony had a street view (with a water view far to the left). We enjoyed coffee in the morning on the main balcony, and I spent late nights on the second balcony immersed in my book. Although it was a city view, it felt private and serene due to the height.The remainder of the unit consisted of the full-sized kitchen, small dining area and small living room area. There was a sofa bed in the living room. Two adults slept on it and they were fine. I did find that the common living areas were smaller and less spacious to the Marriott Vacation Club units in Ko Olina.The Hilton unit is a little older than the Marriott. It was in very good condition, but if they do not continue to maintain it, it could easily slip into feeling dated. It's not there yet, but the modern feeling is missing.The lack of "newness" is more than made up for by the sheer greatness of the Hilton Village. We had planned on making breakfast in the unit, and even bought groceries in the convenient (but a bit overpriced) ABC store that was downstairs (an on every corner of Waikiki). Coming from the East coast of the USA, the time change saw us non-morning people awake early every day. We decided to try the hotel breakfast buffet the first morning as we were feeling lazy the morning after our long travel day.We were initially annoyed (yeah, I know - paradise) by the fact that the hotel breakfast buffet is located in another building located a nice walk away from the GW. After walking through the beautiful grounds and along the beautiful beach, we arrived at the restaurant. Although crowded, we were seated fairly quickly.The buffet was $40 per person - pricey for a hotel buffet. But what a buffet! Choices, choices, choices! In addition to regular breakfast choices (omelets, sausages, bacon, waffles, pancakes, etc.), there was seafood, Asian cuisine, carving stations, etc. It is more of a brunch buffet than a breakfast buffet. We thoroughly enjoyed this buffet. In fact, all ideas of cooking breakfast were disregarded and we ate our $40 breakfast every day of our stay. There were no complaints about the expense as we felt it was worth it. After the buffet here, we didn't need to eat lunch. It is also important that I add that the wait staff at the restaurant was among the most outstanding of all the hotels during our visit. They were truly an exceptional set of people.We spent our first recovery day relaxing in the Hilton Village. There a multitude of stores to stroll through, beaches and pools to visit, and places to discover. I could see spending a week at the property simply because it would behoove you to dedicate two days to simply enjoying the resort. It would be a mistake, however, to miss everything else that Oahu has to offer.I enjoyed the property, and would visit here again.Happy travels!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is the first time we've stayed at this tower as it was being built last time we were there and it is well laid out and beautifully presented. The one bedroom we stayed in was a good size for a small family of 4, it was well thought out for the space. The cooking facilities were good and the laundry was convenient. Elevators were fast and the pool well maintained. There is an ice bucket in the room but myself and a guest from another room could not find the machine on our floor, perhaps it is in the lobby. Be aware, on the 26th floor housekeeping comes at about 9am, so if you have had a late night you will want to put the do not disturb sign up.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent 4 nights in a 1 BR suite on the 30th floor. After arrival we walked to the nearby Wal-Mart to stock up on groceries then explored the grounds of this huge property. This tower is very well-maintained. Our suite was modern and beautiful, everything worked perfectly. The beds were very comfy and our family of 2 adults / 2 teens had plenty of space. The elevators were fast, which was important because the kids were always eager to get out to the pools and ocean. We loved using the mornings to walk along the beach walk, then return along the street. It's a busy vibe here, which is just what we were looking for. The beach was crowded but not so much that you couldn't find a spot for yourself. I give the property / room 5/5 but there were a few downsides when we compare it to other places we've stayed - getting into the ocean at this spot is difficult due to very sharp rocks right near the edge. None of us could walk in, we had to sit down and either float over top of the rocky area (only a foot or two deep) or crabwalk out. I ended up with a bad cut on my hand doing this, and my husband cut his foot. Once you get past this though, it was nice swimming. The snorkeling out further was OK but you are quite close to the reef and there's not a lot of clearance. The Paradise pool that was closest to our tower was always packed. We were lucky to find a single chair to put our stuff on which was OK since the kids were always in the pool anyway. This is a popular spot for very young children, so if you want to relax in the hot tub you can't do it here - there will be a small child cannonball in every few minutes with no parent in sight. One afternoon we came through to find that it was closed for "sanitation". It was opened again the next day. The lagoon is beautiful! Although we never swam in here, it was a popular spot for people trying SUP or kayaks. The bazaar is a really neat spot, and we went there every day just to peek in windows and take in the atmosphere. Shave ice was very good, but expensive here as we found later on in our trip.Overall this a great property and we would for sure stay here again. We didn't really need staff often, but they were helpful and friendly. We loved our leis on arrival, that was an unexpected touch! There is lots of shopping nearby, including several rental car agencies across the street. Due to a severe allergy in our family we are unable to eat out often, so it is wonderful when we can find a kitchen suite in a nice hotel so that we can prepare our own food but still get the hotel experience.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: What's not to like. The room was beautiful, the staff was attentive, and the view was everything I had hoped for. We stayed in a one bedroom but I am sure the others are lovely too. It was just a short, easy walk to the pool, lagoon, ocean, and many other attractions. We did not have a car and never needed one because there is so much to do right on site.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a fabulous resort hotel! I was very impressed with the resort as well as the room and speed of the elevators. The staff at the hotel were helpful and friendly. Overall our experience was great and it was quite easy to decompress and enjoy the visit.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian within the Hilton Hawaiian Village is the premium set of accommodations currently in the Hilton Grand Vacation Club at this location. Their future tower, The Grand Islander, is going to be a little better weʻve heard, will have a fitness center and pool. This tower has itʻs own exclusive pool with kidsʻ water slides and their own parking area. It didnʻt have itʻs own fitness center though, which we had to walk to the Kalia tower for that.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you have children, it is comfortable and spacious room can take. This is useful because the kitchen equipment is also aligned, but there was a little dirt. Here is how to use appliances that do not accustomed to Japanese. Was good and there is a detailed manual. But in this room and it was a hard time because had not been available.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikkian is location on the norherly side of the Hilton Hawaiian Village property. Nice location to exit the property. The biggest downer is lack of adequate ADA parking. ADA parking is located on the 4th floor of the garage structure. It would make more sense to locate ADA parking on the second floor by the lobby. This seems to be an Oahu thing, because ADA parking on the whole island is scarce. The northerly side one bedroom plus king room is large and well equipped. The balcony view overlooks the Ala Wai and Ala Moana area. The room has all the entertainment needs. The king bed is comfy with nice pillows for a good sleep. The duvet is the top sheet, so make sure you tuck it in or your feet will find the end of the comforter. Other than that, it's a great night's sleep. The kitchen has all the modern appliances and utensils. The room has up-to-date TVs. The bath is nice, but doesn't reflect the quality of the room. The shower stall is a bit outdated for a Hilton. The water temperature and pressure is fine for a nice shower. The shower stall could use more shelving. The large bath tub is nice, but no spa jets. Towels nice and clean. The whole unit was clean and fresh smelling. A/C is very nice, but opening the sliding glass door is better for a nice island breeze. The property has free WiFi, but can be spotty at times. The property has everything on-site, but food variety is limited in taste. All in all, a very nice stay.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hotel rooms are very spacious, equipped a full kitchen, separate living room and bed room. Check in is very fast, but staffs are moderate, below expectation. For HH members, 1000 points and two bottle water are offered as welcome gift. The last thing, what is a partial sea view room, it's to see the sea view from the buildings gap, so I recommend you save the money, do not book the partial sea view room. Generally, this hotel is of good valve, I give it four stars.
user_name:
Nelson_Eric
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Loved the location, loved the room, loved the service. Food prices were very high, but hey, it's Honolulu! Closes shops were a plus. We stayed at Rainbow Towers on our Honeymoon and thought we'd go back for a few days. Still a great place.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Just got back from our 1 week stay at the Grand Waikikian - must say that we had a wonderful time. The Grand Waikikian is part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village property so the property is huge and there's a lot to do. I liked that there was a lagoon which was perfect for my 2 year old who wasn't so fond of the waves on the beach. She was a lot more comfortable playing in the lagoon so that was perfect. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was nicely appointed. The appliances were a bit tired but it was still great as a family of young children to have a kitchen and washer and dryer. Loved that there were various activities for us to do on the property - unfortunately my kids were too young for the penguin club, but every Friday there are fireworks and also an outdoor movie for kids as well. The two complaints that I had was when we called to get coffee filters for the coffee machine (that is provided in the room) we were told that they don't provide coffee filters. Didn't make sense, why would you provide a coffee machine that needs filters but not provide filters. So after asking to speak to the supervisor we were told that they were out of filters, not that they don't provide them. That was a little frustrating when you aren't provided the correct information and also when you can't get the necessity to operate an appliance. Also we got a little card in our room offering us a free box of chocolates from the concierge, I made the mistake of going to pick up the chocolates - it's a ruse to get you to go see concierge so they can try to book you in for a timeshare session (we don't own any timeshare, a friend of ours does and let us use his for our stay). So just we aware of that if you get the same card. But besides that we did really enjoy our stay.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We purchased this week as part of a deal after previewing time shares in Las Vegas. Getting here was very nerve wracking, poor communication misunderstandings. I must say until the day we arrived I was nervous about what we were getting.We were given a beautiful 2 bedroom 2 bathroom condo with a full kitchen, washer dryer, 2 living area, and 2 large balconies one that overlooked the ocean and the Paradise Luau. There is no room service and housekeeping only comes once a week, but each time we called for anything they would bring it up quickly. Excellent customer service, from check in to check out, every employee always greeted us with a friendly hello and how can we make your visit better. The rooms were large, clean and nicely decorated. Both bathrooms had glass showers, one bathroom had a shower and large garden tub. The kitchen had dishes, flat wear, pots and pans, cups and glasses. Your also provided with a roll of paper towels, dish washing soap and laundry soap. complaints we spent 1700.00 on this package but received no Hilton points.The bedrooms got very warm at night.The pools, you can reserve your pool seat and people would go down early in the morning and reserve large groups of pools chairs, half the day those chairs would sit empty while dozens of people wandered around looking for a place to sit. Also there is no adult pool so don't plan on a relaxing swim, I love children but sometimes you just want a quiet place to relax, the pools here are not that place.Parking is 36.00 for valet and 27.00 for self. Self parking is actually much more convenient as the elevator to the parking garage is closer to the rooms, since most people tend to valet there were always several spots close to the elevator.As part of our package we had to listen to a 90 minute presentation, it was relatively painless and Paul the salesman only cared about what he was saying, he chastised us like bad school children every time we tried to ask questions, and he was not aware that Vermont was a state ( we asked him. About resort property in Vermont and he snapped you need to tell me what state Vermont is in if you expect me to look it up). But he was just a 90 minute irritant.For the most part it was a beautiful property though in a great location, the package was money well spent.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Yes, the good things that have been written about location--walkbility and access to shopping, restaurants, etc--are very true. But when I look at this property as an HGVC owner (Kingsland and Vegas) and an Elite Premier member, I notice the "little things" that are lacking:No bathrobes in the room;No coffee packets in the room;No comp bottles of water--the tap water is awful;A very minimal number of bathroom amenities--1 shampoo, 1 conditioner, one bath gel, 1 soap;Short and very thin towels at the "Paradise Pool" (useless on the beach); andImpatient Concierge staff (unless you are Asian).This would not be my choice if I wanted to return to Honolulu. If you plan to stay here, bring a lot of personal items with you.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family and I stayed 1/17-1/19. We stayed as a first time visitors to the hotel, as we along with my parents own a timeshare with the Hilton Grand Vacations. We wanted to get a feel of what the rooms would be like, and how hard or easy it was to stay.We are Kama'aina, and were celebrating my husband's 40th birthday. 1. No “early check in”. We were told that with the credit card, ALL we were guaranteed was a 4 PM check in. Nothing more.2. The floor in the master bedroom, there was duct tape on the transition from the carpet to the tile to the bathroom. When maintenance arrived, they pulled it up to see that there was missing carpet, and rather than fix it - they placed black duct tape over it.3. The surround sound out in the living room, sitting area - did not work. When Dan called to find out how to work it, after following the directions there were in the room we were told the surround sound doesn’t work.4. Dan asked where the remote for the DVD player in the master bedroom was, he was told to use the PS3 controller. So, basically there was no remote for the DVD player in the master.5. Magazine in the room that shows all their restaurant specials, Hastuhana’s was out of date. They had a happy hour special of 50% off sushi printed, and when we went into the restaurant we were told that that special was not active anymore for a year. They refused to honor it, even if the magazine was for Jan/Feb 2015.6. There were lots of dirty walls and a hole in the lanai screen. Dishwasher did not have the full cycle completed, so when we got into the room there was a beeping noise that took me a good 15 mins to figure out what it was. It was the dishwasher, and the door had been pulled open rather than run the full clean cycle.7. The biggest thing was that we felt like since we were not Japanese tourists, we were not the most important guests on property. We were told that the room we got were the “leftovers”. I think management needs to work on their customer service skills when it come to non-Japanese tourists/guests. I checked trip advisor’s website, and that seems to be the running theme for the reviews of guests that were not from Japan. I noted lots of guests from Australia that felt that because they were not from Japan, they were not treated with the same level of service as the Japanese tourists. So, when this happened to us - it wasn’t surprising. 8. Dirty sheets in the 2nd bedroom.9. I was told at check in that there would be no maid/housekeeping service. So, we made the “error” in thinking that the do not disturb sign was not needed. Well, apparently we were wrong. On the 1st morning we got an early wake up call when the maid knocked on our door yelling housekeeping, while also trying to enter our room. Supposedly there was an error made on their housekeeping sheet saying that the room we were in was vacant and she was trying to enter the room to change out the room binder. (This is the binder that shows hotel information, numbers to restaurants, etc) I had opened the door, and the maid appeared to be shocked that there were guests in the room. Overall, while we enjoyed the stay and the boys had fun - the Grand Waikikian has a lot to improve on. If anything next time, I would reserve a room at the Kalia tower or the Lagoon tower. I think we’d get better customer service and more consistent rooms.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Upon checking in our 1 Bedroom Premium Ocean view at the Grand Waikikian Tower my wife and I smelled an overpowering floral scent in an attempt to mask a foul burnt curry smell in our room. As an owner I was disappointed and immediately called for a manager. John Reagan called me promptly and i invited him to conduct smell test which he did. As soon as he arrived he accommodated us and moved us to another fantastic room ocean view. Kudos to Mr. Reagan as he represented the Hilton brand to the fullest. As an owner and Elite level member this is why I continue to encourage my friends to buy this HGVC brand. Thank you John for making our 30 year wedding anniversary a memorable event!!!! Mahalo!!!David and Renee

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have stayed in Waikiki beach hotels many times in the past but this was our first experience staying in a condo. This condo far exceeded our expectations & we can hardly wait to go back. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were treated as important guests. Thank you so such a wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The room was noisy and dirty, and the concierge was unknowledgeablne and rude. I felt more like a hotel guest at a 3-star hotel than a $50,000 time share owner!! I will definitely not stay at the GHrand Waikikian again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have stayed at the property 3 times in the past 2 years. Although it is part of the "Hilton Village" with access to the shops and dining establishments, this property is quiet and without all of the crowds and noise of the Main Hotel. The rooms are nicely laid out and the full kitchen gives you the option to not "go out" for every meal.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Grand Waikikian Suites. We had a 2 bedroom suite and we were happy with the accommodations minus the tricky pull out sofa bed which was very difficult to put back together. We were very happy to have the washer/dryer and over/dishwasher/microwave to use. It came in handy and saved us loads of money on food. We were disappointed however that we were given a lower floor room as we generally are given a better room with a view since we have Diamond status with the Hilton chain. We were staying on our time share points this time and found that our service was more lackluster because of it. The staff was nice enough, but we have had better. The bell service was the only exception. They were superb and worked like a well oiled machine with people checking in and out at the same time. The rest was fairly average. We did enjoy the pool and of course, just being in Waikiki is nice.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The rooms and the building are relatively new, clean, large and enjoyable. Good value if one is a member of the owners group. The internet is poor to extremely poor. Hotel pools' water is cold to icy cold. Pool Chaise is never available unless you arrive there around 8 to 9am.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: To begin, we loved our stay at the Grand Waikikian. We have stayed here in the past...and enjoyed it...and, we enjoyed our time here again.Here are some pros and cons:1. While some items are expensive, for example $9.50 for a hot dog, much on the property was pretty much on par for other resorts around the world. We travel quite a bit, and we were not completely shocked by some of the prices. During happy hour, cocktails are $6---not too shabby. Look for deals, and you may find them!2. The Paradise Pool (with the waterslides) has been closed twice in the last 3 days due to 'issues'...to be honest, the issue is the number of kids in the pool! Today it was 'code brown'. Yuck! But, by having so many kids in the pool, accidents are bound to happen. We have a child with us---but, with potty breaks, accidents in the pool are unlikely! 3. We have a partial ocean view. We love looking outside at the beautiful water/ships/planes/people. But, at night, the luau and fireworks show and parties on the property tend to be noisy. The noise seems to be caught in a tunnel that reverberates noise into the rooms. We had a city view for 3 nights...not a great view.... but, quiet!4. Hotel is 7-10 minute walk to Ala Moana shopping center. Very convenient But, a bit of a distance to downtown Waikiki. Perhaps a 15 minute walk to the main street. A nice, safe walk, though. Bus stop are outside. And, the transit system is pretty cheap $2.50 (ask for a transfer!), and buses run often.5. Staff is very helpful and courteous. 6. Our 2 bedroom suite is spacious, clean and modern. We LOVE having a washer and dryer in suite. While it takes forever to dry our clothes (?), it is very convenient!7. ABC on site is great...one can stock up on essentials like water!8. While chairs at pool look hard to come by, we have not had a problem at all! We have found available chairs everyday!9. Drycleaning service is great....sent 2 blouses out in the morning...I had them back by the late afternoon!10. No daily housekeeping...only every 4 days or so...but, they are more than willing to bring up whatever you may need. 11. Free WIFI. Hard to log on at times, but it was FREE..and, after a few tries, we were always connected!Overall, we love the HHV site...and we really enjoy staying at the Grand Waikikian! We will be back!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is the sixth time we've traveled to Hawaii and the Grand Waikikian is our favorite tower. We were surprised at the lack of aloha from the front desk staff-this was in all of our transactions at the front desk. The bell service guys have it down! Perhaps it's a training issue. The furniture seemed a little tired in our one bedroom, but that's not why we visit HI. We had a flooding issue in our room-no fault of the hotel (came from the room above), but I was surprised at the lack of concern for our well being. It occurred at 11:15pm. We called down to the front desk and they were prompt in getting us moved. The bell man was the only one who apologized to us (see first paragraph). The next day was our check out and there was no mention of the move. We never heard from anyone to see if we were okay. Quite surprising. That's not going to keep up away, but it makes us wonder about being a valued HGVC member.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed everything except that the restaurants were expensive and not better that off property ones and that you had to pay for beach chairs and umbrellas. The beach towels were too small too. The room was excellent, clean, kitchen was complete and it was all tastefully done. Most condos pale in comparison. Nothing was or felt cheap. The staff was great. High quality experience all around!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our two bedroom suite was well appointed. We had a very relaxing stay. There is no maid service, but the rooms stayed clean with just two older couples. There is a full kitchen, so we had breakfast in the room every morning.The location is at the edge of Waikiki, walking distance to all of Waikiki and also Ala Moana. Because it's on Waikiki, it felt a little cramped. We usually stay on the big island or Maui, where resorts have more spacious grounds.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A lovely large two bedroom unit with plenty of room for 6. Enjoyed the full kitchen and the space to move, plus a generous balcony. Further from the main restaurant area than many hotels but still only a 10 minute walk and close to Alana Moana shopping centre. Bigger beach area than most hotels, free wifi, no resort fees and a lovely spacious feel about the lobby.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and I travelled with our three children, their spouses and three grandchildren. Between us we had three suites for two weeks, all five star in terms of space, furnishings and outlook. Located in the Hilton Hawaiian Village, all tastes are catered for - with several pools, a lagoon and direct beach access. The water slides were a big hit with the grandchildren while the variety of shops, entertainment, bars and restaurants throughout the Village were a big hit with the adults. The staff are friendly, knowledgable and helpful. All up, we couldn't fault anything at all about the Grand Waikikian and will not hesitate to stay there again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: On this visit, we stayed at Hilton's "Grand Waikikian." This is Hilton's latest resort to be added with the final tower to be be in place by 2017 (projected).This latest tower sits behind the "Lagoon Tower" but interconnected with adjoining lobbies.The front of the lobby where you check-in is lavishly decorated and reminds me of "Disney's Grand California Hotel" in Anaheim, California. There are mahogany wood fixtures throughout the interior hallways with see through wood carvings. There is a fish pond on one end and a waterfall that leads to an outside pool complete with hidden slides.The complex has 39 floors, five of which are penthouses and require a special card key. Our room, which was on the 29th floor offered us a nice view of the surrounding area. Unfortunately we only had a partial view of the ocean, which we are accustomed to during our stays here.The suites are lavishly decorated and comes equipped with a fully stocked kitchen, two baths, Lanai, washer & dryer, frigerator, hardwood floors, flat screen tv's, and of course free Wi-Fi for today's electronic savvy family!Restaurants as well as an assortment of shops abound within the complex to satisfy everyone's needs. The only drawback is that it can get very expensive...Of course with three "ABC Stores on premise," you can opt to save a little by preparing meals in your suite.Concierge on premise are very helpful in planning out your daily itinerary. Of course they also pitch their usual "spiel of listening to another timeshare venture, which we declined."The Hilton Hawaiian Village is centrally located ("In my humble opinion") to a lot of attractions and within walking distance. There are walking tours to submarine adventures. The complex offers surf lessons to Lai making. Guests wishing to attend a Luau can attend one of two in the complex. During our last visit in 2014, the "Rainbow Towers" signature tiles were being refurbished, renovated. The new look is gorgeous (pictures attached) both during the day and night!Guests are treated to a fireworks display every Friday night along with other outdoor activities to satisfy even the hard to please. Of course the majority of guests who stay at anyone of Hilton's Towers come to tan and frolic at Waikiki's famous beach. There is also the "lagoon," which is basically a huge salt water pool for all ages.Our overall experience and stay at this resort was very good and worth a stay if you can afford the $700.00 a night room!Of course nothing lasts forever and when the time comes to leave, your already making plans to return!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is top-notch all the way. Hotel itself is beautiful, grounds are gorgeous and very well maintained. Having the lagoon there is a nice alternative for people who want to try things like paddleboarding without having to attempt it in the waves in the ocean out front. The beach is great and expansive. You can walk for a couple of miles and there are numerous bars & restaurants along the way. Our room was well appointed and spacious. I liked having the kitchen so I could bring home leftovers or keep snacks and breakfast items around. Staff was attentive. I highly recommend the luau on the rooftop. We took our 3 children, who are all in their 20's, and they loved it as well. I don't have a single complaint!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Lobby is beautiful. Upon checking in the people in lobby tell you nothing. Like you are suppose to know everything about the huge place already? NOT. Room was beautiful, but 80 degrees upon checkin. After several hours of being HOT we call and maintenance arrives. It took our room 2 days to cool down. The patio furniture on our balcony had the finish coming off...it really should be replaced. The complex is huge. Which equals huge amounts of people. We stayed for 4 nights. We never could get a lounger at ANY of the pools. And guess what...they are building more towers. And if you want to set on the beach, be prepared to spend $59 for one umbrella & 2 lounge chairs .... PER DAY! The breakfast buffet is WAY overpriced for continental breakfast that you would receive for FREE at any Hilton hotel...but this was $20.95 per person for fruit & cereal. The restaurants have waiting list...if I wanted to wait in line for dinner with a vibrating pager I could do that at home. Because the complex is so large be prepared to walk....A LOT! The resort side doesn't have any restaurants or snack places you have to walk to the hotel side for everything. I was totally not impressed. AT ALL. All that and on our last night in the unit....the washing machine started to leak all over the floor. Average at best. We came on a package to see if we wanted to purchase. 1st impressions....you only get one chance, we feel like it was a disappointment. We didn't buy. When people come on a VIP package maybe Hilton should do more to make them feel like they are actually important. Did I mention this place was crowded....and they are adding more towers. Think about that before you book.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: On this visit, we stayed at Hilton's "Grand Waikikian."  This is Hilton's latest resort to be added with the final tower to be be in place by 2017 (projected).This latest tower sits behind the "Lagoon Tower" but interconnected with adjoining lobbies.The front of the lobby where you check-in is lavishly decorated and reminds me of "Disney's Grand California Hotel" in Anaheim, California.  There are mahogany wood fixtures throughout the interior hallways with see through wood carvings. There is a fish pond on one end and a waterfall that leads to an outside pool complete with hidden slides.The complex has 39 floors, five of which are penthouses and require a special card key. Our room, which was on the 29th floor offered us a nice view of the surrounding area.  Unfortunately we only had a partial view of the ocean, which we are accustomed to during our stays here.The suites are lavishly decorated and comes equipped with a fully stocked kitchen, two baths, Lanai, washer & dryer, frigerator, hardwood floors, flat screen tv's, and of course free Wi-Fi for today's electronic savvy family!Restaurants as well as an assortment of shops abound within the complex to satisfy everyone's needs. The only drawback is that it can get very expensive...Of course with three "ABC Stores on premise," you can opt to save a little by preparing meals in your suite.Concierge on premise are very helpful in planning out your daily itinerary.  Of course they also pitch their usual "spiel of listening to another timeshare venture, which we declined."The Hilton Hawaiian Village is centrally located  ("In my humble opinion") to a lot of attractions and within walking distance. There are walking tours to submarine adventures.  The complex offers surf lessons to Lai making.  Guests wishing to attend a Luau can attend one of two in the complex.  During our last visit in 2014, the "Rainbow Towers" signature tiles were being refurbished, renovated.  The new look is gorgeous  (pictures attached) both during the day and night!Guests are treated to a fireworks display every Friday night along with other outdoor activities to satisfy even the hard to please.  Of course the majority of guests who stay at anyone of Hilton's Towers come to tan and frolic at Waikiki's famous beach.  There is also the "lagoon," which is basically a huge salt water pool for all ages.Our overall experience and stay at this resort was very good and worth a stay if you can afford the $700.00 a night room!Of course nothing lasts forever and when the time comes to leave, your already making plans to return!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We arrived early , advised our room not ready yet . No problem of to lunch we go . We were told they will call when our room is ready and we will get it rushed for you . After a day of traveling with 4 children , of to lunch . Check in is 3pm , we waited past 3.30pm . Then how it's going " your room was ready for you at 1.46pm sir " why did I give my phone number if they don't call it . Off to our ocean view rooms , as per our check in paper work . No ocean view from the 2 room s we went into . After 3 hours of calls to the hotel and our travel agent the advised the only had an alternative for the next night . We booked all our night with ocean view . After offering to pay for extra , they found a ocean view corner room with connecting for our children ( 2nd room no ocean view ) This is our 2nd Hilton hotel stay on this trip . Both have been less than perfect .

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I recently stayed at the Grand Waikikian with my two teenage daughters. We have stayed here on several occasions having stayed before at many other Hawaiian Hotels. The main reason we stayed here this time was due to its location to visiting family members. We booked a two bedroom partial ocean with the second bedroom to have the two double beds. On arrival after a long flight we waited to check in only to find 1. The room what not what we booked and 2. The venue was totally booked out. Although the quality was good (is it always has been) two teenagers in one bed what not what we wanted for 9 days! After complaining for 3 days and requesting a Manager, we were miraculously moved to another appropriate room. If you book a two bedroom with double beds in the second bedroom, take note that it "is not guaranteed" at the time of booking. This is what I was told, although it was the first time it happened. A good outcome. Crazy busy venue. Rooms have everything you need and a fabulous bonus is the washing machine/dryer. Good restaurants on site but proximity and price was a key factor in staying there. Look out for the new tower to be built - completion due around 2016. Called the Islander, another time share, but will be new and up to date.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and two adult children stayed there from 12/22-12/25. We enjoyed Christmas Eve in Waikiki which we never did before. The room was a 1 BDRM suite which was elegantly furnished however seemed a little small for 4 people. The appliances were all new and worked perfectly. Being born in Hawaii we normally spend Christmas with our family but we thought of trying something different. We had a great time at the Grand.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a wonderful Thanksgiving holiday at Hilton Hawaiian Village! Central to everything. Walked to zoo everyday; visited memorials and PCC. Great time and great place. Restaurants, pubs/bars are a walk away.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you are not a Hilton Grand Vacation owner, this place might be pricey and hard to get into. If you do want to try, go for ocean-view as it is worth it. The suites are one bedroom, two bedroom and up. They have all you need as to appliances including washing machines etc. Clean and still modern with a typical Hawaiian touch. The service is great. A bit hard to get to the them over the phone, but once you ask for something, it arrives quickly. This is not a hotel, but condo living, so cleaning is once a week unless you want to pay extra. They have a well equipped store downstairs and just outside you have the whole Hilton Hawaiian village. So close to various pools, including the one with water slides for kids etc. The Lagoon is special where you can rent various water sport equipment in a safe environment. I tried the stand-up paddle board for the first time, and with no waves to worry about is was a breeze. So pricey but great luxury in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Huge Hilton complex has everything you need. The staff is most helpful and friendly, also very knowledgable of the area. All the tours we took had excellent guides that were top notch scholars and history buffs. You will not be disappointed except maybe the cost of everything.
user_name:
Patrick D
Hacienda Heights, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I've stayed here twice. Like any property, repeated use show up in wear and tear. This unit is scheduled for paint and carpet. It needs it. The service is first rate. The people lovely and the view is marvelous. Just know you are in a high rise with a village full of kids. There really is no adults only pool

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed in a two bedroom and a one bedroom at the start and end of our trip to Hawaii. The one bedroom had a great view towards the mountains, and the two bedroom had a beach/ocean view towards the other towers (there are five or six of them so this is a big complex). Both apartments were spacious, clean and well equipped and staff were attentive. We cooked a lot, buying our groceries at the amazing Don Quixote store about a 15 minute walk away. ABC convenience stores everywhere. You can use the facilities at all the buildings - our favourite pool was near the Tapa tower - not usually sunny but not busy either, and the bar beside it has a great happy hour in late afternoon. Did not try the restaurants or spa in the complex, but Goofy's just outside on the main road has great breakfasts and dinner. Lots of interesting shops in the complex - expensive but unique.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: First and last stay in Honolulu. The Hilton is a sprawling and aging hotel packed full of vacationers 100% of the time. When you check-in, expect to feel like cattle looking for a cowboy. We didn't have to tackle those lines since we rented from a timeshare owner but the people waiting to check in and check out looked frazzled. The service overall was just OK. Hotel help, lobby attendants, servicing staff didn't always feel welcoming. The pool is a nightmare, plan to be ready exactly at 9am to lay down your towels for the day or you'll be one of those people roaming around the pool at 10am with no place to go. The hotel location is nice with shopping right across the street. Some good eats are close by...I'd recommend eating out vs at the hotel. Better food off grounds. The best part of the stay was the firework show....and tour bus that took us to the historical sites. A few hotels next door seemed to have a more relaxing less cattle-like feel.Good luck.We wont be back.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: of course average rating is against other like properties of Hilton grand vacation. We had the two room suite facing the ocean somewhat. Hilton charges extra for these and really they shouldn't. These are not full ocean view rooms, they can't be because the Grand Waikikian sits way back toward the street so what you have is full view of the two towers that block the ocean view. The Hilton hawiian village is nice although very expensive to dine. Very high end restaurants like Benehanas and Kobe steak house. There are ABC stores at least three and the prices are the same as the rest of Honolulu. Better to get your beer, soda chips even gifts etc. There is a foodland at the mall about 1.5 miles away take the #8 or pink line eat to get there cost $2.00 per. person per trip. There is no Ice machines, which is good because you never know about those, however you have to call down for ice and even though it was very slow at the hotel a couple times we got forgotten about and had to call again. No biggy they sell ice down stairs in thier little shop. Plenty of entertainment options right on site. Bar prices are well bar prices at the various est. around the property. lots of pools however very busy. We don't go in for that anyway. The Wii Fii worked great the whole time and it's free for guest.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian is a beautiful resort on the beach and in the heart of downtown honolulu. The units are spacious with great bathrooms and kitchenettes. It even had a large garden tub in the bedroom where my wife could soak and we could watch movies. The tower was well maintained and the staff was very friendly. Additionally, it was much less crowded then the other towers. There are three pools that you share with other Hilton Hawaiian Village guests.
