One pool even has water slides, but skip it unless you really like children. The hot tub at all the pools I went too looked more like kiddie pools. I do wish Hilton would establish an adults only pool, or keep little kids out of the hot tubs. The only other recommendation I have is to renovate Mandara Spa. It's nothing like the brochure. It has one older above ground hot tub, like the one you would buy from your local dealer, a small sauna (no eucalyptus) and a no frills dry sauna. It wasn't big and it wasn't extravagant.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Anytime my family vacations on Oahu we stay at the Grand Waikikian. The suites are literally a home away from home. The location in the Hilton Hawaiian Village lagoon and proximity to Waikiki beach make this a relaxing getaway. Rooms are clean, staff always polite and location is awesome.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Everything was perfect. If you eat at Tropics ask for Ramfis(best waiter ever). Can't wait to go back. You can take a cab from the airport because almost everything is walking distance from hotel. Great beach.
user_name:
Rebel H
Glen Rose, Texas, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Wonderful hotel. We had a 1 bedroom condo with washer and dryer. The accommodations were great and luxury. The location was great. Room very clean. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay great. Would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian is a tower in the Hilton Hawaiian Village on Oahu.This resort is right on the beach! While we had an ocean view ( not ocean front) suite, the view was still spectacular. The suite was a good size and the 2 bedroom/2 Bath we had included 2 balconies and a full kitchen with small dining area. The tower was also very quiet and relaxing. The living room area was sufficient but would have been cramped if we had a third person, even though there was a sofa bed. The staff was great and friendly although they continuously asked if we were owners of the property. If we weren't I assume we may not have had access to some of the amenities and perks and they would make sure of that. This tower had a lounge that visitors can take advantage of if your flight landed way before check in or if your flight leaves way before check out. We took advantage of this since we had a 10pm flight out of town. The lounge had computers for limited use, a few televisions and lockers incase you want to get in a little more beach time before you leave. They have fireworks on Friday night and lots of restaurants and shops directly on the premises including car rentals. Some of the restaurants will deliver to your room, however we did not take advantage of this offer. The food is pricey but I guess this is expected. Our unit had a stack-able washer/dryer that took hours to dry two or three items. We called maintenance and they promptly came only to advise us that the dryer was not broken it just takes a long time to dry. We took an excursion to Pearl Harbor and to the Polynesian Center, both notable trips and worth taking the trip. There is plenty in the neighboring community some of which is just a short walk...restaurants, shopping etc. Overall the trip was amazing and I'd have a hard time finding anything about the city, the resort etc. The only regret is that we did not take an inter island flight to another island. I plan on returning in the next year or so and hopefully I can fly out to Maui.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian was a wonderful hotel. We had 5 in our party and had a three bedroom suite with kitchen and living room. Our room overlooked the beach which gave us great views of the entire Hilton Hawaiian Village and the beach. We actually watched the fireworks from our balcony on Friday Night and it was wonderful.Had a great visit and the beach, restaurants, bars are just a short walk. All of the staff was wonderful from check in, to the bellman to the valets. We opted to valet, a little more expensive, but the convenience of not walking to the car made up for it.I would go back and stay here again. Love Hawaii, Love the Hilton Hawaiian Village and now I love the Grand Waikikian tower. Best place to stay in Oahu.
user_name:
Tony G
Sioux Falls, South Dakota

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Felt like a nice hotel, not really special, but convenient to the Hilton Hawaiian Village beach! The staff was less than accommodating when our married kids found that their room was a double, and we asked them to find a king room. The manager was actually rude to our daughter, and tried to "apologize" by sending a little basket of snacks to their room. No excuse for rudeness ever! Still, we enjoyed our stay, and the convenient location.
user_name:
UTMom5
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: No one from HGV confirmed my reservation prior to arrival: should have received a welcome phone call about 1 week prior since this was my first time staying at a HGV club resort to confirm reservation, inform me where to go from airport, and inform me of fees to expect (daily tax, cost of valet/parking, and holds on debit cards).Held was made onto debit card TWICE for $250; thus, $500 was held onto our bank account. This amount was extremely high and unnecessary and limited our spending at the hotel restaurants and other amenities (umbrella/chair rental, etc.).Kitchen should have been properly stocked with amenities prior to arrival. No cookie sheet and limited towels. Stove top was broken: indicated that top was always hot even when completely off. Simple check by staff could have corrected these problems.Master bathroom toilet did not flush properly: needed to have maintenance correct problem.Master bedroom was not equipped with HDMI cable to watch movies on DVD player. Called hotel services at 9:30PM. At 11:00PM, no one had still shown up. Talked to front desk at 11:30 and still no one had shown up. Request was either completely ignored or forgotten and was unacceptable.Staff interaction was poor: most requests were brushed off by telling me to talk to hotel concierge desk. All concierge staff speak fluent Japanese and appear to speak English as a second language and brush you off if you're a born AmericanCooling system in room never reached thermostat setpoint, even when patio doors had been closed for over 24 hours straight. As a result, we spent several nights sweating in our room.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great vacation in paradise with many of the features of home available in our rooms or in the hotel. A very friendly and helpful staff worked out several itinerary changes brought about by Hurricane Ana's invasion of our vacation plans. We had to change rooms, but the staff made that move as effortless as possible.
user_name:
Bishop F
Kansas City, Missouri, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I usually wait until after check out to give a review but I'm making an exception this time. After reading the reviews here I was starting to dread my upcoming reservation.To our happy surprise when we checked in the front desk was extremely pleasant. She answered all of our questions and gave excellent directions around this massive property. Mike the bellman was johnny-on-the spot helping withmy groceries. Our conversation on the wat to the room was personable and very helpful. The room was very clean when we arrived early. And everyone was pleasant in accommodating our early check-in...which was much appreciated because we had eaten some airport food in LA that didn't agree with us. Having early access to the room was a blessing. Housekeeping waa amazing. Upon check in we noticed that there was only 1 pack coffee and we decided to ask for more at that time than when we needed it. Within 5 minutes housekeeping rang the doorbell with the number of coffee packs that I requested and took out the trash.It is only day one but itis going great. Looking forward to the rest of our stay.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great rooms had a 2 bedroom suite, full kitchen all pots, pans, 2 bathrooms, washer and dryer in the room the pools are wonderful, they have 4 , also one with water slides, great dining choices, from fine dining, to casual, close to Ala Moana shopping, bus stops, taxis, we stayed for 7 nights, in the Grand Waikikian and every moment was wonderful. Cannot wait to book again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our family of five (three small children) stayed in a two bedroom suite in September. Overall, the hotel is reasonably good value for money. There are very few hotels that offer a two bedroom apartment (with kitchen) in central Waikiki. We have stayed at the Westin and the Royal Hawaiian. They are nicer hotels but they are not comparable in terms of room options. The Trump looks very nice but double the price of the Grand Waikikian.The hotel lacks character, especially being part of the enormous Hawaiian Village complex. I find the village area very old fashioned and a little run down. The size of the complex means there are always people everywhere. I prefer smaller crowds. The check in time is 4pm and check out is 10am, which seems a little unfair and inconsistent with most other hotels.The location of the hotel is excellent for the Ala Moana mall - within 10 minutes walking - but it is a bigger distance to the main Waikiki strip (still walking distance in the cooler evening). Not a big deal but just be aware of that.Our room was ok. It seems to be a little dated and the furnishings are starting to look tired. But it had everything we needed and plenty of space. We had a city view and the room (even on the 18th floor) was a little dark because of that. The pool facilities are large but they get very crowded. I prefer the pool at the Sheraton (which you can also access from the Royal Hawaiian). The kids enjoy the slides.We did not eat at any of the restaurants on property. There are plenty of good options nearby.I would stay at the hotel again. Not because it is a great (or very nice) hotel, but because it provides all the facilities you need in Waikiki and the price is not too bad.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed 9/27-104. 2 BR. Suites are nice enough. I think I stayed in a suite in the Lagoon tower before, and it had a bigger living room space. But we enjoyed the resort. The pullout beds are the most comfortable I've ever seen. Firm and comfy. Nice pillows and linens. Elevators fast. I was able to keep my clubs at the bell captain and they were great about getting them and storing them. We had a 16th floor room with not much of a view. But that's ok for me. Pools are kid heavy. Beach is close, rocky shore... need to swim out to deeper to avoid the rocks. Everyone was very nice, and we had a pleasant time.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We booked a 2 bedroom room in the lagoon tower for 7 nights for 3 adults and 2 young children and i must say we were not disappointed. We stayed a few years ago in another tower and this time decided to try an apartment. What a great place. The apartment was huge, two bedrooms, two bathrooms a large living area with a fold out bed, kitchen, two balconies one facing the marina.The staff were wonderful, we had our own check in with lei greeting, and they even had our room ready quite early in the morning.Located right in front of the room gives you easy access to anywhere on the property. i cannot fault this place, other than the queue at starbucks, and would happily return

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This review is a few months late, but I think it should still apply. We had an awesome time, but we know what we like and if you're into sitting by the pool all week, skip this review. As far as I'm concerned, the Grand Waikikian was over the top nice, but we stayed only 4 nights and did Waikiki during the day only once. We rented a car for our week in Oahu and really saw a cross section of the island. Yes, it was $27/night to park, but everything in Hawaii is a bit expensive. There are not that many hotels outside of Honolulu, so commuting to different parts of the island is a very reasonable thing to do, just plan to avoid Honolulu rush hours. I was not overly impressed with the beach in front of the Hilton complex, and even cut my foot trying to swim there. It's a public beach complete with the occasional homeless person! There are much nicer beaches all over Oahu, some with giant turtles and great snorkelling. Hawaiian culture is really interesting and it's worth taking the time to explore, with or without a car. So for us, getting a city side view from the hotel was no problem since we had so many other great views during the day. In fact, I actually enjoyed our city side view. One minor quibble was difficulty finding the lobby from the parking garage, but once we figured it out it was no big deal. I just wanted to mention it's very possible to have a good time, even if you're not a crowd lover. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A mix-up with another hotel proved to be to our advantage. We phoned the Hilton Desk, explained the situation and were so pleased with their courtesy and timeliness. We asked for Condo style and were booked into this lovely property. Cleanliness and modern. We did not have much of a view as our balcony faced the street. Elevators proved a bit slow and parking was chaotic, but these are minor compared to wonderful treatment and beautiful surroundings. The best Hilton property in Honolulu

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We just returned from our first trip to Hawaii, and are already planning a return. We used our HGVC points for the week and it was a great experience. Everything about the facility was first rate. The kitchen was well equipped and the washer / dryer was great for cleaning out bathing suits. The location is close enough to walk to shopping, restaurants and of course, the beach. Highly recommended.Can't say enough about all the people we had contract with on the islands. Friendly and funny.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: HGVC Grand Waikikian was grand, but cramp in second bedroom. The renovated Lagoon Tower is roomier and just as grand. Ocean view two bedroom suite provided breathtaking ocean view with morning coffee on balcony. Room was clean and full kitchen with washer and dryer were a plus for family. Hilton Hawaiian Village is a cluster of hotel towers on well kept grounds. Pools were located throughout property so there was a distance to travel to use the pools. Parking was $27/day but convenient for easy in and out access. Food on property was overprice, as there are many cheaper places to eat throughout Waikiki. This Hilton is quite a walk from the center of Waikiki, but is indeed a village by itself.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We used our Hilton Grand Vacations time-share for our 20 year anniversary trip (June of 2013). It was fabulous! This hotel is part of the large complex of hotels owned by Hilton in the Hawaiian Village. While we had a city view instead of an ocean view, it was still very nice. The one-bedroom plus suite was spacious and accommodating. Sitting on the Lanai in the evenings was a real treat. Enjoyed walking to nearby activities like the outside bars with live bands.Would love to visit again with our children.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very clean rooms and nice spaces. Very high density area, which was a culture shock for me, but that is Honolulu. Don't come here to get off the beaten track, come here for a good hotel in a packed area. Beach was good, but they charge you $30 for an umbrella and chair. Food was great. The tower is a bit of a hike from the action. All and all, pretty good.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Just returned from a six-day stay at this timeshare. We were really lucky and got two beautiful rooms we decided to switch halfway through our stay. The accommodations were quite nice and the kitchen was very accommodating. Fluffy pillows… Nice duvet covers. Hawaiian Village itself is busy and very touristy. When we first got there there was a large crowd of Japanese tourists. It's quite obvious the resort caters to this demographic and all the signs are in Japanese and there was a rice cooker in our room. My friend who I traveled with told me that we should probably check out another island another Hilton resort after our experience here. Don't get me wrong, the proximity of the restaurants shops and night life is great… It's just super crowded and really not my crowd. I appreciate a little diversity in my vacations but this was kinda crazy. I think I checked Waikiki off my bucket list… I'll go back if there's a great deal but probably never again. I would like to check out something a little bit more quiet and remote honestly...I would definitely not recommend this for honeymooners or couples. This is more of a family resort :)

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian is a great physical space, and the rooms were nice, but the tower itself is a great distance from the balance of the resort, and the elevators are completely insufficient for the volume of guests.Our frame of reference may be a bit jaded since our home club is Kingsland on the Big Island, but the service was mediocre at best and they just didn't seem to care about anyone, knowing full well that plenty of other people would be paying to stay ad infinitum, so there was no real need to make sure we would return.Make no mistake, our kids loved this place. The beach, lagoon, pools, and everything else available for families at the Hawaiian Village made this a vacation they will never forget. They all had a ball, and the resort itself certainly provides everything a family traveling with kids could every possibly need (albeit for hefty charges).That said, for the prices they charge, it would be nice if your business was genuinely appreciated, and that just isn't the case here.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This place is not for us. Way too many towers that pack in tourists. Pools are over crowded and the village is crowded. We had issues with getting the valet service to deliver our car in a timely manner. Rooms are acceptable. It's just not what we would chose for a relaxing tropical vacation.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: First visit to HHV staying at this building. Nice lobby great easy check in vs main lobby but why the added pints via timeshare I just don't see it as an extra value for the points I own here and love the idea of getting 3 month jump on everyone else but the crowded pools are a little much maybe it's due to summer. But with adding another tower next year I can't see it getting less crowded. Big island is better value per point

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It is really tough for me to write this review. I wanted so bad to like the Grand Waikikian, but at the end of the day/stay it really was just average, at best. If you're considering the property you probably already know the drill and may even be a Hilton timeshare owner. If not, then expect about what you'd get at a timeshare, just in a high-rise setting. The rooms are plain and minimal in their decor. The kitchen facilities are adequate and in a place like Honolulu and Waikiki, the option to prepare even some meals on your own is a major cost savings...though getting the groceries themselves is not cheap. To that end, do not do your shopping at a store that begins the alphabet. The property doesn't really offer much on its own as it is part of the larger Hilton Hawaiian Village, which is really why you'd consider this property. The access to several pools, a lagoon, somewhat private beach and multiple restaurants and shops all on one property is really what makes the visit worthwhile. We did encounter some good staff who provided quality service, and had some less than fulfilling experiences with others. The staff that ran the surf school the day we participated was good but the whole thing was a disappointment. More time was spent on dry ground learning the fundamentals of surfing than actually out in the water. Once in the water it was a process of holding a rope to become next up in the queue, then get one try at catching a wave while the instructor yelled at the students...really wasn't much a 'fun' vacation experience. The entire staff of the HHV would be well advised to remember that the guests are there on vacation, to relax and enjoy themselves...HELP THEM DO THAT...it's not rocket science. There are a multitude of options across Waikiki, in most ways, the Grand Waikikian is no better or worse than they are. Keep in mind you are at the end of the stretch of Waikiki, so getting into the main beach or around the shops is a little walk or challenge navigating in your rental car.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village is a large, sprawling, crowded, busy and expansive place. My wife, two kids and I spent a week here, and as with most things in life we found both pros and cons. THE PROS: The Grand Waikikian is a beautiful building with great rooms and wonderful views of the ocean, the city, and Diamond Head. The room are well appointed with full kitchens, a washer and drier, balcony and large bathrooms. As a timeshare owner with Hilton I've come to expect nothing but the best in all of their HGVC properties, this one included. However, for 39 floors, four elevators screams bad planning. No one should have to wait 30 minutes for an elevator. And asking someone to "deal with it" on Friday and Saturday Check-in/Check-out doesn't cut it. The resort offers several pools and even though a lot of people on here complain about the crowds and the rarity of getting a lounge chair - I offer the same as above - deal with it! The place has a lot of people and they all want the same chair by the same pool at the same time. We found there was always room on the giant beach to throw a towel down. We'd spend the day at the beach or lagoon, and then cap the day off at the pool where we found plenty of seats and a cold drink waiting. THE CONS: Crowds everywhere - so make reservations and don't just show up at a restaurant or you'll wait and wait and wait. And in "The Village" there is a very "cruise ship on shore" feeling. The place is in a prime spot on the planet so they'll charge you a lot for anything you might need or want. Go off sight for tours, luaus or rentals of surf boards, umbrellas, snorkels and chairs. I mention Cons, but I truly believe how much those add up are completely up to you and your attitude towards life. If you complain at a resort in Hawaii, I assume you complain most everywhere. Prepare for people, prices and fees, but also take stock in where you are and who your with. The Grand Wiakikian was fun for all of us because we knew what we were signing up for. Do the same, make your plan and then kick back and enjoy the surf and sun and everything else will be painless ... Unless your mind creeps into the negative while you're waiting for the elevator.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Although it is saying well, when it returns to the room, relaxation which has returned to my home is felt. This time, the child seemed to be still more pleasant for the child's friend to have come for play. I was allowed to participate also in the manager reception of Hokulani. The taste of the beer drunk while looking at the highest scene cannot be said not at all. Although the lottery did not win, but my family was excited very much.It is not believed that this is participation fees no charge.It is recommended absolutely.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village is definitely a beautiful and extremely large resort. Don't have to leave as it has everything you will need, however, extremely expensive. Everything was expensive from the restaurants to the activities. Beautifully kept grounds and facilities. But for the money would probably try to stay somewhere cheaper so we can spend our money on activities in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My father,mother, my wife, my daughters really enjoyed stayed in grand Waikikian. In/adjacent the hotel, there are pool and lagoon. 2 bed rooms are comfortable more than I expected. I always use business hotel alone, so I have no chance to aware of condominium type room's advantage for family. There is restroom and shower in the each room, so we close,but keep the moderate distance with My parents and child, very nice. add to excite experience in Hawaii, We could deepen our relationship! Thanks!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It was a four-day stay standing, but was able to spend the best time. Room on the south side most two bedroom Premier. It looks good to sea, night view of the city side clean. Is the size it is too enough for three people. It has been showing the English version of the "Frozen" on the lawn at night, Children was also a delight.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This property is very nice and very crowded as any hotel is on Waikiki beach. Because it is so crowded, specialized attention and service is not going to happen. Also, the property seems to cater to the visitors from Japan. Language seemed to be a barrier at times. If you can overlook these things, you will otherwise find it to be a very nice property.
user_name:
Myrna S
Missouri City, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: if you are looking for a condo type beachfront this is where you want to stay! Hilton is steps away from ala moana mall - bus stops infront that will take you anywhere around the island - staff is very friendly - beach is not rocky at the Atlantis submarine takes off from the pier there - many pools to choose from - never feels crowded - some construction going on which is a bit annoying -

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: July 2014 - This hotel is only designed for Japanese Tourist .The front desk does not understand what a 5 star service is all about for this level of hotel, they argue with you that nothing can be done, and it is the same person on the desk doing that , bad for the hotel Maybe if I could speak Japanese they will pay more attention....

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family of 4 enjoyed the two bedroom ocean view suite. Good one-butt kitchen; do yourself a favor and hit the local Costco, Safeway or Foodland markets and stock up. We averaged 2 meals a day prepared in the suite, which allowed for the occasional splurge at a restaurant without feeling like breaking the bank. The Hilton Hawaiian Village really is self contained, and you could walk to all the shops and restaurants in the Waikiki area if you wanted. If you are into resort amenities, they have it all at a price. Want a chaise lounge chair and umbrella for the beach? Pony up $40 for the day. $35 an hour to rent a Stand Up Paddleboard. You get the idea. The staff were all fantastic, very helpful and friendly. We had trouble getting our housekeeping service to resupply the toilet paper; twice during our 10 day stay we ran out and had to call for more (they clean the suites twice a week, and both times didn't leave any new rolls of TP). The section of the beach near the lagoon is nice and expansive; walk towards the Diamond Head end and you'll see how narrow the beach is in places. Add to that some nice reef sheltered areas in front and this place has the best section of beach. I'll miss looking out my window and seeing the Rainbow tower and the colorful ocean!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I am really uncomfortable usually sleeping in a hotel. The Hilton Grand Wakikian had the most comfortable mattress, a very fluffy, wonderful comforter and an abundance of so soft pillows. The location is great! My son was surfing twice a day right in the front of the Hilton village, the beach was great for swimming & snorkeling. Less busy than further west on Waikiki, but so close to everything. We had our own private Hilton fireworks that happen every Friday.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Been coming to the Hilton Hawaiian Village for years with my Family. The HGVC Grand Waikikian is the best for my family and myself. It is so close to everything and yet it is a self contained resort with a history.
user_name:
Jesse Caldejon D
Torrance, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you like a vacation where you can have peace and quiet to read, walk the beaches, enjoy the pools, and also have access to a bustling shopping area with excellent shops and restaurants when you want that as well, then this is the perfect place to stay. Great location, very friendly staff, and prompt service.
user_name:
Charles Ronald M
Chicago, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Have stayed here before and enjoyed it. Great location at the beginning of Waikiki Beach. Room was satisfactory after several attempts to remove strong smoke odor. Pools and recreation areas are very crowded but then everywhere in Honolulu is crowded!
user_name:
John Michael S
Huntington Beach, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family and I had a wonderful week's stay at the Grand Waikikian Suites. We had a beautiful 2-bedroom suite with a gorgeous view of the ocean. It was a corner room, which included two balconies, one off the living room and another one off the bedroom. We had the convenience of having a full kitchen and a washer and dryer. It was nice to relax in the room after a day of tours or hanging out at the beach. It was a wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We just spent a week at the Grand Waikikian and had a wonderful experience. The accommodations are great and the location is within walking distance of lots of great shopping in addition to the fun shops at Hilton Hawaiian Village. We loved being on the beach and having the option of pool, beach and ocean. Great place to stay with friendly and helpful staff.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Relaxing visit with nice rooms. The pools are very crowded and people were saving the lounge chairs before the pools even opened. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The restaurants at the hotel are overpriced and not that great. The surrounding areas have nice restaurant finds if you look on Yelp.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Have stayed at the main Hilton in Waikiki many times but this is the first time at the Suites. Room was smaller than expected but it was more than made up for by the friendliness of the staff. Everyone involved from the Parking Valet to the Bell Service and Front desk were all consummate professionals. We were on a grueling trip from Japan to the US coast to coast and back in a two week period and of the entire trip we never had a better night's sleep. The bedding was plush and the bed heavenly for a weary traveler. Good value, good services and great location; I whole heartedly recommend this property.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our first trip to this Hilton hotel was overall a good one. The staff is very attentive and wonderful. The hotel rooms are clean and reminded us of the Orlando properties. Gift shop overpriced, but the staff is so kind you forget about it. However, there are 6 Hilton properties in the Hilton Waikiki Village. As a result, the pool you really want to go to, the Lagoon pool with the slides, is completely overcrowded. We had trouble finding and sometimes didn't find even a chair for our belongings. You are dodging people in the pool itself. The hot tubs are overrun. The pool bar was terribly overpriced. Other than that, if you're looking for a big city feel on an ocean, Waikiki is for you. Otherwise, rent a car and travel to the North Shore. Which we did. But this Hilton property was a good base from which to travel.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our Family really enjoyed staying at the Grand Waikikian! The accommodations were very nice and comfortable. This hotel is convenient to everything- shopping, pools, beach, and dining. A big plus for me was the convenience of having a washer/dryer in the room and a kitchen equipped with everything. If you run out of supplies, the housekeeping staff is quick to bring you what you need.
user_name:
Robert John E
Fairfax Station, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We weren't excepting much, because we have stayed at this Hilton property before and it was a decent value. This time however, we were surprised by the improvements we found. The rooms, pools, restaurants, and ground are great. The staff is exceptional! So far, we are very happy!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: First time in Oahu and I was apprehensive about crowds, but ended up thoroughly enjoying it. Here is a breakdown of our stay. Hope it helps you plan your vacation as other reviews have helped me.Rooms: We booked a 1 bd bath ocean view room 5 months in advance. From reading the reviews I was concerned that the ocean would not really be visible. However when we got to the room we were pleasantly surprised. The ocean view was amazing. You could see the turquoise waters of Waikiki beach, as well as the lagoon. It did make me nervous when my kids (9 and 4) were out on the balcony as we were so high up so you have to watch them carefully when they are out there, or make it out of limits. We could hear and see the Luau every night but I found it a plus more than a minus.The beds were OK. They were a bit small and soft. They are double beds not queen so it’s a bit tight for 2 adults.Housekeeping came everyday. It was so nice to come back after a day at the beach to a clean room. Make sure you leave some tips as they will provide extra towels, toiletries etc. We rented on movie so really didn’t take advantage of the free rentals and x-box. But it’s a great feature to have and probably only possible in a resort as big as HHV.Pools : We were mostly at the Paradise pool since the slides were there. We didn’t have much trouble finding chairs as most people have complained about. If you go early (before 10) there are plenty of chairs. If you go later, you just stand around and there are ppl leaving all the time so you will find a chair soon enough. The pool and slides are great. It is full of kids, and a couple of times there were “accidents” so the pool had to be closed for cleaning for several hours.Lagoon: This was a good place to go when the pool is closed or you get sick of the slides. We did the stand up paddle and it was much easier than expected and a lot of fun. Even my 9 year old could do it. It is a good place to swim although colder than the pool, and has a bit of a stench.Beach: The beach is beautiful, clean and calm outside the hotel. It is not very crowded since most of the ppl there are hotel guests. You could spend the day there just frolicking in the water. The water is calm enough for little kids to play in the shallows. However there are no lifeguards, so be aware.Location: Location was good as it was not in the middle of Waikiki, so not as crowded but you can walk to a lot of touristy places if you wanted to. Ala Moana mall is about 15 mins walk, or 5 min drive. The food court there is good for lunch. Roys is good for dinner. Parking. I did a lot of research on this and we ended up renting a car and paying the $27/day for parking. When I did the math for renting a car for a few days in Waikiki vs paying for a full week rental near the airport it was only $50 more for the rental +parking and we would have the added flexability. Renting a car from Waikiki is expensive ($80/day) and you need to factor in the cost of the cab rides to and from the airport. I would recommend renting the full week from Costco.Other/Activities. Fireworks on Friday night is fantastic. Lapperts ice cream is a must. Love the full resort feel and all the conveniences it offers. We stayed at quieter places with nicer rooms, and this resort although busy more than makes up for in terms of location and full array of activities.Recommend going to the Farmers market at Diamond Head on Saturday mornings.
user_name:
KateN285
San Francisco, California, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My first trip to Oahu, Hawaii and I could not have picked a better place to stay at. It is an impressive hotel with all the facilities you could possibly one. When they say it is a village, they mean it. You have restaurants, shops, several swimming pools, and right on Waikiki beach.We were in a two bedroom suite with a view into the lagoon. The suite was well decorated and gorgeous. The view can't be beat! The kitchen was small but more than adequate for preparing food. My only complain is the terrible knives that they keep in the suite. If you are trying to cut a pineapple, be prepared to work hard or bring your own knives. The location of this hotel is great. As many other reviewers point out, you can pretty much walk to any of the main tourist areas. Our first day, we took a 15 min walk to Hard Rock Cafe for drinks and to explore the area. A few days later, we just took a walk along Waikiki beach starting from the Grand Waikikian to the other end. The hotel is also a common stop for many of the tour buses so you don't have to go anywhere to get picked up. There is also plenty of parking in the garage although it is pretty pricey but that's typical for most places in Hawaii.It there is one negative, I would say that its popularity makes it pretty crowded. For example, the Starbucks is always packed. So are the restaurants there but I would just advise eating off the property.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian Resort is part of the Hilton Paradise Resort in Waikiki. It is always a great place to stay with comfortable rooms, excellent pools, and one of the best resort-based shopping/dining areas in the Hawaiian Islands.
user_name:
Brian Keith M
Wooster, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location, walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Ctr., Waikiki beaches, restaurants and all the shops along the famous Kalakaua Ave. Stayed in a 2bd suite, was comfortable enough for the four of us, but living room and kitchen somewhat small but couldn't beat the ocean view we had from every window! Pool was ok, has waterslide, which we enjoyed but overall pool area was small and very crowded (summertime of course). There's also a man-made lagoon where you can swim, kayak, snorkel, etc. with rental booths for all your beach equipment needs. The only bummer was that there are no BBQ grills provided like most other resorts. Overall experience was wonderful, would definitely stay again.
user_name:
Sefulu P. T
Kapolei, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I really enjoyed the room and the location was good. Had a king bed one room suite. Nice to have a washer and dryer to keep swim suits clean. Visited the beach often and the dining available in the shopping area downstairs. Enjoyed the free DVD rentals. Did have difficulty figuring out where to park to access the elevators into the actual hotel but eventually figured it out. The Luau was not as nice as I had hoped. The food was not culturally based -- not true Hawaiian food and it was cramped. Wish they would have had the luau on the lawn.
user_name:
Lisa Ann K
Elk Grove, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I have been to Hawaii 20+ times and this was the first time I have been truly disappointed with a resort of this caliber. The resort amenities are fine, but not great. They have 3 pools, of which one is a "Super Pool" but there is really nothing super about it. The much smaller pool has a couple of slides for the kids, but the pool is very narrow and small so it gets packed very quickly. The grounds are beautiful and right on the beach so that is very appealing and the main reason we chose this location.With that said, what really was disappointed me the most was their customer service (or lack there of). We spoke with several people at the resort (Concierge, front desk, guest services, etc.) and there were 3 people that were very nice and helpful. Everyone else truly lacked any customer service skills. I have written a letter of complaint to the GM and the corporate offices because they were rude and unfriendly, which is not what you would expect at a resort of this caliber. We will not be returning to this location!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I start by saying that disappointingly I never got to stay in the Grand Waikikian due to the absolute worst service I have ever received. Hopefully this will warn people who potentially want to book packages through HGV. In November last year I paid for a 7 night "VIP" package for the GW Suites (2 bedroom apartment). This purchase was under the promise from sales staff that we would have absolutely no trouble booking the room in 2014. Coming from overseas, travel times are limited and I was assured and GUARANTEED there would be no problems at all. In January, I tried to book for April - no availability. So I decided to give more notice and attempted to book for October (6 months in advance) and was told the same. Apparently we had to stay in another hotel owned by Hilton, somewhere else in Waikiki. The sales reps were so rude and wouldn't respond to our calls and pretty much just said 'tough luck'. The rep who originally sold me the deal still has not responded to me 6 weeks later. We were told that the Tower was completely booked out, which was strange as the exact room I purchased was available on numerous accommodation sites as well as Hilton's own website. Scam?! The rudeness from the staff just kept continuing and I realised that they just don't care. Then came the fight to get a refund! In the end I enlisted the help of the Better Business Bureau to try an get the money back. The BBB were told I would get a refund in "a few business days" -- 3.5 weeks later a US check turned up. We cannot deposit a foreign check and it's going to take 8 weeks to clear AFTER we get charged a whole bunch of fees. So we are losing money! After more frustrated emails, HGV refuse to refund directly to the credit card we payed for this disaster on. I now cannot get MY money in time to book the planned holiday somewhere else in Waikiki. So bitterly disappointed in Hilton's staff, especially the ones at the Village who sold me a package that couldn't be used. Completely lost faith in the Hilton brand, which is a shame as the HHV used to be a favourite place to stay. I don't expect anything more than a generic template reply to this review... I just want to warn any travellers who are looking to purchase pre-paid packages to stay in the Grand Waikikian without secured dates. DON'T DO IT! For people staying at HHV (as I was) if you are approached to purchase such a deal, run away! No matter what they promise you, don't do it. It's not worth the trouble. Worst customer service ever. Untruthful business practices.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our family of 6 from Australia stayed at the Grand Waikikian in an Oceanview 2 bedroom suite. THe room was very comfortable and spacious. We had an excellent ocean/lagoon/pool view between the Lagoon Tower and the building next door. We also had a spectacular city view from the bedroom balcony. The Friday night fireworks were spectacular and we had an excellent view from our front balcony. THe location of the Grand Waikikian in the HAwaiin village is much better for young families than Waikiki beach itself. WE loved the lagoon, and the equipment, like stand up paddle boards for hire. A little expensive, but a great experience.The turtles pond and the magnificent parrots were a hit with the kids and looked great in photos. It is very easy to access many different types of food, restaurants and takeaway. For lunch, I loved the California Sushi rolls by the Paradise pool. THere were many great choices for dinner. Starbucks in the resort is a bonus for that breakfast caffeine hit. THe only downsides occur because the resort is so large and can feel crowded in areas. Also inconsiderate people are in the habit of putting towels on all the poolside chairs early in the morning to bar them all day, whether they use them or not. At Disney Aulani resort staff remove unused towels after an hour...Overall ,a great, convenient choice for families. We would definitely return.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I own a TS unit in the Lagoon Tower, but had bonus points to use so spent a week in the Grand Waikikian. Lovely unit, very clean, nicely appointed. I wish I had ponied up more $$ and bought in this tower because the Lagoon has seen better days (but I understand new furniture is on the horizon for Lagoon!). The entire resort is great so much to do I love HHV.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed 3 nights at the Grand Waikikian in a one bedroom premier with 2 double beds. The suite was REALLY nice. Dark wood floors, furnished kitchen with dishwasher, a breakfast nook, washer & dryer, one pull-out sofa, an armchair and two chairs at the kitchen counter. There was a sunken tub in the bedroom, separate large bathroom with shower and a nice size balcony with patio furniture. (2 small laundry detergent packs, one dishwasher soap pack and small dishwashing soap provided). We were on the 26th floor and our balcony view was of the city on our left and the ocean, beach and Rainbow Tower on our right. If you check in early and the room is not ready, you can leave your bags with the bell desk and use the lounge on the 8th floor. It has lockers, showers, tea, coffee, juice, a separate children's playroom, 2 computers,2 tv's and plenty of sitting areas. You'll be given a pager to let you know when your room is ready. Check out is 10am so the lounge is useful when you have a later flight home. You'll receive a DVD rental card entitling you to rent DVDs from kiosks on the main floor. Use your blue Experience card for savings around the village (free twisty bread with pizza order at Round Table, 10% off at Dairy Queen, free beach mat with $25 purchase at ABC store, etc) There are many restaurants and shops on site. Paddle boarding in the Lagoon, penguin and fish feeding in the mornings, day camps for kids, hula lessons, outdoor movies, etc. Staff were friendly and attentive. This is a timeshare hotel but you are not approached to attend a presentation.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was a staycation for us, but Hilton Grand Vacations at the Hilton Hawaiian Village is always great. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view, which was nice. For visitors, you don't need to go anywhere else. It is a self contained resort, with shopping, restaurants, pool and beachfront. But you should go and explore the rest of Hawaii.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Waikikian tower. It's a beautiful resort with plenty of activities as well as a great surf spot just steps away from the resort. My husband surfed the entire week and didn't need to bring his surfboard because there is a rental shop just across the street from the resort. At the end of each day we were able to store the surfboard in the storage area in the lobby. Also, you don't want to miss the fireworks show Friday evenings on the beach side of the Hilton resort, nice touch!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I paid for extra for a plus 2 bedroom, occupancy 6. It slept 6 but only had room for 4 in dining area and sat only 3-4 in living room (VERY TINY). I believe this violates the guaranteed occupancy for 6 that I paid for. Also, it was on a lower floor than plus price is supposed to provide for. (Rooms begin on floor 5; I was was just 4 floors up from that, in room 802 of a 39 story building; this is not my idea of a preferred floor level I was told I would receive for the extra plus points I paid). Master bedroom very small & stuffy with no windows that opened, no lanai and a miniature soaking tub. Most furniture was tacky and worn (The second bedroom was decorated with all mis-matching furniture and the dining furniture was worn and scratched) This entire unit felt like it was an after-thought. I was told units like mine get lots of complaints. Otherwise, the place is beautiful. Grounds and pools are wonderful and the staff were great (except for my unit location)
user_name:
Karen Lee L
Manteca, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Beautiful resort with lots of shopping and restaurants nearby and on property. Great place for families and/or couples. Access to beach, many pools, lagoon and the property is AMAZING, I would highly recommend the Hilton in both Honolulu and on the Big Island.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Beautiful resort with lots to do for the entire family. Walking distance to Waikiki and Ala Moana Shopping Mall. Staff is wonderful and accommodating. Best "Family" hotel in Waikiki! The hotel is clean and there are plenty of restaurants.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are Hilton timeshare owners. We stayed 14 nights in Hawaii with out first 4 at Grand Waikikian. We stayed in the Grand Waikikian tower (not lagoon or kalia). When you read reviews be sure you know where the person stayed. We loved the pool area and spent most of the time at the lagoon and pool with slides. Stand up paddleboard on the lagoon is so easy that the 5, 7 and 10 year olds in our group had no trouble. There were plenty of chairs by the pool, we had no issue with overcrowding. The Hilton Hawaiian Village has many restaurants and shops, you won't need to travel far to find what you need. You will need a stroller with kids. We debated bringing a stroller for our 5 year old as she is getting to old for it, but everything is do spread out we were glad to have it. The shopping district is an easy mile walk away. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The rooms were smaller than I expected. The Orlando HGVC one bedrooms are much larger. Kings Land HGVC also has larger rooms. But you will not find a better location on Waikiki beach than this resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Staying in a two bedroom apartment was perfect for our family. Decent location, but it is a long walk to the main Waikiki Beach area. Short walk to the Ala Moana Centre and Kalakaua Ave.Rooms were well furnished, LCD TVs and well equipped kitchen.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A relaxing place for family and friends to vacation who have varying interests, because there is something onsite of interest for everyone. Located inside the Hilton Waikiki Village, a haven for spending time on the beach, walking, shopping, dining and relaxing with friends. You could just remain in the Hilton village during your entire stay. Our unit had an excellent ocean view. The unit was very clean and the property well kept. Adjacent to other Hilton condo and hotel towers on the premises. There's a lagoon pool on the property that's adjacent to the beach and also a traditional swimming pool. The staff was very friendly, and the premises are very safe. Numerous stores and shops on site, with grocery items also available at multiple ABC Stores, a ubiquitous chain on the island. And Starbucks is there, along with other coffee shops. Favorites---the ice cream store across from the Great Lawn. Stroll down the beach next door to the Hale Koa Hotel, for the shaved ice--sold next door to the bar on the beach. Walking distance from the shopping mall, the Ala Moana Center, which has a lot of high end stores.Lots of daily tour pickups on site for sightseeing---which I would recommend in lieu of driving, unless you're prepared to deal with heavy motor vehicle traffic and rain.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My second visit to Hilton Hawaiian Village and first in the Grand Waikikian. It was a very nice and comfortable unit with a great view (unit was #2609). Very well furnished with everything you would normally need for a home away from home. The unit was clean and in good repair with the type of furnishing you would have at home. A lot restaurants and shops within the resort that are a bit on the expensive side but everything in Hawaii is expensive with the exception of pineapple.I had a rental car for the week and parking was $27 a day I think next time I will take a shuttle and rent a car per day as needed at the onsite rental office or one nearby like next to the abc store nearby. Groceries are available abc stores(limited) or a foodland market thats a few miles away near the H1 highway. The resort grounds were clean was well maintained and on friday night there was a pretty good fireworks display. The luau was expensive but there are coupons around the place to get a discount or upgrade from free. I give the luau a 7 out of 10 and the food buffet was pretty good and plentiful.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was my third vacation at the Hilton Village in Waikiki. I love it because everything is right there. You never have to leave the property. From Starbucks, to groceries, to beach, restaurants and bars, to gym and spa, it's all right there. BUT if you would like to go to another restaurant, shopping, etc. it is walking distance. And, if you would like to go to Pearl Harbor, or rain forest a mini bus will pick you up at the hotel and take you or you can rent a car on the property. There are paddle boards, surf boards or you can take a sunset cruise all from the Hilton. Not to mention the fireworks. So Beautiful!
user_name:
Suzanne Eileen M
Chandler, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are elite members of HGVC. Normally our visits to this property is overall satisfying, however, we were forced into accommodations - because of HGVC online booking feature failure - we never got to book the tower we prefer despite very early and repeated efforts even with customer support. It appears that HGVC might be oversold and thereby can no longer deliver on promises made to timeshare buyers/owners. Anyhow, because we had concrete plans, we ended up in a much smaller unit than our elite status purchases and were also immediately disappointed with the response when an article of clothing was reported to management as disappearing from the unit never again to be found; one of the toilets 'sang' when flushed through the entire stay; air-conditioning did not control temperature uniformly throughout the unit; main bedroom was too stuffy as a window couldn't even be cracked a little and even with the bedroom door wide open all night; garbage was not picked up in a timely manner and needed to be left out in the hallway overnight; etc... Overall, a big disappointment on what was to have been a pleasant graduation surprise outing for our eldest daughter. HGVC needs to either fix their online booking system or else stop not allowing HGVC members to book select properties as might be occurring (meaning once you stay at a 'prime' location you cannot go back). At least that is what it seemed like despite our valient efforts to secure the property we had wanted. In the past year we have stayed at HGVC Miami South Beach (A+); the Hilton Hotel in the Florida Keys (B+) and HGVC waikola (Big Island) (A+) and, as elite members, believe our expectations are not unrealistic. We hope someone from HGVC reads this note and offers commentary especially regarding our concerns that HGVC might have oversold itself thus making books more difficult for its timeshare owners seeking to stay in other locations. Thank-you.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My room in the Lagoon tower was not clean. Sofas and floor were stained. Plumbing problems on 2 of the 10 nights we stayed where we had no water and toilet not flushing. Kitchen utensils are dated. Overall the feel of our room was more of a 3.5 star hotel. Pool areas are definitely a highlight of this complex especially if you have children. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Due to Hotel being next to the main public car park area it is occupied by many homeless people who also use the facilities of the complex as the hotel is not allowed to close off the lagoon area. They sleep on the grassy area during the day and cars at night in the immediate area. Although we had no problems with the homeless it is not something you want to see when you are on holidays on a tropical island paying top dollar.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: From our arrival until the day we left everything was extremely pleasant. The staff is very friendly, and always to help. You feel very comfortable and safe throughout the property. You should not miss Friday night at the beach (19:40) !!!
user_name:
Juan Manuel P
Mexico City, Mexico

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I would give the place 5 stars but once you add all of the fees up - and figure in some of the items that need to be upgraded 4 stars will do.we traveled here Nov 2013 - We were upgraded to the condo here due to a HUGE issue with Hilton Grand Vacations - they sold us a package over the phone for their time shares - that in itself is another story LOL - this is a review of the resort not Hilton grand vacations - which is really nice, and taken care of. PROS: It is very clean and quite beautiful. They have fireworks on Friday which were actually pretty good. They even show movies at night outside as well one or two nights per week. The resort is really it's own city - there is shopping, restaurants, ice cream ect,. and if you are really lucky they may even be filming Hawaii 5-0 while you were there! They have their own dedicated parking spots and rooms at the Grand Waikikian. The beds and rooms are comfortable, there is a Starbucks on the property - there is also a small little beach lagoon as well (that's where the fireworks are set off from) The staff is friendly and helpful. If you want to stay at a hotel and not really have to leave this would be great for you - there is a lot to do just on the grounds (but be prepared to $$) CONS: Pools - yes there are 4 or 5 but none of the pools have sun at the same time -you have to rotate pools with the sun which is hard since everyone else is also doing the same thing - and there is a lot of chair hoarding due to that fact. towels for the pool and rooms need to be replaced - as well as the lounge chairs at the pool as well. You want to go the beach? - It will cost you $15 for an umbrella and $10 for 2 chairs DAILY to layout on the beach???? UMM doesn't the resort fee cover that? Guess not, and Parking - another $35/day -- we rent a car wherever we go - we like to explore. I just think with a resort fee of 25/day there should not be a charge for beach chairs/umbrellas - parking I can understand since it's pricey all over the island - but to be charged for both is excessive. Since the place is so big - be prepared to walk and walk - 10 min from our room to the restaurant/bar area - but hey you are on vacation walk off some of the drinks/food!Would I stay here again.... I am 50/50 on that - one point I know what I am getting myself into with the fees and costs AND I also know that I am getting a clean and maintained resort as well - so do the pros beat out the cons, probably so. My most important thing is how clean and comfortable the rooms and hotel grounds are. I know you don't spend a lot of time in the room, but I like to start my day feeling relaxed and I can only do that in nice rooms. I am a hotel snob will freely admit that. The resort is in my opinion becoming too big - pretty soon they will have to have shuttles take you from the further towers of the hotel to the pools and beaches. Make sure you look at the resort map before booking your tower.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Just back after 2 weeks at this wonderful resort.Very Clean,Excellent staff.Customer Service Manager Lori is 2nd. to none. Always ready to do an extra mile to delight guests.Fast Check In & Check Out, well trained staff.Will go back any time.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It's a grand scale of what not to do for a resort. 5 pools and everyone is so rude hogging pool chairs with their beach towels in the morning and then don't show up for several hours. It's obnoxious and rude behavior and the resort should not allow it! This place is overload, too much everywhere. I guess if you are a typical American into over consumption then this is the place for you. You lose the peace you anticipated before coming here. Hilton has lost it's way at this resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Words cannot express how much I LOVE this place. I love that I'm in Waikiki, but yet, feel like I'm away from it all. The beach at the Hilton is far less crowded than Waikiki beach. I loved the fireworks show on Friday nights. My favorite place to hang out is on the lobby lounge chairs overlooking the pools and just people watch.
user_name:
Melissa F
Union City, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our first time staying at the Hawaiian Village. Although we found it to be very busy, we enjoyed our stay at this great facility. Lots to do and see and everything is easily accessible. We were able to tour to other parts of the Island through the hotel services and enjoyed that service.
user_name:
Roy E
New Smyrna Beach, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent vacation spot; friendly efficient staff. Hotel is conveniently located with easy access to shopping and Waikiki. We are Hilton Grand Vacation members and always look forward to stay here. We have already booked our next holiday at the HGW.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a very large and nice facility. We enjoyed the lagoon with our toddler and the room was excellent. Location is right at the beach and walking distance to malls, restaurants, shopping street. Front desk staff were useless and need re-training. Don't expect to be treated 5 star by them.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the Grand Waikikian last October with family, It was our 1st visit to Oahu and we were very happy with our 2 bedroom unit on the 29th floor, It's a great Hilton Complex, right on the beach! We will be returning this year!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent value - excellent facility -parking a bit much at $ 27 per day - great location - rooms are very comfortable , clean and convenient . The Hilton Village is beautifully landscaped and of course right at the beach !
user_name:
Harold S. H
phoenix, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I came here from April 13 to the 19th 2014 (This was the first time I had ever been to Hawaii in my life.) . And it was SO AWESOME!!! Enjoyed the breakfast, enjoyed going on the man made lagoon and doing the paddle board twice!I HAD A BALL!!! The first night I went here the staff was very friendly. The minute I came here they gave me a lei. 11 people traveled with us and that includes my entire family. We got a City view suite on floor 16. That had 1 bedroom,1 bathroom, a washer & drier, kitchen appliances, and many more. The rooms were okay so I had to sleep on the pull out couch. Food: In the morning I had Buttermilk pancakes which was AWESOME! And tried the French toast with ice cream and a banana. Like I said it was AWESOME for a picky eater like myself. Anyway the room was well kept. The bathrooms were clean. And I will never forget what I did with my family going to Pearl Harbor,going to The Polynesian Cultural center, Ted's Bakery, And this whole trip. I REALLY wanna come back in the future... Really... REALLY!!!!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the Grand Waikikian for one week....one week of awesomeness. This place is all suites condo type rooms. There is a full sized frig, stove, microwave, sink, pots, pans, the whole thing basically. It is very spacious with a huge master bed room and bathroom. The other room is optional with two twin size or maybe one queen king bed. The bathroom for that room is very big and nice as well. There is a washer and dryer which is always a plus. There is a balcony; we had the city view. The location of the hotel is very good...next to the beach and 1-2 blocks away from the main shopping area. I really enjoyed the stay here, friendly staff, and there is a little village to check out by the main lobby. It is expensive...but hey, you're vacationing in Honolulu so it is worth it!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I had a great overall stay at the Grand Waikikian Suites. This was my first trip to Hawaii. I stayed in a 2 double bed partial ocean view room. I stayed for 8 nights. I am NOT a HGVC member. Upon arrival there were no problems the staff was very accommodating and assisted me with my luggage. They also gave me information about the pools and various excursions at the resort. This is a big busy resort, I was totally aware of this going in. However I was surprised it was actually not that busy. This is not a secluded Maui resort, you should not be expecting that. As I said it is busy but not ridiculously busy. The hotel facilities were very nice. See my Hilton Hawaiian Village review for a review of the facilities. My room was on the 28th floor with an amazing view of the city and an OK view of the ocean. I come from a small town, so the view was just that much more amazing. The view of city and the mountains is amazing anytime of the day even at night. The room was large. The bathroom was small and the shower head was broken but worked fine. The internet was fast. The TV and the PS3 with DVD rentals were an added plus. The beds were great as well as the couch. The furnished balcony had amazing views and was a very good size. I think the best part of the room had to be a washer and dryer. This was extremely useful especially because most of my trip it was extremely humid. The staff is very nice. I would not say they would go out of their way to assist with 5 star service, but then again this is a resort not a five star hotel. On my day of arrival I left my luggage on the shuttle the staff was very helpful in assisting me to get it back. On the day of my departure the lounge was very nice. It has lockers so you can store your items, and showers to refresh before your flight. The lounge also has cold water and internet access. Overall my stay was amazing. The only reason I do not rate this as 5 stars is because it is not a 5 star hotel and I think it is better that way. I am very picky when it comes to my hotels. Overall very pleased. Thank you Grand Waikikian.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our second stay at the grand Waikikian. We had a great experience 4 years ago and decided that the apartment style complex would suit us and our two children.Having booked 6+ months prior for this visit, I was surprised to not be able to book a 2br apartment for us and our two young children. I went ahead and booked a one bedroom with a very specific request that we not be directly opposite the luau which is held on top of the car park next door. Of most important to us was that there a view of the beach given the amount of time that we spend in the room. We were extremely disappointed that there was only a glimpse of water and just the boat masts on the harbour when you craned your head from the balcony. With two small children, we spent a lot of time in the room and it was very disappointing as a part of a beach holiday to be overlooking a main road and buildings when I had specifically requested and booked a beach view. I spoke with the reception about this who offered no solution. I then requested to speak with the manager. Late that afternoon we were shown the only alternative available which was what smelt like a smoking room on level 7 directly opposite from where the luau is held which was clearly not going to be suitable.All in all, I like the hilton facility, the location, the staff, the room service, the pools and one of the restaurants (Tropics) but I'm not sure that we will stay there again next time given the room we were provided with in this trip.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hilton has really slipped at this location. Staff was rude at check in. Prices are ridiculous and food was sub standard. Room was right above highway 92 which ruined the balcony experience and made it impossible to leave the door open for fresh air.
user_name:
Michael Anthony B
Lodi, CA, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed in a one bedroom unit at the Grand Waikikian from April 5th to 11th. We arrived around 1:30 and were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready. Check in staff were very pleasant and delighted my kids with welcome leis as well as an escort to the owners lounge – just in case we needed it as we were leaving. They also introduced us to the concierge who gave us a welcome beach bag, a great map of the resort, and offered to help us book activities if needed. There was no pressure at all. We’re advance planners so we didn’t need anything but food recommendations.When we booked we had our choice of the Waikikian or the Lagoon Tower. We chose the Waikikian because of the washer/dryer and the updated décor. We did use the washer/dryer almost every day. It was especially nice to be able to dry swimsuits. We used the refrigerator and microwave to prepare restaurant leftovers and to have cereal in the morning, but did not do any heavy duty cooking. There are too many good restaurants in the vicinity and we were on vacation! We were traveling with our 6 and 9 year old children who loved going to Benihana and would have gladly had dinner there every night. It’s expensive, but provided one of the trip highlights for my kids. Another good option for food is the Wailani Coffee House (great and inexpensive breakfast) just across the street from HHV. Round Table Pizza also provided a good in-room respite after a long day at the beach. We also loved going to Starbucks for their boxed food (protein packs, fruit and cheese tray, etc.), and taking it to the beach with Frappuccinos. We did not care for Pronto Pickle – the HHV quick food to go service. As for activities, we spent one day at Pearl Harbor (book in advance directly to avoid crazy tour fees!), one day at the Polynesian Cultural Center (highly recommended), and the rest of our week mostly lounging at the beach and pools. Our on-site activities included the Atlantis submarine trip. My kids loved it! My 9 year old did a surf lesson through the resort. The instructors took great care of him on the water. They have a photographer on the water as well to get action shots. They were so great I bought a flash drive with all the photos for $60, which I consider money well spent to keep me out of the deep water! We also did a hula lesson and a ukulele lesson which were very much enjoyed. My kids also really enjoyed the penguins. You can sit on the wall/enclosure and just chill with them for as long as you want while they swim and play. We played at the Paradise Pool for the water slides, but always migrated back to the beach. It’s a lot less crowded, the water is warm, and the sand is so nice on the feet. HHV uses a card system for towels. When we checked in they asked how many cards we would like. We got two per person. You trade the cards in for fresh towels and can trade the towels back for cards. You pay $10 if you lose a card/towel. It was really nice being able to get fresh towels when ours got too wet or caked in sand.The room is equipped with two televisions and a Playstation. Each tower has a bank of DVD Now machines that offer games and movies at no charge (one at a time). My son loved the ability to rent various games to try, with the option of just taking it back if he didn’t like it. We also rented a movie.There is a mall just down the street as well – probably a mile. We walked it easily. It’s an odd mix of very high end (Prada, Dior, Chanel, etc.) and Long’s Drugs, Foodland, etc. Nonetheless it provided a great distraction for our exit day. We had to leave the room by 10am but our flight didn’t leave until 3pm. We stored our luggage with the bell captain and went to the mall for a bit of souvenir shopping and a nice lunch. My only complaint for the week would be the blankets on the bed/sofabed, which were scratchy. Tips: • Charley’s Taxi has a flat rate to/from the airport for $29. No coupon required – just ask for it.• Bring your own laundry soap and dryer sheets to avoid high prices and unfamiliar brands/scents

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I know this review is premature as we will not be staying there until Monday but I thought I would write about our experience so far. I received an email from the hotel two weeks ago confirming our upcoming reservation and indicating we could contact the concierge to make reservations. I have called everyday for two weeks and left over a dozen messages for the concierge with no return call. I left my email to and have heard nothing. Called the front desk to let them know and inquire about a cabana(which is a ridiculous $ 204 per day) by the pool. They said they would have the concierge call me right back. That was five days ago and still nothing. Frustrating. I hope the service is better once we are there. Stay tuned...

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Really enjoyed our stay. Facility and amenties were very nice. Especially liked the in suite kitchen with stove and full size fridge. Great location on Wikiki, walking distance from many stores/restaurants.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is very clean and the decor is beautiful!. The pools are so overcrowded you will not get a chair unless you get there by 8am or hover and stalk people until they leave. the beach is beautiful but it IS a public beach. The lagoon is misleading. It is NOT owned and operated by the Hilton. You will pay dearly for chairs and shade. We enjoyed the restaurants and found the service to be very good. If you like to shop high end, this is your place! If you want more popular priced souvenirs to take back with you, that is easily found as well.I found that this is definitely a big city hotel with a beach and palm trees. It could have been anywhere. We had our 12 year old son with us and I didn't feel comfortable allowing him to wander the grounds as the hotel is located off a main street and is accessible to the public and ALL ways. Even the bathrooms are accessible to anyone using the beach. It made me a bit uncomfortable.As for the room, It was well appointed and clean. The Upgrade to Partial Ocean View meant that if you squint really hard and can see past your neighbor's balcony, you can make out a faint strip of ocean. The pillows are very flat and hard so you may want to bring one.We had a good experience but will not go back again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We really enjoyed our visit. The staff here were wonderful. They were very accomodating and went out of their way to be helpful. The owners facilities were great for an early arrival and late departture due to flight schedules. The pool was a bit crowded and dominated by kids but we were out on beaches and visiting sights most the time so that didn't bother us. It's convenient to beaches, shopping, bus lines, etc. We had a car rental but if you didn't it wouldn't be a show stopper due to the location and public transportation options. We'd definately go back & recommend. If you go to the North Shore try Opal Thai (lunch) and Cinnamons for breakfast is great if near east coast. I'd recommend Safeway for groceries. Great produce and even sushi. (crispy roll samples convinced us to buy -delicious!)

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hawaiian welcome with leis was great. The pool and lagoon were fabulous and the kids had a great time on the water slides and snorkeling in the lagoon. The rooms are nice and clean and comfortable. (Skip the upgrade to the ocean view room. Wasn't worth it.) Parking was expensive $30 a day.
user_name:
Jeff G. W
Surprise, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Not really suitable for couples more a family venue. Unfortunately the weather was dreadful so spoiled the stay but convenient location on the beach. It takes ages to get any help especially when the TV internet wouldn't connect. Also the cleaners don't speak English to ask for tea /coffee which wasn't left. The restaurants are ok but the birds are aggressive although they do have signs to warn you. Wouldn't go back or recommend. Ignored request for low room and put us 2 from top of building.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a beautiful luxurious suite (time-share/condominium) hotel in the Hilton Hawaiian Village. It is well designed, quiet and comfortable. One Lanai had a view of the beach (my daughter saw a Whale breach from it) and the other looked down Ala Moana Blvd toward the mall, park and Downtown Honolulu. The building is on a lagoon with numerous watercraft swimming and tanning options available as well as on Waikiki Beach. There are several pools available, all of them were filled with children and parents. The nightly Luau is next door on the roof of the parking garage. It is quite loud, but does not run late.
