Sunday night has fireworks on the beach which would not have been visible from our room. We saw them from another room with members of our group.
user_name:
Thomas Hall D
Parsippany, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great visit to HI for our granddaughter's college graduation present. Super balcony view of the oceanfront and Convention Center Roof Top site of the daily Luau performance. We got the entire show but minus the great chow buffet. Actually made luau reservations at the luau next door at the Hale Koa so got the advantage of best price and best show!
user_name:
A. Lincoln G
Clifton, Virginia, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I guess the other islands have spoiled me. When on holiday I don' t want the first thing I do when I start my day is check the traffic! Hard to believe this paradise could be worse than LA for traffic.In any case the hotel property is excellent but closing one of the pools twice over 7 days when someone throws up in it (a child) was a bad omen for us and the four days my wife spent in bed.Just like every resort it sure would be nice to have someone actually enforce their " pool chair reservation" system! 4th elevator in our tower died days after our arrival, was still un repaired on our departure 12 days later. At peak hours all the elevators are needed. Staff was well informed, very capable and helpful. The hotel's location was ideal, a rather long walk but we walked back from the zoo. And the largest mall is within an easy walk.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed a fantastic week in Oahu at the Hilton Grand Waikikian. This resort is ideally located at the world famous Waikiki Beach where you can enjoy the sound of surf as feel the warm sand beneath your feet as you stroll this idyllic paradise. In addition to the vast expanses of the beach, Hilton has a private lagoon with a variety of water sports, such as paddle boards, kayaks, paddle boats and snorkeling. The views are incredible with picture perfect sunsets. Just a few blocks over from the beach a variety of stores and restaurants await your exploration and enjoyment. We went with another couple and this is definitely on your "to do" list every year.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We took our 4 adult children along with their spouses/fiance's, we had 2-2 bedroom suites in the Lagoon Tower for them, and our room was in the Grand Wakikian. We all enjoyed our rooms and the good times we shared as a family at the various resturants around the facility. It was a great time for all, and I would highly recommend this trip to any family. There are many fun things to do as a family.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: One year ago, we stayed in a Hilton Vacation Village in Orlando. It was beautiful. We were so disappointed when we arrived at the Hilton Grand Waikikian last month.There was no comparison. Our ocean view was a ways away with a parking lot and a marina between our hotel and the ocean. Directly to the right of the main balcony was H1. A six lane highway. The balcony off the bedroom was directly above the highway. By the way, the balcony is off the second bedroom not the master. If I had children staying in that room I'd be very afraid.The furniture was old and the rooms needed fresh paint. Unless you went to the pool area at 8:00 and reserved a chair with your towel (which is against policy but they do not enforce it) you don't get a chair. To get a chair for the beach is $15 and an umbrella is an additional $27 (per person). We would never recommend the Hilton Grand Waikikian. Never!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This isn`t hotel at all. I felt like at home for a 2 weeks. I must say that my family just slept and had a breakfast there. We left hotel everyday after breakfast and back in the evening.There`re too many beautiful places in Oahu you need to go!!! Famous Waikiki beach is fine but not the best. So we stay at hotel beach maybe 1 or 2 days. But hotel is fine, we`d suite - 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen and living room - so it was perfect for us (2 adults and 2 kids - 6, 11y old).This year we`ll stay in Oahu for a month but in rental house couse we don`t want travel every day to nice beach.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: One of the people my wife works with is part of the timeshare culture and let us use her time here. Upon arrival everything was the way it should be, professional check in, professional baggage handling, etc. First impressions for looks were very good. We did not have an ocean view but city view which was kind of a nice change as we would be on the beach all day. One surprise is how busy the traffic is on the main road next to the hotel. The traffic in the entire city is as bad as I have seen. You will hear sirens and loud exhaust systems with the patio doors closed but it's not bad. I liked the city and mountain views at night. This is an enormous complex with several hotel buildings and a mini shop and restaurant area in the middle which was also a nice surprise. We shopped and ate at several of them, (Frescos, Tropics, one of the Japanese places, the pizza place and the ice cream place). I also liked the several ABC stores on site for snacks. We laid out by two of the pools and one day on the beach and rented an umbrella and beach lounge chairs, all placed for us by staff. (By the way for you cheap skates, tip these guys, as I saw many people not tip them after they lugged these items out to the beach and set them up for you). I also tried paddle boarding in the lagoon which was really fun. There is a car rental place on the premises and we rented a car for the day and drove the north shore, only 75 dollars. Don't waste money on the Atlantis sub ride, you don't see much. There was a huge party and band on Friday night in the common area which we could have attended but did not, it looked fun though. I have seen many posts about this being a "Japanese tailored property". I have to disagree. While there was a large contingent of Japanese tourists and staff to assist them, there are as many non Japanese staff and people staying as well. Frankly I liked it as it made the hotel an international experience for us. The room was a suite with a fold out couch and full kitchen which we stocked with items from the ABC store. Huge bathroom, jacuzzi tub, and large patio and sitting area. Nice flat screens, and comfy furniture. We did run out of toilet paper and towels and I talked to a worker in the hallway who promptly brought us what we needed. Our next trip to Hawaii I don't think we would go to Waikiki or Oahu island as Maui was much more of the Hawaiian experience we were looking for, but if I had to go to Honolulu again, I would stay here no problem. Lots of pluses here, no real negatives, maybe the sheer size of the complex, but do your research first if this is a problem for you.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I can relax like your own home. It is a feeling that went back to home unlike hotels! I feel freshness "It's - Hawaii oh" very much I bought farmers' market fruits and vegetables, and eat in the lanai by creating a healthy smoothies in the morning because there is a full kitchen. The ~ I can make anything right refrigerator, rice cooker, microwave, oven, coffee maker, juicer, dishwasher equipped with We will always walk to serve as the exercise because about 10 minutes to walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center. It is good for health because it walk and well being in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The resort was fine. Nice pool and friendly staff. But the hotel left a lot to be desired. The furniture was worn out with scratches all over it. Our bedroom wardrobe wouldn't close and swung open taking one lower drawer along with it. And the enamel of our tub was chipped. Not what I expect from a Hilton brand. Best Western maybe, but not Hilton. But the worst part of our room was the view. We paid for a partial ocean view. And I recognize that we would only see a sliver of the ocean, which is fine. But what I don't expect from a partial ocean view (read = charged extra money) is a full frontal view of a very busy loud and smoggy street! Seriously?! This is the second highest category of view and I get the luxury of trying to sip my morning coffee while looking at the morning commute?! Never again. Stay at the Lagoon or Kalia.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I prepaid for a Hilton Grand vacations stay when I did a tour in Orlando. I chose this location over the other two Honolulu locations based on price and Trip Advisor ratings.This hotel is nice, but so are most other hotels in Honolulu. I was disappointed in the room and the view, especially after recently staying at the Elara in Vegas. The view from this 21st floor hotel was an unimpressive city view. I requested a high floor beach view, but I guess the are less willing to accommodate if you have prepaid for the room. Self parking was $27 a day and you had to drive to least the 3rd level of the deck unless you wanted to valet park, which was $33 a day. I hate valet parking, because you have to pay more to wait for your car. No big deal. The room was nice, but sort of bland for a beach room in Honolulu. It was clean when we entered the room, but they only service the room one time in a week unless you pay for more service. All the pillows are very thin, which is so unlike any other Hilton worldwide I've stayed in. I was able to eventually get service to bring me another one, but the guy stood there like he was wanting a tip. Why should I have to tip for a decent pillow? They would bring up towels quickly if you called down and requested it. I had a hard time getting toilet paper, so I finally went to the second floor and procured some off a cleaning cart. I'm not sure why they can't just stock extra in the room like other Hilton properties do. They have a decent kitchen with an empty fridge. Bring your own skillet or buy one, because theirs is terrible. For some reason I had to attend a sales pitch for the property, although I had already paid for the room. It was in the middle of the day, which ruined our day. I tried to get them to reschedule to another time for us, but they said they couldn't. We attended with an open mind anyway. My goal was to be very friendly and actively listen to their pitch, but "Lance" quickly changed my attitude. "Lance" didn't like when I mentioned that I wished I could have changed the time of our meeting. He rudely said they were too busy for that and that I should just be glad I got a good deal on the room. I told him that I paid almost $300 a night 8 months ago, which wasn't that a great of a deal after I researched that hotel and others. He got furious and exclaimed I was staying in a $1,200.00 a night room. I was shocked that he thought I was an idiot. I told him that I could have gotten this room for around $320 online. He told me I was wrong. I said I guess my computer was lying. He said it sure was. I then told him he needed to treat me better than that, because I did have a little sense. I have an MBA and am very well-traveled staying in many hotels, including some in Honolulu. He said he didn't care and then asked me if I planned on wasting his time or if I was buying. I told him not with the way he was treating me. He then walked out of the room and then came back to tell us that we were free to go, while he escorted us to the door. I then proceeded to give him a tip to help him, because I work with consumers daily. I told him he would be more effective if the treated people nicer instead of like third-graders. He didn't seem to care. I can't believe Hilton lets their salesmen treat potential customers like crap. What a way to lose a potential customer. This hotel was just okay for me. I will not be staying at this one again.
user_name:
Steve S
Silver Spring, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are HGVC members. Have stayed at HIlton Hawaiian Village before, this was our first time at the Grand Waikkian though. We had a partial ocean view two room unit (room 1805.) Two minor complaints about the room. 1) when we checked in we were told we would have a great view of the fireworks from our room. No, it was an OK view, I wish we had gone down to the beach. The Rainbow Tower blocked most of them. 2) AC was great in the living room and the second bedroom, but pretty wimpy in the master bedroom.Room was clean and plenty spacious for the five of us. We like staying at the resort with our teens as there is plenty of stuff for them to do and hang on their own. Staff is great...very responsive when we called for more towels or anything else. When the parking elevator was closed for maintenance a staff member walked us through a back way all the way to our car (he could have just pointed out the stairs.) Enjoy the bar service at the pool and all the food options (have the pork nachos at Tropics...yum!)1805 is right next to the elevator. However, we hardly noticed it. Sometimes in the morning when it was really quiet I could hear a slight swooshing sound...it actually sounded like waves, but we were not close enough to the water to hear those. It did have the two twin beds in the second bedroom, which is what we really needed.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village is immense - over 20 acres of campus including shops, restaurants, tours, art, pools, beach, and lagoon. It is an urban setting so do not confuse it with a Maui, Kauai, or Big Island's beautiful and tranquil beaches - but is does have its draw for those who want a little bit more action, large selection of marvelous restaurants, easy transportation in Waikiki and Honolulu. It is expensive vacationing and if you are staying in town do not rent a car the parking alone will be $30 to $40 per day. Depends on what you want in a vacation and what you are willing to pay for it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent 10 days at the Grand Waikikian and enjoyed every minute. We had a great view, we were able to cook and do laundry. We were close to a mall, walmart, and other stores and restaurants. Great beach, pools, gym, bars, yummy brkfst buffet. In walking distance of Waikiki but in a nicer spot. We even walked/ran to Diamond Head.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We loved the Grand Waikikian at the Hilton Hawaiian Village.Firstly we are not time share holders but we were asked by concierge if we were interested in sitting in on a presentation. I told him that we already own property elsewhere and we weren't interested. He accepted this and it wasn't mentioned again.Our 2 bedroom room was wonderful it was very clean and comfortable for 2 adults and 2 teenage girls. We wanted a room this size as teenagers need their own space as we were staying 12 nights. It had a partial ocean view which was very nice indeed. The house keeping was also exceptional except they don't like to leave toilet paper and we had to keep asking for this. They would immediately send up as many rolls as we required. The only down fall would be that their beds need upgrading. I found them to be very uncomfortable, not bad enough to say I had a bad night sleep but I like the Hilton sleep serenity beds and having stayed in many Hilton hotels this is what I expect to sleep on. If they upgrade there beds (and they should as they are getting old) this would have been a perfect room. Having a washer and dryer in the room is a BIG BONUS as this is something that I now look for when booking a room.Our room was right next to the elevators and many people say that they can hear the elevators and ask for a room away from them. Well up until now I have never stayed near the elevators and I have to agree. From now on when I book a hotel room I will DEFIANTLY be asking not to be near the elevators. It really is annoying and I couldn't work out what this noise was that was keeping me awake, it was the elevators and YES they go all night. This is nothing against the Hotel as it would be the same where ever you stay. I guess it only takes one experience to realize this.The HHV it self is FABULOUS very glad we stayed there but it could have been closer to the center of Waikiki. It is only about a 10 minute walk to Ala Moana which is good but like a 30 minute walk to Waikiki. It really is to far to just pop down to Waikiki for tea so plan to be there in the afternoon and hang around for tea. Recommend the Cheesecake factory before 6pm. We went there at about 5:30pm and had to wait till 6pm to be seated but we expected this and planed it that way. You can have up to a 2 hr wait at times. The restaurants in the village are great as well, we ate at the New York Deli 3 times including breakfast, Roundtable pizza, the Italian restaurant and the Japanese Steakhouse. All was wonderful. You don't have to leave the village it is a holiday destination in itself.As a well rounded traveler I would defiantly recommend the Grand Waikikian at the Hilton Hawaiian Village my family and I loved it. I really don't understand negative reports and think that some people are just to hard to please.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It was the first time of stay is the owner. Overseas for the first time without using a travel agency, to go in person. It was full of anxiety, but I was able to hotel employees greeted me politely, to stay comfortable. In addition, I am very happy where you would like to visit is made​​.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I love grand wakikian in wakiki, although I live in Kailua, which about 20 minutes away, I love to spend time in this hotel few time a year. My children specially enjoy the penguin and the flamingo in the hotel, whenever we take a walk in the hotel during. however service is really poor if you are not Japanese. don't understand that. Front staff would approach you with Japanese, this is USA, pls respect and speak English. It made me feel disgrace.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We booked this via another club membership. Flights got cancelled and we arrived 2 days later - that there is no refund is acceptable but there was no effort whatsoever to make up for it. We tried to upgrade from a non sea view room but got a "not possible". We booked telling we have a 1 year old and requested a travel bed. After check in there was no baby bed and took 3 phone calls to get one. The welcome gift, however, is the biggest joke: a card which provides for some discounts at Hilton facilities and restaurants. Rooms are functional but run down. The overall impression is that this is a very commercial place offering anonymity.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Don't book here if you are not a vacation club member. We got the "only available room" turns out to be accessible--a hard task to deal with with two 5 year olds in tow--no tub and shower with no water protection--wheel in wheel out. Partial ocean view only if on lanai and leaning. TERRIBLE! Booked on Hilton's site. Expensive for what you get--book elsewhere--Sheraton looks better--water slides, pool and more central--closer to the main beach.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is the most fantastic hotel I have ever been in! The hotel room has a washer and dryer which came in very handy after a day at the beach! Also, the refrigerator and stove was good for cooking breakfast in the morning. My kids loved the water slides and the lagoon, the water was pretty chilly but once you were in it was fine.Every staff member we came across was cheerful and eager to please. I liked the no resort fee for this part of the hotel. The wifi was fast. Everything was great!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is everything you could want from a vacation in Hawaii. It is in a great location and has great views of the ocean. There are lots of activities and restaurants located within walking distance. The only thing that I didn't like about this hotel was the valet service. It always took them 15 minutes to get my car. I tried several times to call ahead and have them bring it up but never got anyone on the phone. Whenever I would return to the hotel I could never find them either. I would wait for 5-10 minutes and then end up just leaving the car on the driveway with the keys in it cause there was no valet to be found. Very annoying. If they improved the valet the hotel would be the best.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This tower is part of the 22 acres of Hilton facilities at the west end of Waikiki. While it is "beach front" it is about a 6" walk out to the beach. But it is a nice walk. The entire 22 acres are very family friendly with several pools and nice landscaping. The restaurants we ate at were good, not spectacular, but very convenient. The beach was nice - a rocky bottom in some areas. It is less crowded than the beach more towards the center of Waikiki. It is about a 10" walk down to the center of Waikiki. There is live music somewhere on the resort property every night and we were pleasantly surprised at the quality of some of the groups. We were in a 2 bedroom with our 2 adult children and there was plenty of room. The kitchen was well stocked for making meals rather than going out. We rented a car and drove to Safeway and stocked up so only ate out once a day at most. Eating and drinking in Waikiki is not cheap. There is a little market on the property that was fairly well supplied. There are numerous shops around the 22 acres and really you could never leave the Hilton property and be just fine. We all agreed that we would like to return to this resort in the future.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was a perfect choice for our family of two adults and two teens 13 & 15. Very comfortable, plenty of space, dreamy beds, great views, fireworks and spoiled for swimming choices. Free wi-fi a must with teens and was one of the perks of staying here. Our kids loved the paradise pool with slides and waterfall. We stayed a week and loved the service, lagoon, free hotel beach towel service, and direct beach access. We didn't want a hotel room and we were worried about being outside the main strip, but it was a perfect location. We stayed in room 2603 - beach views, partial Diamond Head view and city lights at night. From the balcony you could watch the sun rise in the morning and the sun set in the evening.15 minute beach walk into the main strip or $6 in a taxi, 10 min walk or $6 taxi to Ala Moana shopping centre. Food a bit pricey and hotel services a bit touristy but you expect that. Pronto Pickle great for fresh snacks and lunches. We shopped at the on-site ABC store for breakfast but you could get groceries in town. CJs New York Deli the best for dinner - great burgers and fab service. Outside the resort try Spanners - 5 mins walk and great chicken wings! Helpful concierges and the front of house guys were outstanding - lots of tips and always smiling. We loved this resort. While you're staying here don't miss dinner at Dukes in the main part of Waikiki, Hanauma Bay if you love snorkelling, and visiting the north shore. All within an easy drive. We also did the on-site luau which is more like dinner and a show so we had low expectations based other reviews but we were pleasantly surprised. They were renovating the rooftop venue and they held the luau on the lawn - perfect location and great entertainment if you don't mind the price. Dancers and host were energetic, professional and really entertaining. I would highly recommend the resort for people who want the convenience of an apartment on the beach at Waikiki.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed our first trip to Hawaii. The accomodations are fine and close to the airport and highways. The traffic is heavy in and around the resort. Once you get out of the Honolulu/ Waikiki area travel is easier. The property is on the beach. There are many Hilton facilities on the Hilton Hawaiian Village property so it is crowded. There is something for everyone so you have many choices of things to do.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very comfortable, high end accommodations at this Hilton timeshare. We had a one bedroom plus on the Ala Moana Street side. The unit was very comfortable with great amenities and upscale Hawaiian decor. The street noise was quite loud with the lanai doors open, but with doors closed and the air on, the room was quiet enough for us.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I had the highest rated room available on Hiltons website... single room suite .. "premier" Premier is their best. I had a partial view of the ocean but looking straight out of the room you stare into another high rise. very disappointing for the best "premier" room. can't imagine what "plus" and "standard" would have been.
user_name:
Richard Bruce L
missoula, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have stayed at this location of Hilton Grand on two occasions. We would recommend the Lagoon location and discourage the Hilton Grand location. It does not have the quality of view or the security to reduce the invasive smokers that the Lagoon location seems to provide.
user_name:
William Robert S
San Diego, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great resort for a family! Location perfect for walking to restaurants, shopping, leisure activities and of course the beach! Watched an episode of Hawaii 5o being filmed and rented a car for a few great beach drives. Only thing I didn't like was that there was no recycling in the rooms, poolside or resort. Luau was fun but I feel was not worth the money spent.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: You can never go wrong with the beach, the shopping, the overall feel of Waikiki but unfortunately this property is extremely overcrowded. The pools are completely full. You cannot get a seat until 20 minutes before they close. This whole saving chairs is ridiculous. The staff say it isn't allowed but they do nothing to change it. You have to pay, pay, pay for everything - even a chair to sit on. When you pay over $600 a night I expect to be able to sit on a chair without paying for it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian is an outstanding vacation resort offering amazing and enjoyable amenities which would please the most discriminating and pickiest guest. The full kitchen is fully equipped to accommodate the 6-person capacity of the two-bedroom suite. The two bathrooms were very clean and equipped with ultra modern showering and toilet apparatus. The entertainment equipment in all rooms were outstanding. The air conditioning system with its digital controls kept my family cool during the warm winter days of Christmas Eve and Day. Bravo Zulu!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was my second time staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and 1st time in this tower. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with a city view. The room was nicely decorated and had most of the comforts of home. The unit had a washer and dryer in the closet, which made doing laundry very convenient. The overall property is beautiful and scenic with multiple restaurants and shops. I recommend heading across the street for breakfast at the Wailana Coffee House for a reasonably priced breakfast. The Tropics Bar and Grill on the property has and excellent view and live music in the evening (not sure of the exact nights). The paradise pool is great for toddlers one older children. Parking is quite expensive and we rarely rent a car when in Honolulu. A few bus stops are pretty close to the property and fairly inexpensive.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very nice modern rooms with a lot of space and nice amenities. The tower is beautiful and extremely clean and well maintained. As for the whole property, it is massive and can be a bit overwhelming at times.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I stayed in Partial ocean view on the 22nd floor. I'm can only see the ocean if I stick my head over the balcony . I should have paid for city view. Rooms are nice and spacious. I stayed in a one bedroom suite. Washer and dryer in the room came in handy. The hotel is based on a busy road so thankfully the doors and windows are double glazed. It's actually very quiet. Forget the pool. Over Xmas period there were no seats by the pool and no room in the pool.. Waikiki beach was fine. Ala moana is a leisurely 10 minute walk. Check in was a breeze. I will be staying here again .

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a very nice place to spend a vacation if you are interested in seeing the city. Most places of interest are within walking distance. Places a bit farter away are easily visited using public transportation (only 2.50) or by taking a tour which the hotel will help you arrange.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the Grand Waikikian as part of a Hilton trip (i.e. not timeshare). The units were clean, and pretty good at keeping noise out from the other rooms around us. The service from the staff was excellent, and the restaurants on site were much better than expected.
user_name:
Scyphers
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Upon arriving at the grand waikikian, the staff was helpful. Check-in was quick and I immediately went to my room. The room was okay; the shower head desperately needed to be cleaned along with hair that I also found on the walls. I laid down in bed and when I looked up, I noticed there was blue silly string on the ceiling. It was literally dangling from the ceiling. How could they miss that? The view was okay; one of the other hilton properties was blocking the view of the beach. The next day, I went to the front desk and asked about going to the USS Missouri. The women's English was poor and proceeded to tell me as best as she could that it was closed. I took my chance and went. It was NOT closed. The Arizona Memorial was. I'm glad I didn't listen to her. The little food marts in the hotel had workers in there that could also barely speak English. I understand that the hotel is geared toward Japanese tourists, but c'mon. If you plan on staying here, you'll know what I'm talking about. Everyone warned me that I should go to Maui; I wished listened. On a side note, I also went to the Mandara Spa. My legs were in such pain I desperately needed a massage. I left not feeling any better. I asked the masseuse to please focus on my legs and to not focus on my feet. She completely ignored me and focused on my feet and barely massaged my thighs and calves. What a waste of money and time. The best part was the hot tub before the massage.
user_name:
Susana I
Stirling, New Jersey, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A great place to go with a family, with lots to do. The central location was great, with everything in walking distance. The service of the hotel staff let them down. The pull out couch was very uncomfortable to sleep on.
user_name:
Nick H
Hanmer Springs, New Zealand

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our first trip to Hawaii and we enjoyed it and the hotel played a large part. Our two bedroom two bath allowed us to sleep well and also hang out in the room when we were tired. We were able to buy groceries to eat breakfast and some lunches in our kitchen area. They were many restaurants to choose from but were more expensive than needed. The on site Dairy Queen was an exception and it was very popular. Staff was friendly and helpful and the place was very clean. This location is not quite on the main drag of Waikiki but this cuts down a bit on traffic and noise and the walk to Waikiki and superb high end shopping is about 10-15 minutes away.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As HGV timeshare owners we got a room on the second from the top floor of the Lagoon Tower, Diamond Head View. Nice view of beach and fireworks, but very noisy in the evenings. Luau on rooftop below us ran most nights 5:30-8:00 pm, which would have been ok, except it competes for noise with ive entertainment at the Tropics Bar, a short distance away, and several night, with a huge inflatable TV screen set up on the lawn below our window that was so loud we could listen to the movies with our room windows and door shut (23 floors up!). The noise stopped by about 10:30 which would have been ok (but spoils dinners on the lanai), and then the delivery and service trucks back up with loud beeping noises in the center of the complex from 5 am most days, and from 2 am on two days during our stay. It woke us up every night and we got very interrupted sleep. The other complaint is that the parking in Waikiki is miserable. Parking at the hotel is $27 per day (and we are Elite owners at HGV). There should have been a discount. We enjoyed the Italian restaurant, Fresco, in the village and a place called Cheeseburger in Waikiki just down the street, but most other meals in Waikiki were overpriced and of limited choice. We did not try any other restaurants on site. We would have enjoyed our stay a lot more if we did not have to listen to the service vehicles each night.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very nice family vacation spot. I would stay here again! However, I would choose to each at another location (many to choose from) if you want good friendly service! Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I was able to spend a very good holiday. Two still small children seem to have been very happy. I was able to usually enjoy the sea and the swimming pool which were not so good to the full.. In addition, I am going to come next year.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The best thing is it is located in the heart of Waikiki. The rooms are nice, the pools are cold an the lagoon well bring a wetsuit. If you like to feel like you at at the mall on vacation than this is the resort for you.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent facility/accomodation and nice place for work in a relux environment, it is attaractive for me to work. I am a Telecommunications consultant, and only this thing I need for work, it is internet access. I work for my clients and phone conversation with my clients. After work, seaside walking reflesh me up gently. I do visit HGVC facility for not only relaxization but also for work. End of this month. I will visit Vegas.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have stayed here several times and have always been extremely happy. The penthouse concierges and the serving staff in the penthouse lounge are second to none.  We love the suites and their amenities and would never stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It was good to have from being let me play safely in the pool and lagoon small children because it was together. The children had fun in so close, you can also picnic in the park, such as shopping malls. I think enjoy nothing more did not activity, but children when they grow. Fun for example is are there such as penguins, but my daughter though was chasing the pigeons. I was able to eat the best breakfast on the terrace of Room with a view overlooking the sea and my wife

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great staff, comfortable accommodations, but very crowded and in the midst of a busy city. Not a place for couples seeking a quiet paradise. The entire complex of hotels is congested and too touristy. Mobs of people on the grounds and around the small crowded pools. The resort is not on the beach as claimed, but a short walk to Waikiki Beach which is noisy and crowded. Not a peaceful and relaxing setting.
user_name:
Paul Richard T
palm beach, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Aloha,We stayed at The Grand Waikikian in September 2013 for 2 glorious weeks. I was very nervous prior to our travel as I had booked direct through Hilton Vacation Ownership and we had to do a timeshare presentation. I must admit I was checking trip advisor regularly to see if I could get a good understanding of the hotel. I was scared at some points with peoples reviews of the properties but just kept thinking that was their opinion only. We arrived at the hotel at 9am to a lovely and hospitable welcome. Our room was not ready (which we had expected), so they let us shower and refresh on Level 8, which was just what we needed. So we hit the streets for breakfast with our buzzer in our hands waiting for our room. We got a beep at 1pm and we were in our room absolutely thrilled at what we had been given. I could finally relax.. it truly was fantastic and exceeded all my expectations. Dennis our personal concierge had already left a lovely message for us and we felt like all was going to be great... which it was.The 2 Bedroom Apartment was fantastic and spacious. I have 2 boys with food allergies, so the kitchen was my best friend. It was well equipped with pots and pans. We had enough crockery and glasses for 6 people which was enough for us. In Bedroom 2 we had 2 double beds which was great and a king in the Master Room. Make sure you get above 7th floor if you are staying on the resort side as you do not want to be looking at the car park. I would have been so upset with that view, especially after travelling 11 hours from Australia. The pool area is fantastic but very busy. My only complaint is that people would leave their towel on seats and leave the hotel. I had a couple do it in front of us. They left the grounds with their towels on the seats, then came back over an hour later. This is so not fair as you want to watch your children whilst they are playing in the pool. This might be something for the hotel to look into. (Very hard to control though). I said to my husband that the pool with the slides lacked poolside service. But on our last 3 days this became available with a cafe opening up. Fantastic to sit with a cocktail by the pool.We did many tours, which were fantastic. The only downside to this is that we had to walk all the way to the tour desk on the other side of Hilton Hawaiian Village to get collected. At 6.30 or 7.45 in the morning and 2 kids this was a bit of a task. They should be able to collect you from Grand Waikikian entrance, It would make it a bit easier.The location is a bit further out from Kalakahua Ave but it is an easy 15 min walk. If you want to be in the middle of it all then maybe this is not for you. We were happy with the location as it was a 10 minute beachside walk to Trump on Kalia RD, and a 10 minute walk in the other direction to Ala Moana Shopping Centre. We ended up buying a 7 day Waikiki Trolley pass that came in handy when my little boy was too tired to walk back. It was time to do the Timeshare presentation. Coming from Australia we really didn't know much about it, but we were interested to find out. We did not feel at all under any pressure to buy. Melissa our agent was lovely and then we met Ron which was great. I just wish we had more information before we attended as we were not going to commit to a $30,000 purchase until I spoke to my accountant. I would have liked more information to bring home with me so I could investigate this option for us more closely. We were offered a deal to come back and stay by 2015, but didn't take it up at the time as i felt like information overload. I like to contemplate things before I jump in and buy. We decided to take up this offer as it would allow us to investigate time share more closely at Hilton. To this day I am still waiting on a response from phone calls, messages left prior to leaving Grand Waikikian,nand emails re this offer, which is pretty disappointing.In Conclusion, we had the most amazing time on our holiday and it would have not been as memorable if it wasn't for the care to detail and patience of Linda Bade. She made our Hawaii trip so successful and we are now organising our next one. You will love your stay at Grand Waikikian. Mahalo

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed in the Grand Waikikian tower for a week. My husband and I brought our two grown daughters with us. We all felt that we had died and gone to heaven! What a beautiful view we had from the 30th floor! The employees were all friendly and helped us with anything we needed. Such as,( my daughter left her curlers on and remembered on our way to a Luau) she called from her cell and they took care of the problem. I popped a button on the back of my dress, the desk attendant sent me a kit to repair ASAP. We could not have asked for better service. The two bedroom suite was gorgeous, of course the beds were clean and slept wonderful! Mahalo, Hilton Grand Vacations!!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: after moving from a 1 bedroom plus in the kalia tower, to a 1 bedroom plus in the grand waikikian, my disappointment was overwhelming . being a grand vacation owner, I know you get what you book and point pay for, so my kalia ocean view was just what I was expecting, but my grand waikikian plus, was so disappointing. when booking online, a 1 bedroom is a city view, a 1 bed plus is a ocean view, and a premier is an ocean view/front. we have stayed in the GW several times before and all times have booked a plus, having a view of the ocean. this visit we were on the road side, with a view of the neighbouring Iliki hotel and the road towards red lobster. if you leaned out over the balcony the ocean could be viewed . after phoning to complain , I was told I would have needed premier view to assure the ocean was my view. this needs to be addressed because all other visits I have booked a plus and had ocean, the description needs to be changed so there are no misunderstandings. I would have been better off saving my points and only booking a 1bedroom, because you can't get any less view than the road. all in all, a bitter sweet end to another wonderful stay in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Was on a business trip to Honolulu and found the Hilton Hawaiian Village a very good value for money. The location to the Waikiki area is superb. I found that getting around that area was pleasant. Lots of good shops and plenty of places to eat. I recommend the Hilton property to anyone while visiting the island of Oahu.
user_name:
Barry M
Seaford, Virginia, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great property, too bad the front desk customer service isn't up to Hilton standards. Room was great, amenities great. On day of check out received late check out (in writing) until 1 pm. At 12:20 front desk called to tell me they were charging me $150 since I was not out by noon. I told them about late check out, but they did not care and insisted on charging me anyway.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very nice resort. Fantastic shopping experience since you can just walk downstairs and the world is at your fingertips. Free DVD rentals. They charge you for umbrellas and chairs (hefty rental fee) if you decide to go to the beach. The pools are very congested. Location is key however. Parking per day fee; however, you can go in and out at no extra cost.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Is the Grand Waikikian better than the lagoon tower ? partial ocean view is a joke , I am in 2312 maybe you can see a bit of ocean if you hang over the balcony and crane your head. The Lagoon tower has better ocean views. You can not hear the annoying nightly luau from the GW , so that is a plus ! There is no direct way in to this building, you seem to have to walk around or thru the Lagoon tower lobby. There should be an entrance closer to the front of the property. I am not trying to sound lazy but if you like hanging out at the pool - making several trips to get supplies during the day , this can get annoying ! The rooms are nice the TV's are way too small , as much money as they spent on this property the TV's in the room are pathetic ! again this year I am VERY DISSAPOINTED with the number of umbrellas at the pools , none of the pool have any or enough umbrellas. HILTON , not everyone wants to bake in the sun all day. Spend $200.00 each and but some damn umbrellas !!! If you want to come here to relax and do nothing besides hang at the pool, this can be a MAJOR bummer, almost enough to make one not want to come back ! They re-did the TAPA pool , I don't like it as much. It used to be more secluded now people can get in from both ends of the pool ( it used to be only open at the bar end ) so it is busier. The beds in the one bedroom are kind of small for two people, I am guessing the are queen, king would have made a big difference. I would not mention the small things but this is a HILTON GRAND VACATIONS CLUB , I just expect a little better of the small things. overall it is a nice place, and I would recommend it - as long as you don't want to find a shady spot by the pool, if you do call ahead and see if the bought damn umbrellas !

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My fiancé was offerd this trip as a promotion to have her buy into a time share. We were offered 7 days plus car rental at Dollar and an upgrade from a 1 BR/ 1 bath to a 2 BR/ 2 bath suite (we paid for the upgrade)About us, we are well travelled in the US and abroad, middle class in late 40's of age. The experience;1) Dollar Car Rental is off site from the airport and is on the low end of car rental but free is free. The car wasn't clean and wasn't the best but again, it was free. 2) Upon arrival we were registered within 10 min and given a Hawaiian leis. My fiancé asked if we could have a room with an ocean view and was told it was a "city view" lol. OK, we had to try. We were taken to the 15th floor and upon entering found that it did indeed have an ocean view and overlooked parking and the luau as well (faced the Rainbow Hilton). We were pleased with the view. The room was a generous in size, fully equipped and even had a washer and dryer. Everything was clean and problem free. Our weeks stay was overall very satisfying. The property was clean ( they even buff the sidewalks) with plenty of shops, resturaunts and pools though I wish one pool was dedicated to adults only. The property was definitely kid/ family friendly and one evening we noted a childs movie being played on the lawn. The staff were friendly, and helpful including the valet, concierge and bellman. We had such a nice stay that my fiancé who was already a Hilton Diamond decided to buy into the time share. The salesperson was extremely nice, helpful and ultimately was instrumental in her deciding to make the purchase. Now the critical part;1) Upon registration, it would have seemed that the girl helping us should have known which side our room was facing. Surprised us upon seeing the ocean and a big plus but still she should have known. 2) Checkin was 4 pm and they stick to it no matter how early you get there. However, they do give you access to a nice lounge that has showers. 3) The worst problem and ALMOST a deal breaker was in the last hour of our stay. In signing the deal for the timeshare we were going to run past our checkout time and the salesman called the front desk and told them our checkout could be 1pm instead of the customary late 12 noon. At 12:20 a lady called stating we hadn't checked out yet and was charging $150 to her card. When my fiancé told her we had an email stating 1 pm and what had happened, she continued to state she was charging her $150. After asking for the manager, it was resolved and we checked out at 1 pm. We wanted to talk to a manager face to face but was told they were all out to lunch but one would call us before leaving the island in 3 hours. 3 days later, we are still waiting. All said, we enjoyed ourselves and were happy but Hilton needs to work on customer care. One wasn't knowledgable and the other was rude and almost lost them a $20,000.00 deal in 2 minutes. As a manager herself, my fiancé was mad at the time and felt a manager would want to know about a staff member that was just pain rude. Apparently not!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a great experience at the hotel. Our triplets are a handful so having a washer, dryer and full kitchen made life easy. Service was good, the suite a good size and the fact that we had access to all the Hilton hotel facilities and amenities allowed us to be able to be entertained for our entire 8 days without needing to leave.
user_name:
Les K
san francisco, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are Elite Members and Hilton Honors members. Stayed at the Grand Waikikian for the first time last week and it was a VERY disappointing experience compared to the prior week at Kings Land. I sent an email about this but no response. This is the first of a few posts to show all the pics. 1. The sheets were not supplied for the pull out bed so had to call room service.2. We were missing a dinner plate had to call room service again.3. had to have the PS3 replaced 3 times & and have a tech visit twice. He spent 90 min trying to get the units to play Blue Ray in the living room. 4. cabinet doors were coming off the hinges - had to call room service a 3rd time.5. The bathroom door wouldn't lock which upset my teen daughter6. chipped and peeling furniture6. The Paradise pool looks like it hasn't been scrubbed in months (see pic) one of the water slides isn't working ad when I asked the life guard he said it's been out for a while and no ETA to fix it. 7. Garbage everywhere around the pool. Do they ever clean up?

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I like Hilton Grand Wikikian. Its location is very good. I can walk to the center of the wikiki and also to the alamoana syopping center. From the eastan side the guest rooms, we can see both wikiki city and the ocean. In the day time we can enjoy beautiful blue ocean, and in the night, we can enjoy a beautiful bright city view.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The resort life has been enjoyed fully in Honolulu. Moreover, I does my best for one year. Breakfast bakes the egg, the bacon, and the bread which were purchased in the supermarket, and is energy filling. We swim in a pool or the sea and shop before or after a lunch. Returning, after swimming quaffs the beer which carried out bulk buying. Supper takes a walk in sands in the direction of Waikiki Beach, and is to the Bar restaurant (early bird & happy hour aim) of an on-the beach. Return is a walk about a street, carrying out window shopping.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our third time stay at Grand Waikikian after two years interval. It is a general rule that value of commertial object is decreased as time goes by. I am sure that rule is applied in GW case. We are not satisfied it in terms cost performance.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our first time to stay in the Grand Waikikian, which is our home resort of HGVC as timeshare owner. Our first stay in the resort was generally great. However, we are not sure to rate this resort as Hotel for the TripAdvisor, especially in the view of cost performance, as we paid only taxes for nights. It was favorable for us without daily room clean-up service - stressfree, no disturbance during our jet-lag rest. We could everytime wash and dry towels in the room with equipped machine. No amenities were needed, as we broguht all our preferences.　Water pressure of showers were unfortunately dissatisfied. Shower heads should be changed to some applicable type for lower water pressure.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great amenities and location on the water. There is a lagoon and the beach abutting the property. My family enjoyed stay and both facilities and staff where very good. While right on the beach, it is not really in the downtown part of Waikiki. That is both good and bad. Things are calmer right outside the street boundary of the property, but we ended up having to taxi it to a number of restaurants and shops which is both expensive and time consuming for a family. It would have been nice to walk, and that would have been possible, but our seven year old, especially after a long day at the pool and beach, was not up to the half mile walk.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great Service! I'm an 'owner' that used 'open season' for two nights availability at The Grand Wailea. This is such a great value when available. This property is beautifully landscaped and just a short walk (10 minutes) to all that Waikiki has to offer. I used Speedi Shuttle from HNL and round trip was $23.00!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a problem of a contract although it was regrettable that it is a room the sea is hard to look at. If it is removed, it will be a large and beautiful guest room. It is a washing machine to a kitchen. It is very convenient. Although Ala Moana Shopping Center is also near, he can enjoy himself enough in Hilton Hawaiian Village.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I was sad to come to this property and not to be happy. First let me say the positives. It is located right on Waikiki beach and has a beautiful property and the location if you like busy is great. The things I don't like. a 1 bedroom is like for 2 or max 3 people. The beds are small, like a small double. My husband and I had a problem and my 2 boys were too big to sleep in one bed. Plus the beds and pillows are not great. I tell you this as an owner. We own a 2 bedroom but haven't experienced it yet. There are no grills outside for the owners to use and the kitchen is functional but not great. There are also only 4 elevators for 39 floors, granted they are fast but at check-in and check-out times it can take a while. Also, even as an owner, if you have a rental car, you pay $27 a day to self park. I feel that it is all too busy and is getting more expensive as they cater to the Asian market. p.s. in the summer months forget the pools, too crowed and no lifeguards on duty.I am sad to post this review since I do like this property as well as own here.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location of the hotel, right by the beach. The pools are really good but are always very crowded, the property needs to be bigger in order to make a more open atmosphere. The concierges barely spoke english which was a problem, most of them spoke Japanese. Try getting a good suite room, a normal room is not very nice. We upgraded our room after the first night and the upgraded room was very nice. Definetly enjoyed my stay but would not consider it again because of the quantity of people.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Block out drape needs to be added to the shades in masterbedroom and the front desk staff needs to answer phones promptly and give out lais to welcome people. Also the concierge should call close to booking to answer questions and tell you the free tix they give to entice you mean you won't get a lai at luau. Also luau needs to be on beach not parking garage. Bad atmosphere on concrete.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very clean and attractive. The pool and beach area do get crowded, so if you do not want to have to get up early on your vacation rethink this resort. There is plenty of shopping and restaurants available. It is in a good location if you intend on staying in an urban setting. Walking around the area is quite easy. Use the beachwalk.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Booking of room and flight to coincide, they did not mention the events that occur each week so you can plan around it. They have a fireworks show every Friday. Check in scheduled on Friday and check out on Friday. Flight arrives after fireworks and departs before - go figure. Had a room with two terraces and view of odd stuff on the damaged roof of the building below. I felt that service always asked what room we were in to determine what kind of service to offer. Lower floor, lower service. We had to figure out our way around the facilities. No detailed maps and the maps they had were all varied - one is a restaurant map, another a activities map. Then you need a map for the city. I had three maps in my pocket. Then there separate maps for the different buses and trolleys.
user_name:
Eric G
San Lorenzo, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian is visually very appealing. I like the washer and dryer inside the room and the wood floors. However, I sooner stay in the Lagoon tower. The rooms are bigger and have a better view from the lani, for a much lower point cost.
user_name:
Ceasar Pedeglor... B
Ewa Beach, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Last year we spent some time in a penthouse suite and thought we would never be so fortunate as to do it again. Not so! As luck would have it, we managed to squeeze three nights in the Penthouse again this year. It did not disappoint. To clarify, the penthouse suites at the Grand Waikikian are not your standard HGVC Penthouse suites. It comes with private Penthouse concierge service, daily cleaning service and evening turndown service, Penthouse lounge, complimentary continental breakfast, and cocktail/ pupu hour nightly including complimentary beer/wine. Penthouse suites are floors 35 and up. Theses cost a ridiculous amount of points (but are totally worth it). This year we got a two bedroom penthouse (ph) suite - room 3511. This suite was truly amazing. Being on the end of the building, it encompassed the entire side of the building, and offered three balconies each with its own view on a different side of the building. So we had a diamond head view (lots of ocean), a city view/ ocean view, and a full city view. Unreal!! The suite was beautifully decorated, well appointed and in good shape. Two balconies were average size and one was quite long. The views were gorgeous. Both bedrooms had bathrooms with jacuzzi tubs under the windows that allowed you to relax in the tub while enjoying the beautiful city lights at night. The second bedroom's shower was quite large and had a seat in the shower. Both bedrooms had their own balconies. The layout was not as open as the standard two-bedroom floor plan because of its end location, but given those views, there was no reason to complain. The suite is also on the same floor as the Penthouse lounge, which was very convenient. That meant we also had convenient access to the concierge staff just down the hall. There was no increased noise associated with being near the lounge. What really makes having a penthouse suite worthwhile is actually, in our opinion, the amazing Penthouse staff. We were really thrilled to see no turnover in the concierge staff from last year. Each one of them is remarkable in their own way. They are on top of everything, knowledgeable, multi-lingual, and just plain pleasant. We just love each one of them. From managing room switches, to making a dinner reservation, to making recommendations for what not to miss on your day's plans, to just smoothing out some little wrinkle, they can be counted on 100%. They remember everything. It's great walking in to the lounge for breakfast and being greeted by "so how was dinner at Tiki's last night? Did you try the ribs?". They just never miss a beat. I am not exaggerating when I say these people make the trip go from great to spectacular!! Penthouse was all we remembered it to be. Great suites, amazing views, and truly wonderful staff. I know we won't catch all of you (and we do mean to....not one of you fails to amaze us) and I will likely butcher some spelling but ... Thanks Keiko, Mayumi, Hiromi, David, Darlene and Stanley! We miss you already.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: just want to go back! big beach, nice surf, nice pools, great icecream! Great staff! Very nice island with very nice people, best beach is on the other side of the island, but best choices for family stuff is in honolulu. Dolphins! Turtles! Lava tunnel diving! Surfing! Skydiving! Polynesian cultural center, very interesting! Helicopter Tours!
user_name:
Rickard Jan Ken... D
Stockholm, Sweden

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Wow we finally went to a hotel where they greet you with Leis when you arrive. Such a great finished hotel with great wood work and fountains everywhere, and a 3 slide pool. The room had wood floors, easily cleaned and a great kitchen, " if you want to cook, we didn't " A great balcony on the 28th floor that overlooked the Park and ocean. A little scary if you are afraid of heights but we didn't request a lower floor, but was fine.. The private room had a great mattress, slept like a baby. Service was great when you needed it, they were always willing to help.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We recently stayed in the Grand Waikikian for 5 nights and had a wonderful time. I traveled with wife and kids 6 and 9. The facility is big and it is commingled with other Hilton towers. At some point in time it felt a little crowded, specially at some times during the day where lots of people was checking in. We arrived early because we were flying from Seoul. They did not allow us to get to our room until 3:30 PM. But they gave us access to a Lounge, which it was very basic compared to others I have been. The staff was very professional and eventhough they offer timeshare acquisitions, they were not pushy nor irritating. There are many dining options but it is better to call and make sure you can walk in. Many restaurants at walkable distance as well as cafe shops. There are small stores called ABC that sell absolutely everything and that's were I found healthy snack to take to my kids on the beach. Believe it or not there is a dairy queen as part of the complex as well. There was a breakfast buffet in one of the cafes close to the beach but only some days of the week. My kids enjoyed the paddle board on the lagoon and also the slides at the pool. This is a family friendly hotel. They are small to take the surfing classes but may be next year. But there is so much to see in Oahu that we also visited other areas in the island - Hanauma Bay, Makapuu lighthouse trail, Pearl Harbor and off course Waiola Snow Cones ! Our room was in the twenty something floor and it was very quiet. The suite had kitchen, laundry and dryer. When traveling with kids that becomes handy. I recommend the Suites for the location, easy access to the beach and multiple pools.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The accommodations are good, but it is a money pit. Overpriced for everything. Pools undersized throughout considering the number of rooms. Gym - how about some blinds or sun screens for morning goers? Gym was undersized (and too hot!!) relative to the number of rooms/guests - maybe 20-30 pieces of cardio equipment for thousands of guests? Staff was generally friendly and approachable. Worst experience with concierge - book stuff on your own, they are misinformed and self-interested.
user_name:
Matthew H. N
Weston, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I am here now enjoying my 2 bedroom premier suite on the 31 floor with beautiful ocean views everywhere I turn!!! Service has been great. A few issues with room were immediately addressed and this is a busy time. Bravo!!! Reception was outstanding! Bellman are very professional and running all of the time. Concierge Wendy Davy is most helpful. I am supposed to be meeting her right now but I am enjoying and appreciating my room so very much!!! Will I return? Absolutely! For those of you who enjoy the 6 day sales deal ...you have no idea how much better it is to be here as an owner. more thing the Mandara Spa may be in desperate need of renovation (come on Hilton get this handled) but Bronson is a fabulous masseuse.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you want to have a great 4th of July experience come to the Grand Waikikian. Great pool,lagoon,and ocean access but if you come 4th July week you see the fireworks up close and it was like 15 mins long and well worth being near the crowd. Also I believe that there is a fireworks show on Fridays that lasts about 8 mins and you are right next to the fireworks. Overall great family experience and I highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: During our recent 8 day visit to the island, my family of 4 stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with kitchen and in-room washer/dryer. The lagoon, swimming pool(s) and beach access all came in very handy!We could rent (for no charge) dvd's and PS3 games to view/play in the room in the lobby- very convenient for late at night (free) entertainment. The hotel grounds are beautiful and well maintained. There were plenty of restaurants and shops on the property, so we didn't have to go far to find something to snack on, or something to do.Every employee we came in contact with was friendly and helpful.I am not sure how much this property would cost to stay; we were able to attend a time-share meeting, and received our room at a HUGE discount.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a very well situated luxury apartment hotel right on the beach at Waikiki. Part of the Hilton Village, so shares pools and beach access.Only downside is that every item of beach rental except towels incurs additional payments.Service is excellent and the opportunitry to self cater is very useful.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a great time and a perfect visit. Last year we did the time share presentation in Orlando and purchased this trip at a discount. Well worth it! Not sure how it happened, but we were upgraded to a Pent House! (24 floor) ( I called about 3 weeks ahead of time and requested a ocean view room, per another person's reccomendation on tripadvisor... thanks to that person for the great idea). We were in the Lagoon Tower ( I don't think I was ever able to keep straight what each tower was and what it had until about the last day, the Lagoon tower and the Grand Waikikian are the vacation club towers). We didn't do the time share presentation until are 2nd to last day. The sales man was crazy, literally, I thought he had a mental illness. He spent more time telling us about his fancy sports car and how he missed his family in NY than anything. I don't even know the details of what he was offering. But that was fine, since we were not that interested in purchasing at this time. But we met another couple that purchases a once every other year package (so if you are interested ask about this.. our guy never mentioned it). Anyways back to the actual resort SO GREAT!! Our room was amazing. It was Lagoon Tower, room 2468. This was not close to the elevator (popular complaint after reading other reviews). We had a two story condo/suite. Upstairs had a Master Bedroom with a view of the Ocean/ Marina. Great closet and full bathrom. The 2nd bedroom had 2 twin beds, huge flat screen and another full bathroom,more than my 2 kids ever needed (they are a little spoiled now by the Pent House). The free nightly DVD rentals were awesome. We were able to rent one out of each machine each day. This was great for my kids. They rented games for the game station. Plus they watched movies ( which seems like a crazy thing to do on vacation, but a great way to entertain the kids while making dinner or getting ready for the day). We had a full living room. Another 1/2 bath on the main level. Great dining room table for 4 people. Full kitchen. The maid service provided dish washer soap ( we had to sneak out a 2nd packet from one of the maid carts for another day).There are free washer and dryers on each level, again each room had a packet of laundry soap. We were able to do laundry late at night and early in the morning with no difficulty. The kitchen was stocked with plates, silver ware, cups, coffee machine ( 2 packes of regular and decaf also included), toaster, rice maker and blender. Microwave, full stove and refrid.. I would highly rec'd going to Costco and picking up a few items to be able to eat in the condo if only for conveince, but mainly to save money ( we spent $80 one night on 2 pasta dishes and a small pizza, we went to costco and spent $25 on a whole baked chicken, vegtable tray, sweet rolls and raspberries). So the room was great! Maid service only comes on your third day. Excellent cleaning. The sundry store in the Lagoon tower had good prices comparatively, to the ABC store. The only place we could find cheap grapes and mac and cheese. The RESOT was excellent. The pools are great. My kids got to pet the penguins. The flamingoes are no longer there ( they are back at the zoo). We did the 9am hula lessons ( you need to sign up on your first day, because the classes are free, but fill up quickly). We did NOT do the Hilton Luau, we went to the Polynesian Cultural center and it was well worth the drive. Same price as the Hilton, but we go SO much more. One thing I was trying to find in the reviews was info about the Pools. Kids need to be 36 inches to be able to go down the water slide ( my kids are 38 and 41 but they needed to have a life jacket or water wings). Only one person can go down at a time. There are three slides, One is a short 5 foot slide, any age could do it. The Medium one was fast, my son was afraid at first, but then was going down like a pro. The "big" slide is mostly a tunnel and my husband said it was much faster than he imagined. My kids only did this one a few times. Other reveiws indicated how croweded every pool was, but it wasn't really a problem. I think we got at least 2 chairs everytime we went to the pool ( and I kids never got out of the pool to sit). I know my review is long, but hopefully helpful. Feel free to ask me if you have any questions. Iwould be happy to help you, especially if you are going with young kids.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My experience with this hotel resort was again very pleasant and wonderful. I will recommend very highly to anyone to stay in this hotel or any Hilton hotels. For the people who complained about this hotel resort and the personnel, they need to go and stay at Sheraton especially the one in Nassau, Bahamas, to see how rude and unprofessional personnel can be. Thank you Hilton, you're the best!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Disclaimer: we are Hilton Grand Vacations owners.Stayed in May 2012 and then in June 2013: customer service was much better last year than than last week. We had to call guest services OVER and OVER to request towels and TP. The number would ring and ring and the an automated service would pick up and some times place the call on a long hold or just hang up on us. Persistence eventually paid off but we had to be very persistent. We requested ice the night we checked in and waited 1.5 hours and called twice before it was delivered. The dishes and glass sets are incomplete. I suspect that when someone breaks one it is not replaced. One small frying pan nod one small and one medium pot made up the cookware. Really kind of pathetic considering the cost of the time share.Love the location. Love the grounds. Love the bed sheets. This was our fifth year in a row staying at Hilton properties in Hawaii. We will be back but compared to Kingsland on the big island or even our stay last year, the property has declined. As my daughter said that the customer service should have been outstanding for a hotel guest let alone a time share owner, but unfortunately it was not the case. We tried calling the concierge on Tuesday from 4:00 to 5:30 and no one ever answered. At check out we were not asked how our stay was....We will be back and hope that the customer service improves to what we expect from a Hilton property.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent 8 nights at the Grand Waikikian Suites. Our party of 6 had a 2 Bedroom Oceanfront and a 1 BR City view on the 17th floor. (We had a lot of HGVC bonus points to use before they expired...) Both rooms were very clean and spacious. The kitchen was well stocked with dishes, pots, pans, etc. As an owner, the HGVC only provides mid-week cleaning. However, anytime I called for towels or supplies they were delivered within 10 minutes. The staff members around the resort were all very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the lagoon and the pool (both had sun and shade). The beach area was a bit crowded and the chair rental was expensive. However, our kids had a blast with the paddle boards in the lagoon.We ate at Tropics our first night at the resort and it was OK. We really enjoyed the Round Table pizza, Pronto Pickle and Starbucks. My kids also thought the ice cream shop was fantastic too. We prepared all of our breakfasts in the room and ate lunch by the pool a few days. We walked out into town for most of our dinners.Our car service from the airport stopped at Foodland for groceries and then we made a mid-week grocery stop at Safeway. However, we also purchased some groceries in the hotel store and the ABC store. We did not find the prices too outrageous. (Hawaii is still less expensive than the Bahamas.)Cab fare around town was relatively reasonable. We only rented a car for one day to make a trip to the North Shore.Here are a list of activities that we did: Nau Wale No Island Tour (Lighthouse hike, Blow Hole, North Shore, Turtles, Pali look out, etc.) Waimea Falls, Paradise Cove Luau, Island Magic Catamaran Snorkel, Dole Plantation & Hole-In-the-Wall Food Tour. I have separate reviews for many of these activities.These are the off-property restaurants we went to: Duke's, Morimoto, Chart House, Cafe Sistina, Ted's Bakery, Giovanni's Shrimp Truck and Hard Rock Cafe. I would definitely recommend the Grand Waikikian Suites for a trip to Oahu. The resort/village has many great shops too.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It's all good...excellent, even. Our stay began with an energetic welcome from Will-the-valet, with tips for self parking and getting around town. Your garage keycard will be good all day on your last day, even after you've checked-out. Camille from the Holokai Concierge was patient and made wonderful recommendations: swim at Laniakea Beach as turtles rest on beach. The housekeeping staff were pleasant and quick to respond. The Owners Lounge was probably the best perk, for those whose departure isn't till the evening: we took a shower. Your GPS address will be 18 Kahanamoku Street, since the lobby entrance isn't on 1811 Ala Moana. There's an Xbox in the room, so let your kids choose a couple of free games to keep 'em happy: my reality these days. Bring your own boogie boards, most airlines accept as regular checked luggage if in a bag: calm ocean waters come to life. The rooms have wired and wireless connections, so we Yelp'd and FB'd to our hearts content. Skip the Starlight Luau: saw the show from our balcony and it didn't look inviting held on the roof of their convention center. I hope your stay will be as fun as ours!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a very high end resort which is conveniently located in the heart of Waikiki so it is walking distance to many shops and restaurants on Kalakaua Avenue. The resort has many shops and restaurants on the property which is located right on the beach. The valet parking service was slow at times.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I have stayed at Kalia Tower several times before the Grand Waikikian Tower was built and the view of the Ocean and Hilton property from Kalia Tower is great. Those you have to use more points to stay at Grand Waikikian the view is terrible. I have stay in the Premier Rooms and Bedrooms Plus and the view were always bad or semi bad. So, if you are going to Hawaii to view the Ocean from you room I would not recommend Grand Waikikian Tower unless you are stay in the penthouse which for owner of Hilton is not offer.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband and I stayed 1bed room, 27th floor at the Grand Waikikian Suite for 9 Days. Balcony is very big and we can see Diamond Heads (City View) and little bit ocean. We stayed Kalia, Lagoon, Grand Waikikian before. The Room is spacious, Huge bath tub (it really huge), full kitchen and huge fridge also Wi-fi free!. We cooked every day. We normally bad experience with receptionist but they are good this time. Walking distance to Ala Moana Centre, Waikiki, so it really convenience and good area.We always come back this resort once a year but only negative part for this time follows• when we arrived normally we get greeting (Ley etc) from staff but we didn’t get anything, • Swimming pool is always packed especially, there has sign “Children under 5 is not permitted” at the Spa but many kids who is under 5 is stayed at Spa. Even staff doesn’t say anything. I wish they have Adult only pool and Spa like King’s land at Big Island. • We ordered Nachos at the Hau Tree Bar, it was terrible not eatable…• We had cleaning service in midweek but they didn’t stock anything (tissue paper, toilet paper, Rubbish bag) so we called them and looks like they came outside of door and took our rubbish but didn’t leave stuff which we requestedWe just walked in to Harbour pub where located next Ilikai Hotel and front of Harbour. We went Happy hours and Beer is $1.5, food and service is excellent. In addition, I hope Owners Lounge at 8th floor can open from 7pm to 9 or 10pm every day, because we are unable to print out boarding pass (we couldn’t print out domestic flight in Australia)

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
