review_body: We have stayed in quiet hotels with our kids and been bored. I knew that Waikiki Beach, and this property, would be busy and not quiet- therefore I booked it. It was a little annoying that the pool was crowded, but then again- my kids made friends and were happy. They let you bring your own food/drinks down to the pool, that was a plus! We constantly left the property to go out and about the island...so all was well. The Grand Waikikian tower has amazing rooms, terrific staff. The spa is not top of the line, I was a bit disappointed with it.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you are looking for a lively couple of days before moving onto something a bit more quiet then the Grand Waikikian is for you. Room was immaculate with all the mod cons you expect in the US. They even had a kettle for us anglophiles to make tea! Location is great as easy access to beach and Waikiki shops one way and upmarket shopping mall another. We will return for a 4th time!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our 3rd time visiting Hawaii, but this was the first time just being there for a family vacation not for business. When we checking in the staff was very helpful and nice. Took a little time to check in but once we got to our room it was the best. Very clean and orderly. View was of the beach and it was perfect. In the morning we could see the surfers surf on the waves. Was wonderful!! We made breakfast every morning and ate outside on the balcony. We had a few Pigeons that would love to come in the room, the kids loved it. Was a great location, we could walk down to steak shack and to Dukes to eat dinner and didn't take long at all. Went to Tropics for dinner and was awesome. Service was excellent and the food was great as well. Our room was always clean when we came back from our adventures during the day! Called down stairs to get help pulling out the sofa bed and they were right up and figured it out right away. Kids would go down to the shop in the lobby and the staff was always friendly and helpful. Overall loved the Hotel and would defineatly go back anytime.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent facility, clean, spacious rooms with outstanding staff. Concierge assistance was excellent...amenities in room,i.e. coffee maker, cookware, dishes, etc. were more than enough. I would recommend this facility when staying in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Focus for my review is Grand WaikikianSuites.The Good stuff: Decent sized rooms, comfortable beds including pull out; PS3 DVD player; free DVD rentals from lobby; kitchen; washer dryer in room - very convenient; We had a room on 12th floor facing street but once windows were closed it was quiet enough even for a light sleeper. Location seems good; Don't have anything to compare with but it worked for us. Not so good stuff; Check-in: Lady at lobby who was handing out leis looked tired and uninterested. Offered leis to a party arrived before us but ignored us for most part as we walked in - even ignored our little one who went and stood in front of her trying to get her attention to get a lei. Half way through our check in process another member finally warmly welcomed and offered leis.The room: Kitchen: Roaches in the room. Found 2 roaches on the kitchen counter during our stay on 2 separate occasions. Not cool at all. We did not bother calling anyone because it was something that needed to be taken care of right away so got rid of them by ourselves. We did provide this input to the team member who was giving us the timeshare presentation and he offered to share this with the team. Never heard back before we left. If we decide to never come back to this property this would be one huge factor.Dated and stained/rusted silverware; Super scratched and smudgy glasses. Was missing can opener which was delivered when we called. No salt/pepper. I have stayed at various places with kitchens and always found salt and pepper in the kitchens but this one didn't have it.Kitchen needs to be better equipped (more pans)Bath and Bed linens: Not enough towels provided. Only 1 set of personal sized bath items. When housekeeping is only once in 4 days then I would think there should be more towels etc provided so you don't have to ask for more after every shower. Same thing with the dishwasher soap and the laundry detergent. Got more in reasonable time when asked for. Housekeeping only once in 4 days. When they cleaned our room they did not change fitted sheet for the pull out sofa. We ended up washing it ourselves.Rest of the Resort: Food: Didn't eat much at the resort: Round table pizza not good at all. Tried to get into the Tropics Friday evening there was a huge wait so passed. Tapa bar had a 30 min turnaround time for drinks (only drinks - no food was ordered). Breakfast buffet at the Lagoon tower was disappointing - very dry hash browns; ran out of white bread; oatmeal container was empty when we got there. Made to order Omelets were good. Expensive.Pools: Crowded but ok. It can get hard to get chairs. Couples making out in the pool in full view of young kids was embarrassing. We had to leave the pool to avoid that behavior. Cigarette smoke from the beach area can be heavily smelled in the pool area - again not something that worked for us. "

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel is very clean and modern with nice, thoughtful touches throughout. The staff is attentive and well trained. There are several high-rise timeshare/hotel buildings on the premises and it is right on Waikiki beach. There are also a lot of shops and some restaraunts on the premises although they can be a bit pricey. They have a luau every night and fireworks every Friday evening. We enjoyed our stay and will return.
user_name:
Jane Marie G
Webster, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: There are many reviews about the Hilton Hawaiian Village that give details about the HHV grounds and amenities, so I won't belabor the fact that this is one gorgeous place. I will however try to give a review of the Grand Waikikian which is where we stayed for a week of our visit to Hawaii. We didn't ask for any specific requests but found ourselves on the 27th floor overlooking the city and the mountains. As much as I would have liked the ocean view, I had no illusions that I would get one. I was however pleasently surprised to be on such a high floor. There's about 36 floors in this building. The ones above me were the Penthouse and sales floors. So we were pretty high up. The speed at which we moved up and down in the elevator was impressive. We never had to wait too long for an elevator and in such a large building, that's saying something. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite. The interesting thing is we were on the end of the building and the balcony (lanai) was as long as the room. In other words, the balcony was accessable from the bedroom and living room. The balconies on the end of the building were longer than the balconies on the side of the building. You will see that in the pictures I post to this review. The view was really very nice even if it wasn't the ocean view. The room was very nice. If you have ever stayed at Parc Soleil the rooms are similar but a little smaller than at Parc Soleil. Lighing in the room was very good. Even in the bathroom. There was only one sink in this room. I don't know if this is true for all one-bedrooms in this building, but was true for this one. For some reason, I couldn't adjust the AC. Since we visited Hawaii at the end of the rainy season, we had a couple of days of rain as well as a little cooler temperatures. The AC was set to 70 degrees but when we tried to raise it, it wouldn't change. So we had to adjust the AC by turning it off and on. I confess I did not report this but I'm sure if I had, someone would have come to fix it. The kitchen is well equiped with everything you might need for four people. It is a regular full size kitchen with full size refrigerator with ice maker, stove, microwave and dishwasher. The living room area had a nice flat screen TV with a PS3 attached. The PS3 had the capability of running Blue Ray DVDs. Interestingly, there is a DVD service for both the Lagoon Tower and the Grand Waikikian that offers free DVD rentals. Actually you can get as many DVDs as you want while you are there. You just have to get one DVD at a time. You have to replace one DVD before getting another. Our only problem was we could never find a DVD that worked successfully. We got a BR DVD of a movie from the Lagoon Tower (since we stayed there first) but had trouble with skipping and locking up. We put the DVD back and got the same movie from the Grand Waikikian and had the same problem. We reported this to the front desk and they had the PS3 replaced. So we tried again and had the same issue. So I'm not too impressed with the quality of the DVDs in these kiosks. In theory, this is a nice amenity, but for us, it was rather frustrating since we couldn't watch a movie without problems. Other than these minor issues, we were very happy with our stay in this room. A couple of other tips and information. Parking is expensive. Overnight parking costs $27 but offers in and out access. Since we didn't want to pay that amount everynight for the week, we only had a car for a couple of days. The Hertz rental desk is opened from 6am to 1pm daily. However if you want to return a car outside of these hours, you can drop off your keys and contract on the 5th floor of the parking garage. If you don't get a parking pass the hourly cost is $8 per hour. So if you decide to have a car for one day and want to use the parking garage, it could get expensive if you keep the car in the garage for very long. If you plan to rent a car for several days, you will need to go to the front desk to get a pass card for the garage. Then you will be charged the $27 per day that you are in the garage. A little known alternative is that there is parking at the marina next to the property. However, that parking expires at 10pm in the evening. There is a section called "Lot A" that costs $6 per hour. But something that is not well known is that there is free parking on the marina as well. The sign indicates that the parking is for beach and boating access. If you only plan to be a short period of time, like an hour or so, you might be able to park here for free. However, it is a popular place to park so it might be hard to find a spot. It's a convenience that I would not take advantage off for too long. I don't know if you could get towed if you weren't actually going to be beach. But who knows. It's a kind of a walk from that parking to the HHV buildings. There is plenty of transportation available to get around Honolulu and Waikiki. There are trolley shuttles that are $2 per person per direction. However, if it is raining, you could get wet even on the trolleys since it is open to the weather. If you're up to it, the Ala Moana Mall is 3 tenths of a mile from HHV. If you're young and ambitious, you can actually walk just about anywhere in the Waikiki area. Or you could take the trolley in one direction and walk back. Just an additional bit of information. I know it is expensive to eat in Hawaii. It is also expensive to eat at the HHV. If you are a breakfast person, some of the locations within HHV can cost as much as $20 for a buffet breakfast. We like going to the Wailana Coffee House for breakfast. They have an all you can eat pancake breakfast with coffee for about $8.95 or without coffee so you can order your own drink, for $6.95. They are right outside of the HHV property so they are close. There is so much more, but I need to stop. I love Hawaii and HHV is where I stay when going to Oahu.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Waikiki isn't our thing, we discovered, but if it's yours, the Grand Waikikian is a pretty good choice. The one bedroom suite was comfortable and spacious. The staff is helpful, friendly and accommodating. On the beach, closer to the pier gets you away from the rocky ten to twenty feet of the bottom at water's edge. Depending on taste, this could be a nice place., esp. if you are considering a vacation club in a totally touristy area like Waikiki.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are owners in the Hilton Grand Vacation Clubs, so we always stay at a Hilton Resort. This resort is probably the nicest one we have ever stayed at. The resort is beautiful, the rooms are awesome, and the view is unbelievable. It is located within the Hilton Hawaiian Village, which consists of 3-4 Hilton resorts, shopping center, a saltwater lagoon, and beach. As usual, the staff are top notch. They are super friendly, and go above and beyond to make sure your stay is what you expect. They can help with local tours, excursions, rental cars to see the island, etc. We rented a jeep for the day to see the island from a kiosk located in the village. The rate was cheap, the process was easy, and the trip was awesome. There are stands by the beach to rent a jet-ski, surf board, paddle board, go snorkeling(which I recommend), rent a segway(which was a blast), and just about anything else. I also recommend going to see a luau, it is very entertaining, and the food is great. I CAN NOT think of one bad thing to say about our stay here. We had a 2 bedroom suite overlooking the beach, very clean, very comfortable, and very modern.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Resort is part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village and is beautiful. Staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. We would definitely stay here again. We had a one bedroom condo with a full kitchen. The condo was spacious and we usually had lunch in the condo, which helped save some money. The resort had 4 pools, a lagoon and of course, the beach. The resort had numerous places to eat and shop. There's even an ABC store inside the village. The place is great for families.
user_name:
Richard L. Z
Nesconset, New York

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Three night getaway with visiting family. Just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki strip. Nicely done high rise with beautiful views and stately Hawaiiana decor. Kids love it as well. Will definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The resort is huge and it has all the conveniences you would expect. Stayed in a one bedroom suite and the room was nicely equipped. I personally felt that one housekeeping service during a eight night stay was too skimpy. But if we ever needed anything, it was sent up to the room very quickly.I stayed at this property because I am a HGVC timeshare owner. We liked the location as it is off of Waikiki beach a bit, less crowd on the beach at the resort, but an easy walk to the heart of Waikiki if that is your desire.If you are traveling with a family, this resort would be a good choice. For a romantic couples trip, you may want to look for a property with a more intimate setting.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This time was the second stay. . The grandchild was same as Mr. and Mrs. daughter, too, but 2 bedroom types were available and were able to enjoy a stay with a space by the use with two couples this time last year. I had you teach the usage such as the institutions of the hotel carefully from コンセルジュ and was able to inflect. The different experience is possible every time and look forward to the next use.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Self parking $27 per day (too much for self parking) 2 Bedroom Premier is just a regular 2 Bed 2 Bath! Clean and no nonsense. Great for families with kids. Nice shops, big resort. (the slide pool is too small and in the shade!)
user_name:
Ali A
Los Angeles, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed 4 nights at the Grand Waikikian, I got a fabulous deal on this through HGV of course I did have to go to a timeshare presentation but, the value was so worth the 2 hours. The sales person and his manager were not pushy at all and respected our "No" decision. We had a wonderful 1 bedroom suite. Rooms were very tastefully furnished and very comfortable. And though I don't cook it was nice having a fully stocked kitchen. We were able to buy fruit and have lovely fruit salad for breakfast, also a toaster is available, so toast with cheese and we had a great little breakfast . (A rice cooker available as well :o)). The living room had a extremely comfortable little couch - usually hotels have lumpy hard couches, not this one. Also a DVD player and a game console were available - DVD's can be rented in the lobby. The bed and pillows were very comfortable - slept very well. All in all I really loved this place, was nice coming "home" at the end of the day and chilling! I gave the property a "Very Good" instead of Excellent (which it really is) only because the entire resort is so big. I found the grounds to be rather overwhelming but, that's just me. I loved the resort and despite the size would stay again and certainly would recommend.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: ON 4/5/13 we flew into Honolulu, Hi, we booked a 2 night stay at the Outrigger Luana. 1 bedroom condo, it was nice and clean. But could of used alittle updating. Our view was amazing.Good front desk people.Very accommdating and very nice. But we didn't like valet parking for $25,00 per day. Considering Honolulu is very expensive. but all in all i'll rate is as nice. The on 4/7/13 we went to The Grand Waikikian by the Hilton, we liked the hilton again beautiful ocean virews. With a two bedrooms and 2 baths. We stayed there 5 days. It was nicely furnished and very accommadating to our needs. We rented a cadillac srx suv because we had our son and some friends there.So this trip was alittle business and alittle pleasure.We all enjoyed it. But again the parking was too-expensive the Hilton valet parking was $33.00 a day and self parking was $27.00 a day. Its really tuff parking in H0N0LULU, alot of one way streets.it

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian is a great location to stay at. The views are great and there are alot of things to do right at the property. The staff is very helpful and nice. The Bali Steak and Seafood restaurant was a big disappointment with a high price tag. The food at the Tropics Bar and Grill was good and the ambiance was great. There are a lot of things to do for the whole family. We would definitely come again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent location, close to everything you would ever need when in Honolulu. The pools, lagoon and nearby beaches were wonderful. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. Although this is a higher price hotel than what I am used to, it was well worth the extra money. The room was very nice, clean and c/w a fully functional kitchen. Ask for a high floor - the views just get better as you get higher. We actually had mostly a city view, which seemed disappointing at first, but if you come from a small city like we do, it was interesting to watch the this busy city from our balcony. Also very easy to get a taxi at the front entrance.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at 17th floor in a 2 bd Premier with ocean view. I've never heard any bad noise during stay, except "Luau show" drums, voices and music at dinner time.Concierge is excellent, s/he knows everything not only Oafu island, but also neighbor islands.What I experienced small thing is, lost my way at parking lot. There are two exits, but it's hard to know which way is right exit.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family and I enjoyed this hotel. This will have been my fifth trip to Hawaii, but my first time at this resort. I found the suites great because we had a kitchen (which cut down on food costs), free internet and free laundry. The resort is crowded, but my kids enjoyed all the activities. If I were visiting with just my husband for a couples trip --- then I would suggest a quieter property. However, I felt this resort was great for our kids and had plenty of activities right here on site.A few tips --- go to Foodland grocery store in the Ala Moana mall or the Walmart to load up on groceries. They are much cheaper there than the ABC Store on site. Next, if the weather is cool --- forget the pools because they limit the amount of people in the hot tubs and you cannot even get in. This was frustrating! A resort this size should have more hot tubs! Also, pool chairs are scarce!Overall, we enjoyed our stay and we were glad we chose to stay here.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Rented a 2 bd/2 bath condo which was on the 12th floor and faced the ocean. The unit was beautiful - well maintained and clean. Beds and linens were great and the unit had all the necessary amenities. Would have preferred to be higher up as the complex hosts the nightly luau on the roof of the building next door. You can actually watch and hear the whole luau almost every night. Granted, the luau started early and ended early but it was a bit annoying if you were trying to have that late afternoon nap. The complex is huge but is well appointed. Lots of shops and restaurants on site. There were a couple of ABC stores either in the complex or very close which was perfect for quick pick ups of water/beverages. Location is at the very end of Waikiki beach but the beach is beautiful. Quite a bit quieter than down closer to the Westin Surfrider area. There are lots of places to rent umbrellas and chairs close by, but if you walk down just a little bit, the prices drop. It is close enough to walk down to the main drag, shops and International Market Place. It's also close enough to walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. The beach was so beautiful we never spent any time at the pool but whenever we walked by it seemed to be very busy. We only ate in the complex one night and ordered from the pizza place and we found it to be quite expensive ($80 for pizza?) but it tasted good (but not $80 good).

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the GW in a 2 bedroom Premier with ocean view. To say the least this room was fabulous. The service by the staff was incredible. If we needed something it was brought to the room in no time. You could spend a week in the village itself and never get bored or run out of things to do. Food is pricey, but it is Hawaii and we found ways to save. We went to the ABC store and bought breakfast items and a case of water. There is a corner cafe across the street that you could get a reasonable breakfast.Overall, this was a very good vacation that in part was due to the hospitality of the Village staff. I dont think we ever ran into an unfriendly staffer.Due to flight delays we needed to stay one more night and HGVC was very easy to work with as we moved right back into the room that we had checked out of.Thank you HGVC and Hilton Hawaiian Village!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I first visited HHV in 1972, since then more an more guest towers have been build and less and less of the 22 acres is open space. If you go out for a walk around 6 AM it's a wonderful experience, after 8 AM it's like Times Squre at New Years. The pools are crowded, and with more people and few options for meals the wait times are longer, and there are fewer seats per property capacity to have a drink and relax. Need to Change the name to HIlton Hawaiian CITY Towers, and from what I was told there will be 2 more build in the next 5 years. The Luau I went to 40 years ago around the lagoon is now held on top of high rise parking structure surrounded by guest towers. The view is not worth the $100+ per person cost. The ABC stores are like 7-11's and there are about 2 dozen within a 10 minute walk, prices go down as you walk away from the resort properties. Waikiki is a crowded place these days. I was on a promotional package for Hilton Grand Vacations for the 6 days I was there, so I paid half price, which I found to be a good value, I would not pay full price for my experience.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband and I spent 9 days here with friends in October, 2012, and we had a fantastic experience. Our unit was lovely, spotless and actually quiet despite the fact that our balcony overlooked the curve in Ala Moana Blvd. We kept our balcony doors open whenever we were at "home", and all of our breakfasts, cocktail hours and even after dinner drinks were consumed out there as the tradewinds kept us cool. Perhaps the fact that we were on the 31st floor had something to do with the quiet and the winds, but it was such a pleasant place to be!We enjoyed all of the amenities of the Hilton Hawaiian Village complex, especially the main pool and Hau Tree Bar, but we also spent much time off the premises as well. We explored almost all of Oahu using The Bus and a car that we rented for 4 days (and parked in the public lot by the marina), and we discovered that the walk down into the main Waikiki area or to Ala Moana Shopping Center was easy and excellent way to burn off some of those calories we were consuming. We loved shopping in the ubiquitous ABC Stores, and we were rewarded with some free gifts for saving our receipts. The beach in front of the complex is one of the widest and nicest along ALL of Waikiki, and we never had a problem finding a place for our towel there. We had a small issue with our dryer door falling off! that was quickly and efficiently resolved by one of the nicest maintenance people I have ever encountered. He even recommended a local's restaurant for dinner that turned out to be one of our favorites. We loved Honolulu and its energy, history and beauty, the Grand Waikikian and being in Hawaii. We cannot wait to return!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Remember you are on a resort- by the end of my trip I told several guests the travel tips. FIRST- there is a public lot behind the hotel. $10 for 12 hours- also if you don't like a $100 plus for a luau on the roof-and $62.50 a kid - try Germaine's or Paradise Cove- We did Germaines for $50 a person(Use Hawaiian discount.com for coupon- the concierge doesn't tell you that- It was on the beach(not a roof)- beach was beautiful and it included 3 adult drinks a ticket too-food was great-get the beef- entertainment a little vegasy but fun- very interactive with the audience- the location wasn't that nice to get too so next time I would either do the cultural center(no drinks) or Paradise Cove. OH best restaurant in Hawaii is Ted's Bakery- on the North Shore go for lunch and buy a few dishes - you will thank me- but don't blame me if you come back a little heavier!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Really enjoyed our stay. clean, beautiful, we lacked for nothing! I Hop was across the street for a quick breakfast and the Outback Steak House was one block to the left and the steak was great! 2 ABC stores were a quick walk away for grocery purchases. The grounds were breath taking

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you please read Dragon 26 comments, I agree on the majority of it, I will add I am American, a HH Diamond member, and this people do not give a #%€># for that either. Calling in advance does not help either.We have to put up with Luau's almost each night, as we were at the same level than the roof where this activity was performed, if at least we could have a better view and see the show, but we just heard the noise.The DVD and play station were not in working condition, the balcony furniture, was aged, and the concierge service was very inconsistent.The room smelled terrible, and even after 4 calls to housekeeping nobody showed up, had to buy air freshener myself and use it through out the unit all week. Last time staying in this facility for sure.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Beautiful hotel with a great pool for the kids. Lots to do on the property. Lagoon and beach right there. Only problems we had were with the valet. They have a scanner that you scan to get your vehicle, we were there for 8 days and it only worked 2 times. Would much rather had a human at the desk. At $33 a day you should be getting personal attention. Also had a problem with ants in our room and the washer/dryer did not work that well. Not a big deal. Room was clean and was cleaned daily which I was suprised with as it is a condo.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As a regular visitor to Honolulu, I make it a point to spend a few days "in town" at the Hilton Hawaiian Village to be exact. This was my first time to the Grand Waikikian and out of all the towers I have stayed in, this one was the best. Unlike some other comments, I found the "bar staff" specifically Scott and the Tropics bar, to be outstanding. No doubt about it. I am returning on the 19th fo a few days and made reservations again. My only concern is that the do not put me anywhere but the Grand Waikikian. This time I may actually buy some points!!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I have stayed at this resort for 12 years and for the past 3 years at this tower, which is one of Hilton's timeshare properties. I have found it to be excellent. The rooms are great. I believe they are all suites. The kitchen is fully stocked, washer/dryer. There are markets nearby to stock up. The property is great in that it is centrally located, but still feels like a resort once you step inside. The lagoon and swimming pool are amazing. I would highly recommend this property to anyone not budget conscious.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As timeshare owners, my wife and infant son stayed at the Grand Waikian earlier this year in January. While the vacation itself was nice, I figure it is about time that I listed my long standing grievances with this Hilton property.The one constant detraction from this resort and my experience at Grand Waikian is the checking in and room assignment. Like most people, we had requested that where possible, we be put on a higher floor. We understand that this request cannot be accomodated all the times but asking for a higher floor at the Grand Waikikian is like dental surgery.First of all, it was clear that the Hilton staff had absolutely no intention of even trying to accomodate this request. I received a brief nod and after various clicks on the keyboard, the Hilton staff provided me with a room key and tried to send me on my way. The fact that she made no mention of the room number as she attempted to send me off immediately tipped me off and when I checked the card holder, I think we had been assigned a room on one of the lowest floors possible. I immediately returned and asked about the high floor preference and was met with a most disgusted look and informed that "a higher floor is not a right". Arguing that the lower floors may make it difficult for my son to sleep, the Hilton staff relented and promptly put us on the 25th floor (which was obviously open). I can honestly say it appeared that this simple gesture for her was absolute torture for her and this is how we had to start our vacation. This was not first time having this type of experience with the Hilton staff and I suspect it won't be my last.On that note, reading TripAdvisor and similar sites, I always thought it was funny how many people complained that Grand Waikikian (and other HGVC properties) was geared for Japanese tourists and Japanese tourists received preferential treatment. Speaking of my own experiences as a Japanese national and those of many of my friends here in Japan, I want to assure those reading this post that nothing could be further from the truth. If anything, due to the language difficulties and the cultural reluctance for Japanese people to complain, I would argue that Japanese tourists often get the short end of the stick.Lastly, before I forget, my wife was 4 months pregnant during our time and was suffering from morning sickness on the day that we were checking out. I explained the situation to the front desk and asked for a delayed checkout and was promptly denied due to "being busy". As my wife was ill, I even mentionned that I was an Elite member, but once again, denied. I guess in that sense, the Hilton staff are consistent in treating both Elite and non-Elite members poorly.As a HGVC owner, I am not happy having to post this negative review of a property that I own and frankly, I really do not expect that anything will change by this post aside from some template response from management. That being said, I really do believe that Hilton should make at least some effort to train their staff to provide even a minimal level of service. In closing, oddly enough, in my experience, I thought that all of the other HGVC properties actually provide much better service. Considering the costs and popularity of the Hawaii properties, I certainly expected Hilton to better services its guests, regardless of nationality.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Parking is expensive. If you like the freedom of driving yourself around the island, try to limit the car rental time instead of the whole length of stay. The traffic is not worth driving daily. The stay was worth every day. Very convenient. The resort even has a Postal Contract Unit incase you have to mail home something instead of taking it on the plane. My wife loves the resort so much that we will definitely come back soon. Hilton Hawaiian Village is within a walking distance to shopping and nightlife makes it an ideal place for peaceful vacation and having it all.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed every aspect of our stay here. The beds were great, the suite was excellent, and the pool was a lot fo fun! Everything was as indicated. No complaints at all. Did not go to the luau, but it certainly sounded fun - did not go too late to bother anyone, though.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband and I are HGVC owners and frequently stay at the HHV whenever we are in Waikiki. We haven't been for many years and our last stay was actually in the Lagoon Tower (I have a previous review) which was nearly 7 years ago. This was long before the Waikikian was built. A few weeks ago we decided to do a mileage run to get me up to the next level of status on my preferred airline. We chose Waikiki as our destination and decided to stay at the HHV. This was a short trip for us (4 nights) so we took advantage of "Open Season" and paid ridiculously low rates for our suite, vs. using our points. A tip to other HGVC owners: the points redemption at the GW are somewhat higher than in the Lagoon Tower or Kalia Tower. If you are visiting for less than a week, I strongly recommend looking into the Open Season option vs. points if this is your preferred tower. That said, the Lagoon and Kalia offer perfectly nice accommodations at a much better value, so if points are your thing, I would look there first. As always, the service was impeccable. Everyone was friendly and accommodating from check in to check out. The room was also immaculate. We rented a two bedroom, partial ocean view and were placed on the 14th floor. Our view was of the marina and the lagoon. We could also see the rooftop luau. (Free show!)Beds were comfortable and everything was spotless. My only gripe about the room would be the showers. The shower heads were a bit of a challenge to get just right. They use handheld shower heads that can be adjusted to your height, which is nice. However the challenge is getting the angle right without having the handle crash to the floor. Not a deal breaker or anything to really complain about, but would be nice if the shower heads were more traditional and not the handheld type. Where I do have a moderate gripe is with regard to the wi-fi. For all owners and guests of HGVC wi-fi connectivity is free, however the connection strength is poor. In fact, poor doesn't do it justice. It was terrible. It was impossible to stay connected for longer than 30 seconds at a time before having to log-in again. If you want to stream video (watch a netflix video on your iPad for example) forget about it. At the most I think we had 2 bars of strength, which wasn't consistent. I ended up using my 3G for internet connectivity instead. My other gripe (and this is a big one) is the pool. I totally get that it's Hawaii and with this resort in particular, it is very kid friendly. I don't have children and I fully expected to see lots of kids at the resort. However, the GW pool is the only one on the property with a water slide and water slide = lots of kids. There were so many in the pool/around the pool it was impossible for me to enjoy myself and relax. In the past there used to be an adults only pool in the Kalia Tower. I was actually looking forward to spending my time there but learned that it was no longer available as an option. We ended up at the beach, which was totally fine (it is Hawaii afterall) but it would have been nice if the HHV dedicated a pool just for adults. Hopefully the absence of an adults only pool is only temporary. The other issue with the pool is with respect to the reserving of lounge chairs. We also own at Starwood and their policy is that if you leave your belongings unattended on the pool chairs for longer than an hour, they are taken away. Hilton has no such policy, at least that we could see was being enforced. People were arriving at early hours to 'claim their spot' and not returning until later in the day. This is incredibly obnoxious and inconsiderate behavior and a huge pet peeve of mine. I get that people can be/will be rude, but it's the job of the resort to ensure some sort of regulation around this. From what we could tell, this wasn't happening. Finally, something should be said about the hours of their restaurants and bars. We arrived really late on a Friday evening. By the time we checked into our room it was after 11 pm. We were shocked to find that not a single bar or restaurant on the HHV property was open except for the Round Table Pizza. What bar closes at 11 pm on a Friday night? Especially if your goal is to keep people on property and the majority of Waikiki stays open until the wee hours, you would think they would want to compete. Apparently not. Granted we could have walked into Waikiki, but after a 5 hour flight (and two hour time difference) we weren't exactly up for a stroll into town. We did really enjoy Tropics, though we never ate in the restaurant itself. We enjoyed live music in the lounge and snacked on pupus. Drinks were expensive, but strong and the pupus tasty. Overall, this is a great place to stay. The GW is a great facility, but to be honest, any of the other HGVC towers will do. We will be back!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hhv has gotten too crowded. This was our third time here and we are hgvc owners, which I've discovered gets you no better service than anyone else. While the location and accommodations are second to none, I could do without the crowds at the pool, the crowds at the restaurants and the crowds at check in and check out. The "member lounge" intended for HGVC guests is inadequate as well. We will be going to another destination for our vacation next year.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Staying at the Lagoon Tower and saw roaches. Only been in room for 1 1/2 days. Called and they sent a man with bottle of spray - not good. Have dead roach on wall and nobody wants to clean it. Took long time to send someone - service not good. Housekeeping only cleans every third day. :-(

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our family (2 adults, 2 kids aged 4 & 6) stayed in June 2012. Our check in was a drama (especially after a 10 hour flight)! It was booked by a 3rd party (an Australian website) and upon check in I was told that our room had been cancelled. To cut a long story short after 45 minutes it was sorted out and we were allocated our room.We were a little disappointed that the room configuration was not what we were expecting and we had a "city view" . We had booked a 1 bedroom with two beds but instead got a 1 bedroom with King Bed and pull out sofa. After contacting management and our travel agent in Australia we could not change rooms. After the debarkle with check in this sadly left a sour taste but none the less we were in Waikiki so got offer the disappointment fast. The pull out sofa in the living room was fantastic as the kids thought it was a real treat to to have their own tv and Playstation. Having a washer, dryer and kitchen in the apartment was invaluable! The pool was a huge hit, especially the Super Pool. The kids would gladly have spent our entire stay in the pool but there was shopping to be done!!!!!It took us over half an hour to walk to restaurants not in the village. But the kids never whinged about it!!! The Friday night fireworks was great! Walking to Ala Moana Shopping Centre was easy! About 15 minutes (and that's walking with two slow coach kids in tow). And getting a Taxi back from there was not very expensive.Despite our initial check in hiccup (and wrong room allocation) we had an amazing holiday!!!!So great in fact that we are booked for 2013!!!! The kids are constantly talking about their Hawaiian experience (even though we didn't do anything besides swimming, shopping and eating!!!)

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is conveniently located in the Hilton Hawaiian Village. There are plenty of places to eat in the area. The pool is the best out of all the other places in Waikiki. Great place for the family. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The room is what you would expect from HGVC. Fireworks on Friday was a welcome surprise for the kids.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We loved the grand waikikian. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment with a fully equipped kitchen and laundry. It was very luxurious and we looked out over Waikiki beach. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the grounds were immaculate. The kids loved the pool and would have been happy if we didn't leave the village on our entire trip. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are Hilton owners on the Big Island and decided to stay here for our first week before going to Kona. We booked a two bedroom ocean front property on a high floor (at a substantially higher cost in points). Everything about this property (and all of Hilton Hawaiian Village) is beautiful and the location is great. You are very close to Waikiki but are a little off the main roads so it is much quieter. The rooms are very well appointed with comfortable beds, full kitchens (although they really need Keurig coffee makers) and nice televisions. The shopping and restaurants on the property are very nice, and most are not outrageously priced (for a resort area). The shop in the Grand Waikiki and was great, with a nice selection of grocery, gift and drugstore items, along with ready to eat foods as well and everything was very reasonable. The staff in the store was super helpful as well. This property is within walking distance of the Ala Moana shopping mall as well as the shopping, restaurants, bars and beach at Waikiki. Everyone should make a point to find the Mai Tai bar at the Pink Palace (Royal Hawaiian Hotel) on Waikiki beach and get a beachfront table to watch the fabulous sunset as you enjoy the original Mai Tai (or the Royal Mai Tai – both are great). We experienced two problems which is why my overall rating cannot be higher. The first was that as I said above, we booked a room on a high floor, we again asked when checking in for a high floor, and said we would be happy to wait longer if we needed to. We arrived about 2 hours before check in time, so went to the hospitality room to wait. When our room was ready (just a little after the 4 pm check in time) we went back to the front desk to finish the process and again asked if we were getting a high room, he said it was very high. We then find out it is on the 17th floor (of a tower with 38 floors) and I said that I did not consider this to be a high floor. He said it was the best they could do. We said we could wait longer, and he said that would not make any difference as this was the unit we would get. We reluctantly headed to the unit. I will say it was ocean front, however since it was not very high, the view was nothing special. I contacted the front desk again to express my displeasure and was again assured nothing else was available. If this had been true, I would not have been upset, however we talked to numerous guests with rooms on much higher floors that checked in later the same day. One on them even told me how many points they used and it was MUCH LESS than what we had used. During our week of the 30-50 times I used the elevators I saw only two guests exit on floors below ours. Based on the number of people at the pools, etc. it was obvious that the property was not close to being full, however they did not honor our request for a high floor. I even talked to guests that were not Hilton owners that were given units on much higher floors. The management should have honored the specific reservation and requests that we made, or provided a better response that just – “that’s the way it is, quit asking”. The second problem was that while the pools and surrounding areas are beautiful, the water in the pools was much too cold to be comfortable. Most of the time there were only kids in the pools, since most adults found them cold (I visited with at least 20 people who said they could not get in them at all). We visited friends staying at two other Waikiki properties and both of their pools were MUCH warmer than those at the Hilton. The ocean and the man made lagoon were much warmer than the pools. Management needs to address this issue since a majority of their guests are adults. Hilton Grand Vacation Club is one of the best timeshare management programs there is, they have a lots of properties in great locations and their point system is very good. I hope we do not have a similar experience the future.Overall a Great Property that needs to provide additional training to some front desk staff.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the a two bedroom suite at the Grand Waikikian Suites for seven nights as guests. The lobby was huge, impressive and tastefully decorated. We arrived early in the morning and as expected, our room was not yet ready. They do have though a hospitality room with plenty of seats to rest, spaious dressing room, several shower and toilets.Complimentary refreshments like coffee,tea and orange juice were offered too. Our suite was spacious and I love the interiors. There's a washer and a dryer provided and a steady supply of laundry detergent too. The kitchen was equipped with a big oven, microwave,blender and coffeemaker. On the downside, I find the cooking pans quite small if you're cooking for a family of five and they don't have any larger pans so that made our cooking options limited because of this. It's unfortunate because all their appliances were in full size (big ref, big oven,big stovetop). I also find the housekeeping inconsistent. On our arrival, I found some drawers very dusty and so were the lampshades and other furnishings. We stayed for seven nights and there were days when housekeeping was neatly or badly done. Most days it's not good.If not for this, i would rate this hotel a five. . The location of this hotel is excellent. Not in the busy area but still with quaint little shops and restaurants around. The beach in the property is quite nice and just walking distance from the hotel. Bell service was exemplary and we did not encounter any problem with the staff. The free dvd rentals helped us relax in the evening before going to bed.I hope the management would take our reviews seriously. These are small but important details that can make a big difference.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are owners and decided to stay here. The rooms need a makeover and are ready for the long await update. The pools are small and seemed very crowded. It seemed like everybody was smoking on there lanai which came into your room! The plus side was the beach and location these hotel can not be beat. The service was second to none. It seemed that the elevators were very slow and always full. The beach is the best on the keys.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a long weekend from work, so we took a trip to Oahu. We rented a car because I'm not into taking a bus, and although we've stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village many times, I had a hard time finding the Grand Waikikian entrance. Minor detail, but we parked in the parking structure and made our way to the Grand Waikikian. Let me say, first of all that this place is gorgeous. It is very warm with floor to ceiling Hawaiian wood. Check in was a breeze and they welcome you with a Hawaiian necklace and a gracious Aloha and treat you like royalty. The room was not cheap, so our expectations were high. Our room was on a very high floor, but the elevator was quick and there really are very few suites per floor. The suite was great with a full kitchen and all utensils and soaps. There's a stacked washer and dryer. There are two Samsung TV's and a built in eating area. The suite was very well-apointed and would be perfect for families. And how nice to be able to wash your bathing suit and put it on clean and dry every day!! There is a gift shop in the lobby that stocks everything you need if you would like to cook. It is set back from the beach, but not far. We had sort of a city/mountain view but you still got a peek at the ocean.This is a time share property, so watch out for the hard sell. They will call you the second you walk into the room and invite you to come down for their pitch and "free" gift. They are very polite however.It is a very short stroll to Ala Moana shopping center. Try the Mai Tai Bar on the top floor with ocean breezes. It was the best.Can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This Hotel is extremely beautiful and very classy. The rooms are fantastic - everything is brand new/modern, very spacious, and SO clean We had a one bedroom on the 28th floor mountain/city view. We were there as part of a timeshare exchange, but we only stayed for four days. Whenever we needed anything - especially clean towels, they were right there with them, at no charge. The only time we heard traffic was when we sat on our balcony, we were never disturbed while the sliding door was closed. We were treated to a nice little gift basket on our arrival for our honeymoon- really nice - above and beyond! Check in was a little slow - but extremely friendly. The valet and bellman were also very friendly. Improvements needed with concierge: two employees were very hard to approach and took time to "warm up" to us. When giving directions they acted as if we knew where we were, pointed, and rushed us along. And when I asked for opinions on restaurants for dinner - He abruptly pointed out the restaurant on site - which is probably a great restaurant, but I wanted personal/local advice and options. Then he handed me a magazine and said look at these restaurants. So I figured out our place to eat that night - and it turned out brilliant (might have to do a review on the Westin Surfrider restaurant!) For a snorkeling trip I was directed to a lovely young women at the inside office concierge - she was a doll - wish I got her name. So maybe go to the office concierge and not the concierge desks along the hallway? The turtle snorkel trip was great! Right at the Hilton pier - great staff, and we got to see turtles. AND it's only a one and a half hour trip! Which is great for a quick little trip right off shore, doesn't take up the entire day. Ok, read everyone elses reviews, it's a large resort. Lots of walking - its part of the Hilton Village. But close to a great little outdoor shopping area. The lagoon is freezing, couldn't get in, and the sand is really rough on the feet- but it's man made. Not enough Pools for the size of the resort and not enough chairs-the kind of hotel to get up early and get your chair. I abolutely refuse to do that. The Tapa pool was closed during our stay. Towels are awful!! Little little towels, and worn out. I think they should update these. And the one hot tub - close to the grand waikikian, closes at 7 PM - WAY too early!!!! That was a bummer. The beach on the Hilton side is cramped - and they charge something like $36 for beach chairs and umbrellas. I would just go down a little past Tropics and sit on the beach there - seemed MUCH less crowded. Tropics - great apps and happy hour music/band! I think this is not good for couples looking for romance- crammed up with families. Even in October. And I personally didn't enjoy Waikiki, especially on a honeymoon. Great to see the beach, diamond head, and have a great dinner and late night in the city, but one day/night was enough for me (I live in Philadelphia, I'm over the city vibe - but others look for that type of action with things at least being open late). Was easy to walk around - no choice, couldn't get a cab on the street! Great walkway along the beach from Hilton down past many properties, and lit up at night. And an awesome sunset - one of the best we were able to see. For a more relaxing time for couples I recommend the North Shore. We rented a car for a day and headed up there (about an hour drive) - it was amazing! And Pearl Harbor is very close also - the main reason we came to visit Oahu. Overall - Not one complaint about the room - great accomodations! And most of the staff was extremely friendly!! Just decide if you want city atmosphere, lots of walking, and many families. The atmosphere of this hotel (Grand W) is certainly high end and classy! It's a shame they rely on the Hilton Village for ammenities - that's where things go down hill just a little.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This resort is disappointing. To go to any swimming pool, we had to go down 23 floors, walk through two to three lobbies, up to100 yards to relax in a pool or jacuzzi.We are actual HGVC owners and decided to come to Honolulu for the first ime.This will be our last time in Honolulu. We "spent" extra points for a Premier room. However, the view which was billed as an Ocean View, should have been called an Ocean Peak. The rooms are very nice and well appointed, but, since they are new, they are smaller than the other towers, and have less desirable views. We just checked in today, so I guess our disappointment shows! Is a pool and a Jacuzzi with an available lounge chair too much to ask?

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed at the new tower Grand Waikikian. Nice, but no fitness center. Had to walk over to the Kalia tower. Not a great facility. Crowded at any time. Stale air from lack of adequate ventilation.. Nice kitchen in room. But why the tub in the bedroom? Water in the pools and lagoon was too chilly. Very crowded on the grounds and they have another tower on the drawing board. Street noise on Ala Moana Blvd was deafening.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We decided to go to Hawaii for our 40th anniversary and thought we were fortunate to be able to stay at the Grand Waikikian. The suite were absolutely beautiful but that was where it all ended. We had wanted to cook some of our meals in the suite which we did but they only had four plates, forks, cups, 4 towels, 4 face clothes etc.. So the dishwasher and washer/dryer was going all the time and for a resort that encourages their guest to save water and energy it was a joke. We had wanted to make breakfast in the suite but there was no egg flipper and when I called they stated that they did not provide them and that I could go and buy one. Great rice cooker though.We travel a lot and I am used to getting nickeled and dimed by resorts but i was in for a shock when they $25.00 and fifty dollar you to death. $25.00 a day for parking and if you did not valet park you had to park a faie distance away from the entrance to the hotel. If this wasn't enough the charged you 16.00 for a chair on the beach and $30.00 for an umbrella.We were ignored by most staff and was even glared at by one while the Japanese guest were treated royally. We sat and watched as the staff lavished Asian guest ahead of us with leis, chocolate and beach bags. We got one box of chocolate. When I said something they reluctantly gave us a couple of things. I felt that I was being tolerated and not welcomed by the majority of staff. Very disappointing.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We only stayed 2 nights but the room was fantastic, kitchen well equipped and bedroom & bathroom clean and comfortable. The Hilton Hawaiian Village is a bit out of the way & it is a 10 minute walk to get to the beginning of the Waikiki action but that didn't worry us.The Tropics Bar and Grill had a fantastic small band playing & my only criticism would be that they stopped playing at 8:30 on our last night - I could have listened to them for a lot longer.Altogether a great experience

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: First and foremost what a beautiful setting: Diamond Beach!! Very close to the airport but not too close, GW has an ideal location for bars restaurants boardwalk activities and of course the beach. There are a few very good restaurant in and around and a few bars as well! The room was a pretty good size suite with master bedroom and a seperate bedroom with two twin beds. Each room has it's own bathroom which is always a must! Amenities were very nice, full kitchen and washer and dryer and a quaint little balcony!!After checking out, you can leave your things on the 8th floor Hilton member's area and enjoy another day at the beach. That level has full bathroom showers changing rooms and food and drinks for guests that are leaving that day: very practical!Will definitely go back!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days and were very happy with our room upgrade ocean view and room quality. We enjoyed days on the beach, excellent food at Tropics Bar and Grill, and just walking around the grounds. The resort is beautiful in every way.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Grand Waikikian lived up to all the expectations I had prior to our vacation. I learned a long time ago that one of the best aspects of a vacation is the prep work and consequently the expectations of a vacation. The number of points spent for a Grand Waikikian penthouse unit was almost prohibitive but we're glad we made the investment in our vacation. We were surprised, to say the least, on some of the amenities the unit possessed. For example, the toilet was one that both cleaned and dried thereby negating the need for toilet paper(nice). The view of the Friday night fireworks was excellent as we sat on our lanai. The size of the unit was extremely comfortable and the everyday maid service was right on time. The staff in the lounge was so great and always received us with a smile. My recommendation is if you have the points or cash and want to experience an extremely memorable week in Waikiki, give the GW a try. There are many reasonable restuarants nearby and the beach was outstanding but understand our week was after Labor Day and not extremely crowded.
user_name:
vacationjulia
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We paid top dollars to stay in GW suites. Naturally, I expected a full kitchen and wash/dryer. The suite we stayed at was partial ocean view. It was kind of new and clean, so it was nice. But PARTICAL ocean view is a joke. You either stay in city view or actually pay lots of money to get a real ocean view. Hugh crowds from Japan. Not sure whether we stayed in Hawaii or Japan. The village was overwhelmed by expensive stores and man-made attractions. Next to waikiki white sand beach which is a plus. We booked the room directly from hilton (not time share), so daily cleaning service was provided. We went through a time share ownership presentation. For us, it was waste of time (2hrs+). Skipped it if you don't need free tickets or gifts from the resort.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I had originally made reservations elsewhere but changed when I saw a good bonus points offer with Hilton. We stayed 6 nights. We had a 1 Bedroom apartment which was a good size for the 3 of us but it wasn't the luxury that we were expecting. We had just come from the Fairmont in Maui which was amazing.The furniture was a bit mismatched with a weird dining table in the corner. It was a very crowded hotel and impossible to get a spot by the pool as all the pools are shared with the rest of the Hilton Hawaiian Village. It didn't help matters that one pool was closed for the filming of Hawaii Five-O. The location to Ala Moana was great but I think I would choose somewhere less crowded next time. Unfortunately Waikiki has a severe lack of high quality vacation apartment accomodation unless you are willing to pay a fortune.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our family spent eight nights at the Grand Waikikian in late July and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! We had booked the room directly through the Hilton website, so we had daily housekeeping, and only on one day was our room cleaned late, and the housekeeping staff apologized for the delay. I had done my research and knew my view would be that of a city, as this hotel is set back from the ocean. We had originally booked the Ali'i Tower, but felt that we needed more space and the kitchen amenities. I am incredibly picky about where we stay, and I was very happy with my unit.The CONS:Yes, the furniture was dusty, but I found the kitchen and bathroom clean.We had an issue with the washing machine in the unit, twice. However, both times, maintenance came up and reset the unit, and it worked.Distance from beach (hotel is not oceanfront, but via a long walk through the lobby, you emerge at the Great Lawn or a pool area)My kids only used the pool once, and as with many resorts, pool chairs were reserved by people who left their belongings...unable to find chairs.Didn't care for the "bench style" seating at the table in our room.Ridiculous charges for chair and umbrella rentals.Crowded beach.The PROS:Had several requests for housekeeping; my needs were met.Resort property is just stunning.My kids loved the lagoon activities (stand up paddling, canoeing, pedal boats).Wide, beautiful stretch of beach; we walked along the beach toward the Sheraton and the beach was narrow at the other properties we passed.My son loved the fish, penguins and flamingos on site.We enjoyed the live, nightly entertainment at the Tapa Tower.The Village is great (shopping and dining), enjoyed walking through the village after dinner.Very quiet front desk: line ups to check in and out weren't an issue.Free video rentals for each room (great for the kids).We enjoyed dinner at the Tropics, situated right by the beach.Previous reviews note that the HHV is busy and crowded, and in fact, there was a Convention going on and our property was at 100 % capacity. Yes, the Village, beach and pools are vey busy, mostly with young families. If you're looking for peace and quiet, the HHV isn't for you. And we found Waikiki busy, period. We walked down Kalakaua Avenue in the evening and it was incredibly crowded. We spent the following week in Maui, and it was quite the opposite: quiet and calm.The issue about the pool cards has me stumped. Upon check in, we were given orange pool cards, to be used in exchange for pool towels at one of the pool huts. I had read many complaints about this system but I thought it worked just fine: return the towels and get your cards back. Easy.With regards to the staff, front desk was fine, valet staff were friendly, and we only used the concierge once, and that experience went well.All in all, I'm glad I did my research as I generally knew what to expect. We all had a fabulous time!

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family and I spent a week at this gorgeous resort. The property and buildings are beautiful on the outside, but our one-bedroom suite was not. The rooms were very dusty, the refrigerator was a mess with food residue, the inside of the cabinets was dirty, and the spare blanket was covered with stains. When we told the front desk, they said that someone would come to clean it - which never happened. On our second complaint, we were called and told that the mid-week cleaning could be done a day early. They did come to clean, but it was a mediocre job. The facilities are beautiful, but management need to reconsider their services.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and I visited at the Grand Wiakikian July 1 until July 7, 2012. Our room 2802 had a great view of the water and the city. Maintenance came a time or two for small issues and they were timely and friendly. The sound bar that many of you see in photos near the television is NOT part of the TV but is connected to the DVD player. This was not an issue as my MP3 player would connect to it to provide ample Sara Evans to survive. Here is a tip that you can use. The parking elevator goes down to the street level. This helps as you bring back a heavy load from the ABC store. The reserving of pool chairs is a problem but I have no cure for this. We would head to the pool at 8am and that goes smoothly. Now a negative, HHV needs a decent workout room. On the morning that it rained we walked to the Kalia Tower to find about six treadmills for thousands of rooms! Each tower should have exercise facilities or a ratio of 3 treadmills for each bar on the property. The Mai Tai drinks at Tropics are great by the way (even at $12). Enjoy your visit. We did very much.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Two people at the front desk were actually very nice, but the initial lady who checked us in was so mean and uncooperative! We were told switching rooms would be simple (we had to do so because of availability)--her answer was that you'd better be out by 10am and we won't let you into your new room until 4pm. We have a young child who naps, and this does NOT work for us. I specifically asked about this when making reservations, and the Hilton representative said this would not be a problem. The room had lots of stuff broken in it, from HVAC (not cooling down below 79F), to sink not draining, to the dishwasher being totally useless (unless you completely washed the dishes before using it!). And the "partial ocean view" was a joke: you had to exit to the balcony and LEAN OVER to see a tiny sliver of ocean. Partial mountain view would have been slightly accurate. Full view of cheap hotels with their plastic lawn chairs on their balconies and the nonstop (round the clock, even with all windows and shades closed) sound of the busy street below, with buses and sirens going at all hours, is really the only accurate way to describe it. The front desk lady said "too bad, this is what you get, be happy you're in Hawaii". I've stayed at several Outriggers before and had a better view every time.The first day my kid and I got food poisoning at an on-site restaurant, and I just needed the single toilet bowl cleaned a bit (not the whole suite). The front desk staff REFUSED to do this without an additional cleaning fee for the entire suite. They finally said they would have the cleaning staff bring up the cleaning supplies but I would have to do it myself. Seriously??? Such a big deal over 2 minutes of effort? Their response: it's our policy, tough if you don't like it, we don't have to send anyone up at all. I said sure, I'll do it myself, and was ready to do it, but the non-front-desk staff at the hotel are all really nice and did it for me.The "grand" pools are a joke too, by comparison to other Hilton properties (e.g. Waikoloa). I can understand this since Waikiki is so dense, but it would have been good to know we'd be packed in like sardines in advance, just to set expectations. The concierge staff was nice but repeatedly gave us misinformation (e.g. when things open and close, how best to get places, etc.).I will NEVER be back here, and will continue telling everyone I know to stay away!
user_name:
Polina S
San Jose, California, United States

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is our second time staying in the Grang Waikikian. We are Elite owners in the Waikikian.The hotel is very nice.. The service is not always as nice. The people working there seem to pass the buck often. Everytime I wanted information or had a simple question it was too complicated for them to help me and I always had to go to someone else.I cam live with that. I didn't need much. But I noticed my necklace missing. The maid comes in the room half way through the trip and cleans and replenishes the towles ect. I wear this meck lace a lot and leave it on the counter when I shower. I didn't wear it one night and didn't pay much notice to it when I came back to our room. We do utilize the in room dafe for extra cash and my wedding ring (thank God.) But, I didn't see it on the counter the next morning. I thought maybe I put it away and went on about my day. When it was time to check out we were rushing a little and I checked the counter again and arouund to make sure nothing was left behind. When I got home I realized that I never saw my necklace again after the night I set it on the counter. I know I didn't leave it behind I checked drawers and the counter for it again. I'm positive it was taken. After calling the Grand Waikikian and leaving messages I never got any response. It's been a week and I'm still attempting to just talk to someone about it. Be very very careful about all of your things while staying in this hotel.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Overall, was quite satisfied with the stay. First of all, this is a huge complex, a city inside Waikiki itself. Fully self-contained. The hotel is very clean, staff was very pleasant and helpful, and the view (get an ocean view room) is quite nice, especially if you stay over on a Friday night and catch the firework from your balcony.There are some negatives. This is a very busy hotel. By noon, all the chairs by the swimming pool were occupied. This hotel was full of screaming kids (including my kids) at all its pool that it shares with the rest of Hilton Hawaiian Village. For the number of towers it has, the amount of pool is inadequate. Also, if you follow the direction to get to Hilton Hawaiian Village on the brochure, you WILL get lost. Call the hotel for directions and where to park for the Grand Waikikian (if you self-park) or else, you will exit into the middle of a very busy shopping plaza with no good way to get to the hotel.The kids love this hotel. I just like it since its a little too hectic and noisy for me. Feels like downtown Las Vegas by the beach.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I've stayed at every HGVClub tower at the HHV, this is nice and worth the stay, period. Cons: Parking is ridiculous, $30 for valet and $24 self park. Power went out during our last night, elevators went down and no power in the room. Also, the pools are pitiful. I've only stayed at HGVClub resorts in Oahu but the pool/chair space to amount of people should be criminal. The orange card towel exchange is a pain as well. Hilton Waikoloa is much better pool scenario. Some employees could care less about "service". Pros: Price due to timeshare usage. DVD kiosk. Location and fireworks on friday nights. They close the super pool on fridays at 6pm-8pm for the revue show.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I stayed here in a combined business/ family trip and it was the worst service and the staff had the worst attitude. I even spoke to the General Manager, Henry Perez who once I finally got him on the phone at home , was offended that I had to talk to him and not his other managers after having such success while we were at the property.... Not. Let's break it down in detail:1) We were assaulted at the pool by another guest who felt we took his chairs. Maybe if there were enough chairs this wouldn't happen. Security was called and no one did anything to applogize or contact us about the incident my 5 year old is traumitized feomtge altercation. Additionally , for three straight days we watched locals use an assortment of room keys to get in and then proceeded to swim in their JEANS while all the locals that worked the pool looked the other way. 2) I specifically asked for a room with 2 double beds when I made the reservation. They gave us a King and when I asked why I was told ," we give preference to our owners not renters". This is a timeshare property for Asain clients and if you are not Asian and a hotel guest you ate treated like garbage.3) On a particularly rainy day we stopped by one of tr concierge desks to ask for some tips to entertain our 5-year old. After she finally acknowledged our presence, she rudely asked what we needed . Once we told her he looked out side and snidely said ," it's a nice day out, why don't you go to the beach". Wow, great job on that one!Once w returned home I took up the matter with Hilton Honors as I am a member . They were horrified at my story and told me they would have a reps ones in 72 hours. The supervisor never contacted me again. I kept pursuing the matter until I finally got a message a month later from the Hilton Honors supervisor that said the matter was resolved as the General Manager, Henry Perez ( complete waste of my time see above), had called me and the issue was resolved . HE lied and had not called to resolve the issue ever.After paying $3000 for our room for 5 nights I would not only NEVER stay here but will more then likely switch myself and my company of 1000 sales reps over to Marriott properties .

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location. Beautiful rooms and property. Parking: as is it everywhere in Honolulu is expensive, $24.00 per day.

hotel_name: Grand Waikikian by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at Grand Waikikian two times in the same vacation, different room type each time. Have also stayted at 2 other towers within Hilton Hawaiian Village in the past. First room type - 6 nights - 1 bedroom unit - booked through "timeshare tour special." Beware - this saves a considerable amount of money - but - we felt treated like 2nd class citizens under this deal. They are clear that renters are treated different than owners. They gave us what was supposed to be a resort view unit but it ended up being City View and was right above Ala Moana Blvd. The traffic noise was so loud, even on a moderately high floor, that our balcony was not usable. In addition, there was construction going on. It was terrible and the managers had no empathy for us. I will say that the timeshare concierge was wonderful and understand - tried his hardest to help us move but when it did not work out they gave us $200 in restaurant vouchers. Another issue - the photos on the website show seating for 4 (at the dining table,then two more at the eat in counter in kitchen. This totals 4 dining chairs in the room, in addition to the built in bench at the table. This is false advertising - there are only two chairs in these 1 bedroom units and it looked as if something was missing. When I asked management about this, they have us such a hard time. After 3 phone calls and getting angry housekeeping brought us up 2 more chairs. Not sure why this had to be such an issue. Timeshare salesman was one of the most offensive people I've ever met. He turned the charm on at first, then turned it off and got angry at the end when he asked us why we want to throw our money in the garbage on our non-time share vacations. This were his exact words.2nd room type - 4 nights - 1 bedroom partial ocean view unit - this unit was paradise compared to the other. I had booked this myself as a rental via the Hilton site. Only could see a small part of the ocean but the absence of the traffic noise and street view was a big improvement. This until had all 4 dining chair, did not have to ask for more.Overall unit assessment - wonderful, modern decorations, clean but showing some wear and tear. Beautiful granite in kitchen and wood floors in living room. Washer/dryer was great to have but dryer was slow as others have noted.Employees were hit or miss at front desk - yes, some very rude. Others very nice. All bell hops and valets were super nice. Free video rentals was quite a treat. We loved the pool - did not find it hard to get a chair as others have posted. Prices of food at their market/shop were actually comparable to regular ABC stores and their selection was much more upscale.We love this resort - did not find it big and overwhelming or like Disneyland as others have stated. We had 2 boys age 8 and 9 with us and we loved being able to pick from several pools daily. This stretch of beach is magnificent compared to the rest of Waikiki....plenty of room even at Sunset to spread out and throw the football on the beach...never too crowded. We loved having the fish, birds, ducks, beautiful gardens to walk through every day.Since this was our 2nd stay here, we discovered many hidden treasures and tips. Get your hot dogs and snacks from the cart or snack bar from the Hale Koa next door - 1/3 the price than at hotel snack bars. If you are staying a while, it's worth a trip to Walmart to stock up on snacks and drinks to keep in the mini fridge. Parking is easy and cheap if you park in the Marina lot next door.....not a long walk if the weather is nice....who minds a walk in paradise? The rates go up on weekends so it's better to just self park in the deck then. Waikiki beach walk is very close and has lots of great places to each and shop......the whole Waikiki beach stretch is a very easy walk from the hotel.
